Not only the dialogs and different relevant sounds impressed me and made me feel like watching a good historical movie; but above all,  the pieces of music and songs inserted in the narrative depicting the love (male-female) of the characters that existed in that time effortlessly won my heart. Any music lover will be just too happy to witness this programme.The charges for entering tickets as well as for the Light and Sound Show appeared reasonable to me. We enjoyed the show in ordinary class, however there’s an executive class too with separate seating arrangement. Perhaps that place gives a better sight of the light switching from place to place (in the fort) during the show. I have come to know that there is concession in ticket rates for the school troupes.I have not given the minute details of the fort as well as its history which must be available on the internet. I just say that Golconda Fort is one of the best places to visit in Hyderabad. I have visited Chaar Minaar on one hand and Ramoji Film City on the other and I frankly admit that my visits to Golconda Fort have been the most satisfying ones. This mighty fort is the pride of Deccan. Once the centre of the Bahmani Kingdom as well as the centre of the diamond-trade, this grandiose fort gives you a call. Whenever you make a trip to Hyderabad, please don’t miss visiting it.

Name: Neelam Rawat
Title: Winter destination !!
Review: The best months will be October to mid February as weather will be suitable for this place and best time is 9 to11am and 4 to 5:30 if visiting in summer .Please carry sunscream, hat, water bottle and shoes with good ground grips.You can also carry camera but you need to pay 50 rupees in addition to tickets.Inside the fort you can eat or drink as they have canteen inside the fort.

Name: betty u
Title: Not to be missed!
Review: The tour of Golconda Fort and the tombs was mesmerizing. My tour guide, Mr. Kalakundhi, was awesome and was full of information, very professional.  I was hesitant to go on this tour solo, since my daughter was in school, but SO GLAD I did. Gave me such a better historicial understanding of Hyderabad and surrounding area.

Name: Sweet Sang
Title: Fascinating
Review: Visited in Feb 2020 during our Anniversary. Enjoyed the view from the top, amazed to find a temple there. Overall an excellent visit.

Name: Tara S
Title: Nice fort to walk around and get view of city
Review: Great place to spend a few hours walking around and exploring. Worth going to the top to see the temples and views.

Name: Sunder S
Title: Disappointing!
Review: This was a huge let-down. The fort is a crumbling ruin, poorly maintained. All that has been done is to create a lawn-like space in the front. The rest of the fort is left as it is - overgrown weeds/plants, run-down look, and a general sense of decay. This could have been developed into something worthwhile - a pity! India has too many of these forts for us to bother about maintenance. Perhaps if the ASI could hand over these monuments to the local state government it would be better off.The tour guides simply try to rip you off - they start with a price of Rs. 1200, and what you pay is your skill to negotiate. We paid Rs. 800 for the long tour. Why can't the ASI also publish the tour guide prices like they do in other places?

Name: Scarlet Fernandes
Title: Golconda Fort
Review: Great arrangements and stone carvings!!One can view the whole of Hyderabad from the top of the fort

Name: Saarah B
Title: Beautifully buily
Review: The fort is very marvelously built and the structure is one worth seeing. The fort is huge and it’s awe inspiring that such a beautiful construction was made in times where there were no machines and nothing to help people make the fort. The sunsets at Golconda Fort are ravishing. Will recommend going here if you have come to Hyderabad.

Name: Ken W
Title: Sound and light show
Review: We came in the evening to watch the sound and light show.  It’s about a 4 hundred metre walk from the entrance to where the seats are located.There are 2 sets of seats...vip on a raised area up some steps, and ordinary at ground level.  To be honest, I think the view was probably as good from the non-vip seats.  Bottom line, there’s not a lot of difference.They do give out tubes of insect repellent, but we had applied our own spray before arriving.  There are plenty of mosquitoes, but we weren’t bitten.The sound and light show was ok, but there were many songs and poems included  in the performance, which meant that the whole thing dragged on quite a bit.  We’d previously been to a similar show in Jaipur and Udaipur which were superior.  However, if we hadn’t been to the other shows, we probably would’ve enjoyed this one more.Overall, it was worth going but we won’t return.

Name: James L
Title: One of my stops with ASLI HYDERBAD
Review: It's quite a climb to the top, but worth it!  My guide Nagarjuna from Asli Hyderbad took me here, and had great knowledge about all the history.  Also kept me safe from all the people asking to be my guide!

Name: JeffCarter
Title: Amazing
Review: I am so glad I came here. I was in India for a wedding and had a few free days so took a tuk tuk and came to the fort and learned a lot of history, the hope diamond is here or was, the only geocache in Hyderabad is here, and I had a wonderful afternoon just walking around. The weather was not bad in late January. There was a lot to see and do I even stumbled upon an indoor area that had a swarm of bats that was very cool to discover. The entrance fee was nominal and I think it was totally worth it a good way to spend a few hours and an interesting thing to see in Hyderabad.

Name: Nilesh Patil
Title: Fort
Review: Good.Laser show was good. Hugh area.Well maintained.....Lot of mosquitoes in the evening during laser show............

Name: Saurabh M
Title: Birla Mandir....peace....calm and beauty
Review: Exploring Telangana...... Hyderabad.....at birla.maindir.......No cameras are allowed here.......Located near lakadi ka pull metro station.......  Beautiful place......Birla Mandir is near to Lakdi-ka-pul and Assembly Hyderabad metro station. Birla Mandir is well connected by TSRTC buses and MMTS. The nearest MMTS station is Lakdi ka pul. Bus No: 5K,5S,5 From Secunderabad to Mehdipatnam any bus no. 113 from Uppal to Mehdipatnam.Birla Mandir is a Hindu temple, built on a 280 feet (85 m) high hillock called Naubath Pahad on a 13 acres (53,000 m2) plot in Hyderabad, Telangana, India. The construction took 10 years and was opened in 1976 by Swami Ranganathananda of Ramakrishna Mission. The temple was constructed by Birla Foundation, which has also constructed several similar temples across India, all of which are known as Birla Mandir....The temple manifests a blend of Dravidian, Rajasthani and Utkala architectures. It is constructed of 2000 tons of pure white marble. The granite idol of presiding deity Lord Venkateswara is about 11 ft (3.4 m) tall and a carved lotus forms an umbrella on the top. There is a brass flagstaff in the temple premises which rises to a height of 42 ft (13 m). The temple does not have traditional bells, as Swami Ranganathananda wished that the temple atmosphere should be conducive for meditation.Apart from the main shrine, the consorts of Lord Venkateswara, Padmavati and Andal are housed in separate shrines. The temple also has separate shrines for various Deva and Devi including Shiva, Shakti, Ganesh, Hanuman, Brahma, Saraswati and Lakshmi. Selected because teachings of men and Gurbani are engraved on temple walls. Birla temples are open to all, as identified by Mahatma Gandhi and other Hindu leaders.

Name: Shubham Mishra
Title: When you are at god's place, no one is left empty-handed.
Review: For theists, come for lord Venkateshwara's blessings+ breathtaking view of Hyderabad. For atheists, come for breathtaking view of Hyderabad.

Name: Andrew D
Title: Hyderabad's highlight
Review: This is one of my favorite places in Hyderabad. The details are quite elaborate and there are many sculptures to appreciate, as well as a lovely view of the Hyderabad city from the top.Mobile phones are not allowed inside, but you can leave it in the cloak room and take a number.

Name: OctOriental
Title: No Big Deal
Review: Shoes off. Mobile phones no no. The temple is not any grand architectural piece of tourist interest. It's just another temple for devouts obsessed with temples. If you're not in that category put it last on your list.

Name: Jayavel D
Title: Divinity
Review: Very beautiful place and construction was tremendous and shows the passionate of the person who constructed.

Name: Daniela R
Title: Great site to visit
Review: Beautiful temple and spectacular view of the lake and surroundings from the top. Does not allow photography so cell phones cannot be brought along.

Name: Vaishnavi_g
Title: Beautiful temple of marble
Review: Very beautiful temple on a hillock. Avoid going around noon time, as the marble gets really hot under the sun. Worth a visit if you have good enough time in your itinerary.

Name: rd07
Title: Beautiful Temple, I visited after decades!
Review: Visited this temple as a kid. Now after many years. Its a beautiful temple located on top of a hill. It faces Hussain Sagar and give 360 degree view of the city. Its Lord Venkateshwara's temple and one cannot take a camera to click pictures.

Name: Kavya Sharma
Title: The White Beauty
Review: One of the most beautiful and peaceful places of Hyderabad. The vibes of the temple cannot be expressed in words. If you are planning to visit the temple try to go early in the morning or in the evening.

Name: AjithBhaskaran
Title: Good view of the city from here
Review: Good view of the city from the Mandir. They do not allow mobiles inside but the way they manage the mobile safekeep is commendable. The place can get crowded on weekends and holidays. Lumbini Park is nearby but not a ‘must visit’.

Name: Ravindra V
Title: Peaceful experience
Review: This temple is situated on the top in the area known as Adarsh Nagar. Made of marble and is simply marvellous. Photography is not allowed.

Name: Dr RAJKUMAR YADAV
Title: Best place to visit
Review: Best place to visit as it's historical and having great hindu mythological values.clean and hygienic compound as well as best surroundings

Name: Gurus49
Title: Lovely Temple
Review: A beautiful place to experience peace and tranquility amidst the hustle and bustle of the city of Hyderabad.

Name: shekharlele
Title: Great place
Review: Like other Birla temples across the country, it is an architectural masterpiece. Close to the lake, it is a must visit. However, pls ensure you don't carry any stuff such as mobile phone, umbrella. food, water, etc as nothing is allowed inside.

Name: Himanshu S
Title: Good to visit in the evening.
Review: It is temple of Lord Vishnu, made in white marble, with other deities like Ganesha, Hanuman, Sai baba in separate smaller temples. Thee is lift facility for elderly people. Very well managed, excellent visit. Good to visit in the evening.

Name: Laxmi K
Title: Peaceful and Divine.
Review: Lovely architecture and marble carvings. Great view of the hussain sagar lake from this beautiful Venkateshwara Temple that is located atop a hillock. Must visit.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Go for the stunning architecture
Review: Beautifully maintained, the temple is perched on a small hill top. It makes creative use of the rocks and the hill side. Views from the top are breathtaking. Cameras and mobiles are not allowed. You can deposit them in the free locker facility. Go early around 9-10 am before the place starts getting crowded.

Name: gabrial03330
Title: Great place
Review: The place is indeed very much attractive. The temple made out of pure white marble. Really a must see place. Within walking distance they do have a science museum , planetarium and a archeological one with Dinosaurs fossil which you can have a real closer look.It's so mesmerising to imagine that we are standing closer to an animal's remnants that walked around the earth milion of years ago.

Name: challa prashanth reddy
Title: Awesome place with awesome view
Review: nice and peaceful place on the top of hill and can experience the Hussein Sagar Lake. Temple Build totally with White Marble. No mobiles are allowed into the temple.One can find peace if we visit in evenings.

Name: Mainak_Choudhuri
Title: Nice temple atop a hill
Review: The mandir is atop a hill beside Hussain Sagar. You need to keep your camera / mobile in the cloak room and take off your footwear before entering the temple. The temple has clear side view from the Hussain Sagar side only (from Necklance road) but not from the entry side. It is temple of Lord Vishnu, made in white marble, with other deities like Ganesha, Hanuman, Sai baba in separate smaller temples. Thee is lift facility for elderly people. Very well managed, excellent visit. Good to visit in the evening.

Name: Prachet
Title: Collecting My Thoughts at the Scenic Birla Temple
Review: Situated atop a small hill, the Birla Temple offers scenic views of the city.  Though I'm not into rituals or visiting a ton of religious places, the temple offered a moment of quiet after a busy day of sight-seeing in a hot and sultry city.

Name: ramchowdry
Title: Birla mandir visit
Review: Wonderful temple view and recommend to visit with family .Preferably in the evening be there by 6:30 to 7:00  , really amazing temple .

Name: dr ganapathi bhat
Title: " Simply magnificent"
Review: Pristine and huge structure made of marble. At a height, so gives a good city view and an outstanding Hussain Sagar lake view.Vast car parking. There are some steps to climb, but lift is available. Employees are very friendly.Idol of Lord Venkateshwara is magnificent. There are also idols of different dieties that are simply superb.No entry fee. Camera is not allowed  inside the Mandir. There is a counter to keep your belongings.  Hand bag and purse are permitted. About 45 minutes would suffice to cover the entire Mandir.  Inside, a serene feeling should be felt to be believed.An idol shop in  the premises can be visited.  In Hyderabad, don't miss Birla Mandir. Best to go in the night.

Name: Shashikant Pandey
Title: Birla Temple
Review: Awesome place with full peace of mind. You forgot rest issues of life during you are there in temple. Its a heritage and beautiful architecture.

Name: navinderpuri
Title: Life long experience
Review: It’s so beautiful and serine. Clean and calm  gives you eternal peace   I felt as if I am connected to god. My wife wished for something and it was fulfilled

Name: Rohit g
Title: awesome...
Review: pure white marble twmole with what a great finishing.Lobed the view from top of the city.Felt very divine and we enjoyed tge place

Name: PurnimaJaay
Title: Beautiful
Review: This temple is really beautiful and has a nice night view of the city. Simple marble build temple with good positive vibes.

Name: Sunil
Title: Birla mandi
Review: The madir looks too beautiful and they have well constructed to attract tourist and its nice place to visit

Name: chjprakash
Title: Good view of city
Review: One gets a good view of the city from the top. It's very peaceful at the temple and the temple is majestically done up. Beautiful and peaceful is the word

Name: Mutukuloju Pranay
Title: Good Experience
Review: the mandir is built by white marble. such a cool devotional place.once after darshan you can see the entire of Hussain Sagar and central Hyderabad monuments outside of main mandir

Name: anil1967
Title: Amazing structure
Review: A beautiful temple. Very serene and calming.The architecture is wonderful and worth visiting just for this alone.The Temple is beautiful and a must visit

Name: Talent P
Title: The temple is a blend of Dravidian, Rajasthani and Utkala architectures
Review: It is constructed of 2000 tons of pure white marble. The granite idol of presiding deity Lord Venkateswara is about 11 ft tall and a carved lotus forms an umbrella on the top. There is a brass flagstaff in the temple premises which rises to a height of 42 ft

Name: Vinki K
Title: Nice temple with awesome views of city
Review: Located near necklace road this is a temple of Lord Balaji. Gives an awesome views of city skyline,  tank bund and necklace road streets after dark.

Name: Shashi Prakash Mishra
Title: A must watch
Review: A beautiful piece of architecture built over a high place where from you can see a major part of city

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Beautiful temple complex
Review: We had visited the beautiful Birla Mandir during our sightseeing in Hyderabad. From the parking area, one has to climb decent count of stairs to reach the main temple. We had to remove shoes and submit mobile phones before starting the climb. Entire temple complex is built out of milky white marble and looks stunning. The views of Hussain Sagar Lake from the top is mesmerizing. We liked the ambiance and the beautiful decor of Lord Balaji inside the main temple.

Name: shweta_srii
Title: Always a nice outing
Review: We've visited the temple umpteen times and it's always been a pleasant outing.The temple is at a height and one needs climb quite a few stairs but there is also lift facility available for the elderly and those who find it difficult to climb all the way.The temple is made if white marble and is super clean and well managed. Apart from the main deity of Lord venkateshwara, there is also a sai baba temple. Architecturally the temple is interesting as it has the southern style pyramid top as well as the orissa style top. It has intricate carvings in the main temple and also mythological scenes are depicted.The temple overlooks the necklace road and the Nagarjuna sagar and one can get a glimpse of the whole city from the top.Worth a visit in Hyderabad!

Name: Sundaresh
Title: A Pseudo Tirumala Balaji Temple in Hyderabad
Review: A best place to have darshan of Lord Balaj. The Temple is located in heart of beautiful Hyderabad, on hill. The temple is preist freindly and having nice atmosphere. from Temple, you can experience  bird eye view of important places in Hyderabad and Secunderabad especially   scenic  beauty of Lord Budhha statue, Necklace Road, Secreteriat, Assembly, Golconda fort and bridge connecting Hyderabad and Secunderabad.After having darshan, you can visit planeterium, which is very educative and informative. Many Hotels both veg and non-veg serving Telangana authentic cuisine is very satisfactory.for easy travel, Hyderabad Metro is conveniently located. A best  pocket friendly place to visit   and enjoy with family.

Name: VasantaLeela
Title: Spring breeze is lovely at the hilltop
Review: The cool clean marble walkways, orderly queues and relaxed convivial 'crowds' make the religious visit a much more thankful and spiritual experience! Govinda''s energy, no doubt :-D

Name: Tejisaji
Title: White Temple
Review: Yes very nice, peaceful place to visit. and best is they have an elevator for the senior citizen as well but make it sure they don't charge anything from you because it is free

Name: Topping
Title: Great place 🙏🏼🙏🏼🙏🏼
Review: Lovely PlaceGood place to go in the city and very near to Hussain sagar . Very clean and good place to go with family

Name: Oneil
Title: Birla Mandir
Review: Very pretty temple which encompasses several faiths & religions. Strategically located on top of a hill which overlooks the entire city.Very clean. Very thoughtful of the management to provide soft mats on the marble floor & steps which makes it very convenient to walk on rather than burning your soles.

Name: Umesh R
Title: Peaceful
Review: Long queue was there but it going in proper way, at top of temple lake view is good. Very neat and clean place.

Name: AKSHAT J
Title: Place of peace
Review: It was a nice place and totally white people comes from as far as they come.I feel very grateful and peace there You must go one time Radha krishna temple

Name: Him6788
Title: Lovely Place
Review: Good place to go in the city and very near to Hussain sagar . Very clean and good place to go with fammily

Name: Jinesh S
Title: Good Temple to visit
Review: Mobiles and Shoes are strictly not allowed,Entry upto 9 pm only, good to visit in evening time. 200 steps to climb, temple is really nice. you can sit  their and view from above is magnificent

Name: Neelam Rawat
Title: Beautiful experience
Review: If you are visiting to Hyderabad then it's a must go place, the best time is October to December and before 10am and after 5pm is the best time to visit as white marbles will be a bit heated so these two timing is best to visit there.You can't take your mobile and camera inside so there is free clock room to submit your stuff.

Name: JeffCarter
Title: Great Views
Review: This place is very beautiful - but things to know. No Camera of any type. Must take shoes off (not too dirty to walk in socks). You only need about 30-45 minutes. I am glad I went, the views of town are incredible and the white marble structure is stunning. I wish I could have taken at least my phone camera. This was not on a suggest list of places to visit - so I had to ask to add it. I am glad I did. But I did not try to use the bathrooms or shop in the gift shop so have no opinions of those experiences.

Name: Pablodvlp
Title: Multi God white marble temple overlooking the lake
Review: Beautiful white marble temple dedicated to multiple gods.Once you leave all electronics, backpacks and shoes, you head towards to top of the hill where the temples are located. There are various sections for different gods.The view from the top is pretty good, especially towards the lake.There is a gift shop right outside the exit which is also a good spot for pictures.I enjoyed checking the shops on the side of the road on the way down back to the city.If you are on this side of the city, it's a good opportunity to also check out Sagar lake.

Name: shirin t
Title: Holi place
Review: This another amazing place super beautiful white marble stares reach on top and the stone are carved tells the whole story of Vishnu avatars. All of them. And you feel very blessed to be there and don't want to come out at all.

Name: importedinteriors
Title: A STUNNING AND MAGNIFICENT TEMPLE
Review: Beautiful, well maintained, and a temple that everyone should visit when they are in Hyderabad. Has a wonderful view of tank Bund.

Name: Bharath m
Title: For a peaceful devotional
Review: Very nice and peaceful place for devotees to worship Lord Balaji. Whenever I feel devotional,will visit this place compulsory.

Name: Supraja
Title: Place of peace
Review: Have to visit the mandir for sure Everytime I visit. What a atmosphere ... Really a very good time and quality time spent

Name: Jajabor
Title: Excellent view of the city
Review: Must visit for tourists in Hyderabad looking to experience a spectacular view of the necklace road around the Hussain Sagar lake. Parking space is a bit of a problem. The approach to the temple is very narrow, steep and almost always very congested.

Name: Sagar Bidkar
Title: Nice temple
Review: Like any other Birla temple this is also very nicely constructed temple. The feel is so serene and location offers very good view of HussainSagar lake.

Name: CuriousTraveller
Title: I wish everybody calls it as Balaji Temple instead of Birla Mandir
Review: It is one of the best temples in Hyderabad. I love the temple very much. From the temple you can view the entire city and its beauty. The best time to visit is on Saturday. The crowd is more on Saturdays, Sunday evenings and on festivals. If you like to have peaceful darshan without crowd avoid all the days that I mentioned above. Overall its a great experience.

Name: tapas1966205
Title: God Venkateswara called us.
Review: Till we saw the Idol, we were not knowing that Birla  Mandir houses Balaji -we are follower of Balaji. So, after taking all those steps , when we saw Lord Balaji - we were overwhelmed . The whole temple was very nicely and painstakingly kept clean . On will also get a superb cityline view from the top level.

Name: moogul818
Title: Nice Experience
Review: It is one such place of worship where a sense of calm descends on you as you enter. Located at a relative height on the bank of the Hussain Sagar lake, the temple offers a good view. It is neat clean and well managed.You are not harassed by vendors and once you are on the steps of the temple you can be on your own.I would recommend it for a visit when in Hyderabad.

Name: Quest797144
Title: a great religious place
Review: The temple construction is in sync with sanctity of the religious place. Though it has many steps to climb, there is provisions for senior and handicapped people. Once inside the temple, one feels calm and serene in front of the deity. A great place to visit again and again.

Name: shilpi j
Title: Pleasant and calm place
Review: Birla temple is for sure a must visit while in Hyderabad. Being a local i have visited this place couple of times and always find it neat and calm. Unlike other temples three management here is good and you get ample time for darshan without any pushing and things alike. Also, u have an option of buying the prasad ladoo, which is very nice. I never miss it. There view from the temple is surreal overlooking lake. All in all its a nice and beautiful places to spend some quality time in peace.

Name: Rohit Bandil
Title: Worst management, Don't plan on festival & new year day
Review: I had gone on 1st jan 2020 with my family.It was huge rush there and there was no management to handle those many peoples. Unfortunately rain had come and people started breaking there queue and stated rushing into the temple. Temple does not have capacity & space to handle more crowd.Small children were crying in the rush and temple floor became very slippery due to water. There was no management, children were crying, entry side people were breaking queue.It was almostt stampedelike a situation in the temple but fortunately, by god grace, r an hia stoped after some time. I would not recommended & suggest to visit on any festival or an new year day like.Temple is very good and place is very calm. You can plan it on any other day.d

Name: Deepak
Title: Darshan
Review: Excellent darshan. Nearby laser show and gardens. Mini shopping shops good one. Take a city tour of royal they will charge rs 400 and start from Birla mandir .see lakdi ka bridge nearby you will love.

Name: vinvara
Title: Temle visit
Review: A peaceful heaven A sincere placecto visit White marble temple, very clean No mobile phones are allowed bur have secured locker service Good car parking spaceWas good to see lots of school children attending A must visit white in Hyderabad

Name: Sriramramanathan
Title: Pristine and Serene granite temple
Review: This is on the shores of Hussain Sagar, but the approach road is very narrow. This will lead to traffic chokes. Either go @ 7 am or if you go later, alight and walk to avoid delays. All vehicles ( specially cars) cannot turnabout until the temple gate and hence you will always have a backed up traffic to challenge. once you get into the temple , you have to deposit your mobile/ electronics and footwear into its respective lockers/ spaces. The mobile locker line will delay you further if you don’t go early morning. After this, the pristine beauty of the granite hill top temple will captivate you no bounds. The temple main deity is Venkateswara and you have the related gods and goddesses en route. The view from top, of the necklace road and Hussain Sagar is breathtaking.

Name: Ambrish L
Title: Serene and blissful
Review: I went there on 25-Dec. Being a holiday it was overcrowded. But they had managed the crowd so well, it was smooth. Overall a peaceful and blissful experience.

Name: Pratik Choudhari
Title: Blissful experience
Review: Made out of white marble birla Mandir is located at a hill top and provides Hyderabad's skyline view. Temple premises is clean and tidy. Must visit in Hyderabad if not for god visit for the atmosphere there and the view.

Name: Sreedharan N
Title: Birla Mandir is a Hindu temple built on a 280 feet high hillock called Naubath Pahad on a 13 acres plot.
Review: Birla temple dedicated to Lord Venkateshwara of TTD  Temple is said that a whopping quantity of white marble, which is almost 2000 tonnes, was brought from Rajasthan for building this temple white marble, They are actively involved in welfare programmes, charity programmes..

Name: Suresh T
Title: Bhel
Review: A beautiful temple made of white marble. This is the temple of Lord Venkteswar. Well managed temple and situated at height. A must visit site for Hindus, visiting Hyderabad.

Name: pushpa b
Title: Beautiful!
Review: It's beautifully built. You have to leave your bags, cell phones and other electronics in the cloak room. So I suggest if you have a taxi hired, leave it in there. The view from the top is nice.

Name: CuriousTraveller2014
Title: Reasonably good temple
Review: White marble temple, overlooking Hussain Sagar Lake, Hyderabad city. Approach roads very narrow. Seems Birla science museum is near by, which opens at 11am, wanted to visit it but went too early to temple.Can visit if you get time.

Name: Naik M
Title: Superb place to visit
Review: This is a really very good place to visit in Hydrabad, when going for any purpose. The temple is so beautiful that on each visit you will be happy.i

Name: Prakash
Title: Family visit
Review: Beautiful temple, went with family and enjoyed but they are not allowing to sit also and spend some time...

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Can't forget the experience of the visit
Review: It's a great temple made up milk white marbles depicting gods and stories from Ramayan. They don't allow photography and cell phones inside the temple. You need to deposit the cellphones in the safety lockers, and foot wear in stand. Then you can take Darshan with barefoot. You can take Darshan of Lord Ganesha,  Hanuman and Shirdi Sai baba on the way. Then take darshan of balaji ( Lord Venkateswara). On the way you can also see the beautiful city with hussain sagar lake and tank bund. The city looks so beautiful from the temple. There is lift facility also for old and aged people. Overall its a beautiful temple. Saturdays and Sundays the crowd is more.

Name: Mittal28
Title: Clean temple
Review: You cannot take your mobile and camera inside the temple you need to keep in locker room..steps are more..but very clean temple..from top you can see the whole city view..do visit once

Name: Tarun
Title: Hindu temple
Review: A must visit place in Hyderabad. The architectural structures is extra ordinary. The detailing of white marble are awesome. This temple gives you a different experience. It's well maintained and it's very neat neat and clean. The security of very tight. One of the best tourist attractions in Hyderabad.

Name: Rasik shah
Title: Visited birla Mandir
Review: Nice beautiful Mandir. Great entrance to see god idols clearly. Well organized in & out door  . Big tall ceiling. I will recommend to my friends and family to visit this temple

Name: Praveen
Title: Good..
Review: Good place I visited recently. Peace and calm place. Looking so beautiful and enjoyed in the place. Simply nice....

Name: Aravind D
Title: Must see
Review: Nice temple and you definitely need to see this. If possible go in the evening where the lightings would be great.

Name: Nikola Nesic
Title: Magnificient temple
Review: Take off your shoes and enjoy the marble under your feet. Beatufiul place, with astonishing view from it.

Name: Ratnesh M
Title: Temple of Lord Venkateshwara
Review: My Hyderabad visit would not have been completed if I had not visited this famous temple. After indepence of India, the Birla family - the famous philanthropist and industrialist established Hindu temples at several places in the country mainly of Lord Lakshmi Narayan. This temple being in South India, this temple is dedicated to Lord Venkateshwara. Though every places of worship is sacred, however, the unique thing about this temple is its location. It is situated on a hillock overlooking the necklace road and a part of city - just  mesmerizing particularly during night time. Since camera or mobile phones are not allowed inside the temple, I could not take any pictures inside or of the surroundings. Ample Parking is available there.

Name: Shalini N
Title: Beautiful temple on a hillock
Review: The temple is situated on a hilltop.  The view from the top is beautiful, especially in the evenings. However please be informed that you will have to walk a lot to reach the main deity. Walking includes climbing a steep hill, flight of steps etc. Hence, if you have difficulty in walking, don't take risk.. the road leading to the temple is narrow

Name: KARTHIK I
Title: Best temple in hyderabad to visit
Review: I really love the neatness and maintenance of this place. Chants all over really well managed place. Good seating place and really clean.You can have a good view of tankbund and hyderabad early in the morning from the temple.I recommend everyone to visit atleast once.

Name: OMKAR PAGADALA
Title: Birla Mandir
Review: Full of White and Full of Marble.Birla Mandir is the best place to keep our mind peaceful. Even though it is located in main Hyderabad city. The place near the Mandir is very calm and peaceful.

Name: MyNameIs Shiva
Title: God Balaji
Review: It's a Balaji Temple and  a beautiful place where we get Peace for sometime made the temple with marbles looks great and the view of HussaiSagar from the temple makes us feel great.

Name: NAZEER SHAIK
Title: Very beautiful place for visitors
Review: Its an very devotional and visiting lace in greater Hyderabad. A powerful god who trust all the religions.

Name: ash0501
Title: Faith ad beautiful
Review: Temple bulit in marble for devotees of lord Krishna , beautiful idol in black, climbing the 261 stairs gives u a view of the city,lake ad single stone statue of Buddha, unbelievable

Name: sree143in
Title: Lord venkateswara
Review: Birla mandir is Lord venkateswara temple built this temple entire with milk stone. very nice look in the evening lights.

Name: Sapnasachin
Title: Peaceful with wonderful view
Review: Birla Temple is build on a hill.  The temple offer a wonderful view of Hyderabad City including Hussain Sagar Lake. The temple can be accessed from two different roads.  From access path opposite RBI,  one need to walk to the temple however from other side vehicle can go upto main gate of temple. Cars can go till main entry.  Mobiles are not allowed in temple. Shoes and mobiles need to be submitted in cloak room.  From entry gate to main Vishnu Temple it is approximate 100 stairs.  Lift is available for senior citizens and physically handicapped however the same is situted in a hidden corner reached post climbing 20-25 stairs.  Main Temple Premises have idol of Lord Vishnu,  Garura.  The temple is clean and well maintained.  One can sit and enjoy the view of city from Temple Premises.

Name: Puladasu Rajesh
Title: #BirlaMandir
Review: It's near to Tank band, Hussain Sagar in Telangana state...One of the famous Lord venkateswara temple in Hyderabad....

Name: archie
Title: Excellent View
Review: Must visit place in Hyderabad. The atmosphere is very pleasant. I do visit the place veryfrequently. To see the real beauty of the city and hussain sagar lake one must visit the place in the evening.

Name: Dilip
Title: Wonderful Temple to visit
Review: It's amazing temple (all white marvels). The temple is a wonderful temple on a small hilly area. The close by places are congested.

Name: bh s
Title: EXCELLENT PLACE FOR DEVOTEES
Review: Lord Sri VENKATESWARA Temple Superb Place, for all devotees, its at pleasent atmosphere, better to visit evenigs

Name: MukeshDave
Title: Very nice temple
Review: One must visit this in the evening to have a beautiful view of the city and lake. The watchman was good to take us thru lift as we were with our old parents.

Name: Dieneish A
Title: best architracture
Review: its is best temple in hydrabad , also photogrphy is not avaiable in temple .white marble ,nice view , on hilll you  can see lumbini park frm temple, you can see this temple from Golconda fort

Name: Ajit A
Title: Beautiful place
Review: This mandir is very well maintained and the rules are also very strict. You can't carry even your mobile inside the mandir. Although, from top you would like to take photos of the city. Auto options are limited and if you miss it then you will have to walk till the main road to find one. Whatever be the case, this temple should not be missed.

Name: Suresha_Posavalike
Title: Beautiful Temple
Review: It's a beautiful and peaceful place to visit. As Mandir is very beautiful and from the top you can see the Hyderabad. Parking for four-wheelers is limited and the road is a little narrow. Lift for senior citizens is available but usually, need to search for an operator. There is also a free facility for keeping your shoes, gadgets and other belongings in the safe.

Name: Sounak Poddar
Title: Architect
Review: Birla Mandir has now been established in many of the cities in India and not only that they have set up temples outside India as well. It is a nice place to visit. All the Birla temples are the same structurally so nothing special about the structure here.

Name: rggg
Title: Amazing peace!!
Review: Good:-1. Amazingly peaceful place2. You get to see panaromic views of Hyderabad 3. Very well maintained and clean4. No tickets5. Nice breeze flowing Only thing which we missed is our mobile phones. Some pics would have been great.

Name: Vijay Mitta
Title: Pride of Hyderabad...
Review: Marble wonder ,Marble Marvel... must visit place for people visiting Hyderabad... Very centrally locatated...

Name: Meka S
Title: Must visit place in Hyderabad
Review: Excellent location. Beautiful temple made of marbles of Lorad Venkateswara on a hill top middle of the city. You can see the traditional Hyderabad oneside, secretariat and assembly the other end. Best place to enjoy Sunset and surise. The view of Hussain Sagar , necklace road and tank bund leaves you forever memory

Name: Srisadhana
Title: Must see
Review: Reaching the temple through narrow lanes by walk may feel tough but it does worth it. Such an awesome view of city we never get from anywhere.

Name: wonderful life
Title: A place to visit
Review: A must visit place and worth the visit.If you are o vaca8to hyderabad, don't miss this spot to visit.Keeo this i. Your travel basket in your next visit

Name: Tushita
Title: Must Visit Place on Hyderabad trip
Review: It is one of the largest one-man collections of antiques and art in the world and showcases the personal collection of Salar Jung III, a former Prime Minister of the Hyderabad state. The museum has a vast collection of sculptures, paintings, manuscripts, clocks, and other artifacts.

Name: Amit Bansal
Title: Nice quick visit
Review: You must & should only visit such places if you have an eye for the art & artifacts. Else, you would not enjoy it.

Name: Shubham Mishra
Title: Salarjung museum, best place to showcase weapons after a Jung!
Review: For history buffs like me, this place will feed you like no other place in Hyderabad. Do visit once for a breathtaking experience. Time your visit accordingly as it will take a huge chunk of your day to explore this place thoroughly.

Name: Ruzan Desai
Title: Best Museum in India. Period!
Review: It is a the best museum in India with artifacts from across the globe. Each individual will find something of their interest in many of their rooms. Booking the E-ticket prior is a good idea during the holiday season. Adequate refreshments and seating area at different places in the museum for the elderly. The layout is friendly for the differently abled.

Name: jojo
Title: Informative and peaceful
Review: Visited the museum and was much informative. Properly managed the museum had many collections of variety of different culture having ihistorical importance. The location was very peaceful . Shows being held giving detailed explanation attended by visitors.. Students were visiting at that  time and  overcrowded. Ticket was Rs 50, and Rs 50 if taking photos. Restaurant was available nearby. Wash room facilities were not adequate.

Name: Xavier D
Title: Salar Jung
Review: It is a good musuem with lot of things to know especially for the children. For others also there is a lot to explore.

Name: Andrew D
Title: One of India's best museums
Review: While this museum is overcrowded, it houses an impressive collection of items from around the world. This is honestly one of the best museums I have ever seen and it is worth at least 3 hours or even half a day!

Name: Tripping With Praj
Title: A Unique Experience
Review: I had read a lot about the Salar Jung museum before visiting it as it is one of the top tourist attractions in Hyderabad. The best section of this museum is the Ivory artefacts on display which are simply amazing. The fine carving and craftwork is something you should not miss out on. Other than this, there is a small clock tower which is supposed to be the showstopper. Every hour, a miniature soldier comes out of the clock tower and rings the Gong. This was a big disappointment for me and feel it is overhyped. Other than these, the museum has a wide range of artefacts and collection that depicts the ancient history of the city.

Title: Glimpse at Salar Jung Museum
Review: The museum is worth watching. Takes 3-4 hours to have a glimpse at everything. They close doors at 5 pm. No baggage allowed. Cloak room available.

Name: Chandra J
Title: Very crowded, hard to see things
Review: Very very very  crowded but we did come during Diwali holiday so there were many people there.  Mostly rooms with multiple items of the same thing.  Unless you are a big history buff I would skip it.

Name: Daniela R
Title: In desperate need of renovation
Review: Very interesting exhibits and artifacts, but this museum needs a major renovation. Even without the renovation, the exhibits should be kept clean: there was thick dust visible on most glass items, as well as on the shelves on which they were placed. Access to second floor should be marked as I spent 10 minutes looking for the stairs.

Name: Jaykann
Title: Highlight is the clock
Review: Museum which reflects our history and culture. It takes 3 hrs almost to cover the museum.It's always good show history to next generation and this place is one among of that to show kids.Don't miss 12 o clock ring which is must to do so plan accordingly. Well maintained and worth a visit

Name: Sajid
Title: One of the best in India
Review: With over 40,000 artefacts, this is claimed to be the single largest one-man private collection in the world. And some of the artefacts are just awesome. The veiled Rebecca, the famous clock, European paintings, etc are some of the highlights. Needs at least 3 hours to do justice to the collection.

Name: FellowTraveler795932
Title: Grand Collection of art and more...
Review: We were in Hyderabad for just one day for a family event and it was raining so thought we will spend sometime indoor so went to the Salar Jung Museum but it turned out really awesome. Lots of masterpieces including the Veiled Rebecca, Raja Ravi Varma oil paintings and also MF Hssain and one by M N Roy.  Many other artifacts from India, Burma, China and Europe.  Not to miss...

Name: Mayank G
Title: History Revisited
Review: This place is good people who love to see our historical art, culture and architecture. Good place to get knowledge about history of Hyderabad . A Well maintained museum.

Name: Jalpesh Rojasara
Title: Best collection of nizaam
Review: Must visit museum in India. 4 to 5 hours required to visit it's 2 floor building. All gallery are in excellent condition with clean and air conditioning environment. Must watch ancient watch show. All collection are in excellent condition.

Name: A peaceful house in Hyderabad, India
Title: connecting to your roots
Review: well if you like to know more about your history then this is the place you should go. It is filled with a never exhausting treasure of  knowledge.

Name: queenspr
Title: Seeped with history
Review: This is a great  museum seeped in historical knowledge.A guide here is a must at only Rupees 200 available on site

Name: DipuKV
Title: Vivid
Review: A prominent National Museum of India, located in Hyderabad, Salar Jung Museum takes you on a nostalgic tour of the past, with its collection of royal trappings such as sculpture, paintings, textiles, manuscripts, ceramics, carpets, clocks, furniture et al from various parts of the world. The sculpture section is a real masterpiece, and you can keep gazing away at the exquisitely beautiful Veiled Rebecca!

Name: AjithBhaskaran
Title: Interesting collection
Review: Located near Charminar, this museum offers good experience. It is preferable to take a guide from inside the museum. Need to spend around 2 hours inside if you are a casual visitor and more, if you are into research/history. It appears that a few items are not displayed for public, possibly due to renovation. Taxis are not allowed inside and you need to get dropped outside the gate.

Name: Pradip Kumar Roy Choudhury
Title: Veiled Rebecca- a master piece
Review: Great collection, especially the Eastern Pavilion housing exhibits from Japan and China.For us, the collection of walking sticks/Canes,Ivory collection was good.Couldn't see the famed watch collection, one clock in the inner courtyard.Outstanding piece is the Veiled Rebecca, a 19th century sculpture from Italy. Its housed in a glass cage and the mirrors behind give 3-D perspective of this masterpiece. Take your time to appreciate this sculpture. Take your earphones along,focus on the QR code at entrance to the different Pavilions and you get a audio tour.

Name: SuprabhatC
Title: Excellent Museum
Review: This was my third visit to this place and every time it amazes me to see the great collection of artefacts, pieces of arts, gems, armoury, etc. The musical clock, though, seems to have lost its sheen over the years.

Name: Dr RAJKUMAR YADAV
Title: Great place with it's own importance
Review: Great place to visit with it's own importance must visit type property.once in a life should visit the royal style of Hyderabad

Name: Gurus49
Title: Mesmerizing collection
Review: The collection is absolutely amazing. The staff is friendly and helpful and compensate for any time wheelchair acess becomes a problem.

Name: A_Majumdar
Title: Excellent Museum
Review: A beautiful museum with plenty of collections. The museum has some very extra ordinary and attractive collections.

Name: Milind Kshirsagar
Title: Excellent Museum
Review: Wonderful collection of rare artefacts. Make sure you have minimum 3-4 hrs for the visit. Must visit while in Hyderabad.

Name: shekharlele
Title: Great, seems never ending
Review: If you are a lover of ancient artefacts, then even 2 days are insufficient. A one stop place housing items across countries, dynasties and periods. Words can't express the quality and quantity of collections. A must visit. Pls be mindful that is closed on Fridays.

Name: Rahul G
Title: One of the best
Review: This is one of the best museums I have been to !Extraordinary sculptures and statues !Must visit if in Hyderabad !

Name: Amina
Title: Expedition
Review: Loved the ivory room.. This museum is  a repository of the artist achievements of diverse European, Asian and Eastern countries of the world.. There is a lots of history enclosed in this huge museum..

Name: Arun A
Title: Understand the lasy century's king size life of the rulers.
Review: One of the largest collection of artifacts. You need a whole day if you are passionate about the anitque articles and the life of people a century before. It built on floors.

Name: Jaepy K
Title: HYD rides
Review: A must see in Hyderabad. A great collection and very well maintained. Salar Jung family’s private collection is a great asset for the nation.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Salr Jung Museum Part-1
Review: If there is one place that you must visit in Hyderabad, it is this place. You cannot see all the exhibits in one day. To fully enjoy the exhibits, you need to plan at least six visits, spending three to four hours every time. This is exactly what we did. We will be sharing with you the key highlights from each visit. There is an excellent cafeteria on ground floor where you can get lunch and snacks. A smaller cafeteria exists on first floor of Western Wing too.Cameras are allowed and photography fee is mere Rs. 50. Mobiles are allowed only on payment of Rs.50 and you can take pics with your mobile. There is also excellent locker service where for a token fee of Rs.10 you can deposit your stuff. Entrance tickets for domestic tourists is Rs.10.The highlight of museum is Bracket clock. There is huge crowd at 12 noon. So, avoid and go early to reach museum at 10.30 when it opens. Spend some time admiring the veiled Rebecca and marble sculptures in galler-7. Then come out of gallery and sit in the viewing gallery at 10.50 am to have a good view of the bracket clock. Enjoy the 11 am performance. After this you can visit Ivory gallery (Room 6), Walking sticks gallery (Room 8), Arms and Armor gallery (Room 9), Metal ware gallery (Room 10), Indian Modern paintings gallery (Room 11) and Miniature paintings gallery (Room-12).By now you will be completely exhausted. You can have tea/coffee in the cafeteria, lunch or light snacks and come back. Watch out for our next review of the museum!

Name: Chanchal K
Title: Disappointed in this place.
Review: Disappointed, You should skip it you won’t regret.Nothing was really interesting, heavily crowded. Plus it’s really hot inside due to lack of proper ventilation.

Name: Christopher F
Title: Very Disappointed
Review: Reading reviews and descriptions of this museum made it sound very interesting. This museum is made up of one man’s collection allegedly the largest collection making it up a single Museum.  I do realize that museums in India are not up to par with like museums in the western world but the descriptions I read made it sound as if this museum could stand with some of the best museums in the world, it does not. The items in the museum vary greatly from western art, Asian arts, two some interesting archaeological pieces from the Indus Valley. That being said there really are no exquisite pieces that you must see most of the collection was dated from The 18th and 19th centuries AD, not very old pieces. So all in all the collection was not very impressive, at least to me.￼ The actual museum building was also a let down. Some rooms were totally stripped of all the cabinets but were left open, everything needed to be painted, and there were big empty rooms with dirty furniture laid out in no special way.￼ Because this was the first day after reopening due to Covid I can understand why the food court was 90% empty but it look like the gift shop has been closed for a very long time so there was no place to buy souvenirs. I was very much let down by this museum nor would I recommend it to friends or family. But as most everywhere else in India the people, the staff are great￼ and I really appreciate their hospitality.

Name: Prachet
Title: Missing the Most Famous Exhibit at the Famed Salar Jung
Review: My experience shows it pays to do your homework.  By the time I realized the musical clock put up a neat display at the hour, I had breached the frontier by 14 minutes.  Other than that, the museum is a nice way to spend one-two hours exploring the city.

Name: Sunny Cuty
Title: Memorial place
Review: Must visit place in India hyderabad.we r couples visited this place and enjoyed a lot and it's unic place for icon to Hyderabadis I could see people r visiting from deferent countries and enjoying well

Name: nms01
Title: Impressive!
Review: Neat and clean but in dire need of good signages as there is a lot to see in this museum. Loved the Ivory room and the Veiled Rebacca statue. There is a lot of history enclosed in this huge museum. Need a good 2-3 hours to give this place justice. Also The Musical clock demonstration draws a lot of crowd at noon. Some of the lifts were not working which impeded the elders in our family from visiting the upper floors!

Name: Narendar
Title: best place but worst food court
Review: do not eat at the food court inside the museum. They charged 15rs for a single samosa that you get for 5rs outside but still served a day before's stale samosa.

Name: Barbara A
Title: loved seeing the items
Review: We were going to go to the Taj Falkhauama  and this was some of the items that were in the Palace. I liked how they separated the different art from around the world

Name: Polavarapu
Title: Museum
Review: This museum is older  one in Hyderabad I visit frequently here, who ever come to Hyderabad city will definitely visit the museum, here we can see all old monuments which the  kings used

Name: PurnimaJaay
Title: Bad choice
Review: Please don't waste your time or money. This museum has nothing special to display. One will end up walking from room to room. Bad choice. No phone, backpack. Laptop bag. Camera.

Name: Kaushik G
Title: One of the best museums
Review: We had visited the Salar Jung Museum which is one of the top tourist attractions in Hyderabad during our sightseeing in Hyderabad. One has to pay 20 rupees per person for entrance fees and another 50 rupees for photography using mobile phone or camera. The Museum is very big with many galleries across floors showcasing not only historical artifacts collected from this region but also all over the world. We saw coins of different era of India. We saw large paintings, sculptures, clay artifacts, dolls, wooden artifacts, glass artifacts, ivory artifacts and the list goes on. This is a must visit tourist attraction in Hyderabad.

Name: sonali
Title: Excellent place
Review: Excellent place to visit,must a place to visit.Good for family nd friends.A nice place to visit ,enjoyed a lot, will be visiting again

Name: Sunil
Title: Museum
Review: The museum is not great and I won't recommend this place is there are many happening palce  to visy in hyderbad.If your taking ur kids then must vist palce

Name: Hindustan Markets
Title: GOOD ANTIQUE COLLECTION
Review: One of the best places to visit, must visit in Hyderabad for all kings time collection... worth spending time

Name: rakeshMumbai_India
Title: Priceless collections of Art andArtefacts
Review: The museum is located centrally in the city and easily accessible.It contains part of the Nizams Of Hyderabads rare collections from all parts of the world.The Nizams were known as the richest men in the World.THE COLLECTION IS DISPLAYED IN A BUILDING DONATED BY THE LAST NIZAM with all facilities for viewing.Its ticket entry is priced at Rs 20/ and additional Rs 50/ for camera or mobile for taking photos.Its got wash rooms and cafeteria and places to sit and relax .It's like Louvre if Hyderabad... It's famous for hourly chime if a huge cuckoo watch... The white marble Sculpture are marvelous...It's like Louvre ofHyderabad... It's famous forits hourly chime and seconds beating by a blacksmith of a huge cuckoo clock... The white marble carved Sculpture of Rebecca are marvelous.The museum holds hundreds of such priceless items.A Must Visit

Name: Talent P
Title: rare to very rare pieces of art
Review: This meseum is a repository of the artistic achievements of diverse European, Asian and Far Eastern countries of the world. The major portion of this collection was acquired by Nawab Mir Yousuf Ali Khan popularly known as Salar Jung III.

Name: Meena S
Title: One of the best collections of Art and Artefacts
Review: The museum is centrally located and contains part of the Nizams Of Hyderabad immense collection from all over the world.Known as one of the richest men in the World.THE COLLECTION IS DISPLAYED IN A BUILDING DONATED BY THE LAST NIZAM with all facilities for viewing.Its ticket entry is priced at Rs 20/ and additional Rs 50/ for camera or mobile for taking photos.Its got wash rooms and cafeteria and places to sit and relax A must visit

Name: Ratan
Title: Excellent
Review: It was a pleasant surprise to see the very rare collection from the history of HHE Nizam. it is to be seen to believe.

Name: Alok Kumar
Title: Cuckoo Watch and Marble Sculpture of Salarjung Museum
Review: It's like Louvre if Hyderabad... It's famous for hourly chime if a huge cuckoo watch... The white marble Sculpture are marvelous...

Name: dittakavivr
Title: One man collection of the world's greatest artifacts
Review: The largest one man collection in the world.  Many artifacts are unique, no where in the world can be found such pieces.  Should not miss is the Clock when hourly bell rings, a white marble statue with a veil, and many more such awestruck art pieces.

Name: NITHIN KUMAR CHINTHAKINDI
Title: Historic
Review: The Salar Jung Museum is an art museum located at Dar-ul-Shifa, on the southern bank of the Musi River in the city of Hyderabad, Telangana, India. It is one of the three National Museums of India.

Name: Praveen K
Title: LARGE MUSEUM
Review: This is a really large museum with variety of exhibits. The speaking clock is the main attraction for visitors

Name: Oneil
Title: Beautiful !!!
Review: We were impressed by the collection in the museum. The only hitch like in most other museums in India is that the glass covers on all the artefacts are filthy & stained resulting blurred viewing & bad photographs with glares.

Name: Topping
Title: Historical place to see
Review: This time when I visited museum I noticed that this place is not maintained properly as it used to be before.This is very famous museum of hyderabad basically it is a art museum on the bank of musi river in Hyderabad, Telangana state.It has a huge vehicle parking place but it is very unorganised and no one park their vehicles in line so that there should not be a problem to other vistors to park vehicle and even the security guard available is not bothered about it.

Name: Curious785091
Title: Talk about a collection
Review: This guy was certainly a collectors' collector.  It's amazing to see what he has at this museum - I loved Veiled Rebecca - she is just so beautiful!

Name: Leee
Title: Great and very big museum
Review: Very big museum, in the Hyderabad such nice and excellent experience we had in this place. Lot of things are there in this place

Name: rachelsdnl
Title: Antique gallery
Review: This museum is never ending and has so many antiques that are so unique that you may lose track of time admiring the various collections.  The grand attraction is the oldest running clock and the lady in the veil. All art work is commendable and unique.

Name: AbhiMone
Title: Very good musuem
Review: A must watch musuem in Hyderabad. Reasonably well maintained and gives good colour of the hyderabad history

Name: vamsikrishna
Title: Museum recreation,historical monuments.
Review: Today I am going to review about salarjung museum which I have visited many times in the past.This time when I visited museum I noticed that this place is not maintained properly as it used to be before.This is very famous museum of hyderabad basically it is a art museum on the bank of musi river in Hyderabad, Telangana state.It has a huge vehicle parking place but it is very unorganised and no one park their vehicles in line so that there should not be a problem to other vistors to park vehicle and even the security guard available is not bothered about it.This museum has collection of sculpture, paintaings, carpets, furniture from different parts of the world.It has aurangzeb sword and wardrobe of tipu sultan and few tiffon boxes made of gold and diamonds.Paintaings by raja ravi verma.Tickets price is high and nothing much to look in this except few I mentioned above.Overall I can say I personally did not like this museum and will never recommend anybody to visit as its is just a waste of time and energy and more over it is not maintained properly these days.

Name: Jimmycontra
Title: Salarjang museum
Review: We had gone to see Salar Jang museum as we had so much about it. I had been to see it in my youth, when it was in its original palace. This time it was a big let down, whole sections were closed , the reason given was the museum was being renovated. But the inside story is that a lot of good items have been stolen or sold off. There is less than half of the original items collected over a lifetime. There is still a few items worth seeing. Some of the marble statues, especially the lady in a veil n the double sided statue, the best in the world. The mechanical clock which was kept along with several others is now kept in an auditorium like room n on the day we went the room was filled with school children all shouting n chatting loudly n fooling around so you could not see the clock or hear it well at midday. Overall if you have not seen it, it’s worth seeing. It’s value for money. But if this is your second visit you are likely to be disappointed.

Name: Jinesh S
Title: Very Big and Beautiful Museum
Review: We visited when we were at Hyderabad city. Very big Museum having great collection of old paintings, crockery, Photos and Dresses Textiles, Carpets. Main attraction is a clock which is kept in a big hall. Every hour it bells the sound as per timing. Brief description is provided about this clock by museum personnel. Very good information is provided on every floor and every hall. There is canteen and Shop also inside museum. Ticket is Rs 20 for Indian adult.

Name: nomadic_heart7
Title: House of treasures
Review: A must visit if you are in Hyderabad...this has such huge collectin of artefacts acropss the world ans it is personal collection of Salarjung III

Name: HermioneGrangerhp
Title: hypnotising but not the same for everyone
Review: cool place to visit with children it is definitely damn cool quite big and might get exhausted after some time and is a little boring for people who don't like historical places

Name: Sundaresh
Title: A   Treasure house of Nawab Architecture and culture
Review: A place to visit and experience Nawab Culture. The paintings and Sculpture are unique and   cannot be seen anywhere. The clock is only working model in the world. The building is Nawab style. the place is worth to visit for  fun and education.

Name: JeffCarter
Title: Very large
Review: I am not a big fan of museums and when I travel we rarely stop to visit them, but local people highly suggested I pay a visit to this museum so I did I was told to allocate about 90 minutes at least and that was probably just enough time there are endless rooms across two or three levels with massive amounts of art to view it was almost too much to take in some of the stuff was just amazing. You could wander from room to room for days. Very incredible and definitely worth see there’s a lot here and if something is an interesting you just skip that room or skip that level and they’ll be something else around the corner. There was a large film presentation going on but I missed it so I’m not sure what it was and there were lots of school kids attending as well. If you are into museums you might need even more than 90 minutes. Definitely worth a visit I would recommend it. There did not seem to be much air conditioning and I went in January a cool time of year I could imagine during the high summer it might be a little uncomfortable with the heat.

Name: Krishna Sandeep Siram
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: Good historical place, Felt happy to visit this placeBut one should have patience to visit complete Museum

Name: shirin t
Title: Hyderabad dairies
Review: A must visit place it tells you the history of India not only Hyderabad. Weapons from ancient time suits used in ancient warfares. And a lot more to be exposed to. Need few hours to enjoy thoroughly.

Name: OPM
Title: A visit to Salar Jung Museum
Review: Get the glimpses of History and the heritage treasured. A nice and memorable experience to see the collections of a variety of rare articles

Name: Imran Sayed
Title: Tourism
Review: Ok place. Toooooooo big. So might get tired. And children get bored in such places Even for adults if u r not fan of Museum then u just rush pass it. Else will get bored

Name: Jajabor
Title: As exhaustive as it gets!
Review: The Salarjung Museum is not only one of the biggest museums of the country with an exhaustive list of items for visitors to see, it also boasts of some of the most unique sculptures and antique paintings in the world.Parking could be a problem on a holiday or a Sunday given the crowd it attracts from across the country. Keep a good 4 hours in hand once you enter the museum if you want to cover everything. Be prepared to walk a lot through the many alleys and corridors of the building.

Name: Prudhvi
Title: A place of rich cultural heritage
Review: It is great place to learn about our culture and heritage. There areseveral things that were used during anicent days like swords, knifes, clothing etc. It was amazing to see their skills and art at that time and it was difficult to match with the technology we have now. Overall it was a great learning experience.

Name: Pawan Kumar
Title: Visit
Review: Very nice historical place, feeling good to see this place, this very place and very natual. Feeling awasom

Name: scvrose
Title: Great collection!
Review: We were told we were going to a museum, I wondered. But I was impressed with all of the collections by Salar Jung III.  The building is old and could use some updates, but the collection makes it worth while. Check out the two sided sculpture and the veiled lady marble. Worth seeing.

Name: iti_94
Title: organised and well maintained
Review: very big museum and it takes a lot of time to cover everything but i wanted to check out raja ravi varma's paintings and i also found the  children's museum to be very interesting.there were weapons,potteries and furniture  from all over the world.also there were places to eat and sit.There was a singing clock which plays after every one hour.we couldn't cover the oriental gallery as there was no time.

Name: raghukdev
Title: Sad to see
Review: The private collection is clearly one of world’s best. The state in which art is kept and displayed in the museum is abhor-able. The miniature art has no lighting, many of the statutes have a films of dust on it. Despite these conditions the museum draws many visitors. On many occasions I saw visitors touch the art work and at one location (Western Block) I saw 2 guards eating inside the hall ! Go fast as I believe this fantastic collection will soon be destroyed.

Name: tapas1966205
Title: Veiled Rebecca
Review: Veiled Rebecca is " The attraction" of Salarjung museum. Other attractions are The clock,which is still operative and a Statue, which has two faces - Male and Female.

Name: Hasif U
Title: Value for time
Review: You need at least  3 to 4 hours to have a look around this sprawling complex that has many artifacts to grab your attention. As the Museum closes by 5 PM, reaching there just after an early lunch would be advised. Paintings and sculptures are the highlight of this popular museum and ' Veiled Rebecca' is the star.

Name: Deepak
Title: Visit
Review: All history lovers should see museum . Just Rs 20 ticket you see ancient history. This is included in local tour.

Name: rocky rad
Title: 19th Century wooden double statue from unknown soldier alone is worth the visit
Review: Veiled Rebecca by G.B. Benzoni, Italy, 19th century, Biblis - Oil on Canvas by the French painter W.A. Bouguerau 1825-1905 and Wooden Double Statue of Mephistophles/Margeretta by unknown sculptor of 19th century are worth the visit from overseas.

Name: Bhaskar_Bhar
Title: Must visit in Hyderabad
Review: Its pretty big and have huge collection. Its better to visit on non-season days so that you can cover the same in our own time. For Art lovers, its a must visit.

Name: kiran03r
Title: Jung museum
Review: A government museum with all kinds of artifacts from clothing to weapons. Also has a small food court with limited options.

Name: Rajkumar Bansal Dr.
Title: Fantastic
Review: It was a well spent 3 hours with a re-visit and a re-union with our past. Their crockery and vintage car sections are really awesome.

Name: Ambrish L
Title: Nice place with a great collection
Review: The collection and display were good. Esp the marble statue with the viel and clock collection was amazing. The raja Ravi Varma painting was very beautiful.

Name: Sreedharan N
Title: Third largest National Museum in India
Review: Salar Jung Museum is an art museum situated in Hyderabad. Dont miss out on Salar Jung Museum when you travel to Hyderabad.In this museum, belong to different civilizations. Daggers belonging to Empress Noor Jahan, Emperor Jehangir and Emperor Shah Jahan are among the important historical antiques found in the museum.

Name: pushpa b
Title: Must visit!
Review: It is humongous! If you want to do the highlights, take a guide. They cover the important rooms in about an hour and 15 minutes. The clock is the highlight of the museum. It has a small food court as well.

Name: Aparna K
Title: Memorable visit
Review: Well maintained, organized, kids enjoyed specially European clock gallery. There's drinking water and toilets in many locations. They're snacks bar as well.

Name: CuriousTraveller2014
Title: Not to miss
Review: This is excellent museum, witness rich history of Nizam's of Hyderabad. Exquisite ivory items, brass items. Its so vast, if we want to enjoy it in detail, you need a whole day set aside for it. Don't miss it if you are in hyderabad.

Name: chandrasekhar g
Title: Big museum
Review: Recently visited museum and its place for timepass.Many historical things are placed.Food court is available.We can reach by RTC buses.

Name: Mittal28
Title: Very big museum
Review: Entry fee is rs 20..but its very huge..you need to walk a lot..old coins,furniture,paintings utensils,etc are there..we saw half museum cz we we tired.Speciality of museum is ever one hour clock dings loudly..people gather to see

Name: Tarun
Title: Hyderabad museum visit
Review: This is very nice place specially if you want to know more about history. Enjoyed seeing antiques and historical things. Lot of history, with articles of that era, increases general knowledge of the children. There is a Clock, it is a big attraction for specially kids because of its functions. Try to reach in the morning so that you can see 10, 11 or 12 hitting of bell. Keep atleast half day for the museum. Fee is nominal 20/- and timing is 10 am to 5 pm.

Name: Muralidhara N
Title: Significant of Indian Museum for Antique personal Collections!
Review: Spread across about 10 acres in two floors Central,  Eastern & Western Blocks, Salar Jung Museum presents wide range of artefacts majorly from collections by Mir Yousuf Ali Khan /AKA Salar Jung III /Salar Jung I and his descendants. Apparently Mir Yousuf Ali Khan dedicated his entire life collecting antiques & artefacts spending considerable amount of his wealth collecting them across the world.What stands out clearly is the Iconic Antique Clock;every hour (during Museum Opening hours), especially at 12Noon most visitors gather around the click to see the Beautifully orchestrated Ringing of Bell Mechanical clock as Clock Strikes 12 Times. Good arrangements made by museum for seating visitors in the Gallery and Giant TV displays showing the Scene well! Collection of Sarkar Jung III and The Japanese & European Antique Crockeries!

Name: Aravind D
Title: Great museum
Review: You need to go at 12 in the afternoon to listen to the clock's bell. Great collection of items from toys to weapons, all are covered from the king's period

Name: Darshan N
Title: Must visit place in Heydrabad
Review: Very rich place to see antique clocks, guns, swords, antique furniture cloths, photos, marble Satue pervaeved nicely. Clean well planned museum so many historical things are put here.. Needs enough time time to observe. Must visit place in Heydrabad..

Name: Ratnesh M
Title: Travelling in the past
Review: Visited this piece of history in December, 2019. Ticket for Indians was available for Rs. 20/- and for foreigners it was Rs. 500/-. Guides were there at your service but for a payment. Even photography was subject to charge. But despite all these things, it is a must see attraction in Hyderabad where one could know how Arab people could could come to India and establish an Empire. The museum throws light on the high standard of living maintained by the Salar Jung's and their interminglings with the British. Yes, they're highly englishied. The museum is situated in an imposing building and at the entrance is a fire fighter unit used at that time which is peculiar in design. Inside on the ground floor are the exhibition of high valued furnitures, embroidered clothes, utensils used by the Salar Jungs - Salar Jung is a title. Items made of ivory exhibited there is    worth seeing - from chairs, tables to ornaments to show pieces to walking sticks to knives, all are praise worthy. The most noteworthy is however is the marble statue of the veiled Rebecca made in Italy whose veil too is made of marble. The upper floor contains gigantic halls used for meetings etc. If one happens to visit Hyderabad and has some spare time, one must visit this attraction.

Name: Akshaya S
Title: Must Visit For History Buffs
Review: This place is legendary. It was a pleasure to visit it with my father, who has last visited it in 1965 during his young days. The place has so much to see that one can spend a full day here. Must visit for yourself and to have the next generation know more about our history.

Name: OMKAR PAGADALA
Title: Salarjung Museum
Review: I have visited this last year. There very precious and old monuments here. I have seen them and learnt a lot from theses monuments.I recommend everyone should visit this museum once in their life.

Name: MyNameIs Shiva
Title: Indian Tradition.
Review: If You want to know about the Indian Tradition this is the place where u can get all the information.Good place to know about the Great rulers of india and their related materials and cloths.

Name: Ravindra A
Title: A 'Disneyland' for history lovers
Review: If you visiting Hyderabad, keep aside 3 to 4 hours atleast to visit this place. At the onset you will be mildly disappointed by the lack of proper info on many impressive exhibits, swells of random visitors who show scant regard for pieces of rich history of our own land, below average display design & poor lighting that takes away a lot from the mind boggling collection. But you will gradually get sucked into the 'time machine', transporting you to an era when being royalty meant some other worldly wealth & influence. Marvel at the uncut diamond studded swords, rare miniature paintings, exquisitely detailed clay toys & cringe at the jaw dropping quantum of Ivory artifacts on display. The marble sculpture collection is amazing. There are even jade & crystal back-scratchers will make you wish you had an itch that expensive :)  Please dont waste your time waiting for that mechanical clock in the central courtyard on the ground floor to strike on the hour. Its just a human figure walk out & walk back into the clock at the strike of the hour. Nothing more. Get an audio-guide device for yourself which is available inside the building at the counter right after your tickets are checked & security. Camera phones need to have a separate ticket purchased incase you want to click photos of the exhibits. A love for history, strong legs & half a day is what you need to visit this. Its well worth the effort.

Name: naveen k
Title: Live in a historic palace
Review: A historic palace converted to a hotel. They still have kept a significant part of the palace as it was in the bygone days. Excellent food and Sufi singers

Name: skychaserCalgary
Title: Beautiful
Review: We visited this lovely hotel and the grounds and topped off our visit with a tour of the place and then finishing off with High Tea which was excellent.

Name: Shikha132
Title: Live life king  size
Review: Falaknuma meansLikeHeaven .. and truly each moment spent here is Blissful.. the grandeur , the opulence the lavishness ofThe palace will stun you .. the palace has a lot of  European influence so you can see mesmerising paintings, decor,  fromThe windows to ceiling everything breathtaking . Thank you TAJ for the wonderful hospitality)( which make you feel like a nizam ) for  giving an Opportunity to experience this  wonder .. Thank you Abdul Sam for amazing culinary experience ! Our celebration was made special because of u. Heart felt thanks ! Hoping to relivingThis experience again soon .Fellow travellers each penny spent here is worth .

Name: DrQuresh M
Title: Very expensive - worth every Rupee; Superlative staff
Review: We were 5 couples all between 60-70 years . It rained throughout but the rooms were comfortable and the staff went out of their way to make us comfortable . It would be helpful if the lighting was improved in the outdoor areas and the lobby. Also a well defined walking track would be an asset as they own property of 300 acres but the staff were clueless about where I could take my morning walk for an hour!

Name: ljolsen12
Title: Wonderful place to visit!
Review: The royal arrival with carriage and roses was such a great experience. The tour was amazing. The tour guide did a great job of telling the story of the palace!

Name: Yukti
Title: A magical night
Review: Our experience was majestic - felt like royalty with the carriage ride and dinner then live music. Food was specific to our dietary needs. Plz take care of such historic properties for future generations to enjoy.

Name: anirban73
Title: A Royal experience
Review: Built in 1893, owned by Nizam of Hyderabad and now the Taj group, a heritage hotel. Ypou walk down history, with a royal treatmengt the moment you walk in. Located on a hillock, 2000 feet above sea level, you can have a grand view of Hyderabad. The staff are extremely courteous. One must book in advance, with 50% advance payment for dining. There are 2 main restaurants, Ada (Indian) and Celeste (Italian). A one hour tour of the palace is conducted by the staff of the hotel, explaining the history of the palace and all the rooms in the palace. No doubt the dinner is expensive (almost Rs 7000 per person including taxes for a 4 course menu), but its worth it, along with the tour that you get. Its a memory that you will cherish forever. The staff in Ada, where we had dinner was excellent, courteous and helpful. They go out of the way to make sure you are comfortable. Hats off to the Tata group for reviving this unused palace since 2010.

Name: Nikki
Title: Swimming pool and the gym
Review: Swimming pool and the gym and awesome dinner and breakfastThe trip was interesting and inspiringThe hotel is awesome than Wayne mansion

Name: Kellia H
Title: My favorite place to visit
Review: I come to the palace for dinner every time I come to Hyderabad. It is a must see. Always get the royal welcome and take the horse carriage up and get showered with rose petals as you ascend the stairs. Take private tour and dine over beautiful views of the city.

Name: anshu74
Title: Birthday party gone wrong
