Review: Our experience at the restaurant we visited was absolutely something that came as somewhat of a shock to us...we were a group of 4 and had made an advance payment Rs.6000 per head for dinner.We ended up paying Rs.5200 per head because we complained about the food so were offered a 20% discount.To be fair ,the gentleman who was at the restaurant tried his best to salvage our meal...we were offered free mocktails(sugar laden coloured water) and free desserts...but the food was absolutely not TAJ standard or what we have come to expect of it.. food was tasteless..the vegetarians and the non vegetarians were equally disappointed...it was a forgettable evening...was there to celebrate a birthday but it will be a birthday we will remember for all the wrong reasons...there was no email ( we left our email id along with our comments  ) to explain this...not TAJ at all ...

Name: Anil S
Title: Family holiday
Review: Amazing hotel, palace restored to its full glory.Excellent service, staff treat the guests like royalty. Mr. Qayoom at reception, Mr. Nasir & Mr. Sudhakar at the restaurant looked after us really well. I would rate the service higher than any hotel I have ever stayed. Rooms are clean, spacious and very comfortable. Would highly recommend this hotel and would love come again.The pool also looked very nice though we did not get to use it.

Name: shekher Khandelwal
Title: THE DREAM VISIT
Review: The food and service was excellent and the total experience mesmerizes.  The Taj hospitality is par excellence. Well one has to shell out more to experience all this.

Name: Shagun S
Title: A really memorable day @ Taj Faluknuma - the High Tea was an experience par excellence
Review: The drive to this place was torturous  - we were staying near Tank bund in the city - but once we were on the property it was a magical experience!! An absolute must do in Hyderabad!

Name: Malcom J
Title: Hi tea
Review: The hi tea is incredible. There is a horse carriage to pick you followed by tour of the Palace and an unlimited fare of snacks with tea.

Name: Ramchandra Naik
Title: Family Visit to Celebrate a Function
Review: One of the finest palaces in India. The menu offering provides a very royal feeling. Food is great and the service is truly outstanding!!!

Name: Charles Dulles
Title: Royal experience
Review: We had the hi tea here. Transported to the days of Nizams! The spread was amazing and service was excellent. Expensive but worth it.

Name: Barbara A
Title: An exceptional place
Review: This has been my best hotel experience ever.  The staff is wonderful and would help in diet needs or anything needed in room or to make a comfortable. stay. The food was great and so was the spa

Name: Neeraja V
Title: “Scintillating View of the City”
Review: Enjoyed the most amazing view of Hyderabad from the ‘Jade Room’ with twinkling stars in the Sky touching the ground. Soulful music of live Sufi songs makes the place reminisce the days of Nizam. The historical tour of the palace is enlightening along with an sumptuous meal of  different courses.The staff are warm and helpful. The Grandeur and ambience of the palace is perfect for special occasions.

Name: Iain C
Title: Perfect
Review: If ever you get the chance to stay here do.  It is a wonderful hotel and not to be missed.  Everything is first class if not better and the staff and food are extraordinary.

Name: Swarnangsu
Title: One of the most exclusive Hotel/Restaurant in Hyderabad
Review: We went to Taj Faluknama for lunch + palace tour. You definitely get the royal treatment from horse carriage rides to floral showers to impressive cutlery. We had lunch at Adda which was a set menu buffet. The kebabs were simply out of the world. The rest of the spread was also good, but kebabs were the highlights according to me. Post lunch we took the palace tour which was good but I dare say falls a bit short if you compare with similar palace tours in Rajasthan.Overall definitely a very good experience. If you are going on your own, be prepared to shell out a sizeable amount. It is one of the most expensive place to go in Hyderabad. Also remember to book in advance

Name: PargaonkarP
Title: Good experience to have once.
Review: The palace tour is a good to do once. It is a beautiful palace. If you are lucky you might even get a glimpse of some movie shooting from distace. Food is definitely good. Chef took care of my request for pregnancy friendly food. The food did taste good. Will I pay Rs.5000 for the food there..... hmmm, I will explore Jewels of Nizam first and then decide. :)

Name: Ashwin Vemuri
Title: Tak Falaknuma Palace
Review: Ostentatiously Beautiful Palace Hotel, One of The Best In The World With All It's Princely Charm for Every Guest With An Amazing Bespoke Menu for The Upper Echelons.

Name: supermummy
Title: As excellent as we expected it to be
Review: From the warm welcome to the beautiful room and exquisite dining options this is a first rate hotel.  Perfect staff who are professional and friendly. Wholeheartedly recommend

Name: Wilayat
Title: Old luxurious walk
Review: Taj Falaknuma Palace is one of the most important places to visit in Hyderabad, it is not open for general public. If interested in visiting you can book a day tour, Nizam Palaces Tour by Telangana Tourism. This Palace was taken over by Taj Group

Name: ShankarTravelores
Title: The Royal Living & Dining
Review: Book for a dinner....months in advance.  It starts with a palace tour.  And choose the dining place as "Gol Bunglow".....ideal would be on the Diwali day.....with a pleasant evening weather....and Qawalli Singers on the go...takes you away out of this world.  You don't even feel that you are having a 5 or 7 course meal as it only melts the way the ears lilted with the music. And as you savour....just glance the dark sky that is fully lit up with the Diwali fire crackers colours.  Oooo.....what to say more.....you get to see a 120 degree view of the old city of the Nawabs.  It's a once in a life time experience for a common man like me....and a destination default for the who's who of the country.

Name: Res0rtSeeker
Title: Great Place
Review: Great place to spend the weekend. Interesting residence that is full of history. Just as some of the staff and they will tell you whatever you want to know about the house.

Name: Vagish Dixit
Title: A Palace which retains its aura
Review: Conceded that this is not a specially abled friendly place with no ramps and lifts in sight. But this is an old palace with the zillion steps from floor 0 to floor 1 and of course a horse carriage ride from main entrance to porch. Every room smells of history in its lush and princely aura. Service is genuinely reflective of the period and food is to die for. Overall this place is amazing and is a bucket list item for anyone visiting Hyderabad.

Name: Indusman248
Title: High Tea on Christmas Day with Spouse
Review: Great arrival experience on a Royal Horse Cart (Bagi) from the Palace entrance gate to the main porch - this was coupled with Rose petal shower as a romantic welcome to the Palace. The palace tour takes about an hour and our Tour Guide was using plenty of Urdu couplets during the tour which made the entire experience interesting. There is a souvenir shop in the palace which needs an improvement from collection and its pricing perspective (collection is not that great and pricing is on the higher side).Recommended not to take lunch before the High Tea as the choice is huge and one does not need to eat dinner post the High Tea. Price does not justify the overall experience - needs correction as found on the higher side.This Palace is being managed by Taj Hotels and it was found that it is difficult to get connected with the associates of the Palace for booking.

Name: Rahul G
Title: Unique experience
Review: I visited this palace with my team during my official tour. I must say it’s an unique 5 STAR heritage experience. Dinning is on premium side with 8~9K per person, but it all about experience.

Name: Avinash Reddy
Title: Amazing....!!
Review: Stunning historic Palace property. Parts of the palace are modeled on Windsor Castle and the billiards table is identical to the one at Buckingham palace. This was once the home of the richest man in the world. The hotel has retained all the original features of the palace. My only suggestion is that the Taj group address the issue of pigeons damaging the structure. Installing transparent fishing wire along the ledges is a simple trick that would stop the birds from landing.

Name: scvrose
Title: Nice building and views
Review: The Taj sits on top of a hill overlooking Hyderabad in the background on one side plus the old fort. There is an interesting collection of antiques from the previous owners.  Worth a visit.  Also had high tea in the restaurant.

Name: tapas1966205
Title: It's a travel to Nizami Era and back.
Review: It was off course a small trip. However, right from picking us from the main entrance in the Tah Group Buggy/Golf cart till the High Tea, it was amazing. It is worth to mention the palace guide with an excellent sense of Poetry ( shayeri) . Zade room was awesome, one will remember the bathtub fitted in the queen's ( Begum?) bathroom  and off course the 100 seater dining table. In fact description by words will be an injustice to the famed Falaknuma ( Like the Sky) Palace.

Name: blondeinbombay
Title: Dreamy Palatial Getaway
Review: We've been to the Falaknuma several times, for overnights and work events. The Falaknuma never fails to impress and inspire. It's such an escape from the city, the staff are always so thoughtful, the spa is fabulous, we adore the breakfasts, and have always really enjoyed the dinners as well.

Name: Eshita Shah
Title: Luxury at the best
Review: What a great palace turned into hotel. This place is so beautiful that you wouldn't want to leave. The hospitality is so great. A must visit property.

Name: Sanjay J
Title: Dinner at Taj Falaknuma
Review: One of the finest heritage properties - a must visit at Hyderabad. The hotel boasts of a rare library - an eclectic collection, care fully reserved and restored furniture, authentic heirlooms, fine photographs - overall an unmissable experience.

Name: Rohit K
Title: Dinner
Review: Memorable dinner, amazing service. This is one of the royal properties of Taj collection, must visit place in Hyderabad.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: It's a great palace turned in 5 star hotel
Review: As soon as you enter the palace it will be a great royal treetment from the entrance. The interior is really beautiful. Especially the while climbing the Stair case you can see the history of the palace and Kings through wonderful arrangement of photographs. The rooms are superb wide. Facilities are awesome. In the evenings sitting in the balcony gives the most beautiful experience with your loved once.Overall its a Royal treat. The dining hall is also very huge with wide range of veg and non veg items. Overall its a Royal treat. You must experience once at least in your life time.

Name: amitthecreator
Title: Taj Falaknuma Palace
Review: Taj Falaknuma Palace, the former palace of the Nizam of Hyderabad is now a Taj heritage hotel. Set in the restored 1894 palace of the Nizam of Hyderabad, this opulent hotel is 2 km from Falaknuma train station and 4 km from the landmark 16th-century Charminar.

Name: Aatif Kakajiwalla
Title: A must visit.
Review: A magnificent palace. Extraordinary helpful staff. Superb comfortable rooms. Praises to Rishab and lakshay at the front office, prabitra the restaurant manager and all the waiter too. The housekeeping ask to be complimented for the prompt service.

Name: _karangehani
Title: A Must Stay Luxury Hotel
Review: Superb Service... Outstanding Food... Suites are spacious.. The Common areas are ultra-luxurious... worth every resource spent. The level of care and personalized service at Gol Bungalow and the quality of food is many notches above and beyond the normal. (one example...Had Biryanis at almost all Hyderabad well-known joints and then had one as part of the specially curated Telangana Food Thali for us... and we all just wondered what was the need to step out... this was the best.Front Staff.... young energetic well versed with going beyond the expected. Every minute...Taj truly is a different kind of magic.. and Falak Numa right up there with the best of the best.

Name: ravitaruna
Title: The RoyalTreasure of Hyderabad - Taj Falaknuma
Review: This is one of the most sought after place and has deep attraction among the visitors especially who are visiting Hyderabad for the first time and willing to live royal king size stay at hyderabad.Location  is strategically mapped to attract all type of tourists but preferably more worth in case you are on pure tourist visit and not on official visit to enjoy the place in totality.It has enchanting spell of the mirror of the skies, the iconic Taj Falaknuma Palace. It make you feel in diffrent world altogether due to it's ambiance and quality of services and for every thing including food & I will simply say  a world where dreams are fulfilled, right from the moment you descend from your horse-drawn carriage. This magnificent mansion conceived by the Nizam of Hyderabad. We can have  an authentic treatment at  Jiva Grande Spa,over all I suggest this to enjoy for short visit.However,charges for food and services are good but need to be improved and re-looked.there are so many other places as well whether good quality food are available at comparatively cheaper rates and having Hyderabady flavor.

Name: tschitra
Title: A trip down memory lane
Review: If you want a glimpse of what the Royal India was like before 100 years a visit to this place is highly recommended. The Taj group has done a great job of maintaining the palace and grounds in a very discreet manner. It’s all about the Nawabi splendour and lifestyle. The staff is very polite and knowledgeable. The walking tour is well done and flows well as one ascends the beautiful stairs up to the library, the queens quarters, the dining hall, the jade room and so on. The grounds have a magical look in the evening and the scents of jasmine combine to enthral you. After the tour you can carry on to the restaurant for your dinner. Again a sumptuous spread. Especially recommend the pan ice cream!Book in advance when you plan to go.

Name: Krishna Kanth P
Title: Royalty to the core
Review: Went for a dinner with business clients at The Falaknuma Palace. Everything here is just perfect - The horse carriage, The Flower Petal Welcome, The Guided Tour, The Food, The Ambience, The Service. We loved it.

Name: Emily M
Title: Fantastic and relaxing stay
Review: This place is incredible and I cannot recommend it highly enough.We came here on a family trip with my husband and myself, our two parents, and our cousin and her daughter. They went absolutely out of their way to accommodate our every wish. From special-order butter chicken at every meal and a child-sized bathrobe for my little cousin, to remembering just how my father-in-law takes his tea and what kind of roti he prefers, they really aim to please.The accommodations themselves are luxurious- our room was palatial and comfortable with fast wi fi. The courtyard is tranquil and inviting, and the incredible palace speaks for itself.The entertainment is superb, from the very talented live music offered daily both in the morning and evening, to the high tea program, to the lovely pool, to the billiards hall for a nightcap. One of the attendants in the billiards hall even took the time to try to teach us to play (we were hopeless!).The spa is lovely. My husband and I both agreed it was one of the best massages we’ve had.And the food! The breakfast spread has everything from South Indian staples to European Continental and everything in between. Dinner was scrumptious each evening, and the service absolutely could not be beat (special shout out to Hema Santosh, who took excellent care of us).In all, the hotel is an absolutely lovely and peaceful retreat, and you will feel and be treated as royalty during your stay. Don’t think twice and just treat yourself!

Name: rkapurs
Title: Relaxed break
Review: My wife and I stayed here for the second time and had a great time,  Right from airport pick up to check in was perfect. Our suite was just what we wanted.  The staff was brilliant. We took a spa and Rima and Pizzo were outstanding. I have had a lot of treatments at various hotels and Rima was simply one of the best. They were so good that we had to take a massage the next day also. We had dinner at Gol Bungalow. The ambience and the food was very good. The Hyderabad cuisine was authentic.  I wish they would take care of their service. The staff was courteous when they came to you. No one came and asked if we want a second drink. We had to signal a waiter. Our second drink came in 35 minutes. The assistant restaurant manager was helpful and gave great suggestions. We asked for food in 15 minutes but it came in 35 minutes. It did not matter as my wife and I were enjoying ourselves. No one to fill water glass. When the bottle finished no one came to refill. We got the dessert before the finger bowl. To top it all in the end the waiter came and said sorry for the delayed service as he was busy with the other table.  My wife and I had decided to have a good time so these points did not really dampen my evening, but come on is this The Falaknuma Palace we are talking about. Overall a great trip and would be back again but would never have dinner here.

Name: Shuddho G
Title: ..a world apart
Review: I had heard a lot about this experience but that was nothing compared to what you feel once you opt for this.Of course it is pricey but worth every penny.Must do if you can afford it.

Name: Garon_Susanne
Title: Sheer opulence and wonderful history
Review: A must if visiting Hyderabad. It’s an amazing insight into the life of the under touch of historic India. An amazing palace beautifully maintained. If you can afford it the lunch is worth doing, soaking up the amazing atmosphere and setting. If your budget is a little tighter then do the tour and high tea.

Name: futuregenie
Title: Well maintained, excellent service, superb staff overall a pleasant experience."
Review: A good place to visit. Very royal. The lunch prie fix is quite pricey(a good $1000 for 8 people), but a fun experience if you're up for it, it is a good. The tour is fun. Relaxing environment. A nice place to visit to understand the Hyderabad culture.

Name: Ekta R
Title: Excellent
Review: The whole experience was very good. The tour, the food, the ambiance and the people. It is costly but everybody should experience once.

Name: TheoP0001
Title: Magnificent
Review: This palace once belonged to the richest man on earth, and it shows. Splendor, wealth, grand scale. And the Taj people have done a spectacular job renovating it. Apparently, it took twice as long to restore it than it took originally to build it. Of course, you could stay in one of the splendid rooms but they are priced for their splendor. alternatively, you can book a dinner and get a complementary tour of the main parts of the palace and the gardens. Starry evenings give you a great view of the entire city of Hyderabad below your feet and out in the distance. The dinner is not cheap, but it will fill you with wonder (the tour and the place, if not the meal); it is worth it. And the staff is exceptionally well trained and very proud of the unique palace they have been entrusted to serve.

Name: Naveen
Title: Soak your skin into the grandeur and aesthetics as the Royal Luxury come alive at Falaknuma Palace
Review: Taj Falaknuma Palace needs no definition. In fact, it is beyond the scope of definition.  It is a true blue royal tryst with grandeur and aesthetics. I spent two days here and it was an experience of lifetime, always to be reme6and cherished for. The early morning breakfasts at Gol Bungalow which has a breathtaking view of the entire Falaknuma and old city area of Hyderabad is stunning. We enjoyed our delicious breakfasts here and I loved the typical Fakaknuma style mutton Kheema. We were treated with evening Palace tours which gives an insight into the royal legacy and history behind the rich heritage. The evening Qawali was soulful and the yummy evening desserts in our rooms were aamazing. I also took the Attar/Ittar Bath, which is an in room bath had the fragrances from the Nizam era with rose petals. It was indeed a great thing.The hotel staff was great in hospitality. We were treated with utmost care and every aspect of service was amazing.  The best part was the royal grand welcome as we arrived and were showered with rose petals. In all, one must definitely experience the grandness of this great luxury hotel. We went back home with treasured moments in our hearts and amazing souvenirs from the hotel.

Name: Kesslane
Title: Amazingly beautiful palace
Review: We were able to secure a tour with high tea here...so elegant and such a throwback to the 19th century.  Beautiful views and craftsmanship.

Name: Aditi A
Title: Superb!!
Review: The dinner experience in this place feels like a fairy tale! The atmosphere, the weather, the food, the music, everything was more than perfect! love the way they welcome with rose pettels . They surly make us feel special.

Name: krishna292
Title: Great Tourist Attraction with HighTea But at an Unreasonable Cost Not Worth
Review: During recent visit of my grandson, a student of Harward we planned to visit a different, out of blue place and chose Taj Falaknuma, a Heritage hotel of Hyderabad. The booking was done online and the package consisted of a guided tour of Palace with HighTea at about 3500/- rupees per head (nearly $60.00) excluding 18% taxes. There are number of tours at different times, High Tea, dinner, lunch etc and even the State tourism department also arranges these tours almost at the same charges only on weekdays but ours was a weekend tour. We were four people, took a cab that dropped us at the main gate from where battery operated vehicles take the visitors to the palace entrance. The main attraction is a bird'd view of Hyderabad as the palace is situated on a hillock. It has a well manicured garden and an imposing structure through stairs to reach the main lobby. On the way to palace we saw several peacocks and other structures, all white painted, probably rooms for the guests. The guided tour started at about 3 PM and our guide explained history of palace, background of paintings adoring the walls and roof, galleries, furniture etc, We were also taken to the main dining hall which accommodates 100 persons, one of the biggest halls in the world. The whole place looks beautiful but one shudders to think that all that opulence and expenditure was at the cost of poor people. Why the money was not used to eradicate poverty and hunger by these kings and nawabs. After an hour tour we went to the restaurant, known as Gol Bunglaw, There were several types of cakes, cookies, pastries, choices of soft and hot drinks and snacks, all served in a royal fashion with excellent service. My total bill came to be nearly 16000/-rupess, which is equivalent to about 250 dollars. It is not worth. If one has visited Salarjung Museum and Chowmoholla Palace, where all these items are dispalyed, one need not waste money here. I do not recommend this tour to Indian visitors unless they have money to waste. Of course foreign visitors, if they are staying in a hotel, minimum charges are 600 dollars per day, they can very well see the whole palace.

Name: franckbart
Title: An ok must do
Review: I went there for the very expensive high tea and the visit. Me and my friends could not understand a single word of the first supposedly english speaking guide we had. The second guide could speak a very good english but was a sort of a robot ! No passion at all. A real pity in such a historical property. The high tea is far too expensive for what it is.

Name: Maysadek
Title: Magical!
Review: The dinner experience in this place feels like a fairytale!The atmosphere, the weather, the food, the music, everything was more than perfect!

Name: NAZEER SHAIK
Title: Amazing experience
Review: No need to say special about it. Historical places always good to visit. Maintenance was good and nice look

Name: REENUJAIN
Title: Very beautiful palace.
Review: We stayed there so it was a very personal experience. We were treated like royalty. Amazing experience.

Name: Peter Rackauskas
Title: Birthday Lunch
Review: We stayed at the Taj Krishna Hotel and staff there organized lunch and transportation to the Taj Falaknuna Palace for my birthday. They also organized the amazing horse and coach ride to the palace reception area. Wow wow wow what an experience it was. The palace is amazing, being the home of Hyderabad Nizwan the history is truly remarkable and a must see. Lunch in the Indian restaurant was superb with gratitude to our waiters Santosh and Hema Santosh for their amazing efforts in making my birthday lunch and visit to the Palace so fantastic. If you visit Hyderabad visit the Falaknuma Palace you will be swept away. Truly!!

Name: velind7
Title: Live the Royal Life!!!
Review: The Grand Dining room is worth the visit.Note: Children are not allowed in Taj Falaknuma Palace Grand Dining Room.

Name: Srinivas T
Title: EXCELLENT PALACE
Review: It was nice 100 year old palace, has many surprises.  The old fans and bulbs still working in condition. Falaknuma Palace is well known for its architecture and for housing the largest Venetian chandeliers. Worlds largest dining table with the specialty of audio engineering ...etc. Must see and book for Evening Snacks or Lunch with tour.

Name: Amit C
Title: Spectacular amazing
Review: Breathtaking views, authentically restored, great history, good food.  Visiting this palace is a must if you come to Hyderabad!

Name: Srisadhana
Title: Royal experience
Review: Extra ordinary experience especially if you visit at evenings. Royalty is in every bit of the palace. But price is on higher side. Not a regular visit place.

Name: padmavathy66
Title: Not worth the Hype
Review: We went for evening High Tea.When we were ushered to the dining area I was for a shock.Such a tiny room and so much hype.our table was also very small .For 3 people they had to keep juggling the plates and the cake trays to accomodate all the items on the menu.Even the tour of the palace was  not satisfactory and lasted hardly 15 minutes as most of the area is used for commercial purpose .On that was there were few more private gatherings  so all that areas which are originally in the touring list were out of boundsWe paid a Bomb for this and came back with a let down feeling

Name: LordAdvisor
Title: Experience Royalty
Review: We visited the Taj Falaknuma in June 2019. The palace by today's standards may not seem grand and royal, however, if you take yourself back in time when it was built and look at it from that era, you may be able to appreciate its grandeur. The stories that the guide tells you about this Nizam and the making of the palace gives you an idea of the money that was splurged in making of the palace and the lifestyle that they lived at that point in time.We had dinner at Adaa restaurant and my experience here was not good. The level of service was way lower than what I am used to at Taj properties. It was definitely below standard.I would yet like to try out the restaurant once more as I believe in Taj quality of service and my this experience could have been a one-offI recommend Taj Falaknuma especially to foreign tourist visiting India.

Name: arunlahre
Title: Beautiful place to visit & exprience royal culture at palace.
Review: very luxury & rich experience really memorable fun & fill royal touch at every step. you can enjoy horse cart ride & night look of Hyderabad city from palace.

Name: RajeshKota
Title: Royalty to experience
Review: The palace was built by Nizams and is currently being maintained by the Taj group. The richeness of royal life can be experienced here with excellent ambience, food and cultural events. Prices are on the higher end though..

Name: Rana S
Title: Best hotel India have
Review: Elegant, Luxury and Mind blowing experience, Royal 7 star Hotel , I guess top 100 hotels in world, really worthful stay

Name: Daniel T
Title: Royalty !!!
Review: Royalty is the way to describe the experience of staying in this place. From the pick-up at the entrance, to the hotel room & dinning - everything is top class. Staff is super courteous.Very very expensive to stay here. Dinner itself costs Rs. 4000-5000.

Name: jainms
Title: Good and well maintained
Review: Good to visit once and one of the royal visit palace in Hyderabad, Lot of dinner and lunch parties happen here, its luxurious though.

Name: pjmkhan
Title: Food and Palace Tour
Review: The place is excellent. Ambience is fabulous. Food was delicious and mouthwatering. Palace tour was well organised.

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Falaknuma Palace
Review: Must visit this place if you want to witness grandeur of past. I loved the intricate architecture of Palace.

Name: Srinivas G
Title: a day away from city life
Review: a great majestic palace with great ambience. the maintenance , and all arrangements like a tour of the palace etc were great. only felt the price was very high.

Name: Brock D
Title: Great tour and tea
Review: I am a bit of a history buff and so I really enjoyed the tour of the Palace and to hear about all the history. I enjoyed the tea with its combination of Indian and British fare.

Name: neha_traveldiary
Title: Royalty!
Review: It is a beautiful small palace nestled in the heart of old city reminding you of the bygone era of Nizams. However, the palace is now star hotel with a tour of the property along with meal. I would recommend a high-tea as you get you can experience the property n sample the food as well. Don’t go with expectations of forts n palaces in Rajasthan. Also, make 2 days prior reservation as they don’t entertain walk-In! Enjoy whispering across the 100 seater dining table 😊

Name: Bob A
Title: Our Third Visit
Review: Regret to say the standard of this hotel has slipped since the last two previous visits we rated 5 Star.The staff and opulence of this majestic palace have not changed (which is good) although the exterior of the palace is now looking tired and in need of renovation in many areas.Where we were let down was with the food and in particular the Indian restaurant that one night served totally unsatisfactory biriyani mutton - complete disappointment as it was dry lacked spices and was served with a peanut sauce!!! Really !!! Peanut sauce with biriyani rice - I don’t think soThe breakfast buffet was also ordinary and many dishes served luke warm - not good enough this time around

Name: Amit1965
Title: FALAKNUMA PALACE-Hyderabad
Review: This is an Awesome Heritage Palace of Nizam Era , its so Royal , Grand and Opulent . The Falaknuma word is FALAK-NUMA which comes from Urdu Language which means- " Like the Sky " or " Mirror of the Sky".This was the Royal residence of Nizam Mehboob Ali Khan Bahadur . Actually it was a Dream Palace of Nawab Vikar-ul- Umra around 130 years ago, it took 9 years to get it completed as it's foundation was laid in 1884 and it was completed in 1893, it is spread over 32 acres and is on a 2000ft high hill top from where you have a spectacular view of the city.It was taken over and opened by TAJ HOTELS & PALACES in Nov. 2010 as it was in poor condition in 1950's.Its architecture is very intriguing as its not Mughal or Islamic one but it is Italian and Tudor style as Nawab Vikar had travelled around many countries, he wanted it to be something exotic and exquisite.Its a MUST Visit on anyone's itinerary for Hyderabad.

Name: Srinivas Yalamarthy
Title: Absolute feeling of Grandeur... Truly Majestic
Review: Wow is the only word you will utter the moment you step in to the palace. Private vehicles are not allowed in to the palace and they will transport you on their buggy to the from the entrance to the main palace. They will only allow you provided you make prior reservation. Any amount of interiors in new hotels can compete with the luxury and decor of this palace. For a moment you would have a envy feeling that how grandly those nawabs would have lived in this palace. You get to see the Nawab's room and his attached bathroom with those vintage original fittings, which are nostalgic. The best part of the palace is the walk ways and the huge open air balcony with an amazing panaramic view is just stunning.. literally you can see the whole city as it is in a very elevated place. The food part is jus about to be ok nothing to rave about. The experience will be a life time. You must insist any of the staff to give a tour to the palace which was a great tourist  attraction long back with a dining table which can seat beyond 100 persons at a time. There is no end to explain the beauty and luxury of this place.. one has to visit to experience the same.

Name: VijayChandra
Title: Well maintained
Review: The beat of all is the lawn inside the Palace, it is magical and so peaceful, visited in the night for dinner, the food is very average, service was good, but the food taste was mediocre, not worth the INR 6500 per meal in the Italian restaurant

Name: Manjunath N
Title: Spectacular view
Review: Memories of old grandeur and regal traditions. Enjoyed a sumptuous dinner in the midst palatial luxury.  Once a lifetime experience.

Name: umapathi68
Title: Must see place in Hyderabad
Review: This palace is known for Nizam's era and their culture. One must visit this place if you been to Hyderabad

Name: Ajay v
Title: Stayed for a day in this Palace hotel
Review: Here you feel very Royal as you are pampered like a king .You will feel that you are king and this is your kingdom I loved their food and the ambience very much ..I will visit someday with family and stay here

Name: neeraj2013
Title: A top class Experience
Review: Visited with friends for High Tea and what an experience it was. A  detailed guided tour of the Palace lead us into realms of historically important riches in the age of Nizam of Hyderabad with fantastic interiors, the longest dining table, a well equipped library  and a breathtaking view  of Hyderabad from the stairs. Followed by High Tea with a splurge on variety of snacks t orelish. A must visit

Name: Sangeetha R
Title: Magnificent marvel
Review: Visiting and dining at Taj Falaknuma is indeed an unique experience.  The palace tour is exhilarating and out of the world experience.  Dining gives u spl feeling and royal. But the visits can be only few but can't be regular get away.

Name: reubenranjanfern2017
Title: One of the important points in this city.
Review: Beautiful design and architecture and very well maintained though. Really nice design. Would definitely recommend others to visit this place.

Name: seeker_here
Title: Height of Luxury
Review: The Taj Falaknuma Palace is the palace of he Nizam of Hyderabad and its stand true to its heritage. It is an amazing property, full of history. Staying here reminds you of the lives of the royalty. The views are incredible.

Name: Harsha V
Title: Royal Pampered Stay
Review: Everything said about Taj Falaknuma falls short as one has to experience the royality it offeres and the hospitality it demonstrates, staff loves doing what they do and becuase of that they go the extra mile to make your stay comfortable.

Name: Arthur Y
Title: Incredible venue, stunning views
Review: Highly recommend it for a high-end event.   Don’t forget to take a guided tour. The palace is stunning, it used to be the palace of the ruler of the region

Name: waheed khan
Title: Excellent place.
Review: A must visit place, one of the best  hotels in the world. A must visit tourist attraction. Nothing negative to present ,

Name: BhaskarVVB
Title: Elevated view of Hyderabad
Review: Went to Ada restaurant in TF a couple of times for dinner on both occasions. Food was great. Picked a set menu. Visit Needed a pre booking a few weeks ahead of time on both occasions. If you are a food connoisseur and hope to get a peek into the Nizam way of life, it is a worthwhile visit to attempt. Pretty expensive for a mere mortal like me. Both visits were business funded.

Name: Dilip kumar
Title: pleasant and memorial place
Review: This place has got its own importance and its been a honor to visit this place.Best historical place for hyderabad

Name: Alok B
Title: Should Not Be Called a 'Palace'
Review: The place itself is unbeatable and great but it is too pricey and dining here has a "MINIMUM SPENDING POLICY" which is rubbish in my opinion.

Name: Nishtha T
Title: Jasmine martini!!
Review: I had the pleasure of visiting Taj Falaknuma multiple times, with family, friends, and colleagues. This is a destination visit, if you know what I mean. From the moment we got down at the entrance, to the golf-buggy ride/walk upto the palace, and to the amazing tour of the palace, the grandeur and history, it was an amazing experience.We have eaten at the Celeste as well as Adaa restaurants, and both times the experience was sublime. Try the jasmini martini at Adaa (hope they still have it). Don't forget to take in the view from the terraces, as the princely city twinkles in the distance. All in all, an amazing once in a life time experience.

Name: Nid
Title: Beautiful palace
Review: This is a really beautiful palace with architecture and decor influences from all over the world! If you're not staying at the hotel, you can go for the high tea and guided tour. The high tea itself is not that great, it's tea that comes with a bunch of snacks but the palace is worth it.

Name: Bhaskaran S
Title: Good.Heritage.History.popular
Review: Great place to visitMajestic and happinessLongest dinning tableMenu in artistic wayExperience the Royal living

Name: erode m
Title: Dinner
Review: The visit is not just a culinary experience but also an insight into the way the I am so of Hyderabad. The dinner is preceded by a guided tour of the palace. The food is authentic Hyderabad. Italian and Mediterranean cuisine is also available. Reservation is a must and opens 15 days prior.

Name: yraghuram
Title: Lunch at Adaa
Review: The food was excellent and the hospitality of the restaurant staff is very good. I am planning to visit again at the earliest.

Name: Vishal G
Title: Dream place - once in a lifetime experience
Review: Great place to spend a day, you will enjoy the hospitality and see how life was enjoyed even 100 yrs ago

Name: Wankenne
Title: TAJ FALAKNUMA PALACE: NICE BIG CONSTRUCTION
Review: Hyderabad  is the capital of the Indian state of Telangana and de jure capital of Andhra Pradesh.Along the banks of the Musi River, it has a population of about 6.9 million and a metropolitan population of about 7.75 million, making it the fourth most populous city and sixth most populous urban agglomeration in India. Place to visit: the Charminar, the Golconda, the bazaars

Name: Ashish S
Title: Beautiful palace
Review: It was a Great place to visit. We liked the palace a lot. It is a very elegant place. This visit was memorable.

Name: Sudipta Shaheen
Title: Crowded Area
Review: The area near Charminar is so crowded that you will not able to move. Avoid going there in Weekends. Be careful with your mobile and money purse.

Name: Vipin Tiwari
Title: Charminar
Review: historical monument charminar, visited last month very good place and clean must visit situated in center of hyderabad city

Name: Rahul2604
Title: Little bit disappointed
Review: Disappointed, Landmark of Hyderabad still not well maintained,expected something better,also the area surrounding is full of street vendors,not saying that everyone should be removed but at least make a 10-20 m buffer zone surrounding the Charminar,vendors are as close as they can from the monument,not an pleasant experience for tourists when they are here to explore Charminar.The area around the monument is just like any old city area in India eg Old Delhi/Chandani Chowk,congested,crowded but full of life,lively,many legendary restaurants to enjoy,also this area is famous for pearls and pearls jewelry.During Ramazan worth to visit in evening/night if you are a foodie.

Name: Saurabh M
Title: The Grandeur that lines in the heart of Hyderabad......
Review: Exploring Telangana....... Hyderabad......at Chairminar........Best way to reach is get down at  MGBS metro station and take bus or auto..... Or directly auto from anywhere....An identifying feature of the city, Charminar is the most prominent landmark located right in the heart of Hyderabad. The monument was erected by Quli Qutub Shah to signify the founding of Hyderabad. As is evident from the structure, it was so named as it consists of four minarets. Although it lies right in the centre of the city with traffic and crowds milling all about it, Charminar certainly manages to hold the gaze. It is also famous for the market that sprawls around it and is called 'Laad' or 'Chudi' Bazaar.Since the construction of the monument in 1591, Charminar has been synonymous with the culture of Hyderabad standing tall as a reminder of the glorious days of the past era. It is a massive structure which has four minarets which many believe stand for the first four 'khalifas' (Prophets) of Islam. Towards the north of the monument, there are four gateways known as Char Kaman which have been constructed in the cardinal directions. The structure was intended to serve as a Madrasa or a Mosque. In its present form, Charminar, has been added to the 'tentative list' of UNESCO World Heritage Sites.The structure of Charminar is an exquisite example of Indo-Islamic architecture with Persian influences. The arches and domes of the monument define the influence of Islamic architecture, while the Persian influence is prominent from its minarets. The balconies and the outside walls, embellished with delicate stucco floral ornamentations on the ceiling, showcases the influence of the Hindu style of architecture.At the base of the Charminar is a small temple called as "Bhagyalakshmi Temple"....The Charminar was built to commemorate the decision and eradication of plague from the city. It is known as Charminar as it is supported by four minarets on four sides which were possibly meant to commemorate the first four caliphs of Islam. The old city of Hyderabad was designed keeping Charminar as the centre of the city. According to some legends, Quli Qutub Shahi saw his beloved wife, Baghmati, at this very site. He built Charminar as a symbol of his eternal love for his wife. There is also a legend that talks about the existence of a secret tunnel under the Charminar that connects it to the Golkonda Fort. It was created as a means of escape for the royal family in the time of emergencies.Charminar is famous for many things but is most known for the lip smacking dishes and great bargain shopping. There is no better place for shopping in Hyderabad than the area surrounding the Charminar. The streets are brimming with people at all times, with the shops displaying attractive and colourful bangles and jewellery. It is popular for bangles, pearls, jewellery, semi-precious stones, silverware, Kalamkari paintings, sarees, silk materials, gold embroidered fabric, lacquer bangles, ittar and the traditional Khara dupatta. This street is filled with people and haggling is part and parcel of this market.....

Name: jojo
Title: Charming Charminar
Review: Of much historical importance the monument was crowded when we visited. It was properly maintained but the surrounding areas needed proper control.Being the lanmark of Hydrabad attractd visitors. Area near parking was not properly kept neat and clean.. The area was famous for shopping. especially clothing,, novelties, artificial jewelleries, domestic items etc. Bargaining was must. The people around were very cordial and friendly. Rather congested area more attenton was required.. The evironment of festival making happy especially the kids.

Name: Xavier D
Title: Charminar
Review: Charminar is symbol of Hyderabad for rest of the country as well as for the world. Unfortunately during my visit it was very highly crowded.

Name: vasant agshikar
Title: Charminar trip
Review: Best time to visit charminar by 9 am if you wanna enjoy the view without hustle bustle. You can click some pics too and observe the ancient monument. Evening time visit has its own charm as the crowded with full of people and lively market.  One can do local shopping of bangles, pearls and other stuff

Name: Gurutej
Title: Charminar
Review: Nothing very special here. To be visited only because it is the landmark of Hyderabad. The parking area is almost non-existent, and the place is fully congested.

Name: Raman G
Title: A crowded place. To visit only because it is popular
Review: Went in the afternoon.  We walked in 5 minutes to this place  from Chowmullah Palace. A visit only because it is popular. And has been advertised a lot. The area around is dirty and crowded with hawkers. The latter keep pestering.  The segregated area around it has hawker stalls which is a pain for a tourist. It could have been developed beautifully.  One is allowed to climb up to the first floor. We did not do so.

Name: OctOriental
Title: A good draw but horribly congested
Review: Touted as a hallmark of Hyderabad. But it's a risky, unenjoyable and terribly congested place with a million or so hawkers cluttering up the place and rendering it unworthy of your time and effort. The least the administration could have done is clear up the central area at least to afford a good view of the Charminar.

Name: Chandra J
Title: Grand but very busy
Review: Incredibly  busy, hard to walk.  Good chai tea bakery right near monument.  Went during Diwali so it might have been busier than usual.  Couldn't get up close.

Name: stevebintley
Title: Colourful and full of action
Review: What a place! This is a must visit for anyone in the city and the colours and atmosphere in an evening are superb. I’m reliably informed that weekends are particularly busy, and given the number of people on the mid-week day I visited I’d encourage to avoid too, but it’s well worth battling the crowds to get into the centre of the action. There’s so many market sellers although none are too pushy, live performances and a generally friendly vibe. The history is great, so many good photo opportunities and a real insight into the local culture. Highly recommended!

Name: Mohan D
Title: Visit to char Minar
Review: Very good place to see but we have to take from howker as it surrounded by them. Maintain properly but expect more to maintain properly neet and clen

Name: Global-Bhatakanti
Title: Charminar, a historical attraction in Hyderabad
Review: Historical moment inspired by do minar from Gowalkonda Fort. No parking nearby. One has to park car in chowmohalla palace. Street Market area around Charminar. Can be covered as day sightseeing tour along with Chowmahalla Palace, Salarjung Museum and shopping

Name: Shivam
Title: Charminar trip
Review: It was lovely to check out local delicacy from the area and the view of charminar is amazing for nice photoshoots. The local area has some great cuisines

Name: Shafeeq T
Title: Best Experience
Review: "Great place for variety of shopping at affordable price and street food." One of the most loved monuments in Hyderabad. Loads of people around the world do come to visit it

Name: Sundaresh
Title: A best place for shopping and window shopping
Review: The best place for trying authentic Nawab cuisine, pearls, dress, slippers, bangles, Tea, samosa, kababs, tourist attractions, holy places of worship.

Name: DrQuresh M
Title: Dirty and congested area . Can drive through
Review: We drove there hoping to explore the historical site .  However we changed our minds as a little rain had rendered the area slushy. The approach area was very congested and filthy

Name: Vaishnavi_g
Title: Good for shopping. But nothing much for sight seeing
Review: Charminar looks well maintained from outside. Impressive structure. But not worth going in and climbing up. Interiors are not well maintained. You get pigeon smell. I guess the whole hype around charminar is for the huge flee markets and other shopping areas around it. Where you you can shop just everything from clothes, pearls, bangles and other collectibles. Otherwise you can just watch this on postcard. Not worth investing time.

Name: Sajid
Title: Awe-Inspiring Heritage
Review: The building, the structure is awe-inspiring and to think that it stands there for more than 4 centuries is amazing. What disappoints though is the fact that like most of the places in India, this monument is also not being maintained properly. I fail to understand, why do we find it so difficult to maintain our heritage. This is such an amazing piece of architecture, yet the neglect from authorities is glaring.

Name: Krishna
Title: Not so good
Review: Not a great place to visit. I don’t recommend it for visiting especially for families. Not a good place for visiting

Name: Konganapally Laasya
Title: Experience of Charminar
Review: It’s good and it was so long ago that I completely forgot my experience but you should go It’s good.

Name: Xenos
Title: Iconic Monument
Review: An iconic monument of Hyderabad. Unfortunately, there was heavy security the day we visited this. Loved the bazaar around this. Great place to buy bangles (Indian)

Name: Mayank G
Title: Charminar needs develop and maintain
Review: This is one of the significant historical identity of Hyderabad but local administration needs to improvement and develop this places smooth functioning for tourist and visitor so they can get more information and awareness.

Name: Jalpesh Rojasara
Title: Icon of hyderabad
Review: Iconic structure of hyderabad, very crowded place. Local shopping and few photos that's it. Nothing extraordinary. Parking problem if go by private car.

Name: queenspr
Title: Disappointing
Review: Be aware there are steep and uneven stairs to climb and a bit disappointing for all the effort put in

Name: Ravindra V
Title: Symbol of Hyderabad
Review: Must visit if you are visitor to Hyderabad or a local. Great architecture. There are lot of clothes and pearl shops around.

Name: salony s
Title: Good one time
Review: The monument is worth visiting as it’s beautiful but it’s super crowded. The best part is the market around Charminar.

Name: Pradip Kumar Roy Choudhury
Title: You won't miss it
Review: Not worth going,simply because the crowd and the jostling around.You don't really get to see and appreciate the architecture creation.But visit the area for Pearl shopping etc etc

Name: Madan R
Title: Short trip to Char Minar Hyderabad
Review: Nice place. Nice people. Historical place. All leaving in harmony. Shadab Biryani is good to try and can shop around in the market.

Name: BharathiMani
Title: Ambience
Review: A nice place to go in the evening to go and hang out. Soak in the ambience and enjoy a chai with biscuit. It's in a market area.

Name: MLGP2015
Title: Must see in Hyderabad
Review: One of the oldest buildings in India. Surrounded by a crowded, fun market where both locals and tourists shop.

Name: Dr RAJKUMAR YADAV
Title: Its historical
Review: At least government should feel shame that they somehow forget its historical and they should try to save the glory of the nation

Name: Milind Kshirsagar
Title: Must visit in Hyderabad.
Review: Symbol of Hyderabad. Must visit. But don't expect too much. Not an architectural marvel. But surrounding bazar is awesome.

Name: Avirup Guha Roy
Title: Charminar - The Cynosure
Review: Commissioned by Md. Quli Qutb Shah in 1591, this was built to commemmorate the end of plague epidemic... the four minarets depict the first four Caliphs of Islam... the Monument was built in granite and lime mortar using Cazia style of architecture

Name: Amina
Title: Memorable Journey
Review: Charminar is one of the best popular tourist attractions in Hyderabad.. The charminar thought nothing much to do there .. The mousqe is very beautiful and peaceful place to seat and relax your mind but out side is very crowded with small vendors.. Best place to do shopping for ladies.. Remember if you want to buy something bargain or else you will loose your money..Bangles and Pearls are very famous here.. Don't forget to try Hyderabad world famous Paradise Biryani and Irani chai..

Name: Arun A
Title: Apart from history nothing more.
Review: One of the attractions of Hydrabad, was situated in a conjusted place. It was built a century ago, it withstood all calamities.

Name: shekher Khandelwal
Title: A MUST FOR ALL TOURIST
Review: The experience was great, so much of bustling and energy to be seen. The tea and sulaimani biscuits is a must. Lots of bangles shop.

Name: yesarar
Title: By gone era
Review: Lots of improvement since my last visit, traffic  closed only walking.  Full of shops selling dresseses to local  produce.  Don't forget to  have Irani chai at the Nimrah cafe. Avoid on Fridays.

Name: Daydream36773847890
Title: It is a great place with an unique and identifying feature of the city.
Review: I am visiting this place for 2nd time. It is an identifying feature of the city. Every person who comes to Hyderabad, definitely visits this place. It is most famous for market which is called 'Laad' or 'Chudi' bazaar where you can find various types of products like bangles, clips, hat, dolls, dress, Perl items and so on at reasonable/affordable price.Tips/Details:1. Timings: 9:00 AM - 5:30 PM2. Free entry.3. Good time to visit: Evening4. Time required: 1-2 hours5. It is bit crowded place during peek hours so better be careful about your belongings.

Name: Kushal K
Title: Enriching Heritage!!
Review: Such a lovely feel to walk through the rich heritage that this lovely city is known for. It is such a hustle-bustle during the day but still is one of the most peaceful place, mix with our rich culture!!

Name: ShubH GhosH
Title: Too crowded for a good view
Review: Must be an imposing structure but really cant enjoy the view, Narrow gullies, restricted access , irritating peddlers on road. Best avoided

Name: SaiKumar
Title: Beauty
Review: Beautiful.. monument.. being a Hyderabadi.. I have always loved visiting..this place with friends and family.

Name: Raja vishnu vardhan Reddy (visrey)
Title: Charming Charminar in late night ride
Review: Seeing Charminar in a normal time is just like attending a fair with thousands of people bustling without even inch space. Best way to see Charminar without the crowd is visiting it after 12 though you can't actually enter inside charminar late night but it's a good measure to avoid crowd because of the covid and you can see no one wearing a mask in your vicinity if you are there in normal times.

Name: Nilesh A
Title: Charminar
Review: One of the iconic monument of India, well maintained from out side. Enjoyed the day , must visit the market.

Name: Manoj Kumar
Title: Beautiful place!
Review: It is a wonderful place to visit. It was amazing, and the narrow passage were incredible. It was still under maintenance when I visited it. The charges for Indians were Rs. 20. There are many shops in the area, from antique shops to new. Shopping is all about bargaining. Street food is heaven. You will enjoy the views if you visit at night.

Name: abizer p
Title: A major lanmark
Review: Anlandmark of the city. The views from top are great. One can take great pictures from top. The climb is interesting as well as exhausting.  Some good architecture and writingson the walls . Its a must visit. A bit run down. Ammonia odour on the steps which go down. Authorities must lok into that.

Name: Anjana
Title: Nightmare
Review: A complete Shame…… the heritage site has become a cheap shopping lane . I was heartbroken to c the place. I had been here a few years ago n had fond memories but the current visit washed up all the memories….. wake up Government and plz save the place

Name: dr ganapathi bhat
Title: "Can go once"
Review: The name is do big that no visitor to Hyderabad can miss this iconic structure.  That said, the monument may not have a repeat value. The place is very crowded and unkept. Reaching the place is a herculean task with all that traffic, and parking is a big headache.However once in, the charm of the minar works well.  The structure is an architectural marvel. There are plenty of things to do inside that will make your day.

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Iconic Model and Symbol of Hyderabad
Review: Charminar is situated on East Bank of Musi River which was constructed by Fifth Qutub Shahi Dynasty ruler Muhammad Quli Qutub Shah in the year  1591. This is Iconic Monument of Hyderabad City.This is Flanked four minarets on every corner which are 48.7 meters high.  Visitors are allowed to enjoy short climb up to First floor for which one need to climb 149 steps.Charminar has a secret tunnel underneath which was constructed as an escape route for the royal family in times of crisis. It is also said that the sultan built the monument at the exact place where he saw his future wife for the first time Charminar is also famous for shopping of ladies wear, Bangles and Fancy items

Name: Suman@620
Title: Hyderabad icon
Review: It's nice to see hyderabad icon miner char miner.feel proud to be hyderabadi.those r in hyderabad Telangana starte must visit place

Name: Amit Khare
Title: Too crowded
Review: It was too overcrowded even to have a look properly. We went in the evening time and there was not even space to stand. There was a problem of parking near the monument hence better to go by cab. The market is also too crowded to even take a look at goods properly.

Name: Elizabeth L
Title: Amazing Nighttime Experience
Review: We had a BLAST! This was my last day in India and I was flying out of Hyderabad, so we came to Charminar the night before. For Americans, bargaining is not a thing - how fun it was and amazing deals we received on lots of jewelry items for me to take home to my friends and family. The actual Charminar architecture is breathtaking and is a must-see for anyone in the area.

Name: Kasi
Title: Charminar show
Review: Hyderabad in one of the most beautiful place charminar,  here I like bangles and falls, daily here visiting more people's, when I visited charminar ,that guy told charminar history (superb)

Name: Lalz
Title: Claustrophobic, suffocating and NOT WORTH IT.
Review: The structure is iconic and is pretty much the face of Hyderabad but, is maintained horribly. I would strongly advise people not to go to the top. The staircase is extremely suffocating and cramped. No railing and once you go in, it's impossible to get out because there're people behind you. You have to get to the top, take a breather, and go down through a similar staircase. We went there and my mom almost fainted. If you're claustrophobic, DO NOT take a chance here. The marketplace isn't that well maintained either. I was born and brought up in this city and was really excited to visit the monument. Ruined everything for me.

Name: Barbara A
Title: Worth a look at
Review: This is in the middle of the old town with vendors all around. The charminar is impressive to look out and worth a walk to see it.

Name: sahifa
Title: memorable journey
Review: wonderful heritage at Hyderabad I have purchased many useful items from this place taxi facility is very excellent over here

Name: Sanjay Dugar
Title: Too Crowded
Review: The place is too crowded... Even during covid it was too crowded... The char minar has historical importance to city... The place is though not well maintained...

Name: Traveller
Title: Twinkling eyes
Review: It is crowdy market. Any one really wants to enjoy some ancient article for eg night lamps .Giftboxes  Necklaces Bengals dryfruits shawls has to be definitely. Visit this Charminar.Nice building.

Name: DrKlair
Title: Unique monument
Review: Had to buy online ticket .Very steep steps to go up. The view of surrounding crowded bazars and old city is beautiful indeed. Please note no washrooms near Charminar.

Name: Naresh_byra
Title: Majestic and it feels like first time, whenever I visit Charminar
Review: Majestic and it feels like first time, whenever I visit Charminar. Visited after lockdown and the charm of Charminar is alive but it is not as much crowd as it used to be.The place is getting restoration and it feel good to see our heritage is protected. Must visit place if you are into culture tours.

Name: Imran Khan
Title: Charminar & Market
Review: I have visited Charminar back in 2019 and it was wonderful. The place is jam-packed due to the huge market and shops surrounding it. If you love shopping, you must visit this place.

Name: Ravi C
Title: Memorable Visit of Hyderabad
Review: Historical Building and very beautiful, place is but very crowded but when you will visit it , property not well maintained.

Name: Rohit g
Title: charminar
Review: Good place foe ladies. thy enjoued shopping..remwber if you want to buy something bargain or else you will loose your hard earned money.Worth visiting the place

Name: PurnimaJaay
Title: Not so Smooth
Review: The mosque is very beautiful. If you get to go in, then please do. Out of it will be local selling cheap stuffs. Don't get fooled by their pricing. Be alert and bargain well. Stay alert all time. Don't bring kids. Get ur stuff and walk away. Only buy if you want. If not just walk. It's risky but if possible go with any local.

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Beautiful architecture
Review: Charminar is one of the most popular tourist attractions in Hyderabad and we had visited the same during our sightseeing in Hyderabad. The place is very crowded with small vendors occupying the entire road outside the beautiful heritage structure. We enjoyed biscuits and tea at the nearby Nimrah Cafe and enjoyed the beauty of the Charminar right in front of us. One can go inside the Charminar up to a certain height and we saw many locals standing inside the Charminar.

Name: Sunil
Title: Charminar the beauty
Review: The Charminar is very old and ancient.it looks gorgeous and lovely.But the palce located is highly denced population and its too crowded and the place is not maintained well.

Name: Greg48
Title: Icon of Hyderabad
Review: I first heard of the Charminar years ago by way of a cigarette brand which featured the structure on its packages.The iconic symbol of Hyderabad dates back to the 1500's and is an interesting structure with 4 Minarets and 4 arches. The area surrounding it is a busy street and jewelry market. You can find inexpensive bangles (bracelets) as well as very low priced 'pearls' which would make a cute item for young girls. There are also a number of Pearl Shops supposedly selling the gem that the city is famed for. Not being knowledgeable about jewelry I stayed with the costume jewelry and found the market to be enjoyable.

Name: Mutukuloju Pranay
Title: Hyderabad Icon
Review: Charminar is a beautiful place. visit once.it is quite good and being reconstructed again i.e repairs are being doing right now. besides, there is bangles Bazar where lot of variety bangles are there

Name: SrijitNewYork
Title: Beautiful monument. A must-visit while in the city
Review: Went to the Charminar in the early hours of the day (around 7:30am). It was perfect timing. No traffic, no crowds, no bustle in the adjoining markets... Basically, it was easy to get in and out. I've been here three times before and as always, the Charminar was under repairs, this time around too. There was a scaffold around three sides of the monument. So a good selfie wasn't possible. However, it felt good to walk around it and have an Irani tea and a wedge of Dilkhush (bread stuffed with dried fruits) as an early breakfast from one of the many tea shops in the area. I hung around for less than an hour before heading over to my next destination.

Name: Aratrika Basu
Title: The life of Hyderabad
Review: Chaminar is a lovely place. I really like to go here quite often, but I suggest one to visit it during the month of  Ramzan. The place comes alive and is open all night. If you go there during that time, you can't leave without having the famous Hyderabadi Haleem. Nevertheless, Charaminar is awesome and one must go there when they come to Hyderabad.

Name: Jay-Raghu-2016
Title: Majestic and still stands tall
Review: This was my 3rd visit to CharMinar. The only difference was it was a evening and on a Sunday.Absolutely packed by shoppers, vendors and traffic. Managed to park about 400 meters away. Great photo opportunities. Charminar was well lit and glowing. Recommend a day and evening visit after sunset.

Name: PsychoEdinburgh
Title: Iconic monument of Hyderabad
Review: This is  very busy monument but worth queuing up to see. Once you've climbed the narrow stone staircase you are rewarded by lovely views of the city, fine stone carvings and multiple arches. Well worth the visit and it probably take about an hour all told

Name: Talent P
Title: monument and a mosque, which is synonymous the history of Hyderabad
Review: structure is an example for Indo-Islamic architecture combined with few Persian elements. The monument is located in the heart of old city and it is believed that Hyderabad was measured in four directions from Charminar for administrative purposes.

Name: Vinki K
Title: Hyderabad Ki shaan
Review: Not wrong if I say that Charminaar and the area nearby is Hyderabad Ki shaan. Great view of old city from top. Awesome markets in premises. Great food and tea nearby.

Name: Aparajita_03
Title: Slightly risky to alight the stairs. Amazing view from top
Review: Charminar is an icon of Hyderabad. It is possible to alight up the steep stairs to get a birds eye view of the city. However, the stairs are steep and made in a circular fashion, so aged people or anyone with even slight discomfort in walking should not explore this. The view from top is amazing. The insides are adorned with carvings. The ticket counter closes at 5.30pm. We got our tickets at 5.29 pmso we were lucky that way. The area around charminar is nice for street shopping especially bangles and jewellery.

Name: Ratan
Title: Architecture
Review: Very rich Architecture and good to see the affordable price for purchase of Laccar bangles and other textile materials nearby.

Name: Sardev2014
Title: Interesting historical site
Review: Worth a visit and buy a guide if you can. Charminar is a four pillared historic site that is accessed via steep and narrow steps. There are two levels but you can only access the first level. Views are spectacular and give nice overview of Hyderabad

Name: Alok Kumar
Title: Charminar.. the PASSPORT of denteal india... Hyderabad
Review: Charminar , the PASSPORT to central India... Hyderabad.. the city of Nizam... It's in a very crowdy place.. surrounding are clasteophobic.. but yes.. it's a myat see place.. it's an icon.. one must visit the icon .. if they are visiting Hyderabad..

Name: Nipunika J
Title: Under maintenance
Review: When we visited the monument, two tower was under maintenance. The market around it is very crowded. It is better to get down from cab 10-20 metres from the monument and walk. There are lots of jewellery shops around and food vendors. The around place can use a lot of cleaning.

Name: Brijendra Singh B
Title: Must visit for everyone
Review: Architect quality is excellent but area around this place is not very clean. Lot of small shops have mushroomed around the area.

Name: MD Murtaza
Title: Pride of Hyderabad
Review: Located at the centre of old city, crowded with families, friends, young,old ...is a place of peace and we get to experience a great culture that's different from rest of the city....must visit place in Hyderabad.

Name: Ashwin Vemuri
Title: Charminar
Review: Iconic, Historical, Amazingly Beautiful, A Must Visit for Everyone, Brightly Lit Up All Night, Worth Keeping a Selfie for Life

Name: Oneil
Title: Could have been better
Review: Good-looking structure.  Could have been better if maintained properly and access should have been easier.

Name: Soni
Title: Nice place
Review: NYC place to visit to Charminar and local market around for glass bangels food (Britani) at Shadab and pearls market with some old pearls dealer ( Zacarias) 1 Sri Krishna pearls 2 mangatrai3

Name: Umesh R
Title: Enjoyed a lot.
Review: Charminar is a historical place. One of most attractive place in hyderabad. Surrounding place is occupied by shops. Famous for bangles and dresses.

Name: Curious785091
Title: Connects to so many stores
Review: This really is a great place to get a good view of all the shops below - it goes on and on I'll tell you!  I don't know how they all manage to do it - but there is no shortage of stores.  All divided by categories (shoes, bangles, fabric, etc)

Name: Topping
Title: Great historical place
Review: It is not that the Char Minar is an architectural marvel for the general public but the sorrounding and the market place makes it a wonderful experience. You experience an intricate culture while standing near the place. It is thronged by people all around.

Name: TheoP0001
Title: if you are not afraid of crowds, this is a must visit in the old city
Review: Especially on the weekends, the colours and tastes are breathtaking. But brace for enormous crowds. Yet, we never felt scared or concerned. But yes, there are thousands of merchants selling every cheap bangle, scarf and shoe you can imagine with dozens of fruit vendors and drugists.  All in the open space around the historic monument. But brace for the crowds.

Name: Leee
Title: Very beautiful
Review: Such nice place to visit once in a life , excellent experience, the last evening I visited a Charminar which is made my day excellent city 🌃 view nice place but little bit rush, I had very good experience in this place thank you so much Hyderabad

Name: Lyn V
Title: Historical + architectural delight
Review: We visited Charminar with a guide one afternoon and enjoyed seeing the history of the place. We walked up the spiral staircase and enjoyed the view from the top. It was pretty crowded and in particular, the bazaar /markets below. We would recommend seeing this impressive monument built in 1591 and still standing the test of time. It gave us an insight into India's history. 🕌

Name: tapas1966205
Title: Royal Hyderabad
Review: Charminar is a big tourist attraction in hyderabad, however surrounding area is so congested and dirty. Local authority should look into it.

Name: Kartik M
Title: Historical place
Review: This place was built in 1591 when Mohammad Quil shah shifted his capital from Golconda to Hyderabad. This place have mosque on top floor and is nice. Place is littered with small vendor around makes place busy.

Name: nomadic_heart7
Title: chamring charminar
Review: the hustle bustle of old hyderabad, the cafe ,the chaos all under one roof...the charminar...its very nice in the evening to watch the crowd....you can shop for bangles plenty

Name: The Food Wanderer
Title: A cultural phenomenon
Review: It is not that the Char Minar is an architectural marvel for the general public but the sorrounding and the market place makes it a wonderful experience. You experience an intricate culture while standing near the place. It is thronged by people all around. However, if you are into shopping, this is the place to go.

Name: Neelam Rawat
Title: Must go if traveling to Hyderabad
Review: If visiting Hyderabad then it's a must go place, suitable time is from October to December as weather in Hyderabad is hot after January,I would recommend early morning or after 4pm to visit charminar as at night it's very lovely weather.Please avoid your own vehicle as parking will be a challenge so prefer auto, aur cab for this place !!

Name: sow
Title: Charminar..charminar
Review: One of the historical place built in 1951. .The view from top is awesome.the place is famous for shopping

Name: Scarlet Fernandes
Title: Charminar
Review: A monument too good to believe it still exists.Spellbound, no words to express it's grandeur.Work on at the site to restore it to its beauty.Hawkers and shops to keep distance from the monument.Cleanliness is a must.

Name: Abhishek B
Title: Not worth the climb
Review: It’s enough to have a look at it from the ground floor. There’s absolutely no need to climb up the narrow path of stairs. The view is just like you would get from a big building .

Name: JeffCarter
Title: Great Crowd Watching
Review: I had one day to visit several places in Hyderabad. So I Arranged for a driver and struck out for the day. This is one place I definitely wanted to see, and climbed the steps to the top of the gate to see the views. The place was crowded (and Jan was off season) and full of locals selling almost anything. I wish I stopped an bought more items but I was on a mission to climb the tower and take photos. THe line to climb was long but moved very fast. It was not pricey to get in, and the climb was not bad. The spiral stairs were no worse than cathedral tower climbs in Europe. Beautiful views and the crowds were friendly. I assume pick pocketing might be an issue but i was careful to not bring anything but my camera and very small shoulder pack.   I definitely recommend a stop here and encourage you to take time to stroll around (I wish I did more).

Name: Michael P
Title: Popular temple outside of Hyderabad
Review: Chilkur Balaji Temple, popularly known as "Visa Balaji Temple'', is an ancient Hindu temple of Lord Balaji on the banks of Osman Sagar in Rangareddy District. It is one of the oldest temples in Hyderabad. There are many devotees, so it is usual to queue, see the deity and move on. There is a small bazaar in the temple grounds selling religious items and the usual tack. Well worth a visit to get away from the big city. Ola cabs provide 2,4 and 6 hour packages - 4 hours will probably cover a lengthy visit (travel time up to 1 hour each way) or you can catch a city bus.

Name: sanamkumar
Title: Wowwwww
Review: It’s a divine place. Visa balaji as it is said , blessing for getting a visa if you take round of the temple. The place has a divine feel aromatic experience. Energy seat

Name: Aantharya
Title: Now I know why he is called Visa Balaji
Review: I am giving 5 stars because before I went here I did not know it is known as Visa Balaji. We just visited there as our friend was visiting this place. And there is a belief if you want to work abroad you should visit this temple and pray then your wish will be fulfilled. Surprisingly soon after visiting this place my husband got a project in USA and we went to USA. Should definitely visit this place again and offer our 108 pradakshine now. Going around the temple 108 times.

Name: Rahul G
Title: Tranquility
Review: This temple has great vibes. Felt at peace after visiting, during my visit to Hyderabad ! There is very less waiting time and no cheating !

Name: sureshvaradarajan
Title: Chilkur balaji temple
Review: Train from Bangalore to secunderabadSecunderabad ac waiting hallLocal bus servicePeaceful darshan

Name: SHAMBHU
Title: Good place to visit.
Review: It is very calm place and devotees can concentrate on prayer. In the evening and night it looks very beautiful. View of Hussain Sagar Lake will attract you too much.

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Popularly known as Visa Balaji Temple'
Review: Chilkur Balaji Temple is one of the oldest Temple in Raga Reddy district which is located on the bank of Osman Sagar Lake. This temple was built during the time of Akanna and Madanna.This temple become popular at starting of 21 Century as Visa Balaji Temple. Apparently this temple is known for fulfilling devotee's wishes to get a Visa for going overseas. it is believed that almost all professionals who visit the temple had received an opportunity to fly abroad within a year.This temple specialty:1. You will not find any Hundi in this temple and also not accepts Money from Devotees.2. There is no separate VIP line here. All people from poor to Rich and also CM to PM every one has to come in single line3. This temple is out of Government control. Temple Trusty fought against government and won to stay out of Government control.4. During Devotees first visit they will take 11 rounds (Pradakshinas) around the Inner shrine temple, and Makes a Vow(Prayer). Once the wish is fulfilled devotees take 108 rounds(Pradakshinas) around the same inner shrine temple to show their gratitude and thank the God. It is believed that your prayer's will fulfill here if you vow sincerely.Temple Timings: Morning 05:00 am to Evening 08:00 pm (all days)

Name: challa prashanth reddy
Title: Most popular Temple
Review: One of the famous and well known temples around Hyderabad. devotees believe that by doing 108 pradhakshanas God Balaji will give whatever you asks and i have personally experienced that.

Name: anand887
Title: Unplanned visit call from god!!!
Review: I am happy to be there with my colleagues as it is really unplanned visit to only Visa Temple in in India ..Old and historical Temple with lots of  magic blessed by Bala Ji and Lord Shiva and as per mythology many stories behind getting visa and getting visa ...Apart from that must visit place as lots of believe and really very silent place for mental peace some of glimpse I am sharing....

Name: Sujatha
Title: Chilkuru temple
Review: My wife and sisters offered hair at chilkuru balaji temple very powerful god  very nice place surely ur wish is fulfilled that is the reason everyone will tonsure hair

Name: PurnimaJaay
Title: Nice
Review: Simple and calm temple. No long walk or stairs here. Crowd is always there but manageable. Go with a empty mind and come back with a blissful heart.

Name: Sunil
Title: Namo Balaji
Review: The temple is quite is quite ancient and its very famous in hyderbad.The place is so calm and you get good positive vibes

Name: NAZEER SHAIK
Title: very famous place
Review: The Chilkur Balaji temple was a famous place in the tourism list. Good place for a devotional visit.

Name: Mutukuloju Pranay
Title: Visa Lord Balaji
Review: The temple pradhakshanas are more important here.108 for the desire happened 11 for the starting of desire. good pujari who renjunavates energy and say the temple greatness , culture and good.visit on saturday.carry pen and water bottle

Name: beyondtravel
Title: Balaji temple
Review: Located just 30 kms from gachibowli, is a famous temple also known as visa balaji, the chants, interactive pradakshana, facilities and folkore make it a must place. Beware of the local touts.

Name: Jaykann
Title: Just Divine
Review: Just a hour drive from Hyderabad city. We visited early at 5AM and usually temple gets crowded after 6.30AM Temple is well known as Visa Temple. You find positive vibes inside the temple. Lot of devotees usually visit the temple and do 108 rounds around Lord Venkateshwara. Temple opens at 5AM so if you are planning plan early in the morning and try avoid weekend as there will be so many devotees and sometimes it takes more than few hours.Lot of restaurants are available and few guest options are there around as well.JUST DIVINE AND POSITIVE VIBES

Name: suryaroyl
Title: Divine experience
Review: It is one of the oldest temples in Hyderabad built during the time of Madanna and Akkanna, the uncles of Bhakta Ramadas. This is the place totally free from people pestering you to give money.

Name: sow
Title: Venkateshwara swamy
Review: We visit it regularly.the temple environment n positive vibes over there gives peacefulness to us...
