Title: Very nice temple
Review: Very awesome church i never saw such a beautiful church nice disciplined manners very neat and it is fulfilled with God's grace

Name: Bhaskar_10
Title: Promoting Indian Craft: good exposure to craftsman and customers
Review: Visited on 28th December 2022Entrance Fee is INR 60/- per adult and INR 20/- per childThere was a theme based exhibition going on in ShilpaRaman till 31-Dec'22 and the crafts on display included kalamkari, Orissa Ikat, Gujarat Patola, Macrame from Bengal, Wood Craft, Bhagalpuri, Indore/Maheshwars, Leather products amongs many others.The quality of products on display showcased the rich and vivid talent of the crafts of India and prices ranged from couple of thousand to more than hundred tousand depending of the products.The visitors included mostly families while some youngters (seemingly college students) also visited in groups and interacted with teh craft-people.Very well designated place with paid parking and is a must viist while in Hyderabad.The only challange is the exit gate of the parking being too far, the visitors have to walk into teh parking to get into their vehicle and many could be seen walking along the incoming vehicle which is dangerous. If the management can look into a viable solution it will be appreciated.

Name: Vaishnavi_g
Title: Very interesting place for those who love culture and heritage
Review: If you are renovating your house and interested in art collection this is a good place to visit. From sarees, shawls, wooden crafts, ethnic fashion wears, traditional painting and crafts you get them all here. You have museums and village settings you can enjoy.

Name: Mayank G
Title: Lovely Place to shopping and enjoy
Review: We visited this place with minimum expectation but it turned out one of the best place to visit, shopping, enjoying and hang out with family and friends . You will find her art, culture, music and various handlooms . Lovely place

Name: Gurus49
Title: Artistic Place
Review: A quaint place that exhibits local artisans and their wares. The place is perfect to buy rustic items.

Name: Ranjan Alu
Title: Great place
Review: Good place , love to visit again and again , thank to team who have planned this project , love the culture program , ai request everyone should visit once .

Name: Suman@620
Title: Anniversary celebrated place
Review: We celebrate our 15th Wedding anniversary at that place.me & my wife had great time with shopping &food stall.thr r lot of hand craft meterial to purchase with reasonable price.

Name: Fairy
Title: Indian Ethnic Crafts Village
Review: Shilparamam is an Indian ethnic crafts village. A good place to spend a leisurely evening and fulfil your desire of shop till you drop, on Indian ethnic handicrafts. They have a large display and sale of handicrafts from artisans from across the country. One can find handmade pottery, metal craftwork, ethnic outfits, sarees from Banaras and other South Indian states, handbags from Gujarat, embroidered patchwork runners and cushions, crochet outfits and bags and lots more. The shopkeepers don’t have any fixed rates, and there is a lot of bargaining going around the shops, which makes one feel if they have actually paid a reasonable price. One thing one must keep in mind here while purchasing is that these artisans don’t earn much sitting here all year long. We must be reasonable while bargaining with them. Most times they do quote random exorbitant prices, which is not fair too. So it is ultimately at the customers’ discretion if they want to buy it or not. Just compare prices in other stall before making a purchase. The place is mostly well maintained, and one can move around leisurely shopping and enjoying the village themed ambience. There are lot of food stalls, but we have never tried any of those as the hygiene is questionable at the stalls. The food stalls in particular are not maintained very well. They are just filthy. You may choose to visit this place in the evening to avoid the sun and heat, as the place is sprawling and expansive and totally open to air. On Sundays they have some beautiful ethnic performances in their open air amphi theatre, which are a treat. It is truly refreshing to see these performances to actually enjoy the true milieu.

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Beautiful evening chilling spot
Review: Shilparamam is a cultural park cum shopping area for experiencing different cultures of India and to shop handicraft products from the different corners of India. It has an entry ticket and it is a fun place to roam around in the evening.

Name: Abhishek S
Title: Handlooms and Shopping
Review: This place is one of the greatest attractions specially women who love shopping.From apparels to furniture all you can find here that to ethnic and cultural.It also has a man made lake for boating and a waterfall.You can take photos here.It also has good options for snacks

Name: richagoel15
Title: nothing exclusive but good stuff
Review: It is a nice place with a traditional feeling. The food within the campus is quite affordable. If you have been to delhi hatt then this will be a disappointment, but still it is worth a visit. There are mini exhibitions going on inside. you can get mehandi on your hands and there is a small pond inside too.

Name: Ken W
Title: Tourist trap..not worth the time
Review: We were pretty disappointed with this place.  We'd expected more in terms of seeing local handicrafts being made, together with other cultural things of interest e.g. dance.The website describing the place really bigs it up, and our experience was not as expected.Bottom line is if you want to be hassled by guys selling pashminas, then maybe this is for you.

Name: shirin t
Title: Beautiful in a way that serves Indian culture
Review: A superbly beautiful place offer Indian culture in the shape of handcrafted stuff, Indian cultural attires, show pieces for your drawing rooms, indianized shoes, and a walkthrough which you are going to fall in love with. Local market and end your visit with the street food.

Name: OPM
Title: Shilparamam
Review: A nice collection of handiwork of Indian Artisans with a vast variety of clothes, ornaments, wooden work and also Art and Crafts items all across the country.

Name: importedinteriors
Title: Not what it used to be
Review: Have visited them every time I was in Hyderabad.  I noticed that the crowds have tinned out, the vendors and the ships have been reduced and the quality of handicrafts have declined.  The shopkeeper complained about the lack of business.

Name: Jajabor
Title: Hyderabadi Dilli Haat
Review: If you have been to the famous Dilli Haat next to the INA metro station, New Delhi (near Safdurjung), you may want to skip this one. This is a younger brother of the version in the capital....with pretty much the same things on offer, albeit in lesser variety. The food stalls are very average and don't offer much.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Must visit arts and craft centre
Review: Excellent arts and crafts village with lots of options to explore starting from Village museum to open air sculpture park and shops selling handicraft items. There is also boating facility for adults and kids and a nice food court. With ample parking space, you can plan a full day visit to this place

Name: jainms
Title: Very nice
Review: Good maintenance can see and culture is very well maintained too. Evening the best time to visit here.

Name: Soumyajit Saha
Title: Shilparamam Cultural Centre
Review: Shilparamam Cultural Centre is located in Hyderabad in India. It is a cultural institution where many types arts are perfomed.

Name: sunil
Title: A  village  in the heart of the city
Review: It gives a feel as if we are in a typical village environment with all the greenery and various handcrafts.Boatride is an added attraction and there are markets which sell antiques.

Name: Ram Mohan
Title: Good collection of artifacts and clothes
Review: Shilparamam has been one of Hyderabad’s Popular Landmarks for almost 20 years. Starting from designer home decor stuff made from clay to handloom clothes , you won’t be disappointed with the range available. Easily accessible from anywhere in the city. Metro rail has made it even more convenient to reach this place. Parking is also not an issue . Cultural programs are conducted at the open air auditorium in the premises

Name: Shalini N
Title: Good for shopping
Review: Small handicrafts village with village setups and shops selling handicrafts and other local artworks.. go in the evenings.. Metro Station is nearby

Name: MyNameIs Shiva
Title: Good place to know about Culture.
Review: A place Where we can get some knowledge on Indian Tradition and Culture.Beautiful location in Hyderabad and a must watchable place.If you want to spend good time with Your family this is the place.

Name: Wilayat
Title: Art & craft walk
Review: Shilparamam Arts and Crafts village is a tribute to the cultural legacy of India. The primary aim of this establishment is to foster, restore and help flourish the culture of India's glorious past

Name: Santoso Jaeri
Title: Great traditional place
Review: This is one of traditional cultural place should be visited. There are dance, souvenir and also traditional food such as Dosa and Indian tea.

Name: Najiya Rinaf
Title: Definitely the Kaleidoscope of India
Review: Have you ever been to 'Shilparamam' located in Madhapur, Hyderabad? Many of you would have definitely made a visit to this arts & crafts village. This was my second time here and I was literally lost in their exclusive Indian pottery and incredible porcelain works during my search for ethnic home decors. No wonder it is renowned as the kaleidoscope of India's varied color tones, multi-culture, adorable diversity, and artistic talent.

Name: Sudhir K
Title: Great place for shopping local art/stuffs and hangout
Review: Its a lovely place for shopping ethnic wear, handicraft, etc. Also there are good options for food. There is a boating facility within the campus. Once there was bullock cart ride option also. On some special days, there is exhibition or musical festival and one can enjoy it free. For example on 2nd October there was a exhibition on Mahatma Gandhi and there was a musical concert of classical music/dance. Day time it might be hot in summer, best to go in evening. There is rock garden at back side, which is also interesting to see.

Name: chaithu k
Title: Cultural society
Review: It is an excellent view point. There has memories of our old traditions. And it is good place for enjoying with family or friends. Scluputres are describing how our past people lived in that time. Hope that every one will enjoy the place...

Name: Santosh K
Title: Good place
Review: This is a must visit to see very old culture and very nicely maintained by their staff.So definitely recommended.

Name: Sheetal S
Title: art and culture of gone by days
Review: a nice place to visit and spend 2-3 hours. Buy the 50 rs ticket at counter. Many high priced shops are here so good negotiating is a must. Must visit the museums inside.Worth a visit.

Name: Polavarapu
Title: Silparamam
Review: Silparamam is a park,, with shopping all traditional and cultural heritage, built by government to develop traditional heritage, it's a nice place,,,

Name: NIL_MODI
Title: Arts and Crafts Village
Review: Shilparamam Cultural Society is a arts and crafts village. Its a place of shopping along with fun. Entry is chargeable.

Name: Suneela K
Title: Crafts village
Review: It is an enlightening experience of the rural life in India. Very neatly maintained. Good place to spend time with family and children. The kids love the open place. Very relaxing with all the greenery around. Lots of options to eat at reasonable cost. Lot of stalls to buy handicrafts. Well worth visiting multiple times.

Name: Debasis
Title: Cultural place
Review: This is a good place for family day outing in the hi-tech City area. Well connected by metro trains from anywhere within Hyderabad.Lots of shopping options.Boating is available.Overall a decent place.

Name: abrahamsuji
Title: Craft extravaganza
Review: Easy access. Must visit. Artisans display and sell their products themselves with minimal profit. Got loads of items from there.

Name: CountlessFootprints
Title: Nice place for a stroll and shopping for handicrafts
Review: It's a really big area with ample amount of walking space. Series of stalls selling handicrafts items are located here from fragile cutleries to hand designed sarees, There is an amphitheatre which is a performance area for folks artists - You'll love it if you are into folk music. They have a small lake where boating is allowed till ~6pm and a foodcourt area if you'd like to sip a cup of hot coffee or grab a quick meal.

Name: Pallabi Das
Title: Peaceful Blowing Summer Evening Visit
Review: I went their 2 times . you can enjoy a lot here . You can capture so many memories also. It's fun for children also.

Name: jainms
Title: Cultural city
Review: Very good place & must to visit. we can find hand made cloths, old tradition & also cultural activities in the evening times.

Name: JCDas
Title: Great place to see variety of craftsmen with their work.
Review: Wonderful initiative and well spacious layout of variety of craftsmen from all over India. But be careful regarding pricing of the items. What I found is they initially announce high price and the genuine price may be 50% or below. Thus there might be a feeling of getting cheated. But definitely a good place to buy handicraft and to enjoy cultural programs also.

Name: ShaanRoy
Title: Expensive to shop around
Review: its basically a market where businessmen from different states have set up their shops to sell their goods at a very expensive price. Avoid purchasing stuff which you will get at one third the price in the local market outside. The sellers from the north have a good collection of antique lookalikes but you have to bargain hard to get a good deal. Many shops accept cards as payment option. Parking is available in the basement for 30/- for four wheelers and 20/- for two wheelers. Entry fee is 50/-. Its a big area and will take half a day to roam around. Visit during the evening to avoid heat. There is a boating facility inside the lake and there is a stage where daily shows happen in the evening (dance performance etc. ) There are fast food stalls inside the complex. Not sure if the wash rooms are clean.

Name: Raja
Title: Beautiful Crafts and Arts
Review: If in Hyderabad, a visit to Shilparamam is highly recommended. The arts and crafts in this village are a tribute to the cultural heritage of India.Artists from all over the country display their masterful collections which are reasonably priced.The village museum, Rock garden, Sculpture park are some of the main attractions. Great place to visit, shop and enjoy your day (keep aside at least half a day for this place). There are cultural presentations along with a good cafe to relax.

Name: Alok Kumar Singh
Title: Nice place to shop
Review: A good place to shop, but yeah they charge a bit more, if you know local language bits even better or else if u can get to get discount it's worth... U will love it at night...

Name: Reena
Title: Amazing variety, unique items
Review: I visited this place because I'd heard a lot about it. I was overwhelmed by the variety found here. If it wasn't for baggage limitation, I would've gone crazy shopping here. I'll be definitely coming back for more!

Name: Eddie P
Title: GREAT SHOPPING!!!
Review: I love this spot, sort of an outside shopping market with stalls.  I purchase vest for my sons and I.  It is a busy place, but yet quiet and relaxing.

Name: drdesai
Title: Definitely a must place for Cotton ikkat
Review: Handicraft village with stalls selling clothing, necklaces, furniture and all local items. There is an open air amphitheatre and Best out of waste garden. Since we visited in late evening we did not explore the whole area.

Name: Nagesh Eco Ventures
Title: Best for Shopping with family
Review: Cool outing place with shopping and other activities, Best for Shopping with family. very reasonable rates

Name: Pijush Mukherjee
Title: Park of Craft & Art
Review: The place of Craft & Art - Really a very good place for visitors .  Nice place to visit with family .

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: art and crafts
Review: This is a big place and audio functions happens inside this and also there is a art and craft exhibition and sale over here

Name: Abhilash K
Title: Nice place
Review: This is one of the best place in the Hyderabad. I want to visit here again. Me and my friends enjoyed a lot here.

Name: Vanessa H
Title: Nice market
Review: Really nice market, lots of pushy vendors but also a lot of great stuff. Go here in the evening with all the lights and more crowds which means you can walk around a little bit more relaxed.

Name: Debasis
Title: Family time
Review: Very nice place, quality time spent with family and friends...lot of shopping options...enjoyed the cultural activities also.

Name: Harisha C
Title: Cultural heritage
Review: Best place which reminds us our village in the city. Lot of stalls to buy traditional clothes and accessories. Good prices available for bargainers. Nice place to hangout with friends and family.

Name: Anant K
Title: Wonderful place
Review: This is the place for everyone to visit a very amazing place and beautiful place too visit in Hyderabad city

Name: Oxymoronish
Title: Great place to shop and stroll
Review: Delightful place to shop for quirky things and souvenirs. I picked up some amazing linen saris here. Of course, there's a lot of bargaining involved. And when we went they had a cultural program going on with dance shows from all over India. It was amazing. They also have bullock cart rides and a food court. Definitely recommend this place.

Name: sree143in
Title: Culturel park
Review: This is a best place of different types of cultural activities can perform a nice place for activitis

Name: Anilkumar
Title: The place where u get all the handicrafts
Review: Simply superbRight in the centre of the city & next to kfc 😋.A place where u get the handicrafts,ethnic wears and u can see some pets alsoFully rabbits BTW u will get a chance for boating also.

Name: karthikakavya
Title: Village background
Review: lots of performances takes place here and we can get lots of different types of art articles clothes and many more accessories for ladies and few traditional not few but more traditional artistic things . also food and charts are available and the prices are ok not much bargain but ok overall its a good site view place

Name: Harish M
Title: Good and huge.
Review: It’s good to visit shilparaman, Hyderabad. It is very big in size and have lot of shops for shopaholic from novelties to garments to daily use objects of different cultures across the country.

Name: Madhavi
Title: Country atmosphere in the heart of the city
Review: A must visit for everyone visiting Hyderabad. The craft village of Shilparamam has something for all ages. Good food, handicraft shopping, fun rides and cultural programs.

Name: siva j
Title: Must visit to know the Indian village culture and shop for best handlooms
Review: Shilparamam has the Indian village culture related set up, depicting most of the handi crafts of villages.Good collection of handlooms avaialable for woman, many decorative items available for shopping.Boating also available, can have a reacreation trip for a day, spending time in green park, eat, shop and relax.

Name: thiru_sri3
Title: An excellent showcase of handicrafts
Review: There were no special programs when I visited but it was still worth the visit; it showcases culture and craft in a wonderful manner. being there on a evening made it all the more pleasant. It truly resembles an Indian village (specifically an Andhra/Telangana one). It is hard not to like this place.

Name: YatriForever
Title: Showcase of traditional art.
Review: Located in the hi-tech area of the city, Shilparamam houses and hosts so many fairs of handicrafts, sculptures and thisands of artifacts. The place is lively, so much to see and observe. We bought chairs made of jute, we are very pleased with them. Some small contribution to preserve our traditional art ! Absolutely worth a visit. There's a small entry fee. Visiting the official website of Shilparamam helps to prepare the plan.

Name: Prasad
Title: Good Place to see
Review: Visited Shilparamam cultural society last time. It is intended time.  Some cultural dance programs are happening at the time.  Happy to see that and many things are there for shopping. Prices are little bit heavy.

Name: UniQhu
Title: Best shopping place for Handicrafts and Pashminas
Review: A very good place near Hi-Tech city for shopping exclusive Indian handicrafts, Jewelry and Pashmina scarves.  This place has the feel of Indian Villages. Visit during evenings to experience the best of this place. For people working in Hi-tech city, this place is very close by to have a quick shopping break. For foreign tourists , this place is a one stop shopping spot for Indian handicrafts.Note : Take a quick bullock cart ride available inside here to add a fun experience in your list of activities.I take a lot of my clients here to buy Pashmina's and they are very happy with the best deals they get here.

Name: shashi_shaw
Title: Explore arts and culture
Review: It's a nice place to be with friends and family. You can find a lot of handicrafts, wood work, decor items and even some nice paintings for your living room.It's well maintained and very has a variety of shops and decors. You can find various types of clothes from different regions of India (don't forget to bargain - if you are buying anything)There is an entry fee which helps makes it not so crowded, and you get a chance to explore.

Name: Mohit Agrawal
Title: Good shoping spot withing city
Review: Place will give you a feel of village an the heart of a metro city.They have got a village museum also which is worth watching. A good shopping place for art and craft stuff.

Name: Natesh Reddy
Title: Shilparamam Hi-tech city Hyderabad
Review: Today visited shilparamam,it is located at Hi-tech city madhapur area. Near to JNTU university.i would like to show the village replica to my daughter and shilparamam is a right place. You can see exact village culture there.how to make mud pots and village people living style. different village festival events. Ancient wearing cloths and it will  sale small shops. Village manufactured handlooms etc..water boating,y you can watch Indian traditional dance Bharat Natyam at 6pm onwards.Many foreigners visit this place regularly because it is near to Hi-tech city. Most of them are different companies clients accompanying with their local staff.

Name: KajariMitra
Title: Excellent Range of Indian handicrafts & textiles
Review: This is Hyderabad's Delhi Haat and has many improvements. The stalls are well stocked with merchandise from all over India. The South Indian crafts were off course in plenty and I was able to discover a new form of tribal art - the Cherial of Telangana. The Food stalls were a bit limited but they were selling excellent local brewed tea for a very reasonable rate.The landscape was excellent-very well designed incorporating the natural rocks & shrubs of the area. The washrooms were surprisingly clean & manned by a personnel which helped as some areas were very quiet and not very busy.This place is easily accessible as it is close to the Centre of the newer parts of Hyderabad. so, excellent experience and great shopping!

Name: MUKKU S M R S
Title: silparamam
Review: Good place to buy different kinds of handicraft items in one place and one of the good place to visit in Hyderabad.

Name: aks4477
Title: Visit to shilparamam
Review: Good place to buy different kinds of handicraft from different states of India. Bullock cart ride is also available. Good sculptures, good for 3-4 hours visit.

Name: manikantaa
Title: Nice
Review: Very nice place in this hand crafted things are very interested and I visited last month with my family and friends

Name: Dr. Santosh Raut
Title: Nice experience
Review: Nice experience with entire family, one of the good place to visit in Hyderabad, recommended for once visit

Name: Pearl T
Title: A variety of crafts and entertainment
Review: Saw a variety of crafts from different parts of India, folk dance performances and rode an ox-drawn cart. Good way to see a range of arts and crafts in one location.  Went late afternoon-early evening to avoid daytime heat.

Name: Jayashree G
Title: Arts of the nation in one collective
Review: Be prepared to traverse through the Arts and Crafts exhibits at Shilparamam.  You need at least 1 hour to browse through and more if you are keen to buy stuff.  Madhubani paintings, Kakamkari prints, Sahranpur wood crafts, Odishi Patachitra, Kashmiri woollen items, Gujarati Katha work sling bags and more, Tanjore paintings, Artists offering to draw potraits, Lucknavi Chikankari, Mehendi artists, Ikkat designs, eateries including the famous Gokul Chats are some noteworthy  attractions here.Reasonably priced, Shilparamam is a great way to experience the extensively diverse and rich culture of our motherland.  Only wish that the shopkeepers used an alternative to the plastic carry bags that are readily given.

Name: LAL KISHORE K
Title: SHILPARAMAM -ARTISANS  VILLAGE IN THE CITY
Review: Thia is a ''must visit '' place for those who love artistic works of rural artisans of India particularly from Andhrapradesh and Telangana states.You will find more than 300 shops selling art works of various types,made from wood, metals etc. and also variety of clothes.This is a place to be visited by tourists, particularly foreigners,who wish to take gifts for their friends and relatives in their native country.Some of the artwork pieces are really impressive.There is entry ticket for adults.There is also boat ride for recreation and some eateries to take snacks.It takes about 2 to 4 hours to complete the visit.It is located centrally in the city of Hyderabad .Evenings will be pleasant to while away time and do some shopping

Name: kennice2016
Title: A good place to relax
Review: This place is culturally awesome, highlighting the touch of rural life in India and very refreshing for nature lovers. There is always an entertaining activity happening here. One full day is also too hectic for the fun and entertainment. many foreigners prefer this place for their shopping. The bargaining range is not very wide.

Name: Chetu1087
Title: Nice place shopping addicts
Review: It is a nice place to have look at variety of products specially clothes. Other attractions includes wooden and ceramic articles.

Name: PGNJ10
Title: Nice outdoor place for the evening
Review: By Indian standards, this is a pretty nice place to visit., Highlights1. Can buy handicrafts directly from artisans. As other reviewers have mentioned, bargain well. You can get stuff at 50% of the first quote. It will be harder for non-Indians and north Indians to bargain. So go with someone local if you plan to purchase something expensive. 2. Cultural shows in the evening are interesting. You cannot expect Cirque Du Soleil in $1 ticket. There is a decent effort to manage mosquitoes. Expect few bites if you are not fully covered.3. Boating can be fun for someone who has never done boating. Frequent travellers to USA and Europe may find it childish though. Water can be smelly and again full of mosquitoes. 4. Provides some trees and green environment in the concrete jungle. So you can walk around if the weather is good. Negatives:]1. Street dogs roam around free. 2. Kids are plucking flowers despite warning signs.3. Mosquitoes

Name: dipali
Title: Handicrafts village with array of traditional regional artifacts
Review: This craft village with all kind of handicrafts and art work is located in hitech city area of Hyderabad. This place is run by state government and attracts huge number of visitors especially on the weekends. During the last month of the year December  season, different cultural events like mytholigical plays, dance programs, mono actions etc are also organized in this place. It has variety of stalls for the crafts made from different parts of the country. These hand made crafts range from ornaments, clothes, pingani ware, pearls, bangles, foot ware, handbags, wooden toys etc. One can shop something for your house or some traditional Indian fabric and intricate work then Shilparamam is a good place to go. Lots of stalls selling local crafts and clothing.  If anybody wants to buy fabrics,clothes,artwork, scarves , pottery or ironwork. Indeed it's a good place to shop,beautiful shops and merchandise from across India. There is also a small  garden available for kids, boating, best out of waste sculptures and food. Its a very colourful place. Do buy whatever you like but don't forget to bargain well. These items are available at very reasonable price and bargaining is expected here, so be sure to bargain at every stall. There is also a food court available selling snacks, cold drinks and ice creams inside Shilparamam if you plan to munch during your visit.  There is also a small village museum made up of wax sculptures of different professionals in village. Kids can enjoy Rajasthani puppet show. State government also started night bazar here so that, people can do the shopping during night also. Mehindi (henna) stalls are available where in the girls lay different mehindi designs for payment. This is a very good place for women shopping. Plenty of parking is available in newly constructed basement parking.Only thing is if you are outsider then be careful as the shopkeeper would try to fool you with the pricing of different things.

Name: mighty7886
Title: A celebration of handloom culture
Review: The place provides an exhibition of all the hand-loom items and lush green paths around it. A must visit.

Name: pvrkaushik
Title: Nice place to spend an evening
Review: This place has lots of greenery and themed places... Also rock garden similar to Chandigarh. Don't miss this place

Name: Aqua L
Title: Evening Retreat for Family
Review: A place for curios from around India. Open spaces for kids,  snacks are available. Night market is lean, though advertised

Name: Shridhar93
Title: Must try
Review: Shilparamam is supposed to have Crafts Museum, Cultural Museum, Art Gallery & Library, Multi-purpose Auditorium, Common Facility Workshops and Research & Design Centre along with accommodation facilities for artists and visitors..

Name: Trending T
Title: Night bazaar
Review: This place is famous for indian traditional clothes and it has night bazaar where you can buy lot of handloom made things and can make your time pass.

Name: rockzzM77
Title: Amazing Place
Review: I visited here with my sister and her husband, we really like this theme park, the park was nicely maintained, If you are in Hyderabad must go here.

Name: Lavesh G
Title: Extremely Average market, Good gardens....!!!
Review: U are in for a huge disappointment if you have been to places like the the Delhi Haat, the CIE etc...This place does not have anything to attract you. The only saving grace are the gardens where you can probably relax if you wish to do that kind of stuff

Name: GreenCarpet11
Title: Essence of India
Review: Lights up and the village industries come alive here, even the earth becomes fragrant with the culture of India.It brings up to your mind a myriad images from your past and a happiness that you can grasp no more.Yet, those beautifully crafted items that gleam around your eyes were crafted with hard working hands to earn a few pennies more to feed those who depend on them for a living. Mind you, when lights are out and when daylight streams in too there is a lot to see . The India still lives under the blazing sun or the winter cold , the hand made items, the subtly painted figures dance and prance about on the vases and urns.You run into very beautifully bent arches fitted with lights and flocks grazing all time by the riverside, an idyllic site from greeting cards, very old houses with thick walls which are disappearing today, handmade bags, Rajasthani arts and crafts, bangles and chains and trinkets, wrought iron stuff, jewel boxes, Kashmir carpets, pure cotton sarees, terra cota  and endless little things one would enjoy.It is open everyday. There are museums and parks where you can stroll about. A small theater for entertainment shows typically Indian.   Entry fee is minimal.Enjoy the evenings.Do not litter.

Name: kurukuntla raviteja
Title: Shilparamam
Review: Shilpa Raman is located in Hyderabad near  hi tech city kondapur there is available hand made crafts it is good place to shipping and said seen there is many gifts shops will available  we have to shop at night because it is too beautiful comfortable with everyone

Name: Mohan
Title: Full of enjoyment
Review: At this place we can find lot of handmade products and a beautiful village experience and we can find idols with scrap

Name: Relax08134827658
Title: Good Place for Local Shopping
Review: Good place if you plan to buy handicrafts or other small souvenirs from your trip.However,i must advice to bargain hard.As some of the visitors are foreigners,they tend to inflate prices and charge you more.Buy at 80% of what they quote

Name: gabrial03330
Title: One of the best place if culture and hand crafted items
Review: There you can have N number of hand beautiful crafted items with good price which reflects the culture of the place.

Name: 73prashantha
Title: Cultural site.
Review: They have a lot of handicrafts and reflect telangana culture.their camel and bull rides are awesome. must visit in hyderabad

Name: Camper22259549037
Title: Traditional shopping
Review: I like the atmosphere there with alot of shops and hand made sculptures and alot of art.. It's very attractive in the days of Sankranti with more decorative things and especially bullock cart😍

Name: deepa v
Title: Shilparamam
Review: One of the famous places in Hyd.Located in the hi-tech city.. the place has many shopping outlets right from clothes to toys to paintings to food stalls and it even hosts some cultural events during festival times. Must visit in Hyd.

Name: Kirikera
Title: A must see if you are in the area
Review: As this was behind Hotel Trident (where I was staying), decided to visit it. Lot of ethnic wear. Nice food too. There was a Bharatnatyam performance too that I saw. Do no miss if you are in the vicinity.

Name: NeerajSharma
Title: Great place to buy ethnics
Review: if you want to buy ethnics and other sort of cultural stuff then this place is worth to visit but you need to be a good negotiator else you may feel as robbed later , washrooms are pathetic, food canteen in the area isn't great and they don't maintain hygiene.

Name: Akhil P
Title: Decent place for cultural events
Review: It is good for the all cultural lovers to spend decent amount of time with parents and with their children's all types of classic dances performed well

Name: Khyati
Title: Its good to visit once
Review: This place is good to see and buy art and handicraft items.. it is crowded .. it has number of stalls with different items..

Name: Uma
Title: Ok to visit once
Review: We went on a weekend in the eve. Completely packed. Won't advise to buy sarees. Could find metal jewelleries, bedsheets. Decors, jute bags.. Worth to visit once..

Name: RaF
Title: Misleading Tourists, waste of time.
Review: I visited this place  in the late afternoon. Shopkeepers  are either sleeping  or don't want to attend to  the customers. You can  find this kind of  place  in any village  or temple  fairs. Food  facilities  inside  Shilparam  is unnhygeinic.

Name: Narendra B
Title: Shilparamam
Review: This is added tourist attraction for tourist for local and villege culture of telangana.Hand made handicrafts sold here.It is also picnic spot surrounded by number of green treees

Name: OctOriental
Title: Family time
Review: Great hub of hanging out, boating, eating and recreation. Bordered by a long and wide promenade that is great for a romantic stroll. But needs to be better lit and supported by good quality street side eateries to make it a better place.

Name: Daniela R
Title: Give this one a miss
Review: A veritable floating garbage dump. Smelly and dirty, surrounded by crumbled walk ways that did not even go all the way around. Add to it the horrendous pollution of the city which creates a haze that makes it difficult to see, and you have a truly bad experience. Not worth bothering to even cross the road to see this lake.

Name: ullacarinquiterio
Title: Buddha statue
Review: It was a nice experience to take a boat ride to the statue and walk around it. The best time is in the evening when it is dark and the statue lights up in different colors.

Name: Vaishnavi_g
Title: Good experience
Review: You get to have a ferry ride, and look around the Hyderbad city lake view. You can go for it if you have enough time in your itinerary.

Name: lkoraj
Title: Go for enjoy…
Review: Very good place, boating is main attraction of this place, really you will enjoy at this place, deterrent type of boats are there, a full entertainment place.

Name: Milind Kshirsagar
Title: Go to Lumbini park
Review: Lumbini park or Hussain Sagar are the same things. Go to Lumbini park directly. All that is worthy of enjoying is there only.

Name: Deepyayan Ghosh
Title: Good View from a distance
Review: Hussain Sagar Lake adds a good view but from a distance as few parts have a sewage smell which travels to distane. But if you are in Hyderabad then take a drive in the evening. You also the small boats ferrying tourist to the statue.

Name: Primal Survivor
Title: A lake seeking attention
Review: The major attraction of the city . Designed for families outings. The lake is littered with muck. Strange smell follows. Upgradation process is on causing traffic snarls . Only if response tourism was followed . Sad the visitors don't care.

Name: Sudipta Shaheen
Title: Cool and calm
Review: Very nice lake. Well maintained. They charge 50 rs per head for boat ride. A budda statue us their in the middle of the lake.

Name: dr ganapathi bhat
Title: "Big and grand"
Review: In Hyderabad, Charminar, Husain Sagar and Birla Mandir are must see.Hussain Sagar is a huge area. Lot of gardens adjoin the lake. The lake has nice boating facilities. Rush, during Covid, was less. May need half a day for seeing

Name: Rohit g
Title: ok..
Review: the lake is ok not wow.The boat ride is also fine but nothing very excited.Though we enjoyed the evenong

Name: Sunil
Title: Budha statuse is famous in hyderbad
Review: The Buddha statue is very famous in hyderbad and its located on the way to railway Station its good to watch just stop in and look at the statue

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Beautiful lake with Buddha statue
Review: Hussain Sagar Lake is surely one of the popular attractions for tourists as well as locals in Hyderabad and we had visited the same during our holiday in Hyderabad. The lake is a huge one and we saw it while traveling through Necklace road and Tank Bund road. Boating is available on this Lake from Lumbini Park. We opted for a ride in mechanised boat priced at 55 rupees per person which took us till the Buddha statue in the middle of the lake. There are other types of boat rides like speed boats priced at 350 rupees per boat for 4 people and big cruise boat priced at 100 rupees per person. It was a great experience.

Name: Mutukuloju Pranay
Title: Need to be cleaned
Review: Beautiful lake with the statute of buddha at the center .much contaminated,[polluted.you can see the watercolor is black and green.need to cleaned first

Name: Talent P
Title: largest artificial lake in Asia
Review: One of the most popular tourist places in Hyderabad. At the middle of the lake, you will find a huge statue of standing Lord Buddha which has height of 16 m and weighs almost 350 tonnes.

Name: Sardev2014
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: Worth a visit if your in the area and can cope with traffic. A very popular tourist destination. Massive lake with boat trips available to get to the statue in the middle.  You can take both slow and fast boat.

Name: Alok Kumar
Title: Hussain Sagar Lake may be as enjoying as Marine Drive if Mumbai
Review: Visit the hussain sagar lake in evening.. take a stroll. Enjoy the light and sound show... take a boat ride .. and it will be a different experience... something new.. away from hustle bustle of mega city

Name: Ashwin Vemuri
Title: Hussain Sagar Lake
Review: Pride of Hyderabad, Romantic Locations All Around, Sailing Club Has The Best Views Over Drinks & Dinner.

Name: Curious785091
Title: Take a nice drive around the lake
Review: This is a nice lake with lots of stuff around it.  There are boats that you can ride in too.  Parks along the sides of the water - very nice!

Name: PKB
Title: Love it
Review: I like this place, statue in the middle of water, such beautiful environment, area is getting ready.

Name: mahomed swalleh ameer
Title: My views about the lake
Review: Situation in the middle of the city of Hyderabad.Its a joy just driving around the circumference of the lake.Lots of entertainment along side the lake.Lots of food.It looks stunning as the sun sets.At night the lights iluminate and makes it very beautiful

Name: KRISHAN S
Title: Good attraction, need to improve
Review: The place is affascinating , because of  its height and carvings present on the marvelous Budha statue. The boat ride to achive this place could be pleasant and more comfortable if the Hussan Sagar lake would have been maintained properly.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: World's largest heart shaped mark
Review: Recognized by United Nations World Tourism Organization as World's largest heart shaped mark, this lake is the most visited site in Hyderabad. Though the lake is highly polluted and stinks at several places it is a wonderful place to spend early morning. On one side is the necklace road and other side is Tank Bund. There are several parks all around the lake- Herbal garden, Butterfly garden, Sanjeevaiah Children park, Rock garden, Rose garden, NTR garden and Lumbini Park. Boats are available from Lumbini Park to Girbraltar Rock on which the colossal monolythic Buddha Statue stands.

Name: RANGANATHAN SVN KONDALA
Title: Buddha's essence
Review: The Experience to Tank Bund and the Visit to the Buddha Platform is a Wholesome Experience. In the chaotic city of Modern Hyderabad , this island statue is reminiscent of Peace and Calm ......its a must in Hyd trip

Name: Krishna Sandeep Siram
Title: Good place to visit
Review: Good location to visit in Hyerabad, But lake is not maintained well. We can Experience boating in the lake. It was a good experience but we have to bear some smell

Name: shirin t
Title: Make your evening beautiful
Review: In the evening no other better place then Hussain Sagar to visit. Boating one of the best feature. Yup delicious street food another amazing stuff. Worth trying for

Name: Indusman248
Title: Boat ride with Spouse
Review: Spent some 20 minutes and found that the Lake experience can be enhanced with a museum, dining destination and Buddha meditation halls. We took a speed boat but event the boats can be made available of better quality with Guides.

Name: farzana i
Title: Great atmosphere
Review: Nice place to visit with friends in the evening, take a leisurely stroll with friends - sit on the benches and enjoy the breeze... good to experience

Name: Maryj2111
Title: Perfect evening stroll
Review: Great place to hang around... eat some peanuts, watch the sunset and the Buddha .. get an ice cream or a roasted corn and enjoy the gentle breeze .. watch the traffic and the calm lake diametrically opposite in nature and both endearing

Name: BhaskarVVB
Title: 10 Km worthy walk or ride
Review: If you are a runner or a walker, this 10 Km worthy physical effort early in the morning. I was fortunate to run around this lake at least three times in the past few weeks. Highly recommended for fitness buffs, Beware of the pollution in certain pockets of this route.

Name: alpsbt27
Title: very beautiful place
Review: we visited this lake at night time and enjoyed it very well. here many people come to spend quality time. we really enjoyed the time and place and it is remarkable in the tour.

Name: Tarun
Title: Kids boating in lake
Review: We visited here on my younger son's birthday with family. We first enjoyed the Lumbani Park and took tickets for boat ride on kids demand. We went upto the Lord Buddha statue. Children enjoyed there for sometime. We took many selfies. It is good to photography and visit with children. All of us enjoyed a lot.

Name: Primal Survivor
Title: Another lake
Review: Why do we have to pollute every single water body we get access to ?The concept of lake is good .Drive along is nice too but of lately the area has become smelly and water dirty.Food joints obstruct the view.

Name: MyNameIs Shiva
Title: If You wish to see Buddhah
Review: If You love buddah You are the one to visit this place it's an historic place an a must watch location In Hyderabad.

Name: Darshan N
Title: Beautiful place to visit
Review: Beautiful tiny island between Hussain Sagar Lake needs to travel in Ferry ⛴ Service.. Beautiful lighting arrangement on island clean place breakfast is available here on island Water quality in Lake is poor you can see nice view of Hyderabad city from here

Name: ash0501
Title: Beauties of Hyderabad
Review: The lake created by men adds to beauties of this anicent township,it has Large statue of lord Buddha made from a single stone,the tricolor flying at one corner of lake add colour,a round by a boat is a pleasure

Name: sree143in
Title: nice
Review: hussain sagar lake is very nice look in eveniong lights. boat rounds avilable around the buddha statue.

Name: Rajujacob
Title: Visit
Review: Its looks very colorful during  night time its very attractive with display of light. Its a such a huge sagar.

Name: balkivinod
Title: Often pass through place
Review: I have visited muliple times and the location is good fo strolling for some time.  How ever smells emit from the lake due to pollution. It is good place to have evening walk around the lake. But has become congested due to growing city waistline line.

Name: Stephen P
Title: laser light show
Review: The laser light show is really cool. It's the best one that I've every seen. It's worth going to the Lumbini park in Hussain Sagar Lake just for the show. It's at 7:15pm.

Name: Jo-Ann
Title: Quite unique
Review: From afar the view was cool but when you approach the lake, there’s rubbish everywhere. Sigh. This place is not a village. There are fine restaurants around. Wish it is cleaned and maintained regularly.

Name: 007SureshHyd
Title: Iconic tourist attraction.. must visit
Review: Don't miss the boat ride to buddha's statue. The skyline of Hyderabad above the picturesque Hussain Sagar lake has become more colourful with country’s biggest flag fluttering atop a sky-kissing pole at a record height of 88 meters.The national flag with a gigantic size of 108 in width by 72 feet in length was hoisted by the Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao on windy Thursday morning marking the second anniversary of the formation of Telangana State.The new tourist attraction in Sanjeevaiah Park on the bank of Hussain Sagar lake, which cost the state government Rs 1.8 crore, narrowly missed the feat of being the tallest flag in the country. The recorded will continue to belong to the 82 meters high flagpole of Raipur, the capital of Chattisgarh

Name: vijusjod
Title: Average
Review: The lake is not worth to visit. It is clogged with garbage and dirty water all around. Needs proper maintenance and management to become a good tourist spot.

Name: S B Khare
Title: View from a distance only
Review: It has very low outdoor fun value these days. It is under very poor upkeep. I have passed by it but was advised not to venture near it because of foul smell. It looks great from a distance, but no boating or water sport takes place in these waters. At night, the city lights give a good effect and the statue in the middle of the lake looks great at night as well.

Name: Shailendra
Title: Lost charm
Review: Hussain sagar lake used to be a place to visit on our weekend drives when we came to Hyderabad in 2003 but over the last few years the lake has deteriorated due to lack of cleaning and resultant smell.No more a place worth a watch.

Name: Sounak Poddar
Title: Budhaa Statue
Review: This is an iconic place in Hyderabad and for some good reasons. Boat ride into the sea for the Budhaa Statue is a ride to remember, and that too also for good and as well as for bad reason. Good reason being the ride and the view and the bad reason for the smell. Anyway one should take a call on your own if you want to visit this place or not.

Name: Wilayat
Title: Lake view
Review: Hussain Sagar is a heart-shaped lake in Hyderabad, It is spread across an area  is fed by the River Musi. A large monolithic statue of the Gautama Buddha, erected in 1992, stands on Gibraltar Rock in the middle of the lake. It also separates the city centre of Hyderabad from its neighborhood Secunderabad.

Name: Niyoti
Title: Stinking lake
Review: Yes it is true, we humans have destroyed its beauty completely. It stinks so badly that you cannot stand in front of the lake not even for 10 secs. It was to be one of the beautiful lakes of hyderabad but now its beauty has been destroyed completely.

Name: Sai
Title: Hussain Sagar
Review: The place was really amazingIt was such a beautiful place Unbelievable and mindblowingWhat a place that was.

Name: Mangala M
Title: Crowd management
Review: Lovely lake... however the crowd for boating are not managed well. The life jackets must be dry cleaned frequently, as they stink. It's a punishment wearing them and enduring the stink!

Name: Fff
Title: Picnic
Review: It is a very good place to for the enjoyment and good time to spend with the family and friends and specially the surrounding areas like lumni park ,NTR garden Necklace road and IMAX theatre

Name: Atul S
Title: A place worth visiting
Review: The lake is big and the the ride to the big statue is interesting. Boating is available at very reasonable  cost and it is worth spending 1 hr. You can take few selfies there. The other amenities are just ok and could have been maintained in a better way.

Name: Rajesh T
Title: Good
Review: Good place to see in Hyderabad and very neat and clean. Good and co-operative staff. Arrangements are very good.

Name: Vikas D
Title: Weekend visit to Hussain Sagar lake
Review: Amazing boat ride and view of the Buddha statue. We were expecting smelly lake but fortunately it was not and it was an enjoyable evening with business colleague Nice weekend getaway

Name: Gurmeet
Title: Best place to hangout
Review: This is one of the best place to hang out with Friends or family  in Hyderabad. A famous place of attraction in the city

Name: ChennaiShaji
Title: The centre piece - a lake
Review: A land mark which you cannot miss while in the twin cities of Hyderabad and Secunderabad. jut roam around or you can have a short boat ride.

Name: arzoi k
Title: Gud for once
Review: Just stopped for 5 mins while passing from road.. view is gud.. boating also available.. cud not try..

Name: RAJENDRA884 PRASAD
Title: Nice place to spend evenings
Review: Visited this place around sunset and got lovely views and found it one of the best places in Hyderabad to spend evening and go for long walks.

Name: Muneer
Title: Cool day
Review: It’s a very beautiful and relaxing place for all family I and my family spend a cool 😎 time on this trip 👍🏻

Name: Santosh Kumar
Title: Nice place
Review: Good to visit this place near Raniganj in Hyderabad as it is very clean and nicely maintained.So recommended.

Name: abrahamsuji
Title: Memorable experience
Review: Must visit. Easy access. Ample parking space. Boating facilities available. Excellent place for evening walk & wind down

Name: Qkahmed
Title: Hussain Sagar Lake
Review: Hussain Sagar lake is named after a famous saint by name Hussain Shah Wali. The lake divides Hyderabad city from Secunderabad city. The Tank bund bridge road takes you to Secunderabad. The lake is a tourist destination for those who wish to take a boat ride and also can view a single rock Budha statue in the middle of the Hussain sagar lake.

Name: beyondtravel
Title: Scenic marvel of Hyderabad
Review: The city of pearl is crowned with necklace road that surrounds the large Hussain sagar lake,  which is quite a sight on monsoon evening of full moon.

Name: jainms
Title: Heart of hyderabad
Review: Its in the center of Hyderabad city and very beautiful place & must to visit. Can cover lot of places around Hussain sager lake. Water maintenance to be improved.

Name: Srisadhana
Title: Good place
Review: Lake is decent place to spend a good couple of hours. Nearby stalls are available to snack something.

Name: leelaneeraj1
Title: World yoga day
Review: Very peaceful place ,I like the morning yoga session. Near Buddha, thanks to Isha foundation for arranging this,

Name: amitdon2
Title: Buddha
Review: The Buddha statue can be seen from near through a boat ride in lumbini park.evening boat ride is good.

Name: avixorld
Title: Big lake and joyful surrounding
Review: Whenever I went to HYD I always tried to visit this water body. This is a good refresher within a city what people can get after the busy schedule of a work day. I loved their passenger boat ride to the Buddha statue. My only issue here the ticket system one can introduce credit card vending machine and there should be some poster which can enhance the awareness of preservation of water body!

Name: Manoj43_11
Title: Huge lake
Review: A massive lake in the centre of Hyderabad city is good to visit in the evening time. Large statue of Lord Buddha in the lake is main attraction. The park is also nice and you can spend some time here or go for boating.

Name: Ashraf4916
Title: Nice spot for photography
Review: The lake in the city of Hyderabad, beautifully laid out and good tourist spot. Excellent place for outdoor photography.

Name: Mdeweyer
Title: Statue is impressive
Review: The statue on the island in the middle of the lake is impressive. The lake is dirty and the boat just takes you from the park to the island and back. Takes 15 minutes.

Name: Saurabh A
Title: The water is dirty , and the place is smelly
Review: Goods:The restaurants near to the lake serve good food. It feels really nice to eat near to a lake, especially when the weather is good.BadThe water is very dirty.The places smells at times.

Name: ShvRm_Traveller
Title: Huge Lake in the center of the city
Review: It is a man made lake, built some time in 16th Century and which separates Hyderabad from Sikanderabad. The large monolith statue of Buddha stands tall on an island in the middle of the lake. There are parks, gardens and many other landmarks located on the bank of the lake.This is one of the well known landmark of city of Hyderabad and is visible from the many high points in the city.

Name: 3gautamk
Title: Decent chill
Review: Nice place to chill. Slightly polluted at the edges but nice place to chill. There is sailboat clubs sailing on Sunday. Nice Buddha statue in the center and a huge Indian flag by the side. Very peaceful but hope they clear the plastic refuge

Name: Anoop Vij
Title: MARINE DRIVE OR THE NECKLACE OF HYDERABAD
Review: The towering statue of Gautam Buddha in the middle of Hussain Sagar Lake is a treat to spend time. The place is always lively and is swarmed with people of ages.

Name: Eaglesnow
Title: A massive lake just in center
Review: It was a great experience walking beside the lake it is decorated with park like views and trees for walkers and seats to rest .besides that people go fo boating in this lake.

Name: Mukesh A
Title: Great place...lake is also maintained
Review: Great place to visit. Kids do enjoy boating, the buddha statue and garden around it. Good fun for a couple of hrs

Name: SAID A
Title: A pond to visit
Review: It was sunset time to take some wonderful photos with friends. I recommend to visit it at sunrise or sunset time.

Name: Parvez Rangpur
Title: Natural beauty in City
Review: This is a funtastic place to visit when you feel bore in city. Its mind touching scenery refreshes your tiredness and tenderness.

Name: Sohail S
Title: Amazing spot for pictures
Review: If you have a phone with decent camera capabilities, that's more than enough to capture stunning pictures for your Instagram/WhatsApp dp uploads. You should visit the place after 6 pm, which is when the lighting starts.Have uploaded some pictures. Let me know how you find them.Thanks!

Name: NIL_MODI
Title: Big Lake
Review: Hussain Sagar Lake is very big and easily accessible with public transportation Big Budhha statue is there in the middle of lake. Other nearby attractions are Lumbini Park and NTR garden. Good place to roam around during evening.

Name: Anand R
Title: Beautiful`
Review: Nicely Maintained. The Garden and Walking Area is beautifully maintained with Lawns and most importantly its clean.

Name: Adeeb unisa
Title: Not impressive
Review: I did not like this place .and For those who are looking to go here visit if you have plenty of time.

Name: Abhilash K
Title: Great monument
Review: This was established by late sree Nandamuri Taraka Rama Rao. There is a boat facility to reach the statue. But the bad smell came from the lake is very bad.

Name: Dr I R Patil
Title: Nice
Review: Nice place to spend with family and children you can opt boat ride, children park with few rides, evening laser show.

Name: Debasis
Title: Big and beautiful
Review: This is a jewel to Hyderabad. Always beautiful after sunset. We enjoyed our time on the lake side. Must see.

Name: SSDNY
Title: Smelly Lake
Review: The lake looks very pretty but as you get close you will find the smell. I am wondering if the guest complains about the hotels on the lake.  Shame on the municipality of Hydrabad for not doing anything.

Name: Abhishek M
Title: Boating
Review: Good place to visit with family and small children. It has different boating from lumbini park to Buddha statue. Buddha statue is only reachable through boats. At buddha statue you will find fountains, and lot of crowd during evening. People usually go there for photos. You are allowed to take cellphone and take photos. Separate charges for taking cameras. No bags are allowed in lumbani park, you can submit your bags at clock rooms near ticket counters. There are many places to visit around the lake. All places can't be covered in a day.

Name: neeraj2boby
Title: Necklace
Review: Beautiful manmade lake. Boating is a wonderful evening event. Water front restaurants and lovely area for walking. Has ample parking space too

Name: Mythri Sekhon
Title: Great relaxing feel
Review: Nice place and a great stress buster specially the evenings. Had a great time. All kinds of food and snacks are there and all are good to eat, the tea is amazing. Good place to play for small children.

Name: Bhupendra K
Title: Rain and Run
Review: I visited here for a sunday run when it was raining. I enjoyed every step while running. You find a small patch of greenery and road as well around the lake. There is a small canteen opposite the lake and after run refreshments were available there as per my preference. Very far from my place.....but i can visit again for a solo run.

Name: Ruth M
Title: Worth the drive
Review: The Hussain Sagar Lake is a major feature in Hyderabad and definitely worth a drive around at least part of it (even though we were caught in a traffic jam due to the visit of some dignitary to the city the day we were there. We enjoyed views of the lake from the car and also from a good lakeside restaurant.

Name: vchu99
Title: Looks good from a distance
Review: The lake is beautiful when viewed from a distance (say from the Birla Temple).  Yet, when I got close and walked along the the lake, I saw a lot of floating trash and it smelled really bad.

Name: GoWrong
Title: Centre of the city
Review: One great thing about Hyderabad is that it has got iconic public places where you can go  and relax with a group. HSL is one such place and I think very important which divides Hyderabad and Secunderabad. You can go for a boat ride and there are fun activities for kids too

Name: Vikram
Title: Poorly maintained stinking water body
Review: I had taken my relatives visiting the city to show them the sights around the twin cities. We were unable to stand the stench and the place is very poorly maintained. It also due to poor civic sense of people littering the place. Sad to see the way people don't hesitate to spoil the enviornment.

Name: Soumyajit Saha
Title: Hussain Sagar
Review: Hussain Sagar in located isn Hyderabad. In the heart of the Hussain Sagar there is a statue of Lord Buddha. It is a wonderfulplace to visit, if you are visiting Hyderabad.

Name: AbhayKrSinha
Title: Experience the Hyderabad culture with entertainment
Review: This is a wonderful place to stroll & enjoy the Hyderabad culture. You can also come here by train and the nearest station is Necklace Road. Beside the lake, there is all around parks, where you can have the quality time with your family & friends. Can have a boat ride till the middle of Buddha Statue. Speed boat costs 345 Rs. for 04 person & ferry will cost 55 Rs. per person. Can enjoy local foods along with the international food outlets. There are two places from where you can have the boating facility. One is very crowded but another is having less crowd which is closer to Necklace Road railway station.

Name: Chandana Jain
Title: My 10th visit
Review: I have been residing in Hyderabad for the past 26 years and have been to Hussain sagar lake for more than 10 times. Hussain sagar lake is a lake that has a buddha statue which is apparently carved out of a single stone. The statue is beautiful and for seeing the statue you need to take a boat ride either from "Eat Street" or from "Lumbini Park" there are also private small ships namely bhagmati etc which can be used for a private party, kitty party etc which has a restaurant inside it. These boats also have a live dance performance. The regular boat ticket is priced at 50INR which is adequate. The statue is worth spending it.  The boat ride is amazing and it drops you at buddha statue and gives you 15 minutes to enjoy the beauty of the statue and click pictures. After 15 minutes it takes you back to either "Eat street" or "Lumbini park" where ever you took the boat from. The experience is worth it for 50 bucks.

Name: sadhwani
Title: Good place for evening strolls around the lake on park
Review: This place has nice breeze given the size of the lake and the open area available, though the smell of the water of lake takes time to get used to. Overall a good place for evening strolls around the lake on park

Name: Niya1315
Title: Lake in the middle of this city
Review: If you are roaming in the Hyderabad city, you will definitely see this lake. The iconic Buddha statue is in the middle of this lake.

Name: AmodPune_India
Title: Pathetic
Review: Housekeeping staff cleans the floor while people are eating. They don’t care to request travellers to wait or finish the meals. We were having dinner and the staff lady was rushing to clean the floor. The housekeeping team started putting chairs on the tables. This looked to be the end of day operations. The staff was eating the food kept for travellers. Most of the food items were cold and no heating was being maintained. My next flight was after 6 hours but I was told that the lounge can  be used only for 2 hours. This was new for me. It’s Pathetic and I couldn’t see any supervisor with whom I could chat. Plaza premium definitely needs to upgrade the quality.

Name: Winnia
Title: Arrogant Receptionist
Review: I just came out of the lounge all furious on the receptionist who was a nutcase, didnt seem to understand simple English and above all spoke rudely.I told her to kindly contact the Indigo helpdesk to help me in taking my mother who is a senior citizen to the boarding gate.The wheelchair assistance guy had left us at the lounge since we had a 4 hours layover.Before leaving he said that I need to initimate lounge receptionist and she would connect with Indigo helpdesk and arrange for the assistance.When it was time ,I went and told this receptionist that my mother is seated on the wheelchair and that if she could connect with the Indigo helpdesk for continuing the assistance till the gate, she noded her like an idiot...After sometime when nobody came ,I went back and reminded her while she was fidgeting with her cellphone and she was like we dont provide this service; To which I said this is ridiculous because if you didn't,you should have told that to me the first time.She had the audacity to tell me "How much has it been since you first came, I didn't tell you then, but I am telling you now".I AM REALLY DISSAPOINTED WITH THIS KIND OF ATTITUDE THAT TOO FOR REQUESTING FOR SERVICE FOR A SENIOR CITIZEN. SHOCKED TO SEE SUCH BEHAVIOUR FROM THE RECEPTIONIST.Requesting the Plaza lounge management to please take action against such arrogant staff.Winnia Furtado9833512787

Name: rajiv_thatsme
Title: Horrible
Review: Pathetic lounge with rude staff. No wifi available. No proper bottled water for international passengers. And very basic amenities.

Name: Keith
Title: Worst lounge
Review: This lounge is expected to cater for those travelling business internationally and domestically, but didn’t have any food, drinks or Wi-Fi. When asked why nothing was available “new owner arrives in a couple of days!”Floors filthy and staff sleeping on toilet floor.Worst lounge experience ever!

Name: Deepankar Mitra
Title: Hyd airport lounge management to be change immediately. Worst in India.
Review: At 7.30 pm today , lounge personal at hyd airport lounge said it's closed because food is over ... I mean seriously... How can it be managed so bad... Can the management look into it plz. It's sooo waste.... Action should be taken related to this.

Name: drvivekx
Title: Poorly being managed.
Review: The lounge was closed when we arrived. We were told the lounge will open at 12:30 when lunch starts. When the lounge opened there was atleast a crowd of 40 people waiting for card to get swiped and getting unmanageable. And only one person to swipe . Later after 15 min 1 more arrived. The water dispenser did not have hot water . No soft drink- machine out of order. No tea in tea coffee dispenser.

Name: Amit Rathour
Title: Good lounge
Review: Good lounge but always crowded . Good sitting area for a longer wait time and comfortable seating . The menu is repetitive if you are traveling frequently might not enjoy the menu.

Name: Rahul2604
Title: Good lounge but crowded
Review: Only lounge at RGIA domestic departure,its big with respect to many other lounge in India still remains crowded during peak hours.As most lounge in India only allowed 3 hr before departure but if having more layover can swipe card multiple times and use.Food selection was good,there is a bar also with payment basic,only lounge in India having smoking zone inside.

Name: GLOBALSEAS
Title: refresshing
Review: refreshing in the lounge when we have too much of time to connect a flight .... good food and we can rest and relax ...

Name: DipuKV
Title: Crowded
Review: The Plaza Premium Lounge at Hyderabad, just like its counterpart in Delhi, gives you the same feel - crowded to the hilt. While the spread when I visited was good, limited seating options and long lines diluted the overall experience.

Name: Akshay Sharma
Title: An average lounge with a Premium mentioned in its name
Review: This lounge though named Premium offers an average service compared to the ones at Delhi/ Mumbai airports. The seating arrangement is cramped and the check-in experience is very poor. They need to improve the seating arrangement which makes the whole area quite cramped.

Name: Ankur Borwankar
Title: Excellent food, comfortable couches
Review: Out of the dozen or so airport lounges I've been to in India, this one is by far the best. Comfortable seating, runway facing couches with plush footrests, delicious lunch, live food counter, and polite staff.Lunch included soup, salads & beans, daal & rice, a vegetarian starter, one vegetarian and one chicken main course, a live dosa counter, and a dessert. All of these were fresh and worthy of compliment on a pedestrian Tuesday afternoon. My only gripe is there were no rotis on the menu. It does get crowded around mealtime but I found a two-person dining table without having to wait.A small bar serves alcohol at a charge with separate seating, coffee machines dispense good cappuccino, and there's also a soda fountain with 4 or 5 varieties (PepsiCo, not Coke).A smoking room is inside the lounge, adjacent to the bar, so there's no need to lug your cappuccino across the airport. The room is small but clean and maintenance staff was sweeping it thrice every hour during peak rush.The staff is warm and all the travellers I encountered were friendly as well. Much more genial than the dour, reserved types one finds in Delhi.I was told there are two lounge areas, this review is for the domestic Plaza Premium lounge on level 2.- ANX SCORE CARD -Food: 5/5Service: 5/5Ambience: 5/5VFM: N/A - VERDICT -Definitely worthwhile stopping by. An even sweeter deal if you have complimentary lounge access.

Name: kc_dude
Title: Not at all impressive
Review: Dirty, crowded and very few food options. They need more people to clean general area or tables. International side is much nicer.

Name: Arvind Kumar Yerram
Title: Useful place
Review: Good place offering multiple cuisine options at a very good taste. Obviously unlimited quantity and good service. Multiple options for drinking and great place to rest.

Name: rd07
Title: Too crowded!
Review: Area facing the runway is best for the view and offers best chairs. Very good variety of food and beverages and very hospitable staff.

Name: Abhay Mehta
Title: Good Lounge but difficult to locate
Review: The lounge is good and providing good south Indian dishes in the breakfast. But the location is not good which makes one difficult to locate.

Name: Gurus49
Title: Helpful and adequate
Review: Good food, courteous and helpful staff.  Adequate place for wheelchair maneuvering also.  Clean bathrooms.

Name: Aditi Daga Patwari
Title: relaxing
Review: A relaxing place with good food away from the din of the airport gates. Unfortunately due to covid the wellness center was closed

Name: Santosh1959
Title: Its overcrowded and a very poor quality food
Review: The food is of a very poor quality. The spread is very limited. Do not go there if you have a better option.

Name: srk-rk
Title: Hyderabad Airport Lounge
Review: Lounge ambiance is good. Service is OK. The lounge is generally crowded. Food is average. Overall an average experience.

Name: shekher Khandelwal
Title: The Premium plaza was dirty, chaotic and useless food. The service was poor too
Review: the domestic Premium Plaza was pathetic and poor. The food served is below expectation. The sitting was dirty and one has to form the queue to fight for food

Name: Varun D
Title: Not good.
Review: a- First the Lounge is pretty small when compared to the rush on Airport.b- The dinner served is just to small for the spread expected and charges taken.No Indian Breads served.

Name: Shravan kumar
Title: Excellent
Review: Really I liked soo much how they value and respect the passenger especially Chef Jithender reddy,Nagaraju,Kishore Yadav really I have a great occupancy with all this guys and good deliver to us and they are best Chefs which I found from all lounges and I appreciate there work which they delivered to us.The taste of the food is Soo smooth and so Delicious with the taste.

Name: srikanth
Title: Student
Review: Seriously it was so good to have a great time here I just made my day here for waiting in plaza Premium lounge especially chef.N jithender  reddy Chef. NagarajuGSO  G .Kishore Yadav I just have a great occupancy With these guys in the great delivery of their food and everything has made made a great time to spend over five feel like they are the best luck do you mean that clients to be happy want to wait for the flight and departure thank you

Name: Sumit Singh Gandhi
Title: Average Experience
Review: I had high hopes for this place. The steak was under-seasoned. The menu didn't match the one on their website. I was not very pleased to find out that the coffee wasn't fair trade. This place deserves its very average rating.

Name: Sunil KHURANA
Title: Awesome
Review: Service given by the mentioned staff was so good . Thank you do much  Sivadarshini , yagchin, pretty mehata

Name: Ganga Venkat
Title: Wonderful
Review: Everything is fine.Highly hygienic premises and healthy food. Hospitality also Good. Service provided by sivadarshni.

Name: kelvin.f
Title: Saviours!
Review: Great experience! They were a saviour to me on the day when I was hungry and there was nothing on Hyderabad Airport available from 930 pm onwards.Though I had difficulty finding them at first, but then they were great.Great service quick and speedy and great staff!

Name: Yugandhar K
Title: Excellent service and good food
Review: The staff is very courteous and helpful and the place has a nice view of the runway and ther is a good buffet  with a wide selection.The toilets and showers are well maintained .Overall its a good experience and makes you forget about the wait

Name: Biren
Title: Good Lounge
Review: They took time to let me & wife in but lounge is ok and staff takes care of you.. Good food was served. Overall satisfying experience

Name: Ranadive
Title: Dinner Experience
Review: It was pleasant experience and staffs service  was awesome.staff mr.sajin server the purpose and the dinner too enjoyed well.everyone should experience the new premium lounge facility.Enjoyed it👍👍

Name: Krishnan V
Title: Good Ambience and Food
Review: Good Ambience and Food. Covid protocols maintained.  Spacious Lounge. Due to Covid menu is limited and set but tasty.

Name: Ashwin Vemuri
Title: Plaza Premium Domestic Departure Lounge
Review: Apt Location, Quiet Atmosphere Overlooking the Parking Bays & Tarmac. Excellent Distanced Seating, Well Laid Out Locations for Liquids, Buffet, Changing Rooms, Toilets and Shower Areas.

Title: Arsha : Staff at the lounge
Review: Excellent service! Incredibly helpful and one of the best experiences in a lounge.Clean lounge too.

Name: Hussaini Zafar
Title: Mr. Hussain
Review: The lounge found to be of excellent atmosphere, I enjoyed the hyderabadi style food.   However I cannot finish writing without appreciating the loyal staff members Ms Blessy MariaDhanush ArshaGreat Job , keep upI remain..

Name: Raphael amaral
Title: Good service and very nice place must visit
Review: I had been for the first time to this place and the service and food quality and hostility was amazing will definitely reccomend to go and check it out.

Name: Ravi Shankar
Title: RAVISHANKAR BOPPANORU
Review: It was a great experience at the lounge.Dhanush Dev was very cooperative and helped me on my request.Definitely a nice place to hang out even if your solo.

Name: Midhun S
Title: Feedback
Review: I was travelling from UK to cochin via hyderabad.I had a stop over at hyderabad plaza International lounge. Staff were very helpful and polite Sajin, one of the staff from services was great help to me. He was very professional and well mannered, he listened to my concerns with patience and offered solution. Thanks

Name: Samee1M
Title: Excellent service
Review: It was very pleasant...Awesome service provide by staff and Mr . Louis And balaji sukanya they're area wow in services the lounge was fantastically superbly good.

Name: Ram Chekkala
Title: An Oasis of comfort at the Airport
Review: As you step in into the Premium Plaza Lounge at the International Departures you're greeted by a smart young man who instantly makes you feel welcome. The rest of the time is close to being pampered by the smart efficient staff, who are there eager to attend to to your request....a putely personalized service and attention. Good choice of finger food, drinks and beverages and imp o stay the quiet lounge with the gentle sitting music to enjoy your solitude. A must visit when you're traveling through RGIA airport. Special acknowledgement of thanks to Antony, Nitin and the Chef Mahender Yadav. Thank you. Will visit again.

Name: hozefa k
Title: Excellent hospitality
Review: Excellent hospitality. Mr. Mahendara GSO was extremely warm and welcoming. Food was excellent. Enjoyed my time at the lounge.

Name: Rao Vellanki
Title: Excellent service and nice ambience
Review: A great place to chill out and get some food and drinks. Mr. Louis Raj took very good care of us! The staff were friendly and very helpful. The place is very comfortable and seems luxurious.

Name: Anurag
Title: Great ambience
Review: It's been a nice experience, nice hospitality, good food and nice ambience Great service by Mr. Abhishek

Name: Gaurav V
Title: Positively surprised with the hospitality and food at the international lounge
Review: I visited the NEW plaza premium lounge during my first international trip for the year (of note, I am a frequent traveler and have been a frequent visitor of the lounge in the past). I was quite surprised (positively) with the overall ambience, hospitality, and especially the food. For those who have been visitors of plaza premium in the past would know that the food quality has been decent, but you don’t come with a lot of expectations. However, this time plaza has gone extra mile to ensure the food goes hand in hand with the new setup. It’s almost (authentic) restaurant quality food on the go! Further, the associates made sure that my stay was as comfortable as it could be. Kudos to the team (Sandip, Tirumal - the chef, and Anthony) for going extra mile and ensuring delightful experience. I look forward to my next trip and coming back to the lounge, with a hope to treat my taste buds again! #keepitup
