Name: Gurutej
Title: Royal resting place
Review: This is the resting place of all the Nizams of the Qutb Shahi dynasty. The best thing here are the acoustics for a couple of the tombs.Please hire the services of a guide, else you can miss out on certain features.

Name: OctOriental
Title: Graveyard?
Review: This is described on the information boards as one of the world's few necropolises. You may want to go here if you understand that and are interested in exploring. But it's so deserted like any graveyard and you are left to wander around. There are quite a few tombs here but they are not any grand architectural structures like what you would see in Delhi. More like any typical contemporary old abandoned structures where no one goes.

Name: shekharlele
Title: Highly under-rated, but a superb place
Review: Qutub shahi tombs are located close to the Golconda fort. It houses mammoth tombs of Mughal emperors, each boasting outstanding architecture and sculpture.  You can't miss visiting this place....

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: one of Hyderabad’s most known heritage tourism spot spread across 106 acres
Review: Qutb Shahi Tombs are one of Hyderabad’s most known heritage tourism spot spread across 106 acres which is divided into three zones as Core Archeological area, a visitor facility area and a biodiversity zone. These tombs were laid as a reminder of the glory and grandeur of Golconda kings who were buried over here. Qutb Shahi Tombs are considered to be among the oldest historical monuments of Hyderabad City. It is one of the kind place in the world where entire dynasty is buried at one place.Qutb Shahi Tombs is a group of Mosques that are built in memory of Qutb Shahi Dynasty. There are around 30 tombs in this compound. The largest of all these tombs is the Mohammed Quli Qutub Shahi Tomb. These Tombs are built on a individual raised platform and have a splendid dome shaped structure. All these domes seems to be same from long distance, but the best thing is that all the domes over here are unique, with fine details and intricate shapesMost prominent of all is the tomb of Mohammed Quli Qutb Shah who is founder of Hyderabad City. However the most important and modest tomb is considered to be of Sultan Quli Qutub-ul-Mulk, who is the founder of Qutub Shahi Dynasty. Timings: Morning 09:30 to Evening 06:30 (All days except Fri day). Friday is Holiday.

Name: Mainak_Choudhuri
Title: Quite calm place to visit after the Golkonda fort
Review: Very near the Golkonda fort, the Qutub Sahi tombs contains seven major tombs and several minor tombs (total 44 tombs with a few masjids) of the Qutub Sahi dynasty, who were the rules of the Golkonda fort. It is a calm place to relax and walk among the structures. Takes about one hour to see the major tombs. No need to take a guide, read the signboards during the visit, and read the history of the Qutub Sahi rules beforehand.

Name: Fida Hussain Tangrhong
Title: Less explored, but really beautiful
Review: Qutub Shahi place is one of it's kind, where an entire dynasty has been buried. Less crowded unlike other historical monuments of Hyderabad. The place is really beautiful and spacious. Must visit on your next trip to Hyderabad

Name: mohdghouse387
Title: seven tombs
Review: Considered to be few of the oldest monuments of hyderabad ,Contain the tombs of seven qutub shahi rulers and mosques built by the various kings of the qutub shahi dynasty with beautiful park, have to pay entry fee.Reqest the visitors respect the place and don't litter around.

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Qutb Shahi Tombs
Review: These tombs are of the past rulers of Hyderabad. The place is currently being restored by organisations and soon it will be a beautiful place to visit in Hyderabad. It is very close to Golconda fort, if you are planning a visit to Golconda fort then this place can be visited too. Do take a guide to know the history of the place.

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Beautiful Tombs
Review: We had visited the beautiful Qutb Shahi Tombs complex during our recent trip to the city of Hyderabad. We had to pay 10 rupees per person to enter this place. We had also payed 50 rupees to click pictures on our mobile phones at this place. There are many big Tombs built between 1518 to 1687  where royals from the Qutab Shahi dynasty had been buried. We found that some of these Tombs were undergoing restoration.

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Heritage complex
Review: We had visited this beautiful tomb complex during our vacation in Hyderabad. Entrance tickets are priced at 10 rupees per person and another 50 rupees for mobile or camera and another 20 rupees for car. Inside the complex we walked around the giant white tombs of royals from Qutab Shahi dynasty and enjoyed clicking pictures and selfies at different locations with the beautiful tombs in the background.

Name: R0binR
Title: When the work of restoration is done this will be a must for everyone.
Review: Work in progress, but his will, one day be a must on any tour. It is impressive in its current state but one can still appreciate what it was and can be again.

Name: Talent P
Title: architectural excellence
Review: It consist of tombs of seven Qutub Shahi rulers. Considered to be few of the oldest monuments of Hyderabad, these tombs captivate the visitors with beautiful blend of Persian and Indian architectural styles. You can see the influences of Hindu, Pathan, Deccan as well as Persian styles in the structure of tombs.

Name: doug m
Title: Well worth a visit
Review: Although a lot of restoration was going on it was worth spending a hour or so visiting the ornate tombs. Had a guide for the day and this was invaluable to explain the details of their history. Worth locating the tomb which had a big section of ornate tiling surviving which shows original splendour.

Name: Praveen K
Title: Qutub Sahi Tombs
Review: The site is being restored. The beautification of the place is also under process. This place also has wondeful bawoli  (artificial water body)

Name: Oneil
Title: Kudos !!!
Review: Excellent efforts are being made to make the place a good tourist-attraction. A tourist guide is required to explain the history behind the life & death of the kings & queens & their inner circle.

Name: Curious785091
Title: Lots of history here
Review: So many stories to hear and things to see, took the 5 senses tour with Azim and he was great!  Went to so many interesting places.

Name: Lyn V
Title: Fascinating look into the past and architecture of the tombs
Review: We loved these buildings from the 16th century. They had such intricate carvings and patterns. So photogenic. Was a hot day walking around these 7 amazing tombs so take water. Def worth seeing if you enjoy architecture and history and culture. They are close to Golconda fort so we went there afterwards.

Name: Martin W
Title: Very interesting site
Review: We were really glad we went here, it was so unusual.  There are tombs of 7 successive kings, each grander than the last.  They are in different stages of renovation and one can only imagine how fantastic the site must have been in the 1600s and will be again when restoration is complete.  The tombs are set in quiet peaceful gardens

Name: David P
Title: Massive tomb complex in park setting
Review: The Qutub Shahi Heritage Park is being refurbished and has 80 tombs to wander around. Go in the afternoon until they close at 17:00 ans you may have it almost to yourself. India is trying to get them listed as UNESCO, and so they are really special. The state government has set up a small info center explaining their makeup and the efforts to preserve and protect them. You can see workers using traditional techniques and craftsmen doing restoration.

Name: Ken W
Title: Well worth a visit
Review: Really interesting to look round these tombs, which date back to the 15 and 16 hundreds.We used a guide, but negotiated a lesser price rather than the crazy amount he asked for.You need about 45 mins to an hour to look round.  A fair amount of renovation going on,  to restore and repair some earlier 20th century efforts.

Name: JeffCarter
Title: Neat
Review: I walked here from the Golconda fort. I had a great afternoon exploring the area there are many many tombs to check out and you can step inside most of them or walk underneath some of them. I did have a few locals want to be my guide and I kindly declined I would rather just walk around on my own. There was an entrance fee I think it was nominal. In January is not very crowded so I was able to wander around on my own even on a Saturday. Well worth a visit while in town.

Name: scvrose
Title: Amazing buildings
Review: We stopped by here to see all the temples. There is a lot of construction going on as they are restoring many of the monuments. The walk ways a hard to maneuver, especially for someone in a wheelchair. Still well worth a visit.

Name: Somnath
Title: Excellent place of photographers
Review: I attended a mobile photography workshop at this place and this place has a staggering number of areas to click great pics

Name: Bhaskar_Bhar
Title: Nice bits of history
Review: Take a guide otherwise you will miss the history of the tombs. Also its interesting to see the architecture of each of the tombs.

Name: Shashialabur
Title: Beautiful but a sombre place of burials
Review: The Qutub Shahi Tombs, or the Seven Tombs as they are also known, are beautiful architectural structures, though they they house the tombs of the rulers of an era gone by & their families.Initially planned for only the rulers, there were seven of them but I believe the last one decided to include tombs for the family members too and hence you see many more of them, some small, some big, but all of them architecturally excellent, with a blend of Persian and Indian architectural styles.This place was getting a face lift, with proper walkways, gardens, etc. under various stages of construction when we visited this place. This place is a stark reminder of the impermanence of the human life & body, but at the same time one is forced to ponder on the wisdom of these rulers who built tombs for themselves when they were still alive !The largest of the tombs, of Mohammad Quli Qutub Shah tomb is nearly 60 meters tall, has a huge double terraced structure with a raised courtyard.A must visit place for its. architectural beauty. If you are not too keen on knowing all the details, then you can finish this within an hour, but may need a little more time if you are inclined historically or architecturally.Quite surprisingly, out driver did not know the Qutub Shahi Tombs - probably he knew of them as the Seven Tombs, may be !Beware of Google Maps though, as it took us through the narrow by-lanes on the outer periphery of this large area, without getting us anywhere near the entrance to it !

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Tomb really surprised me
Review: These Navabs got their tombs made when they were alive. It was very surprising to know that the rulers planned their own tombs even before their death. There are a many people who don't even know how to plan a day. Poor people. But we must appreciate these Kings for their planning of their own tombs.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Medieval necropolis
Review: During the Qutb Shahi period, these tombs were held in great veneration. But after their reign, the tombs were neglected until Sir Salar Jung III ordered their restoration in the early 19th century. A garden was laid out, and a compound wall was built. Once again, the tomb-garden of the Qutb Shahi family became a place of serene beauty. All except the last of the Qutb Shahi sultans lie buried here.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: 16th century Necropolis
Review: Qutb Shahi Heritage park is one of the most significant historic medieval necropolises anywhere in the world comprising 40 mausoleums, 23 mosques, 7 step wells or baolis , a hammam, pavilions and garden structure all built during the reign of Qutb Shahi dynasty that ruled Hyderabad for 169 years in the 16th-17th centuries

Name: Sheethal S
Title: Qutb minar
Review: The Qutb Minar, also spelled as Qutab Minaror Qutub Minar, is a minret that forms part of the qutub minar, a UNESCO woorld heritage site in the mehrauli area of delhi, india.Qutb Minar is a 73-metre (239.5 feet) tall tapering tower of five storeys, with a 14.3 metres (47 feet) base diameter, reducing to 2.7 metres (9 feet) at the top of the peak. It contains a spiral staircase of 379 steps.

Name: Amashnee S
Title: Monumental
Review: Visited the Qutub Shahi Tombs during November 2019. The tombs to the royal family and their court are really beautiful. Some of the tombs were still under construction but the one that I had access to was very well maintained. A lot of history and it was wonderful to see that the family honored important members of their court with tombs as well i.e. physicians. I really enjoyed my tour and recommend visiting the Qutuab Shahi Tombs. As my guide described it ‘ these were the great men who built the city of Hyderabad as we know it’.

Name: NITASH
Title: Hidden treasure
Review: I had never heard of these marvels before i visited it last month and it was my fifth visit to the city of Nizam's, Hyderabad.The place is well maintained and new ramps and walk paths are being put up for easy accessibility for all.It had a set of 7 tombs and for some the original tiles bought from Persia are still there. In it's original time it must have looked marvellous.

Name: Jo-Ann
Title: Amazing
Review: Historical. Beautiful. Still undergoing construction to make this place better. This compound is HUGE. Do walk all the way to the end. Plenty of photo opportunities everywhere. Wish they had more explanation for every tomb.

Name: Eileen108
Title: Beautiful Mausoleums and Photo Oppertunities
Review: Just after entering inside, you are surrounded by guides offering their services. We tried one but his accent was so thick that we had to dismiss him after a few minutes, then we just walked around on our own. It is a really big area and the mausoleums have fantastic architecture and photo opportunities, even with the extensive restoration. I consider it a must-do when sightseeing in Hyderabad!

Name: TheoP0001
Title: Impressive. Simple but elegant; the restoration work already shows the benefits and slowly reveals the old splrendour
Review: Walking distance (I am kidding, while it is only 800 meters away, this is India, you can't just walk, but it is very close) from the Golconda Fort are those seven tombs that are slowly being brought back to their old glamour. And as they are restored, through the generosity of the local government and the Aga Khan Foundation, they are becoming very accessible. Right now, they are also doing a nice landscaping work. Soon, the entire area will tell its story and the splendor of the Qutb dynasty that built the city of Hyderabad and brought out its treasures.

Name: Bulbul
Title: Death is indeed the ultimate truth of life
Review: This is one of the must-see places in Hyderabad. Various kings of the Qutub Shahi dynasty built these tombs and mosques for each of themselves during their respective reigns. In fact, its the only place in the world where all the emperors are buried in one place. The architecture of the tombs is a mixture of Hindu, Pathan and Persian styles, and is breathtaking. It is said that Aurangzeb, with his army, seized the fort during the reign of the 7th king, Therefore, his tomb remains incomplete.These tombs convey, in a royal way that - 'Death is the ultimate truth of life'Highly recommended to hire a guide. I found the history here far more interesting than Golconda fort. The guide will charge around INR 200-300 for an hour.The best time to visit is in the evenings

Name: jainms
Title: Seven tombs
Review: On way to Golconda fort if you are travelling from shaikpet / tolichowki. Not maintained well and one of the historical place in hyderabad.

Name: Hus
Title: Mesmerizing
Review: Situated near to Golkonda fort are a set of ancient tombs of the Qutb Shah dynasty.Also called the 7 tombs( the auto drivers recognize this name)Its about 1.5km from the Golkonda fort and an auto rickshaw should cost you not more than 30rs even better if you can walk the distance.Bus 142k,66.65 also have a bus stop nearby if coming from charminar sideOnce you enter there are a lot of tombs with different architectural styles and designs and the Telanagana Government has done a fantastic restoration effort on the site.There were a few tombs which were inaccessible due to ongoing restoration work.It will take around 1.5 hrs to go through the entire site and read through the historyTour guides available but not required.Open: even on all days including Fridays unlike some other places in Hyderabad entry costs: 10rs for Indians and 50 for International tourists Parking charges extraTimings: 9 30 am to 5 30 pm

Name: NIL_MODI
Title: Very Near to Golkonda Fort
Review: Qutub Shahi Tombs are very near to Golconda forts. lovely architecture. very well maintained gardens also. Great historic place.

Name: Beau77
Title: An amazing place for architecture!
Review: This place is very cool and not expensive to get in for foreigners. 100rs with the photo permit. It’s a really cool complex with a bunch of tombs spread out across this kind of park area. It’s a little unkempt, but overall a great place to visit and take pictures. It’s not super busy so it’s easy to just stroll around and see some ancient tombs without people bothering you for money.

Name: Laura G
Title: city tour
Review: I enjoyed seeing the Tombs the area is very peaceful and nice to get away from the busy city.dont bother with a tour guide just shoo them away all the signs about the tombs are in english so walk around and enjoy reading by your self also take off shoes when entering any of the tombs there is some building work going on and the place will be very beautiful once its complete I would come back again.

Name: abrahamsuji
Title: Journey through history
Review: Memorable moments. A glimpse of the rich heritage and culture of our country. Must visit. Easy access from city.

Name: AunieH
Title: Lots of ancient history
Review: This place is amazingly old and still standing. The tombs are massive with lots of history to experience. Royal family members are still buried there. Plan to do a lot of walking to see the series of tombs and learn about the history. There is really no reason to pay a tour guide unless you want to. There are plenty of site markings that teach you what you need to know. The buildings do not appear like they did hundreds of years ago, but they are nonetheless impressionable. Just without all the colors and decor.

Name: jainms
Title: 7 tombs
Review: This place also called as 7 tombs, on way to Golconda from tolichowki can visit this place, maintenance is not good but one of the place to visit in hyderabad.

Name: jm661
Title: A walk through history
Review: This collection of 17 tombs is definitely worth the visit. Each tomb is a mosque and were built during the reign of the Qutb Shahi dynasty in the 16th and 17th century. The tombs are beautiful structures and were relatively quiet, allowing for beautiful photos. One warning is to beware of the pushy guide at the gate who insisted on showing me around.

Name: Manoj43_11
Title: Historical place
Review: Not many people visit here but this place is for you to visit if you are a fan of historical places. So many tombs of Islamic Kings of ancient Hyderabad at one place and the architecture of all of them is very beautiful. Not to be missed.

Name: ShelleyKulle
Title: Take a historian with you, there's lots to learn about this place.
Review: We hired a local historian/journalist to take us on a walking tour around the city and this was one of the highlights.  He's a great storyteller and it's all the more special sitting inside the tombs imaging what life must have been like hundreds of years ago for these royals.

Name: Trending T
Title: best place to have fun
Review: This place is famous for historical data and very big I  hydrant and very well built to engulf the history.

Name: Wakhoworld
Title: Happy daze at the Tombs
Review: This is a Medieval Narcropolus (graveyard) and is world heritage listed.  It's within walking distance to the Golconda Fort.  It was only IRs100 entry which is cheap compared to other attractions.  There are dozens of tombs which are undergoing a 10-year renovation, finishing in 2023.  It's a quiet pleasant place away from the noise of Hyderabad.  Well worth a visit.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: It was a peaceful day out with my cousin
Review: I really enjoyed the trip. I had been here with my cousin. There were only tombs. And these these tombs were made during Navab's ruling. They were maintained clean and peaceful away from all the disturbances. It is just 1 km far from Golkonda Fort. Enjoyed the visit completely.

Name: Vanessa H
Title: Amazing again
Review: We really didnt know what to expect but we were not dissapointed at all. An amazing site with tombs, one more beautiful than the other. Please maken sure you get here early though, it's too hot otherwise to walk the premises.

Name: Ruth M
Title: Not to be missed
Review: These 16th and 17th century royal tombs and mosques are grouped together in a partly landscaped park. A huge restoration project is currently in progress, which may put some people off. Also some of the tombs are currently in a poor state of repair. However, the tombs that have already been restored look wonderful and should not be missed.  Assuming, everything goes to plan, the Qutab Shahi Tombs look set to become a top-ranking world heritage site in just a few years' time/

Name: Mukta2016
Title: Qutab Shahi Tombs
Review: The Qutab Shahi Tombs is basically a large complex which has the tombs of the erstwhile rulers of Hyderabad. Nice place for history buffs to spend some time.

Name: abdulzameerahameds
Title: Nothing much to explore
Review: No much fun visiting place, All the tombs are being renovated. The guides will ask you very high rate. Not well maintained. Its one time visit, if you really have time.

Name: Niya1315
Title: Old Tombs
Review: There are many tombs in an area on the way to Golconda Fort. It was not crowded when I reached. This place is average and can be skipped.

Name: Srinath Bettadpur
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: Place offers a good sight of the tombs of the erstwhile rulers of the land. Beautiful architecture and maintained neatly. If you are interested in history you can visit the place.

Name: rahman s
Title: Historical Place
Review: Nice place to visit to know the history, have 7 big tombs and many smaller ones. have beautiful gardens inside it

Name: rahman s
Title: Historical Place
Review: Its a huge place with around 7 big tombs and many smaller ones inside it. Have beautiful gardens inside. Ticket price is 10, if someone wants to carry Video Camera for shoot have to pay 50/-

Name: Dr. Santosh Raut
Title: This is a hidden Gem, so calm and quiet as most people don't know of this place
Review: A great place to experience the heritage of Hyderabad. A peaceful place to visit... Gives positive energy... The Qutb Shahi Tombs, he tombs of the Islamic Kings of ancient Hyderabad and lesser royals., popularly known as the "Seven Tombs" by the Locals is a slightly neglected but nevertheless a historical site of great beauty and interest for all, especially history buffs who would like to explore how the death of each royal family member added to the monument where the sultan and his family remains buried. it's a fantastic photo opportunity during the golden hours.

Name: Dr. Santosh Raut
Title: A nice historical place within Hyderabad.
Review: A peaceful place to visit... Gives positive energy... The Qutb Shahi Tombs, he tombs of the Islamic Kings of ancient Hyderabad and lesser royals., popularly known as the "Seven Tombs" by the Locals is a slightly neglected but nevertheless a historical site of great beauty and interest for all, especially history buffs who would like to explore how the death of each royal family member added to the monument where the sultan and his family remains buried.

Name: Alan-J-P
Title: Amazing monuments
Review: I had one day to see the sights of Hyderabad after a week's work, and this was the highlight. The tombs are astounding, and because the site is so big it is very uncrowded. What pleased me most is that the site is being extensively developed, with a lot of work being done to remove modern concrete repairs and restore the monuments properly with original materials. When the park is completed in a couple of years time then it will undoubtedly be the tourist highlight of Hyderabad, but in the meantime it is well worth a visit.

Name: Usha65
Title: Tombs but worth a visit
Review: This is one of the worth seeing attraction in Hyderabad. It is almost a graveyard but consists the most wonderful and architectural constructions, good for art lovers.

Name: nik c
Title: Impressive tombs
Review: This place is also known as the 7 tombs, as although there are over 100 tombs in the area, for some reason only 7 are considered important.   They are close to Golconda Fort so are an easy visit when visiting the fort and well worth the visit.

Name: Jwvv
Title: Great to see
Review: It’s incredible they could/or would build these.  It only takes about an hour and is well worth your time.

Name: Ashish S
Title: Amazing Tomb
Review: It was very near to Golconda Fort. We liked the monument. Place was peaceful. Structure has been maintained.

Name: Dilip kumar
Title: Historical place
Review: This place will have its importance for hyderabad and will make your thinking lead to different strategical importance.

Name: Ordubadli
Title: Beware of beggars
Review: Yes, I call them beggars, even though they work there - will come and offer a "tour". If you decline, they will still follow you a while. One of them, when I was leaving, asked if I liked tombs. I said yes. He said: Can I then get a tip?" I replied: Why, did you build these? He did not like the answer. There are also some construction works taking place. Therefore, not all tombs are open to visit.

Name: Seemagoves
Title: Not very impressed.
Review: The architecture is there but there are no carvings. We entered one tomb but did not feel positive energies . We understood the significance of it once we visited Golconda Fort

Name: SandeepSaxena-IIP
Title: Qutb Shahi tombs
Review: Qutub Shahi Tombs, the tombs of 7 Qutub Shahi rulers, is situated about 850 meters away from the Banjara Darwaza of Golconda Fort. These tombs are considered among the oldest monuments in Hyderabad.The Qutub Shahi Tombs exhibit a unique blend of Persian and Indian architectural styles. Today, Qutub Shahi Tombs are the venue of the Deccan Festival conducted by the State Government.They lie in the north of the outer perimeter wall of Golkonda Fort and its BanjarI Darwaza (Gate of the Gipsies, or itinerant merchants), amidst the Ibrahim Bagh

Name: Arisma(Explorer)
Title: A must visit
Review: The best place to feel the history of Hyderabad. I was amazed by the ancient architecture. Also an advice please take a guide that will be available after the main entrance because just roaming around won't help as the guides over there are helpful and knowledgeable about the history.

Name: Sunder R
Title: Qutab visit
Review: One of the must do visits if you're in Delhi. Second visit of mine. The first being when I was a kid... they were showing visitors to wrap around the iron pillar then. Else a perfect way to lose around on a Sunday... have lunch at one of the many joints in mehrauli...

Name: KlausL13
Title: Impressive location
Review: To know a bit the background is important to connect the tombs to the history. Therefore it's worth to get some local tour guide. Very impressive!

Name: Suhail Siddqui
Title: Historical Place
Review: 15 mins distance from Golconda fort. Nice , silent and historical place.Do visit if you have extra time to know the history.

Name: Dinesh_cbe
Title: Good Place with History
Review: This site is located near to Golconda Fort. The architecture of these tombs are marvellous. Average maintenance and very few visitors here.

Name: rsraghavan6
Title: Good place
Review: Amazing transformation from a few years back to now. Unbelievable work done by AKTC team. Their efforts are bound to yield better results soon.Qutub Shahi tombs will definitely be a serious contender for Heritage tag soon. Must visit site Only place in the world wherein tombs of the whole dynasty ( 7 ) are present at one site

Name: Devaa
Title: A tomb to see if you have extra time!!!
Review: A place close to the city ,nice to laze around and wonder if you wish about those Nizams who has constructed this place and now in shamble. Nice place for lovers to play behind this tombs thats what i found happening there. If you have time come and see or give it a pass.

Name: chjprakash
Title: immense history
Review: the tombs are well preserved and mainted. all the history of the qutb dynasty is known to us because of the famous and known tombs.

Name: Travel144090
Title: Nice historical site
Review: One of the must sees in Hyderabad. Quiet and peaceful site little bit aside of city noise. Nice place to enjoy some walking around and relaxing while enjoying interesting sightseeing

Name: SRC4297
Title: Tombs of great rulers
Review: Tombs of great rulers. Superb spot for a family day out. one of the must see sights in Hyderabad. If you have an afternoon to spend in Hyderabad definitely visit this place. There is a park inside which is well maintained. The tombs provide a perfect glimpse of Persian architecture.

Name: 73prashantha
Title: Maitenance is poor.
Review: The site is in a dilapated situation and this needs immediate attention for maitenance. A very old heritage site and considered holy.

Name: Daniel T
Title: Historical place.. worth a visit
Review: Historical place of 400 years of great history. Must visit by every Hyderabadi. Place is nicely connected via public transport.Given the cheap entry tickets, you'll find many unruly youngsters in this place & the near-by Golconda. So be aware of such unruly youngsters who can pass unnecessary comments.On a hot day, carry an umbrella as there is walking involved.

Name: neha_traveldiary
Title: Tombs of 7 generations in one spot
Review: The tombs are a marvel with the sounds echoing melodiously inside the tombs as performed by our able tourist guide. It claims to be the only monument in the world to be the resting place of 7 generations of nobility. The decline of wealth is visible with the unfinished state of the 7th king's tomb.

Name: Mamdouh S
Title: Amazing, would call it the Best attraction in India
Review: Amazing setting, impressive tombs, very serene atmosphere, could easily compete with the Taj Mahal, specially that it lacks the crowds. I can't wait to return back

Name: Khyati
Title: Variety of tombs
Review: They have lots of mosques and tombs built by Kong's of qutub Shahi dynasty.. this is related to history ..

Name: ramakrishnabanoth3
Title: Tombs of ancient people
Review: A static cool place where you can see the tombs of the great legends of ancient age.Can spend a little time to know the history of them.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: Cultural heritage
Review: This is a place that has cultural heritage and we can visit the place just for the same reasons.we can know about the history visiting here

Name: Shabd
Title: History in a snapshot
Review: The Qutub Shahi Tombs are being restored but yet has history screaming from every brick. The way the dome's were built to the religious practices of building ones tomb before death are some of the nuances which amazed me. Ask your guide about the "Bara Dari" and its significance.

Name: RaF
Title: Worth your time and money.
Review: Spend 30 minutes to an hour in this place. Authorities please take care to maintain and keep the structures and grounds  clean.

Name: KidambiSeshadri
Title: Good architecture
Review: Visit for good architecture. It's worth the visit.   7 tombs majestically built.  You can recollect that many movies were shot here.

Name: Amit Rao
Title: Well maintained and a very peaceful place.........
Review: This is a very well maintained ASi site. The restoration of this place, has started in the last few years. ASI, AGHA KHAN TRUST & TATA Trust are doing a very good work in restoring the world heritage. The entry fees is only Rs. 20 / person. Cameras/ Mobile are an additional each ( I do not mind paying of each Mobile we carry- The place is worth capturing). Car parking is also available inside, but it cannot accommodate many cars- Take your luck . The whole place is well maintained. No littering anywhere. Restoration work can be seen. But still lot of places people have scribbled there names on the wall. We should have strict rules to stop such misbehaving people . The lawns are well laid A very peaceful place, at any time of the day. Since I went there during the rainy season, I could continuously hear the beautiful scream of the Peacocks and sweet sound of other birds. You will feel very relaxed and peaceful coming to this place.

Name: nisha17082015
Title: Nothing much to see
Review: There are tombs of 6 kings and 1 queen. Little scary too. Nothing much to see; can be skipped. The area covered is big.

Name: HN_AZ
Title: Very Interesting history
Review: These tombs are undergoing a 10 year renovation and the work shows nicely.  There is a lot to learn about the Dynasty that built them.  It's helpful to have a guide take you around.  The grounds are quite expansive to be prepared for quite a bit of walking.

Name: Ramesh K
Title: Do not expect too much
Review: Photo gallery was the highlight. Not maintained. No guide was available, hence we missed the history part.

Name: Venture814355
Title: Nice but not more than this
Review: The tombs are OK, however all the place is neglected and untreated. It need a full maintenance and restoration, otherwise it looses a lot of the impact of the place.

Name: deepa v
Title: Historical place
Review: The place has historical importance.Located near Golkonda fort..The maintenance of the structure isnt good.can visit once on way to Golkonda fort.

Name: Karthik R
Title: Tombs of Qutub Shahi Dynasty members
Review: The Qutub Shahi tombs are located around 3-4 kms from Golconda fort. The tombs of the Qutb Shahi kings lie together in one place. They are one of the oldest monuments of Hyderabad. The tombs were planned and built by the Qutb Shahis themselves, they form a large group and stand on a raised platforms, one after other in a vast spread place. This resembled like Orchha Cenatophs. The tombs are built in Persian, Pathan and Hindu architectural styles using grey granite and ornamentation, rare of its kind in the world, and vary in sizes - small to massive. The whole dynasty of Qutub Shahi has been buried at one place. The biggest tomb is the mausoleum of Hayat Bakshi Begum. The entrance per person is Rs.10 for adult, Rs.5 for child and Rs.50 for camera.

Name: muthukrish2000
Title: Tomb
Review: This is just with in a kilometer from the Golkonda fort. It contains the tombs of the Mughal rulers of Hyderabad. Just a spot but nothing remerakable. Can visit if you have really time otherwise optional.

Name: niya27
Title: Tombs of Hyderabad rulers
Review: Qutub Shahi tomb is on the way to Golconda fort. Some of the tombs are complete while some are incomplete. You can hire a guide there, but bargaining is required.

Name: SSSUUUNNNNNNYYY
Title: Poor
Review: Visited with family. Parking available. Lot of garden and space for picnic, but structures poorly maintained . Not recommended.

Name: Alex F
Title: Beautiful - Can't Wait for restoration to finish
Review: Wow, the tombs that have already been restored are absolutely stunning. Huge structures, with the backdrop of the Golconda fort, makes this a stunning and pleasant place to walk around. The signs are very informative, which helps make it a satisfying experience.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: Nice
Review: Its a good place to go.Clean and well maintained.Worth taking a guide to get a feel of the palce.Tombs of the rulers of golconda are over here

Name: Sudipta Shaheen
Title: Nice Park
Review: It is the entry poin of Hussain Sagar lake. Very well maintained. You can njoy with your family with young kids.

Name: Amit Bansal
Title: Go there only if you want to go for boating, else ...
Review: Go there only if you want to go for boating, else there is nothing exciting about it. I wasted my time going there. Could have gone else where.

Name: Xavier D
Title: Lumbini
Review: Iconic park in hyderabad , but too much crowded in festive season. Did the boat ride and attended the laser show.

Name: Sagar K
Title: Poor Quality of Service
Review: The ticketing system at the park is a chaos and no proper information at the park. When we reached we paid just entry free at the park after standing in long queue for 30 mins. Then another long queue for Laser Show again 30 mins. And another long queue for Boat to Buddha Statue....Ufff.The management should issue all the tickets at the main counter as per visitors choice and preferences. This will save a lot of time .No organised Cloak Room to keeps bags. Please avoid keeping valuables in the bags. Bags are not allowed in the Laser Show and Boat to Buddha Statue.

Name: Xenos
Title: Over crowded and Over rated
Review: This is an unclean park witch is over crowded. No COVID safety measures practised. A lot of looting happening as per guards. Was advised to take extra care of belongings. Not a must to see

Name: AjithBhaskaran
Title: Over-rated, not a 'must visit'
Review: Crowded, the boat ride certainly doesn’t feel safe. The lake itself is not clean and we get a foul smell from the waters. Overall, not a ‘must do’ visit.

Name: Nancy Peters
Title: Decent evening outing
Review: Its a green space in middle of city and ok to spend a couple of hours. The statue of Buddha is quite impressive

Name: Gurus49
Title: Family place
Review: A small park with activities including a boat ride to the Buddha Statue in the middle of the second largest man made lake in the world.

Name: Milind Kshirsagar
Title: Quality time with family.
Review: Nice place to relax as well as to have fun. Don't miss speed boat ride. Also take mechanised boat ride if you wish to visit Buddha statue.

Name: Shankar I
Title: Average park
Review: Located along the Hussain Sagar lake, this is a small park. People throng here mainly for leisure and boating along the lake.

Name: Mike Pence
Title: Beautiful water front
Review: A pleasant waterfront in the heart of the city. There is a beautiful Buddha statue. Boating in the lake is a good way to appreciate the ambience

Name: Charles Dulles
Title: Pleasant for an evening
Review: The park is a pleasant destination for evenings. There is a beautiful and large statue of the Buddha. The water front is quite picturesque. A good spot for picnics.

Name: Kaushik G
Title: A prime attraction
Review: Lumbini Park is located on the banks of the beautiful Hussain Sagar Lake and we had visited this popular tourist attraction during our sightseeing in Hyderabad. We had gone on a Saturday evening and the place was very crowded. Tickets are priced at 20 rupees per person but another 100 rupees if you have camera or else store it in the cloakroom. There are limited rides inside the park, food stalls but main usp is the boating on Hussain Sagar Lake and the beautiful laser show in the evening.

Name: NAZEER SHAIK
Title: Nice to visit
Review: it is a good place to spend your weekend with your family and friends. once it has a remark. but now t is so nice to visit

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Mechanized boat to Buddha Statue
Review: This is the place from where you can take boat to the Buddha Statue. There are different types of boats that can be hired but it is only the mechanized boats that stop and allow you to alight near the Buddha statue. The tickets @ Rs.50/head cost the least among all categories of boats. The camera charges are very high-Rs.1000 but you can shoot with your mobile. In the evenings at 7.30 pm there is a laser show. There is a small children park as well. Near one of the exits is a small food court as well. Parking is available on other side of the road near the Secretariat.

Name: Pravin P
Title: Budha statue and laser fountain/sound show are the Highlight.
Review: 1.The must watch place of the hyderabad  city.2.A five minute boat trip is required to see the Budha statue.it is a Nice experience. Duration  to visit approx 50 min. 3.Lazer and sound show is one of the best shows.Duration of the show is half an hour. 4.Parking Area very  far from the Park.5.Snacks, eatables are available inside the park.

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Lumbini Park
Review: Lumbini Park has good area to roam around and the greenery surely uplifts the mood. For food there are multiple street food options around this area.

Name: Somnath
Title: Decent park but not well maintained
Review: Good park with a lake and multiple rides for kids. The place is buzzing during the evening and a nice place for kids to visit.

Name: Eshita Shah
Title: A must visit place in Hyderabad
Review: Lumbini park is beautiful and it has laser water shows in the evening. It also has boating facility. It is very well maintained and looks clean.

Name: Stay282088
Title: Good Timepass
Review: The park is well maintained. It looked neat & clean.Facilities available inside the park - Ex., boating, laser show etc., are charged extra excluding park entrance fee.Laser show and musical fountain are highlight here. It was of a great standard.

Name: Tarun
Title: A dayout for fun
Review: Visited this place in the evening hours. Found this place very interesting. The laser show in the evening was awesome. The park has little space but maintained pretty. It is in the heart of the city. Very near to Secunderabad Station and can be reached easily by bus too. My children enjoyed.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: Good
Review: This park has a laser show in the evening.It has boating facility through which we can go to Buddha and spend some time there

Name: Himjal
Title: Nice place along the Lake
Review: The Laser show is wonderful. The most fascinating feature is the boat ride to the Buddha statue located in center of the lake - Hussian Sagar Lake. The ride cost is less than $1.

Name: Lokesh1981
Title: must visit landmark of Hyderabad
Review: If you are visiting Hyderabad, perhaps first time or may be u stay in Hyderabad, u still can get rejuvenate and pass your time at this place with family & friends , Located at one corner of Hussain sagar lake, opposite to secretariat & NTR park, Laser and light show is the top attraction and u get regular ferries to Buddha statue,

Name: Abhishek807
Title: Only Boat Ride with Dirty Lake
Review: They have only Boat Rides with Smelly, dirty Lake. THe boat ride is only Till Buddha Statue. LASER SHOW IS good

Name: Vishnu R
Title: Not well maintained
Review: The park would have been great for kids, if it was well maintained. Since they charge for entry, it could have been maintained.The slides are all rusted, the cars are also down. Only thing they have is a few swings.Boating is the main business over there.We didn't take it, since we have plenty and much better ones in Kerala.They will take you to the Budha statue in the Hussain Sagar lake and back.

Name: Sunil
Title: Family time
Review: The place is really good and the best part is the lighting and the night laser show this two thing attracts people

Name: Arun Karthik
Title: Good Place to Hangout
Review: An attraction every tourist would love, irrespective of their preference in religious, cultural or historical places in Hyderabad, is undoubtedly the Lumbini Park, located along the shore of Hyderabad's famous Hussain Sagar Lake. Established in 1994 under Buddha Poornima project by the Hyderabad Urban Development Authority, it gets in name from the birthplace of Lord Buddha. The park showcases some really wonderful variety of seasonal flowering plants and numerous cactiAn attraction every tourist would love, irrespective of their preference in religious, cultural or historical places in Hyderabad, is undoubtedly the Lumbini Park, located along the shore of Hyderabad's famous Hussain Sagar Lake. Established in 1994 under Buddha Poornima project by the Hyderabad Urban Development Authority, it gets in name from the birthplace of Lord Buddha. The park showcases some really wonderful variety of seasonal flowering plants and numerous cacti.It works as an ideal place for people looking out to let their head down after a hard day’s work. Relaxation and amusement happen to be one of the key reasons behind a large number of people who throng the garden, especially in the evening. The 3-D laser show and musical fountain show that are conducted in the evening mesmerize one and all. An interesting feature at Lumbini Park of Hyderabad is the huge clock decorated with colorful flowers located at the entry point.Nearby attractions include Birla Mandir and Hussain Sagar Lake. A royal statue of standing Lord Buddha made of granite is installed in the middle of the lake and can well be called a true epitome of beauty. This lake has been widely acclaimed for being the largest artificial lake in Asia and draws a number of people for its beauty and boating activities.

Name: Sanjit M
Title: Good Light & sound show
Review: You can enjoy very good light & sound show in this park in the evening. They will show you different colors & themes of laser lights over fountains with music.

Name: mfpb315
Title: Laser show
Review: Great disappointment. The description says that the show talks about history of Hyderabad but it was not so.can be avoided.

Name: sree143in
Title: Best
Review: Lumbini park is a best place in hyderabad to spend time with kids, good atmosphere with a lot of trees.

Name: AB321
Title: Decent place
Review: Lumbini park is a good place to hangout with friends and family going out with kids as it has many services such as boat ride, ride to buddha statue, laser shows, entertainment and fountain shows etc. Maintenance can be improved.

Name: meetdhawan
Title: what a fun day_!!!!
Review: we were so amazed to come across this happening place where you can enjoy with ur family and friends to the fullest. just like its name,its a complete mastizone.. we really enjoyed our friendship day there, from snowpark to bowling , archery, cricket, arcade games,all under one roof....It was a complete fundayyy...Must visit place..gonna visit again..

Name: gpradeepshenoy
Title: Just a small park
Review: Took a Bus from Nampally to Lumbini Park(Nearest bus stop to Lumbini park is Secretariat ). A Walk from Secretariat bus stop to Lumbini park is of about 3 Minutes.               Entrance costs Rs 20 to this park. From this park boats goes to Buddha statue. The ferry rates are Rs 55(up and down charges). It is better to visit this park and budha statue in the late evening/ night . One can spend time at the buddha statue as per their liking and then return to Lumbini park. After sunset the budhha statue becomes lighted because of many lights directed on the statue and is good to watch.             Apart from boats which take tourists to Buddha statue there are speed boats also. These speed boats do not stop at the Buddha statue . Apart from this there is some evening/night cruise in a boat. This boat also does not stop in Buddha statue but the boat plays music for tourists to dance and have a good time.            There are few Kiosks inside Lumbini park selling snacks and beverages. We went for Laser show in the Lumbini park which costs Rs 60.00 The show was very average and the show starts at 7:15 Pm. If you are in a hurry then this laser show can be missed.                Average place to visit while at Hyderabad.

Name: Ambar Roy
Title: Reunion
Review: Good place to hang out during the evening time.Activities not to be missed.#Boat ride to Budhha statue.#Fountain show

Name: Pranav_F
Title: Good for kids and family outing
Review: This park is next to Hussain sagar lake, you can have some food on neckless road in food court and then in the evening you can reach the park by boat from few boarding points. Enjoy the park and then laser light show which was really worth to watch. on holidays and weekends its little crowded for laser show so reaching early would be good. There is lockers available for bags and other belongings which are not allowed in side.

Name: jainms
Title: Entry to Buddha statue
Review: Lumbini park is the entrance to boating and buddha statue, Also laser show available in the park only on evening times.

Name: ShvRm_Traveller
Title: Overrated and commercialized
Review: The purpose visiting the park is to spend some peaceful time, which is defeated because of the amount of effort that is being taken to just enter the park. First, there was a long queue and heavy jostling to obtain the entry tickets. The ticket counter was absolutely unorganized. Then there was a very long queue to enter the park. Bags, even the backpack, were not allowed inside. There was a counter to deposit the bags, where again there was a heavy rush.Cameras are allowed inside the park on payment, however, the amount quoted for allowing a simple Digital camera was INR 1000/-. So we had to go and deposit the camera at the luggage counter.After all this when we entered the park, we found that, there was nothing extraordinary about the place, apart from being located on the bank of Hussain Sagar lake. Moreover, the place was heavily crowded.The boat service to the Buddha Statue starts from the park, on payment of additional charges for the boat.Overall, the park is a over hyped place, which is mostly frequented by the tourist, as it is sold to them as a tourist attraction. To be visited, only if there is nothing else better to do.

Name: Kishore W
Title: Lumbini park
Review: The boating option is good..and the buddha statue is worth visiting...but ppl here dobt know cleanliness art all..children taking bath in public fountain..some even peeing..and littering...wish they all should be fined..the pmace is so well built but ppl dobt realise the importance of cleanliness and wish the ticket counter was managed properly...

Name: Dr RAJKUMAR YADAV
Title: Negligence at its height
Review: Not proper maintained nothing in the name of light show just collection of money no amenities even if rest room also absent

Name: NIL_MODI
Title: Small But Nicely Maintained
Review: Lumbini Park is at very near to Hussain Sagar lake. Park is small but maintained. Crowded in evening. Light & Sound show is main attraction of it. Both entries to park and show are to be paid separately. The show is good and have value for money.

Name: Debasis
Title: Decent
Review: Very nice park with few free rides and paid rides. Always full crowd. Centrally located. Light and sound show was actually average but value for money.

Name: krajeevc
Title: Nice park with activities
Review: Next to Hussain Sagar lake, it's usually crowded. You have boating facility at various price points. The evening 3D laser show and musical fountain is worth watching.Will be good to have some mosquitoe repellents applied on you during the show. The speed boat ride we took up to the Buddh statue and back is worth it.

Name: Vin Dosa
Title: Decent park
Review: In the heart of the city, is where this is located. It is a decent place and can be made better. One of the attractions of Hyderabad can be made better if more attractions/shows can be made available. The boat ride is the best for now. Cleaniness is also something that needs to be really looked into

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: nice and good
Review: Good and quite famous and a awesome place to hangout with greenery all around.Good to visit in the morning and evening

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: You must expeeience the evening at Lumbini Park
Review: Lumbini Park is one of the oldest and the best places in tank bund and necklace road area. It's a very small park with water pool dance show. It's been conducted every evening or not I'm not sure but plz post a question to verify before you visit somebody would like to definitely reply. The entry  ticket was not so costly. It's affordable common middle class people too. There is a boat ride also you must try here. You will not regret.

Name: Abhilash K
Title: Very famous
Review: This is one of the famous park in the Hyderabad maintained by GHMC. I loved the place and I want to visit here again.

Name: Nlay
Title: Well maintained park on banks of Hussain Sagar Lake.
Review: Located on the banks of Hussain Sagar Lake, the Lumbini park is well maintained and clean park. This place is good for relaxing with Family and friends. The food served in the canteen area is also good, and one must definitely try the local made Pizza which is mind blowing.  There are various rides for kids as well.Ticket charges are Rs. 20 for Adult, Rs. 10 for Children (between 5-10 years). Camera is chargeable amounting to Rs. 100, the cloak charges are Rs. 20.

Name: Dr I R Patil
Title: Nice
Review: Nice place to hangout with friends and children especially in the evening time it has option of rides for children and evening laser show

Name: pvrkaushik
Title: Evening getaway
Review: You can have a pleasant evening here... Go with kids and family... All will enjoy.. Take boat ride to Buddha statue

Name: ravishtandon
Title: A beautiful place to visit at Hyderabad
Review: It is situated on the bank of Hussain Sagar. You can get ride for Budha Statue. Can have speed boating and enjoy the swings at Park. A must visit place during your stay at hyderabad.

Name: mohan
Title: Average
Review: Very very crowded, they dont allow bags inside so make sure you leave it in the hotel room or you may have to spend time to keep it in the locker. There is some kids play area but its not clean and dirty. Better to avoid , see it if there is nothing else to do.Laser show is not worth it , its more of a musical fountain . Bangalore /Mysore has 100% better ones

Name: TravellingReddy
Title: Not close to what it used to be earlier
Review: Post the blasts that occurred in this park, the layout is changed and the old charm is lost. Its now more used as a base for boating in hussain sagar lake and reaching Buddha statue..

Name: Aryan2007
Title: Decent place to have some good family time !!!
Review: Lumbini Park in Hyderabad near the Hussain Sagar lake is a small but decent park to have some family fun. They have laser and fountain show daily in the evenings starting 7 pm. One can also do boating in the lake or just relax on the green lawns. There are various options to eat inside and the play area for kids is also available. However, the place gets quite crowded with tourists from all parts of the country and at times gets very noisy.

Name: MhdMuqthar
Title: Green! Boating! Music fountain!!
Review: Lumbini park near Hussain sagar lake has a superb water fountain which would give you perfect visual treat. The boating to the budha statue starts from here.

Name: Chetu1087
Title: Park near the Lake
Review: One of the attraction of Hyderabad tour to visit. I visited this place with my friends and it seems to be kind of overcrowded. Overall good place to visit when you are in Hyderabad.

Name: karthikakavya
Title: Good place
Review: one with family or friends can enjoy  this place can have lots of rides food and water rides all the things

Name: thiru_sri3
Title: A nice place to relax
Review: It is one of the best places to be in Hyderabad. A nice calm place though it is crowded most of the times.

Name: YatriForever
Title: Touristy park.
Review: Located on the banks of Hussain Sagar lake, this is a very small park. There's adequate green cover, but there's more on activities. The kids would love this place with so many play and fun activities for them.Just a park, can be skipped if you are new to Hyderabad on a quick sightseeing trip.

Name: LAL KISHORE K
Title: LUMBINI PARK in Hyderabad-One of the places to visit for relaxation
Review: Lumbini park deriving its name from Budhist sacred place Lumbini, is one of the attractions of the twin cities of Hyderabad and Secunderabad.It is located near tank bund, linking Hyderabad and Secunderabad cities, opposite Govt. Secretariat.Big garden clock is an attraction in the park.There is also music fountain in the park.There is entry fee and some eateries inside.Its a good place to relax and while away the time.There is entry fee.Kids are exempted .

Name: yemKeyAre
Title: Scope for better quality
Review: Nice choices for a simple family outing. Quality and maintenance can be improved a lot. It is in a poor state of maintenance

Name: nik c
Title: A nice park to visit
Review: Lumbini Park on the Banks of Hussain Sagar Lake in Hyderabad is quite a nice little park.  There are a few attractions there for the kids as well as ice cream parlours and a boat terminal where you can catch a ferry to the Buddha Statue.

Name: Thakuri.Nita
Title: Fake
Review: It was embracing hearing wrong information about Buddhism. Though the place is built  good informations were false.

Name: kranthiRamana
Title: CENTER POINT OF TWIN CITIES
Review: Lumbini park and Hussain Sagar is one of the most popular tourist places in Hyderabad. The lake connects two parts of the city (Secunderabad and Hyderabad) to each other. The largest artificial lake in Asia, the Lumbini park came up later on the banks of the hussain sagar which contains abundant greeny, speed boats, double decker boats for parties and entertainment on the double decker boat.previously their used to have lazer lights show.

Name: panii2015
Title: One of Hyd Icon
Review: Its nothing but a boarding point for the boats where you can go for a ride near Buddha statue.  Not much to see here.  Lost the earlier  charm. except few train raids for children.

Name: Dilip kumar
Title: Must visit
Review: Best to visit with friends and also has got its own importance. Must visit place in Hyderabad and time spending.

Name: Mahesh A
Title: Nice laser show
Review: This park is located just next to the famous Hussain Sagar lake. From the park entrance, we can go to both the boating and laser/musical fountain shows.The park is well maintained. It looked neat even though it was too crowded when we went. The entrance fee for getting into the park is very nominal. But we need to pay extra for other facilities available inside the park - Ex., boating, laser show etc.,We went for the laser show first. It was a mix of laser show and musical fountain. A laser show followed by a musical fountain and it was repeated thrice. For the first timers, this would be a fabulous experience. It was of a great standard. The queue for the boating was huge, so couldn't take a trip to Buddha statue.Tips:1. It is not allowed to carry any bags inside the park (other than ladies handbag). They have a baggage counter, so unless you have any costly material, it shouldn't be a problem2. It was extremely crowded even on a Thursday (a non-holiday also). So you need to plan well if you want to cover both boating and laser/musical fountain show3. From there, if you take an auto to your place of stay, some drivers may recommend "a good place to buy sarees etc.," DON'T go for that option. Your such buying cost may also include their commission.

Name: MVS
Title: The amazing Park
Review: Lumbini Park is famous for its  musical fountains. The gaint clock at the entrance of the Park which has been designed using various kinds of colourful flowering plants. The musical fountain and water cascades attract everyone. The sight of water shooting upto the sky. The best part of lasershow is that just 3D. From the Park one can also go for boating at the hussiansagar lake and to the buddha statue in the middle of the lake.

Name: Mohit Agrawal
Title: Lake side park
Review: The park is located near lake where Buddha statue is situated. Park is good for children and you can take boat to statue from here.Parking is a big problem here

Name: RitaKakkar
Title: Kids park
Review: Lots of kids activities. Very crowded. Merry go rounds and such stuff. Some shops selling fast food, ice creams. Again no souvenirs.

Name: MUKKU S M R S
Title: Park
Review: This park is located near the Hussain Sagar lake. The Main attractions of the Lumbini Park are Musical fountain and the laser show.

Name: manikantaa
Title: Good
Review: Very good enivroment in this and enjoy frds and colleagues nice place to stay in gardens thanks to all

Name: Prerna0418
Title: Good Place with Boating
Review: In low budget, this is a place to visit in Hyderabad.. Its a one time visit. They have boating facility as well.. Clock room is also available for luggage till 9:30 PM. The boat ride is for Hussain Sagar, you can see buddha statue from there. Many stalls for food nearby to this park. Best time to visit is between 4:00PM to 6:00PM.

Name: Dr. Santosh Raut
Title: Good place
Review: One of the best and favourite place all the time, full enjoy in low budget. Great enjoyment at evening time

Name: dipali
Title: Good park with smelly lake
Review: This park is surrounded by a number of gardens like NTR gardens and other gardens. The first is mainly a children’s park.It actually is an interesting monument to see in the center of the lake. The Buddha statue is towering in size and made from a single piece of stone so it is impressive. We took a speed boat to go around the statue and get a close look.The boats leave from a small park that has play cars that run on a track so fun for the children.  It is a good place for children to spend time.   I was happy that we had taken a speed boat and not a slow one for the lake was stinking. Yes, the lake is crying for maintenance.

Name: panzzz
Title: Pleasant Evening
Review: An extremely well spent evening at the Lumbini Park. Enjoyed the park, the ferry ride in the Hussain Sagar Lake right to the middle of the lake where the huge Buddha statue stands tall is super fun. Individual boat rides are also possible. Best part of the visit was the musical fountain and the 3D laser light show. Its an intriguing experience in itself with the water showing the various stages of Hyd itself. One can buy the tickets to the show, timing is usually around 7-7.15 PM for the laser lights. The musical fountain starts a little early. If well planned, easily a pleasant evening to spend.

Name: Dinesh_cbe
Title: Relaxing
Review: This park is located along the banks of Hussain Sagar lake. Lot of activities around this park - especially for kids. Good place for relaxing with friends & family.

Name: Anu789
Title: Good for an evening outing
Review: Adjacent to the Husain Sagar lake the park is well maintained - has playing area for kids, eateries and also laser shows.

Name: Cyril
Title: Good place for passing evening.
Review: Visited here at 6 pm in evening had a Boat ride to the Buddha Statue at night which is all lit-up . It looks beautiful. Also watched the Laser & fountain show. It was okayish because I had watched better shows at other places. But good for a price of Rs.50/-. Overall the garden is good good for passing the evening.

Name: SandeepSaxena-IIP
Title: Lumbini Park - Laser Show and Musical fountain show : The best part of laser show is that just 3D.
Review: One of the main attractions of the Lumbini Park is the giant clock at the entrance of the park which has been designed using various kinds of colourful flowering plants. Along with seasonal flowering plants, wide variety of cacti and rocks, the park also has many options to keep kids entertained. The Musical fountain and water cascades attract everyone. The sight of water shooting up to the sky, making a screen of water where the history of Hyderabad is being shown is something not many of us have seen before. It is an experience in itself. The best part of laser show is that just 3D. You will see a city created in 3D right at a park.Musical fountain and the laser show at the Lumbini Park is something not to be missed. The timing of the musical fountain is from 6.30 P.M. and 8 P.M. As for Lumbini park laser show timings, it happens twice, at 7.15 pm and 8.30 pm.From the park, one can also go for boating at the Hussain Sagar Lake and to the Buddha Statue in the middle of the lake. For boating there are two choices available for the visitors. If interested you can hire a speed boat at Lumbini park and enjoy an exciting ride in the lake. You will be offered life-jackets so safety is not a worry here. Other option is the ferry ride, which takes tourists to the massive statue of Lord Buddha in the middle of the Hussain Sagar Lake.Lumbini Park Entry Fee 20  Rs per person for Adult10  Rs per person for Child 350 Rs per person for Speed Boating (Adults / Children) 55 Rs per person for Mechanised Boating for Adults 35 Rs per person for Mechanised Boating for Children110 Rs per person for Bhagamati Boating for Adults80 Rs per person for Bhagamati Boating for Children100 Rs  per person for Rajahamsa (A Family Boat/Min 5 persons) (No Alighting At Budha Statue)Lumbini Park TimingsDay	TimingMonday	9:00 am – 9:00 pmTuesday	9:00 am – 9:00 pmWednesday	9:00 am – 9:00 pmThursday	9:00 am – 9:00 pmFriday	9:00 am – 9:00 pmSaturday	9:00 am – 9:00 pmSunday	9:00 am – 9:00 pmThe laser show timings at Lumbini park is 7.15 pm on weekdays, while on Saturday and Sundays, two laser shows are held at 7.15 pm and 8.30 pm respectively. Laser show tickets are priced at Rs. 50 per person, while the entry fee for park is only Rs. 10 per person. If interested in musical fountain show, you can watch it at 6.30 PM to 8 PM

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Boat Ride
Review: This is a nice garden alongside of Hussain Sagar lake in Hyderabad. Its a famous tourist attraction and also popular among the locals. You have to buy a ticket for entry. There is a laser show in the evening. Nice garden and play area for kids. You can take a boat ride from her to visit Buddha statue and also to take a round in the lake.

Name: Sagar D
Title: Awesome place to spend evening
Review: Lumbini park is on the bank of Hussain Sagar lake..Ideal time to visit is during Evening.Around 20 rs entry fee. Some rides for children to enjoy..They have various boat trips like speed boat (for Max 4 person) & big ferry boat which will take u to/from Buddha Statue with 10-15 mnt hlat time. Main attraction is Laser & Fountain Show which starts at 7:30 pm. There is special ticket for it but it is worth  to pay. U can easily spend 2-3 hrs here.

Name: beyondtravel
Title: Well maintained
Review: A tourism place that is well maintained , mainly a kids weekend outing area with small eatery, laser show, play out area etc....

Name: prosenjit72
Title: Nice place for relaxation
Review: We visited this park situated in the banks of Hussain sagar lake, My son enjoyed the rides. There is provision for boating and nail arts among others.

Name: vmaravind
Title: A good place to spend your evening
Review: A good place to spend your evening. A few rides are available. A couple of them were broken. Its from here that you can hire boats for cruise or a bigger boat that will take you to the Buddha statue.Please avoid the laser show. Its not very interesting. Many a times, the laser gets shot on to you. Thats so irritating.

Name: cagauravj2018
Title: Good family place
Review: Lumbini park is in the heart of the Hyderabad city. Entry fee is Rs. 20. Here you can enjoy boat ride to Lord Buddha statue which is situated at the middle of the Hussain Sagar lake. Other activities also there to do. Here you can enjoy the light and music show at a charge of RS. 50 on every evening..

Name: Suhail Siddqui
Title: Family Park
Review: Good Family place right at the center of the city. Swings, amusement rides and big hussain sagar lake and lots eating place.Do remember these points:1. Lumbini park entry ticket is just for entry 20 per head.2. Inside park if you want to see Laser Show then you have to purchase ticket again. 50 per head.3. If you want to go to Buddha status, then there is separate ticket for Ferry ride which will take you from park to buddha statue on hussain sagar lake.Trying going in evening around 5 pm, will be good for all. Lser shows are from monday to friday at 7:30 pm and Sat - sun 2 shows 7:30 pm and 8:30 pm. On peak holiday time show runs 2 times on all days.Do visit one of the best attraction of hyderabad.

Name: rsraghavan6
Title: Good place
Review: Lovely place to hang out with friends and family. Lot of fun activities available for kids and adults. We tried couple of rides which reminds me of my childhood. Been there with kids and they enjoyed a lot as lot of rides available for them along with eatables available near by. We tried speed boat which cost some where around rs 350 for 4 person and it was a lovely experience. Ferries are also available at cheap rates. It also offer family package for boating . Ice cream parlour, eatables and garden all under one roof, what else can u expect from a place.

Name: kurukuntla raviteja
Title: Lumbini park
Review: Lumbini park is located in Hyderabad city AND near hussain Sagar there is good place to watch there is laser show we can enjoy with family AND friends

Name: travelbuddy18
Title: Must visit for children to enjoy boating and other attractions!
Review: It's a small park which is adjacent to Hussain sagar lake. It is named after Lumbini which is located in Nepal and is the birthplace of Lord Buddha.It has boating facilities (in Hussain Sagar lake), mini car ride, waterfall and a music show in the evenings.

Name: Dr vishal
Title: Don't waste ur time
Review: Nothing to see Nothing to play for children'sJust looted ur moneyVisit to NTR garden instead of this

Name: SRC4297
Title: Big enough for a large crowd
Review: Place is good. Big enough for a large crowd. But better go on a week day to enjoy it fully. You can find some rides, boating, food and it has place to sit and you can watch the laser show! Lots of things at one place....just one thing is, since the ticket prices are low, you will find cheap type of people roaming around also. Just need to careful for ur wallets. No parking near by so 4 star.

Name: Tarun P
Title: Nothing much to see
Review: The park adjacent to the Hussain sagar lake is a small assortment of coffee shops, some rides for kids and a couple of bridges, nothing special except the waterfall that has been constructed on the middle of the park but the stink from the lake makes it hard for you to enter the water.

Name: karthikakavya
Title: Great timepass
Review: people can enjoy if started early and need to spare decent amount of money. varieties of things and events are in the location. can rate 4.5/5

Name: Fahim_Khan_13
Title: Lumbini Park !!!
Review: This Park is normal with 1 ride & normal swings, there is laser & light show too at around 8 pm, On weekend this place is over crowded, for tickets there is long queues. We visited it on weekend, but looking at the queue we dropped to go inside,  then on normal week day we again visited the Park, this time the queue was less, Hence we went inside, after entry to the park, if you take right turn, you will go to the Laser & light show, & if you take left turn you will go to the ride & the swing section & also there is the Ferry you can catch to go to the Buddha statue,Overall normal park, good for the kids.

Name: 73prashantha
Title: Not anything special.
Review: Not anything special. This is just like a normal park. Except for the light show during the evening there is nothing exciting.

Name: GrandTour21627470896
Title: don't spoil your eyes. stupidest laser arrangement ever!
Review: the laser show at Lumbini is 30 min with alternating 5 min slots between an areal laser show and fountain laser show.the fountain laser shine upward in the sky. The problem is the other slot where the lasermounted exactly opposite to audience fires the show at the audience.this is the dumbest thing to do. the permissible lasers are sub 5mW (the laser pointers). the ones used in the show seem very heavy wattage shining right into 1000+ audience eye balls on the opposite side.@ 50Rs per head, the park easily collects in excess of 15 Lakh per month just from laser show. if they could afford to consult/hire any engineer with common sense, it might be turned into pleasurable experience. recommend  not to go there unless you know this problem is solved.

Name: Arjun Menon
Title: Park is just avergae. Not a must see spot.
Review: Park is just an average place which has a moderate entrance fee. You would need to enter the park if you wish to go the Budha statue which is there in another island. IT had some fountains and the maintenance is kind of fine considering the amount of crowd coming in.

Name: Prasun S
Title: Fun and games
Review: Lumbini park is situated just the opposite of Hussain Sagar lake. Here you must watch the laser show.  The show and the audience charm you . After watching the show you enjoy some ride in the park with your family.

Name: Daniel T
Title: Good family entertainment option anyday
Review: Actually known as T.Anjaiah Lumbini Park, good place for low-cost family entertainment. Entry ticket to the park is approx INR 20. Separate ticket for boating. This needs to taken inside the park. There are options for different boats.  Huge rush during weekends and holidays. There is space for paid car parking as well.Boat ride visit to Buddha statue is worth the time., preferably in evenings. There are some fast-food counters at the Buddha statue as well.

Name: Ramnaresh
Title: Feed The Soul Visit Hare Krishna Golden Temple
Review: Best temple to find the real self and purpose of life, More than 50 full time devotees are serving Śrīla Prabhupāda's mission of spreading Krishna Consciousness through the Hare Krishna Movement. Blessed to be here. Advice you to must visit this place. For kids cultural camps are conducted here for college students and for working professionals FOLK, Youth Empowerment Club is here and similarly spiritual retreats and programs for the people from all walks of life you will find here. Dham Yatras ( Spiritual Tours ) are also organised by Hare Krishna Golden Temple throughout the year.Overall It's a must visit place

Name: naveen
Title: misleading cheaters
Review: These are cheaters, they are not real followers of ISKCON,  They simply use the name of Hare Krishna, but they are deviants from original ISKCON founded by Srila Prabhupada. they simply use the reputation of original ISKCON  and collect funds, they dont represent  ISKCON .  they are not bonafide gaudiya vaishnavas,

Name: Phanindra
Title: Wonderful Divine Experience
Review: Wonderful temple to visit, nicely constructed with full of peace and calm ..Deities worship is mesmerizing.

Name: Ganesh
Title: Wonderful experience
Review: Wonderful experience with ISKCON Golden temple 🛕 more beautiful at night✨️....... Annaprasadam also Very Good

Name: Mohan
Title: Nice place to be
Review: One of the best Temples in the country. Very clean, neat, tidy and very nice place which helps in meditation

Name: Saiteja
Title: Must visit
Review: Such a wonderful place! Your mind becomes calm and peaceful. Try to go on Sundays; the prasadam was so delicious!

Name: Arunkumar bashetty
Title: Great place to visit
Review: Beautiful holy place to visit.ancient temple having great past time.can spend good time with family at peaceful garden area and in the temple premises

Name: Kuldeep
Title: Hare Krishna Golden Temple Best peaceful place to visit
Review: The temple campus is very well maintained and spacious with a beautiful park having kadamb trees around. Within campus there is also a very big Sankirtana Hall where special events are held to manage big crows gathering on special days like Janmastami, Ramanavami, Nityananda Triyodashi etc. The temples devotee who are living dedicates life are very courteous and lively and it's easy to interact with them if you need any help or information. The temple is Telangana's first Golden Temple. It is also Swayambhu Laxmi Narsimha Swamy kshetram. Lord Narsimha with godess laxmi manifested on its own and stands together in abhaya mudra. Panchajanya Mahadev also self manifested here. Each Sunday in the evening there is big aarati of Gauranga, Narsimh and Tulsi Maharani and then Sankirtana happens. You will see people dancing and jumping out of ecstasy during the Sankirtana.You can buy and get chanting beads, bead bags, Lords nicely framed pictures. Also there are lots of scripture books that you can get (by His Divine Grace AC Bhaktivedanta Swamy Srila Prabhupada) including Bhagavad Gita as it is, Srimad Bhagvatam, Science of self Realisation, Perfect question Perfect Answer, Journey of Self Discovery to name a few. Also painting, story and and activity books are available for children about depicting lilas and features of the Lord. Surely visit once you get life changing experience with your family and dear ones. Hare Krishna!

Name: thanmai9030
Title: Devition
Review: It was a very peace full day with full of bhakti and exploring the tradition and culture Hare Krishna

Name: Mutukuloju Pranay
Title: Precious one
Review: Absolute great construction, most delighted one.chanting of Hari Nama sankirthana makes it more devotional. well occupied and great place

Title: A beautiful place to recharge spiritually

Everyone receives positive Vibrations from the cleanly maintained temple. Swayambhu Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy, Radha Govinda are center of attractions. Posters on the rooftop and walls mesmerizes with knowledge. Last but not the least, you can enjoy Hygienic and Delicious Prasadam. Must Visit Place especially on Sundays or festivals

I can also say that everyone Prabhus and Devotees kept their effort. Now we have huge parking area. all the facilities. Above all, 4.30am archana timings will start and if you visit by that time in early morning, you can experience a unexpected pleasantness in your Mind. And we can also get books available in all the 17 regional language.

Name: HkM Golden Temple
Title: Golden Temple
Review: Located off Road-12 in Banjara Hills, it is one of the newer temples in Hyderabad. Well maintained it has a nice peaceful ambiance. The central courtyard is airy and spacious and you can watch the puja and listen to bhajans sitting here. The temple opens between 6 am-12 noon in morning and then from 5 in evening till 10 pm.
