Name: Veer2468
Title: Excellent
Review: It is an excellent temple to visit. Awsome drive on the outer ring road. This temple is near ramoji film city.

Name: Bhargav C
Title: nice temple
Review: This is of Lord Venkateshwara's temple. It is nicely located outside hyderabad near to Ramoji filmcity. It is situated in very large area on the hills.

Name: Bhargav C
Title: looks good
Review: you might want to visit this place to experience the beauty of art and culture together. Located 35 kms away from Hyderabad

Name: srikanth423
Title: awesome temple
Review: we go once in a year..its awesome temple for friends ,lovers and for couples..make sure not to go between 12pm to 4pm..they will close it in this timings...

Name: rimjhim
Title: Not at all maintained!
Review: We went to Sanghi Temple yesterday as a part of a family outing. The timings on the internet were mentioned as 8:30 to 10:30 AM and 4 PM to 6 PM so we rushed to reach there on time in the evening. The road to the temple is quite nice. It doesnt feel as if you are in Hyderabad as there is greenery on both sides. The entrance hoarding to the temple showed different timings...Its open in the evenings from 4 PM TO 8 PM contrary to what is mentioned on the web and on Sundays it is open from 8AM to 8PM.The temple is not well maintained at all. The grass and greenery that was there a few years back is no longer there. There were muddy patches everywhere and very little of grass. No floral plants as seen a few years back. So the only so called beauty is in terms of the temple structure. The priests seemed highly reluctant to do any kind of "free" service like offering teertham , flowers etc. It was a major put off. We stayed there till 5:30pm and there was no light in the sanctum sanctorum which was dark inside and made it diffcult to see the idols. Very demotivated temple staff.The temple has quite some numbers of monkeys around which are a nuisance. They kept coming near us when we were seated on the benches , forcing us to leave the seats.Overall it was a disappointment. The only plus point was the weather. Theres no point driving to the outskirts of the city to see a barren temple land and priests who are highly demotivated!The citys Jagannath temple in Banjara hills seemed much better option !!

Name: madhuonly
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: white beautiful temple @ city out skirts near to ramoji film city. this temple is very famous in Hyderabad. for lord venkateswara. having pleasant climate and greenery and awesome place for all visitors.

Name: Krishna_2111
Title: Serene Temple.
Review: Been to this temple as a kid and multiple times along with friends. The drive from the city in the 90's was itself a great experience for youngsters. The temple itself is on top of a hill and is maintained beautifully.  It is all built in a white marble that enhances the beauty of the temple. There is a lot of place to sit peacefully and meditate on the lawn inside the temple premises. Most of the telugu movies are shot here owning to its beauty and popularity. For anyone living in Hyderabad or visiting, this is a must go.

Name: Vikranth R
Title: Peace of mind
Review: Sanghi is a temple were it is located outs cut of city...  It's is in a such a place where u can get a peace of mind..  The temple is situated at hilly area...  With good environment area.. Here many cinema shooting are done...

Name: Shalini R
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: One must visit this temple while in Hyderabad.  This is near the Ramoji rao film city. This is well connected in the city. The temple is closed during afternoons daily.

Name: superb114
Title: Heart Of Hyderabad
Review: The temple is located far away from Hyderabad you need to be there in the morning so that you can have an amazing experience here you can all the temples at one place.

Name: Xavier D
Title: Necklace road
Review: Near to the banks of Hussain Sagar lake, went in evening time, there was a carnival going on during the time.

Name: Jayavel D
Title: wonderland
Review: The necklace road is very beautiful and so impressive and suggesting every one to visit this place....

Name: Abhay Mehta
Title: Good night view
Review: One must have a drive on the Necklace road to enjoy its beauty. I prefer to go in the late evening hours or night for better view.

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Road around Hussain Sagar Lake
Review: Necklace Road is located all along the banks of the beautiful Hussain Sagar Lake and we had traveled through this beautiful road many times during our holiday in Hyderabad. We enjoyed the beautiful views of the vast lake and the beautiful Buddha statue in the middle of the lake while traveling through this road by car.

Name: Mutukuloju Pranay
Title: Walking Track
Review: Events and morning walk Track for many hyderbadies.good and should maintained well again much better.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: The best road of the city
Review: Go early morning around 6 am if you really want to enjoy. A number of attractions lie on the road including the Sanjeevaiah park, Rock garden, Butterfly garden, Dog park, Herbal and Spice garden, PV Gyan bhoomi and one of the highest flags in the country. There is also bicycle club from where you can take bicycles on rent. There are a large number of eating options as well.

Name: Rukitha sree
Title: Awesome necklace
Review: It's an awesome place where you will buddha statue and Indian National flag.cool nd peace full.especially during evening on weekend ..it looks amazing with many restaurants and public.

Name: moogul818
Title: A nice Walkabout
Review: Necklace Road is a boulevard in Hyderabad, Telangana, adjoining the Hussain Sagar Lake. It connects NTR Gardens to Sanjeevaiah Park. Stretched across a length of three-kilometre, Necklace Road connects three major parks of the city, namely NTR Gardens, Lumbini Park and Sanjeevaiah Park. The road runs from NTR Gardens and Lumbini Park in Hyderabad to Sanjeevaiah Park in Secunderabad, from there along the Tank Bund Road back to the NTR Gardens. This gives it a shape of a necklace. There are two boat boarding points - one at Necklace road and another at Lumbini Park. It  is wort a visit along with the other nearby attractions.

Name: Indusman248
Title: Auto Drive of the Necklace Road
Review: We took an Auto Rickshaw and paid him Rs 100 and he took us for a Necklace Road drive during the lunch time. Found the temperature little cooler and it is recommended to take a walk of the Necklace Road in the morning or evening as one would find many eateries.

Name: NIL_MODI
Title: beautiful
Review: Necklace Road is like a walkway around hussain sagar lake. due to the lake's shape is in necklace shape the walkway is called necklace road. have a walk in night.

Name: Somnath
Title: Serence Place
Review: I visited this place on several occasions like marathons and family visits. Clean roads and silent ambiance.

Name: Alia M
Title: The world of street graffiti
Review: Other than the road is constructed in the shape of a necklace, it is filled with street graffiti. Very talented and crrative artists have left their mark on the walls and buildings. My personal favorite is the superwoman piece.

Name: KRAMA200
Title: A Good Place to Visit
Review: Necklace Road  around Husain Sagar Lake is one of the popular Tourist attaraction for visitors. Either you can drive around or walk around. The pplace is well lit in the night. There are lot of places for you to sit and enjoy like Lumbini Park,NTR Gardens etc. Do not miss the Eat Street to have a bite.Children will love it

Name: Roopa
Title: Why Necklace Road?
Review: You can see the road that is exactly designed like a necklace. That was awesome to see :) !!! and quite liked the name. It is apt.

Name: amitthecreator
Title: Necklace Road Hyderabad 500004, InNecklace Road Hyderabad 500004, In
Review: Necklace Road is one of the popular tourist spots of Hyderabad. It is named as “necklace” because the road from Sanjivaiah Park connects to Tank bund Road, which further connects to Lumbini Park and NTR Gardens and thus forming a circle that appears in the shape of necklace when seen from the sky.

Name: RaphsMum
Title: Good place for a drive!
Review: Good place for an evening drive though parking can be a big headache.Check into Eat Street for a lovely evening by the lake

Name: OnAir516505
Title: pretty but not neccessary to visit
Review: Its pretty if you are driving by but not something you should specialy go & see. So plan your itenarary that you can drive past at night.

Name: jainms
Title: Cool place to be there
Review: It's good for the evening times and a very great view of the hussain sagar lake & buddha statue located in center of the lake.

Name: MR_F00DIE
Title: Sunday mornings made better
Review: A nice place for an early morning walk/jog/stroll, made better by the "pet social" that happens every sunday morning- hyderabad's four footed friends meeting and greeting one another.

Name: S R V
Title: Traffic crawls for various reasons
Review: The well lit road around Hussain  Sagar Lake is called Necklace Road in Hyderabad. People drive around in this area to watch the Buddha Statue amidst the lake. The roads are crowded on week days due to office goers traffic  and on Sundays by week end tourist.

Name: Niya1315
Title: A busy road
Review: It is shaped like a necklace, therefore it is called a necklace road. It surrounds the Hussain Sagar Lake. A lot of hotels and eateries are there on this road.

Name: TravellingReddy
Title: The best place to spend evenings
Review: A place known for catching up with friends after a day long work and gives relaxation due to its serene surroundings.

Name: Charith C Raj
Title: Nice place for a stroll or a ride around the lake..
Review: Nice place for a stroll or a ride around the lake.. even in summer at night one can experience cool breeze while on ride. Also there many places to hangout and have snacks or meals like watersedge and other small parks. The area around lake has been cleaned up a lot since 2014. If you want a peaceful time avoid during valentines day, ganesha visarjan,.. and other such days.

Name: sree143in
Title: Status
Review: Necklace road is very famous place in hyderabad we can see here a lot of people everyday evening, comes here to spend time.

Name: YatriForever
Title: Stop and smell the roses !
Review: On a busy day, driving hectic from one place in Hyderabad to another location in Hyderabad, I ended up driving on the Necklace Road. This is almost a necklace shape road around the famed Hussain Sagar lake, right in the middle of the city. It was worth stopping for a while in one of the garden along side the road. It was refreshing, relaxing and enjoyable! Obviously,  you will end up seeing the giant Buddha  somewhere during the drive. The lake's  breeze is indeed has a calming effect. Even if you are in a hurry, it's worth stopping by to smell the flowers. The road has its own charm in the night.Count it on things to do.

Name: yemKeyAre
Title: Nice spot
Review: Nice spot for tourists and locals alike. Good choices for entertainment. Nice and majestic view of the lake.

Name: Prasad
Title: Nice place
Review: Necklace road in Hyderabad is very good to see. Had a night walk with friends last time in this road. Atmosphere is really cool and had a road side food here

Name: Ashish S
Title: Amazing walk on this Road
Review: It's a great place to have your morning walk. Place is neat and clean. It's a very good place to go as you get peace of mind.

Name: Noor Ali Abbas
Title: Lake View Drive
Review: Necklace Road lies on the northern and western sides of the heart shaped Hussain sagar lake. This road resembles a necklace which runs around the lake and connects Tank Bunk roa as well.The road looks beautiful with a long stretch of lush green lawns and trees. Major parks along the Necklace Road are Sanjeevaiah Park, NTR Gardens and Lumbini Park. Jalvihar Amusement Water Park is also here.There are many restaurants and eat-outs along the road. Also, there are toys and balloons shops for kids.Necklace Road Metro connects all the major parts of the city.

Name: Pithva_Rajan
Title: Place to roam arround
Review: This is the good place and one of the attraction to visit in the Hyderabad. A good place to roam around anytime.

Name: RitaKakkar
Title: Adorned by beautiful shrubs
Review: Like Bangalore, the soil here is red too and everything grows nice and beautiful. On both sides of the road, beautiful colourful shrubs are planted. We went early in the morning when the shops were not yet open, but I am sure that the place must look beautiful at night with the restaurants all lit up. We had a flight to catch in the evening, so could not visit again.

Name: MUKKU S M R S
Title: Necklace Road
Review: This is a good place to walk around the Hussain Sagar Lake. This is a hangout place with Friends and Family when tired

Name: hock c
Title: Do drive pass
Review: It's quite central in position - so it's very likely you will go pass/ along it ( reference :Hussain Sagar Lake ).

Name: MJROHIT
Title: A visit at night
Review: The long lit road is a good place to walk around, enjoy street shopping, relish in hyderabadi meals and all in pocket friendly prices

Name: Anu789
Title: Beautiful at Night
Review: Enjoy a breezy cool summer evening along the necklace road that goes around Husain Sagar lake. The Buddha statue is lit up at night and a beautiful sight to behold.

Name: kennice2016
Title: Fantastic view in the night
Review: One of the best roads to drive with a panoramic view. We find either side interesting to watch. The theme location in Hyderabad.

Name: dipali
Title: Goood place but not maintained properly
Review: The dazzling diamonds can be seen only from above after dark from a helicopter or a plane about to safely land.Down below, it is a lovely road to take a ride on its curving path.It has a nice view of the Hussain Sagar with parks and standby points from where you can gaze at the water front, sit on the chairs and simply laze. There will be  none to disturb you . There is an exhibition ground on the road. Most of the time, some event is on. A little further is the water world.It is excellent for a nice walk at night where the roads would be lit and you can see the statue of Buddha. The eat street at neckalce road is also a must go place which is meant for food lovers. when looked from a higher altitude, this road looks like a necklace around the lake, hence named as Necklace Road.After its opening, it saves a lot of time to commute from Khairtabad to Secunderabad. It also is a hub for lot of family outings, one can find fun events along the park. On weekends, there are lot of activity options for families. Ample car parking space at multiple places on this road. One should be very careful and cautious after 10pm, as might find miscreants around since the road gets very isolated.

Name: Nisshant
Title: Good Potential but unutilized
Review: The necklace road can really become a beautiful place to hangout with a amazing view to Hussain Sagar lake But the broken footpath and foul smell doesn't allow you to actually be there for a longer duration.This area should be cleaned and developed.

Name: Sumit S
Title: lost the old charm
Review: The place has lost its old charm. However you can visit this place at beautiful weather times in hyderabad

Name: GreenCarpet11
Title: Dazzling Diamonds
Review: The dazzling diamonds can be seen only from above after dark from a helicopter or a plane about to safely land.Down below, it is a lovely road to take a ride on its curving path.It has a nice view of the Hussain Sagar with parks and standby points from where you can gaze at the water front, sit on the chairs and simply laze. There is none to disturb you . There is an exhibition ground on the road.  Most of the time, some event is on.  A little further is the water world.

Name: ROBERTS ROSHAN M
Title: Good place for Family
Review: Visit in late evening. Pleasant atmosphere. Nice place for Family outings. Lighting is also good. Must visit.

Name: 73prashantha
Title: Loosing its charm
Review: It was very famous earlier. I remember going to this place often during my childhood days. It lost its charm now.

Name: Arjun Menon
Title: Nice Night walk-road.
Review: This is a road which literally goes with the name. This road surrounds the Hussain Sagar Lake (Pardon me if I am wrong in the name). It is excellent for a nice walk at night where the roads would be lit and you can see the statue of Buddha. The eat street at neckalce road is also a must go place which is meant for food lovers.

Name: Nish0901
Title: Road surrounding Hussain Sagar Lake
Review: This is a road surrounding Hussain Sagar Lake. It looks like a necklace. A lot of hotels, parks and restaurants are there on this road.

Name: Dilip kumar
Title: must visit
Review: Best place for lovers and many of them will visit this place to hangouyt and will make sure they enjoy the nature.

Name: sravan s
Title: places for shopping and hangout with friends
Review: this is near to hussain sagar lake. the roads are always rush and people comes here to roam around and for shoppings.

Name: Daniel T
Title: Nice place..but be careful at late night.
Review: when looked from a higher altitude, this road looks like a necklace around the lake, hence named as Necklace Road.After its opening, it saves a lot of time to commute from Khairtabad to Secunderabad. It also is a hub for lot of family outings, you'll find fun events along the park. On weekends, there is lot of activity options for families. Ample car parking space at multiple places on this road.Be very careful after 10pm, as you'll find miscreants around since the road gets very isolated.

Name: ARUN63512
Title: GREAT VIEW IN THE EVENING
Review: It is a great view when the lights are lit in the evening to have a view from an elevated area, looks great

Name: venkatakarthik
Title: best but not safe road for night rides
Review: if you are that person who takes life lightly and have some fun and adventure then you are one for a treat.

Name: KenDeep
Title: Nicely built badly maintained
Review: This place is the living proof of what irresponsible citizens can do to any place. Sans the dirt this is a beautiful place. Nice waking path.  Beautiful gardens.  View of lake. Now comes the sad part. The lake is dirty.  There is dirt thrown all over the gardens. So if u are going for some nice jog or do enjoy the scenary, the place is not very appealing.

Name: Chaitali GK
Title: Nice road to drive along
Review: This road got name as necklace from Mumbai marine drive. This one is also has a shape of necklace and its good road for a long drive with nice music. you will find some good restaurants along this road which have nice view of lighted necklace road.

Name: Ambitesh G
Title: Love this place
Review: Spent hours on this road..i just love seeing people spending time with their families, playing football and having tea. A must visit place if you want to kill some time.

Name: shivaraikod
Title: Soothing breeze
Review: The road in the shape of a necklace is to be visited after 11PM . Taking a bike ride in open air with soothing breeze from hussian sagar is mesmerising.

Name: arunlahre
Title: evening ride
Review: enjoy Mini Mumbai very beautiful during monsoon & ganesh festival. people love to take selfie during viist.

Name: chandrasekhar g
Title: Traffic area
Review: MMTS station is available.Traffic is high. Good place for bike riding.good to visit at night time. Road will get damages if heavy rainfall occurs.

Name: idea614354
Title: A beautiful place
Review: Necklace road a beautiful place in hyd, you fall in loves when you visit here. very beautiful evenings you can enjoy here.

Name: Mahesh G
Title: Nothing much to do
Review: There are a few eateries scattered at some places. It is surrounding the Hussain Sagar lake. But the most annoying was the stink coming from the lake.

Name: moizuddinahmed
Title: Must visit during night
Review: This road is a place you wanna have a good drive or ride with your friend or spouse. It gives the wonderful view of the Husain Sagar lake and the Vast Indian flag in the middle of the lake just stands out and is the most beautiful thing about this place.

Name: 437rajendraa
Title: Very peaceful place for walking in the morning
Review: What a wonderful place in the heart of the city. I took auto and reached there. It was a  peaceful place I have ever seen in the heart of the city surrounded by a road on the lake. You can stay there for hours, but take the vehicle for up and down for one or two hours, walk in the morning and come back in the same vehicle. Good road, greenery and lake.

Name: Vivek G
Title: Too much Traffic
Review: The Necklace road is surrounding the Hussain Sagar Lake with a ring road. The road is new and having many flyovers. The road is busy mostly. The road starts and ends at the Lumbini park

Name: Trending T
Title: Good place to visit
Review: This place has very good ambience with a great look and will make your with friends and you can enjoy.You also have metro facility to have with.

Name: srk-rk
Title: Pleasant place to walk
Review: Necklace road has a lot of places to relax. It offers beautiful  A nice road to walk. It connects parks across the Hussain Sagar lake. Lots of restaurants, food court like Eat street etc. However, There is bad odour from the lake that dampens experience.

Name: Bindu B
Title: Beautiful driveway.
Review: A very well maintained connecting drive way in the heart of the city. Other than long drives one can find many entertainment zones, parks, eateries of all kinds enroute. Beautiful during  winters.

Name: Karthik Dasu
Title: Good place
Review: It is a very good place to visit, especially in the evenings and at the night time.The fresh air from the lake and trees is quite good.

Name: Ravi Pratap Singh Chauhan
Title: A nice walk
Review: The road connects parks across the Hussain Sagar lake and is a nice walk in the evening. The stink of the lake is the negative point

Name: Srinivasarao K
Title: Very nice place for relaxed evening walk
Review: Very nice place for relaxed evening walk...it connectes somany places...lots of restaurants along the road...

Name: VishuMittoo
Title: Hyderabad ka Shaan!!
Review: A place to relax, breathe and find peace. I used to take my dog here and he loved this place more than we did. He found new friends and he played a lot. The only place where you are near to the main road but the traffic dies not effect you..

Name: Meghaa R
Title: Chilling place for couples
Review: The place is more filled up with couples and is a good place to chill mostly on weekends you will find more people there, take a long stroll there and enjoy

Name: Rajesh_in
Title: Nice drive by
Review: Necklace road is famous for it's food shops, hangout places and is around Hussain Sagar Lake. During our visit this time , since it was the 4th Formation day of the telangana state & Ramadan , the entire city & the necklace road were lit up with lights . It was a great sight and a nice drive by.

Name: mdviquaruddin
Title: friends time
Review: one of the beautiful places to hangout with friends and family for celebrating any occasion as the area contains many junk food shops , family restaurant and a multiplex nearby.must visit for everyone to enjoy the area and the food in nearby restaurants.

Name: deepa v
Title: Nice view.
Review: In hot summer in hyd...evenings can be spent at necklace road with friends or spouses.have some fast food stalls..must visit if in hyd.

Name: SVRSAGAR
Title: Apt Name! Its a Jewel around Hussian Sagar!
Review: The first that comes into mind when someone asks about hyderabad is Hussian Sagar and necklace road. Lot of recreation places around. Breezy walk, food courts, IMAX, tank bund, NTR Garden, Eat Street all round the road. You can go to Buddha statue which is mid of Lake from Eat street/Lumbini Park. Dont miss this place if you visit Hyderabad for first time!

Name: Nimmagadda D
Title: neck lace road
Review: the road which shapes like necklace road i feel  goodin this rood you can many plces like ntr gaht ntr garden etc

Name: SomnathKhaskel
Title: Not much to see but good for evening walk
Review: Clean and maintained road and shop - food courts .................. may be an Arial/bird's eye view required to enjoy the Necklace view.

Name: jmodi1981
Title: Nice Road
Review: This road has been named based on its shape which is Necklace type. when you pass through it you can understand the shape.

Name: Sumitkumar_13
Title: Well maintained
Review: Hyderabad has been made attractive with the presence of Necklace Road. Well built and well maintained, this road is a pleasure to drive through

Name: Nirban P
Title: Really Looks like a Bright Necklace in the evening!
Review: Beautiful is the only word i can use for this place. With Eat Street in the center, Waterfront (a gourmet restaurant), and a few other happening places on it...this is a place where you can easily forget looking at your watch to keep track of time!!!

Name: Lalitha G
Title: nice place to njoy with friends and loved ones
Review: its a great place where will get shopping and food courts also. near by some placeses are availble to take kids to enjoy. its a place where always be rush and traffic.

Name: 962dhawals
Title: Very nice for an evening stroll
Review: It do looks like a Necklace in the evening as the name suggests. Just a casual walk on this road gives a refreshing feeling and top of it you can enjoy some wonderful street food. The evening breeze is a cherry on top.

Name: Known Traveller
Title: Necklace Road - Famous for Street Food
Review: Street food- You get awesome Street Food like Panipuri, Sweet Corn, Noodles, Fast Foods. The Taste is awesome. But you need check good places for Parking.

Name: Rashmi K
Title: Beautiful and well maintained road
Review: We went to this place last week and likes it alot.It is literally like a necklace and name seems apt when you see this road at night. Very beautifully designed and well maintained road.

Name: Joe L
Title: Interesting
Review: Not a bad place to go if you are looking to kill some time and see Hyderabad.   There are a few places to stop along the way for pictures and to see the lake.

Name: rcreviews
Title: Necklace ariel view
Review: Surrounding the hussain sagar the road become a necklace shape which can be observe by ariel view.Standing Buddha inside the Hussain Sagar is another attraction in necklace road.

Name: Shubho
Title: Absolutely nothing to see
Review: We went at 7:30 pm IST and there was no boat ride. No decent eateries and place was not even illuminated well. There were very few people at the venue. Not worth our time and effort to reach there.

Name: 24x7TravellingBoy
Title: Necklace of Hyderbad
Review: Truly this road is like a necklace, nice beautiful road for driving at evening, the eat street is available here which is a good place for chats and fun activities, the NTR gardens are also near this which has many fun activities and hangout places. This is for people of all age groups.

Name: Travellove1025
Title: Simple yet romantic place
Review: We have been here a multiple number of times but never get bored of just sitting here and talking. You will feel the love is in the air. Though getting a bench facing lake to sit is difficult as the place is almost always full.

Name: Rahul S Khatri
Title: One Time Visit
Review: The Evening time is perfect to Visit this Area. One can visit Buddha status, NTR Garden, many other nearby attraction places all together. The only problem is the stinking water.

Name: Yaminee B
Title: Secenic Hyderabad
Review: It is pleasant to visit this place in evening time. Mostly young crowd found here unlike rest of the area in Hyderabad. Good to visit with couple. Sitting place and chat is available around.

Name: subrat71
Title: heaven for morning joggers
Review: Has a good green cover. Recently the whole area was renovated. Attraction is Sanjeeviah Park. can spend time with family.

Name: Raja S
Title: Necklace Road a Must Place To Visit if you are in town
Review: Most happening place in town, Tank bund, to Prasad IMAX, Eat Street, Jalavihar Water Park after that Biggest Indian FLAG and so on you can take a MMTS and Reach this Place

Name: Indranil B
Title: Nice Pleace for evening walk
Review: Its nice and serene, specially I prefer in the evening. you can take a stroll and experience the street food

Name: Sumeetsali
Title: Necklace road - Nice Place
Review: Necklace road is a nice place to visit especially with family and friends and teenagers. Children will love it as it has many fun elements.

Name: smandal2858
Title: Necklace Road
Review: Necklace road is in perimeter of Hussein Sagar Lake . It is between twin city Hyderabad and Secunderabad. The journey along with necklace road in morning and night is scenin drive. You can enjoy street food along with the road. NTR garden, Lumbini park, sanjivani park are situated beside the road.

Name: richa t
Title: Necklace Road- To be visited after sunset
Review: Its nice  and serene, Especially i prefer in the evening. you can take a stroll and experience the street food

Name: Sam S
Title: The busy necklace road.
Review: This was built during the 1990's by CM Chenna Reddy to ease the traffic. Punjagutta roads were constructed. I visited Chanakya, Chaitanya colleges to seek admission into Intermediate course. The traffic goes high speed. There are rallies and narrow lanes joining the main road. Its convenient to go to the hitec city via Erram Manzil or go to Secunderabad or Ameerpet but the traffic chaos at the evening near Jalavihar is pathetic.

Name: Aartichand
Title: Scenic drive
Review: The Necklace road is a scenic drive with views of the Tank Bund, the Buddha Statue. The road is good and the large garden has many visitors. If one wants to stroll around they can. One of the more famous landmarks of the twin cities.

Name: Arun S
Title: Enjoy your walk here
Review: Its a good place to enjoy evening or morning walks alongside this road which surrounds the hussain sagar lake, gives very relaxing feeling. Nothing more than that.

Name: joshisandeep
Title: Necklace Road
Review: It is beautiful road to visit, take a complete round in the evening. It gives good experience. it was good

Name: Rajani K
Title: Enjoy an evening walk here
Review: This road encircles the Hussain Sagar lake and is in close proximity to NTR garden and Lumbini park.  It's a nice place to enjoy a morning or evening walk.  The road has  clean, well maintained adjacent lawns and benches are also there to sit.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: nice place for morning walk
Review: This is the place hundreds of people come for walking .Scenic hussain sagar will be there and places to sit and relax are present.Nice place to venture

Name: Xavier D
Title: Mecca Masjid
Review: Visited during our Hyderabad visit , it is located just near to Charminar and is a old heritage structure.

Name: Shafeeq T
Title: Good place woth peaceful environment
Review: One of the oldest and beautiful masjid in India. Whoever goes to the Charminar the icon of Hyderabad must visit to Mecca Masjid too.

Name: Avirup Guha Roy
Title: Makkah Masjid, Hyderabad
Review: Commissioned by Md Quli Qutub Shah, the construction of this mosque took 77 years... it is still one of the largest Mosques of India with a capacity to accommodate 10000 people at any time.... the arch embellishments over the main sanctum are made from the soil of the Holy Land of Mecca, hence this revered shrine was named such

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Heritage structure
Review: During our holiday in Hyderabad we had visited the Charminar and this big mosque is located right in front of the Charminar. We had seen this mosque from the footpath outside and we liked the architecture of the building though the place was very crowded and not well maintained.

Name: Oneil
Title: Okay
Review: The local people should be prevented from sleeping on the marble slabs laid besides the tombs. Very poorly maintained. No official guides available. We had to depend on the first parson who walked to us & offered to take us around.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Poorly maintained
Review: This is historic masjid built partly with bricks made from soil brought from holy city of Mecca. The Mosque is currently being restored. You cannot take camera but can click pictures with mobile. The part where all save the first and last Nizam lie buried has been beautifully restored

Name: chandrasekhar g
Title: Tourist place
Review: One the attractive place in hyderabad. Located very very nearer to charminar.Evening time huge crowd inside masjid.Anyone can visit inside.Full security provided in charminar area.

Name: MyNameIs Shiva
Title: Muslamans God.
Review: This location is near to Charminar one of the beautiful locations in Hyderabad For Prayers and for peace this location is good for that.

Name: Cvitanovich
Title: Great site to visit if your in the area visiting Charminar
Review: There is great history with Mecca Masjid and be sure to read up on it or pull out Wikipedia while you are there.  It is used for prayer so, be sure to be prepared to take off your shoes when visiting. PLEASE be aware, you will be approached if you do not look Indian by "guides" that will tell you the history which you can get from Wikipedia. They will tour you around the place and then ask for a donation.  The same can be said for the man at watching over your shoes.  He wanted money so I gave him American Dollars since I did not have rupees but wanted $5 to get my shoes back.  Oh, be aware even though you have to take your shoes off, the floors are dirty in some areas covered in pigeon poop.

Name: Jo-Ann
Title: Uniquely old
Review: Great architecture. Foreign visitors are welcome to visit the inside of the mosque. There is a lady outside who would make sure ladies have scarves around their necks before entering the mosque.

Name: kcdebnath
Title: Mecca Masjid in Hyderabad
Review: It was 15th August, 19. We reached Hyderabad late from Vellore by Sabari Express. After checked in our hotel at Abids we decided to visit Charminar in the afternoon. Every body knows that Charminar is the iconic of Hyderabad City, the most beautiful monument in the heart of Hyderabad.  We reached in the evening. The place is very crowded as it was Independence Day. We spent some time there. Then we visited Mecca Masjid, one of the largest in the world, situated on the south west of Charminar. Here also we a lot of visitors assembled. All are in festive mood. we were interested to pay a visit there. First we faced a tight security. However we entered the masjid area. Why Mecca Masjid, the name given? Some say the founder, Mohammad Quli Qutub Shah commissioned the construction who asked for soil to be brought in from the holy Islamic site of Mecca. He laid the foundation stone of this mosque in 1641. Some say that a few bricks from holy shrine from Mecca were embedded in it .Another view that only one brick was brought from Mecca. However, the mosque was completed by Aurangzeb,in 1694,  the Mughal Emperor, after conquering Golkunda in 1687. It is so big that it can accommodate 10,000 worshippers in its prayer hall. The architecture is beautiful, one of a Heritage Building in Hyderabad. It is worth visiting along with the Charminar.

Name: Wilayat
Title: Prayers
Review: The entrance to the courtyard is one of the mosque's most striking features with a rectangular, arched, and canopied building that houses the marble graves of the Asaf jahi  rulers.

Name: Sounak Poddar
Title: Heritage Building
Review: Just next to Charminar, a heritage building in the town. Still Standing strong and a beautiful structure. Could have been maintained a bit more, but overall nice place to visit during Ramzan, then one will get the taste of the market in front of that area as well but make sure you don't have a vehicle with yourself because during that period all the roads are blocked.

Name: Arun Karthik
Title: Heritage Place
Review: The aura and sanctity that one gets to feel near Mecca Masjid Hyderabad is simply incomparable. Founded by Muhammad Quli Qutub Shah, the fifth ruler of Qutub Shahi dynasty, it is one of the biggest and the oldest mosques in South India. It is said that he himself laid the foundation stone and the bricks used to construct the central arch of the mosque have been made from soil sourced from Mecca. This is the reason behind the mosque getting its name as Mecca Masjid.It has the capacity to accommodate 10,000 worshippers to offer prayers at a time. About 8000 workers were involved in the construction of this mosque that draws hundreds of tourists from all across the globe, not just for its historical or religious importance but also for its spectacular beauty.A few common sights at this sacred place include feeding of pigeons considered to be a virtue in the Muslim community and devotees sitting by the side of an artificial pond installed in the mosque. As per a legend, whoever sits on the two stones and slab benches beside the pond always comes back to sit on them again

Name: jainms
Title: large Masjid
Review: large masjid located just opposite charminar, Can see this best view from above Charminar. lot if pigeons at the entrance of macca masjid.

Name: NIL_MODI
Title: Good Place
Review: Mecca Masjid is near to Charminar. near to very crowded and busy street. Good place. Good architecture. religions place.

Name: Beau77
Title: Make sure you wear pants
Review: Got turned away because I had shorts on. Make sure you wear pants. But other than that the place looked average from the outside.

Name: Faizan Khan
Title: Quiet, calm, serene
Review: Great mosque. Love the Hauz, pretty rare to find these days. At the time, construction is still going on, so probably would like to visit once its complete.

Name: FaisalNM
Title: Worth visiting
Review: The Masjid lies in the very crowded Charminar area. Most area around the masjid was kept free from Hawkers during the Friday prayer time, which is great.Shoe keeping is done by local people at various places, they keep your shoes and give you a handmade token.The pond for ablution was disappointing. Full of bird feathers and dried leaves and dust floating on it, however, there is a separate place with taps for ablution too but not clearly visible, we had to ask if there was one.The prayer sermon or khudba was in Arabic instead of the widely spoken and understood Urdu which was surprising.The interior of the masjid is spellbinding, mainly because it's very high. Almost four to five storeys high ceiling.Chandelier were covered in cloth thought and fans kept things cool.Albeit run down and under maintenance, it still gave the old time flavour and one could feel they are back in time by say 40-50 years.Worth visiting and experiencing if in Hyderabad.

Name: ShvRm_Traveller
Title: Religious as well as Archaeological site
Review: The Mosque is located in the crowded area of Hyderabad City, on one side of the square, which houses Charminar, in the center. The mosque is in use and has a religious significance as well as the archaeological important. Women have to cover their head to enter the mosque. Overall, it is a decent structure but for a casual visitor, it may not appear, very different from the other similar structures of its time.

Name: Farhan M
Title: Mecca masjid
Review: Mecca masjid is very peaceful you can sit there for hours you will get inspiration specially be there at maghrib time listen the azaan its heart touching

Name: ShelleyKulle
Title: Remember to take your shoes off!
Review: Women are not allowed inside, not even to take pictures from the door to the mosque.  Make sure you're covered (head, arms, legs, etc,) before stepping into the gates, women are allowed to roam around outside and take pictures if you wish near the fountain.

Name: avixorld
Title: Big Masjid but architecture-wise ok ok
Review: If you are carrying a backpack and as we had visited Charminar during Ramzan month , so for the security reason we had been asked to put that in a cloak room that is inside Mecca Masjid. That was the sole reason I went inside it. It's a big Masjid - in front of there is one water body that is maintained decently . Personally for me I didn't find this place is an architectural marvel. I wonder why there is no big central dome in this mosque which is otherwise been present !

Name: afsmr
Title: maintanence required
Review: women should cover their head to enter the mosque, isnt well maintained..therz a water fountain and its full of bird droppings...,u can feed the birds..local vendors sell bird foods...

Name: Vanessa H
Title: Grand buidling
Review: Very impressive building but unfortunately it was closed for rebuild when I was there. Make sure you visit it when its open again, and wear appropriate attire or you will not be allowed near it. They do hand out scarf to cover you shoulders, but legs also need to be completely covered.

Name: Dymita
Title: A mosque near Chaminar
Review: This mosque location is not far from Chaminar, one of Hyderabad landmark. Surrounded by a traditional market, a place that very very crowded. There's an inspection by security before you can enter the mosque courtyard, and ladies mandatory to wear hijab to enter. If you don't have it, they will lend you a scarf or shawl that you use as veil to cover your hair. A very unfortunate condition where there is a lot of bird droppings in the courtyard of the mosque so that it looks less maintained and slum.Caution with your belongings.

Name: Ruth M
Title: An important Hyderabad monument
Review: The Mecca Masjid is an important monument in old Hyderabad. It was built in the 16th and 17 centuries is one of the largest mosques in India. It will be of more interest to Muslims who wish to worship there. For non-Muslims there is not a great deal to see.

Name: Muhammed A
Title: Beautiful Masjid
Review: Huge masjid right next to Charminar and opposite an old hospital that looks more like a palace. Lots of birds, even with hundreds of people it felt very peaceful.Also walking distance from Chowmahalla Palace.

Name: Waman_Parulekar
Title: One of the largest mosques in India
Review: Mecca Masjid is one of the largest mosques in India located near to Char Minar. This mosque is an architectural marvel built by Qutb Shah. If you want to go inside, you need to keep your shoes and backpack outside and decent clothes are expected. Women are required to cover their head with a scarf. A must visit place for history lovers.

Name: Tour785520
Title: Gate way to Bhagyanagar
Review: Charminar has been most charming land mark not only for Hyderabad,but for India,Most colourful and most vibrant place of Hydrabad.Bangle,herbals,traditional dyes and many natural and traditional cosmotics.The most important thing is the mosque inside in upper level, was a place where Mughul Emperor,Aurangajeb used to pray when he invaded Golkonda

Name: Dilip kumar
Title: Famous sacred place
Review: This [place is known for best sacred place and has got its own importance and will lead you to the grreat architechture.

Name: Lingang
Title: Very large, monumentally built
Review: Because it is located city center, all tourist probably will visit the inside of it just because it is there. It has not much particularly to see though other than huge grand and many tomb of the kings. Also be aware of many so called guides who really just want some money,,,

Name: MhdMuqthar
Title: A historical mosque nearby charminar!
Review: This mosque is believed to have stones brought from Mecca in Saudi Arabia. Situated nearby the charminar. Built centuries ago!

Name: nik c
Title: Another nice Mosque
Review: Mecca Masjid is another very nice Mosque.   It was undergoing a restoration during our visit.   Situated next to Charminar it is well worth a visit to both and have a wander around the area.

Name: Shahid B
Title: Holidaying
Review: A visit to the masjid was basically to offer prayers.The masjid is beautifully designed with its contemporary architecture.The time of our visit they had renovations going on and we missed on seeing the chandeliers and other structures inside.Hoping to see it next time when we visit Hyderabad again.

Name: RitaKakkar
Title: Impressive structure
Review: Close to Charminar, it is an impressive structure. Only had a look from the outside on the way to car parking nearby. Looks better maintained than Charminar.Surprisingly, we did not find anyone selling replicas of Charminar. In fact, I have one excellent replica at home, bought in Delhi itself.

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Mosque under restoration
Review: This is an old mosque situated near Charminar in Hyderabad. This mosque was under going restoration process during our visit. Nice architecture and peaceful ambiance. People from different religions can also visit this place.Decent outfit is compulsory.

Name: Ordubadli
Title: Workers Ruin the experience
Review: Fist, there is a huge construction taking place. Secondly, once they see a foreigner come in, even their employees come and first seem helpful to explain the history, etc., and then ask for SADAGA - donation to mosque - bluntly. And when you offer something that is not to their liking (too low), they complain to your face! These guys are not true Muslims - Muslims do not beg, and do not act anywhere like these guys. What a disgrace!

Name: Anu789
Title: Close to Char Minar
Review: Mecca Masjid is close to Char Minar, you could visit if you are in the area. Remember to dress modestly while visiting Mecca Masjid.

Name: SandeepSaxena-IIP
Title: Mecca Masjid- oldest mosques in Hyderabad
Review: Mecca Masjid, is one of the oldest mosques in Hyderabad, Telangana in India, and it is one of the largest masjids in India. Makkah Masjid is a listed heritage building in the old city of Hyderabad, close to the historic landmarks of Chowmahalla Palace, Laad Bazaar, and Charminar.The main feature of Mecca Masjid is its hall which is about 23 meters high, 67 meters wide and 55 meters long. The three walls of this huge hall are supported by fifteen arches, five arches each. Each of the fifteen arches is portrayed with sermons from the Holy Book of Quran. It is said that the hall of Mecca Masjid can accommodate about 10,000 people at a time during worship.There is a pond within the complex with seating arrangements at the edges. There is also a room in the courtyard that stores holy relics, among which the most important is the hair of Prophet Mohammed.

Name: RainedOnInRedmond
Title: Be on guard here - tourist trap
Review: Have visited many mosques and other religious monuments in many countries.  Not the best experience here.  I am white so I stand out as a tourist.  Came around lunchtime.  I came into the courtyard and you have to take off your shoes and socks and when you come back they will expect you to pay for their watching your shoes.  I came in and an old guy offered to show me something interesting (which should have been a red flag, my error) and he took me around the corner to show me some graves of the local rules.  Then him and another old Muslim guy started pressuring me to deposit some money on this grave and say a prayer, and I realized that I was now out of view of the crowd and alone with these two guys who are trying to extract money.  I politely walked away, back to where the shoes are.  By this time my feet have ample dirt on them.  I walked around in the courtyard toward the main mosque and it's impressive enough.  However the cobblestones were filthy on my bare feet and I decided to go look around other things in the Charminar area instead.It would probably be a better experience with a guide or local friend.

Name: fozjon
Title: important site in the center of the city
Review: this is a huge Mosque. It's definitely worth stopping and taking a look when you go to see Charminar.

Name: Suhail Siddqui
Title: Beautiful and Mesmerizing Mosque
Review: Religious place and very old mosque of Old Hyderabad. Beautifully crafted with touch of royalty. This place and charminar are very close to each other (i should say stone throw distance), You can cover both at same place.Very beautiful and must to see. Lots of eatery around and shopping place.

Name: rsraghavan6
Title: Good place
Review: One of the ancient masjids in the city of Hyderabad is the Mecca Masjid. It is also the one of the largest among the religious buildings in Hyderabad.There are fifteen arches in the mosque. A lofty wall covers the west of the Mecca Masjid. It has been named after the Grand Mosque that is situated at Mecca. The mosque in Hyderabad is patterned on the world famous mosque in Mecca.It is one of the sacred places of worship for the Muslims.Good Location for shopping who are interested in bangle and clothes.

Name: Ravikanthvadamala
Title: Iconic structure
Review: Very old, just next to Charminar. Beautiful structure and amazing place. Visited recently. Must see place.

Name: neha_traveldiary
Title: Beautiful mosque
Review: It is a beautiful mosque with huge courtyard full of gurgling pigeons that attract the kids. Women are not allowed inside the prayer hall but can visit the complex and feel the faith. Advise travelers to dress modestly as it is a religious place!

Name: Mamdouh S
Title: Impressive huge mosque
Review: The mosque is amazing, its scale and decorative elements are remarkable. The courtyard is always full of hundreds of pigeons which is a very peaceful scene to look at.

Name: Nish0901
Title: Masjid near Charminar
Review: I visited this Masjid in the evening. I deposited my backpack outside without paying anything. The Masjid was very clean. If you want to go inside, you need to deposit shoes outside on chargeable basis (Rs 5 per pair). You can also take photographs of Charminar from this Masjid.

Name: Debojyoti Roy
Title: Nice place
Review: A nice place to visit in Hyderabad. Located adjacent to Charminar. This is one of the largest mosques in India with 10,000 capacity. The tombs of the first six Nizams are located in main courtyard.

Name: Adnan_Chowdhury67
Title: Juma prayers at the iconic mosque
Review: Visiting from Bangladesh, I had the wonderful opportunity to visit and pray at this iconic Mosque that is one of the oldest mosques in Hyderabad, India and it is one of the largest in India. Makkah Masjid is a listed as a  heritage building in India.The mosque was completed in 1694 and can accommodate 20,000 faithful. Though I am pretty I didn't see 20,000 it was full a huge gathering this juma.The mosque has a water reservoir where the water is bright sky blue. It's an amazing  scene.After prayers I stopped at one of the fruit juices shops and had the best orange jiuce for around a dollar ! It was chilled and really the spot after a  long day.Make sure you visit this place. Is steps away from Charminar. Non muslims are welcome after prayer time.

Name: Noor Ali Abbas
Title: Amazing Architecture
Review: Makkah Masjid is an amazing architectural monument. It is the oldest and the largest mosque of Hyderabad city. As the name indicates, it was build with stones from Makkah, Saudi Arabia.The mosque is very clean and looks very beautiful. It has a large prayer hall with attractive lights. Separate prayer hall for ladies is also available.The area around the mosque is very crowded and it attracts tourists since it is located near Charminar. Charminar, Laad Bazaar and Chowmahalla Palace are nearby attractions.

Name: venkatakarthik
Title: iconic place with lots of pigeons
Review: being one of the attractions in the hyderabad, it is best place to visit with friends and also admire the ingenuity of our ancestors constructions.

Name: Karthik R
Title: A mosque with history
Review: Makkah Masjid is believed to be built with few stones taken from the original Mecca Masjid. Hence, the name. One can see this well from Charminar.

Name: muthukrish2000
Title: Mosque
Review: This is just located near to Charminar. I didn't visited inside only from the outside of the mosque get a chance to go around. It's really wide and beautiful.

Name: niya27
Title: Near charminar
Review: Both Muslims and non Muslims can visit there. But only Muslims can go inside big prayer hall. You have to remove your shoes outside. Bags can be stored outside on a nominal fee.

Name: chandrasekhar g
Title: Mecca Masjid located infront of charminar
Review: High security is provided in masjid area.Electronic checking is must for devotees while entering into masjid.spacious area inside masjid.birds will fly over there for water and food.famous masjid in hyderabad.

Name: moizuddinahmed
Title: Grandeur surrouded by chaos
Review: This mosque is so grand and is a reminder of the Mughal Architecture that was gifted to us. But the vicinity in which it is located needs a lot of work and cleanliness. Hope the authorities take a note.

Name: Abhilash K
Title: Very large
Review: It is one of the biggest masjid in the Hyderabad and even I am Hindu and I liked the place and the culture

Name: Sunil K
Title: Not bed just OK
Review: Well Mecca masjid do not have must to see inside but its exterior and entrance ground is very huge and main attraction of this place. Peoples enjoy alot with pigeons there. Masjid do not have any entry ticket. But be careful while visiting the Masjid do not wear shorts or half pent.

Name: Karthik Dasu
Title: Famous Mosque
Review: It is one of the famous mosque in the city of Hyderabad.it is located right adjacent to the charminar.A good place to visit,

Name: Daniel T
Title: Most famous mosque in Hyderabad
Review: Its a well known landmark in Hyderabad's Old city. Close to Charminar.For tourists, Its worth visiting once, especially early in the morning. You can explore the place in peace.Ladies are required to cover their head with a scarf.Visitors are eitherway not allowed into the central prayer hall, we can only walk around the main prayer hall.

Name: Ravi Pratap Singh Chauhan
Title: Nothing to talk about
Review: The soil used is from Mecca, period. It's a Masjid like any other in India nothing new to talk about

Name: Devaa
Title: The Biggest Mosque in Hyderabad
Review: After Charminar the structure which immediately draw your attention is this sprawling Mosque at a stone throw distance . This imposing structure comes into live during namaz and can accommodate a large congregation.It is listed in the heritage site. The surroundings is very dirty and could have been kept more clean ,government has plan to beautify the area and it is in process.

Name: Rajesh_in
Title: Famous Landmark
Review: Mecca Masjid, near Char Minar , is a well known landmark in the old city of Hyderabad. It is in a crowded place and always people around the same. It is one of the biggest mosques .

Name: J Chand
Title: Huge area
Review: Huge area covered but surrounding is very dirty and poorly maintained. Alwways bad smell comes and becomes horrible to stay a minute.

Name: Sumitkumar_13
Title: Famous
Review: Mecca Masjid is one of the famous masjid of Hyderabad city. It is quite big campus and well maintained.

Name: anshu119
Title: Worth a visit
Review: Located right besides Charminar, Mecca Masjid deserves a visit. One can have a look at the good architecture as well as admire the building. Some nice views of the Charminar can also be seen from the Masjid courtyard.

Name: bharadwaj8008
Title: Historical place
Review: Excellent place for visiting and to offer prayers and see the historical art of Nizam's construction. We can also see Charminar from this site. We have a Unani Hospital near to this Masjid.

Name: blani
Title: Busy but quiet at the same time
Review: One of the largest mosques not only in India completed in 1687 by Aurangzeb after he took over the Golconda Kingdom. It is believed that the bricks used for the construction were brought from Mecca.

Name: _sharonelserwy
Title: Disappointing for ladies
Review: Not even Muslim ladies are allowed inside the mosques in Hyderabad so there is no opportunity for women to see inside the building. You can walk around the courtyard bare-footed tying to avoid the pigeon droppings and then when you get back to the entrance to reclaim your shoes you'll be asked for money by the lady on guard duty.

Name: mohamedriji
Title: Historical monument
Review: Mecca Masjid is one of the oldest as well as largest mosques in Hyderabad. It is a heritage building in the old city of Hyderabad, close to Charminar. Very calm place to sit for sometime.

Name: Veer2468
Title: Very impressive
Review: The surrounding areas to this place is too much crowded but once you reach here its divine! It is a massive mosque.

Name: Gregory D
Title: Huge impressive mosque
Review: This massive mosque, close to the Charminar, holds 10000 worshippers. Although, as non Moslems, we were not allowed inside the mosque itself, it was very interesting walking around the forecourt and appreciating the size and architecture of the building.

Name: Afreen S
Title: The essence of Hyderabad!
Review: The Masjid is located in the densely populated area of Hyderabad bustling with people all around, selling stuff ranging from jewelry to fruits to perfumes! But the moment you enter the Masjid, there is this calmness which is so soothing. You'd see people either praying or lying on those marble floors.. in meditation. However there were two things that really bothered me. 1st, lack of regular cleaning and maintenance. There were pigeon poop everywhere. Secondly, there should be better security! I mean, the main entrance had all kinds of checking and frisking. But if you happen to come by the back door, you can just enter without any Security Check! That's something that should be looked into.

Name: Vivek G
Title: Too much hustle and bustle
Review: It was too much crowded. They provide a dupatta to all girls without one. The view of Char Minar from here is good. The mosque is very old and is of great historical value.

Name: JaganRampal
Title: Grand for the believers
Review: A majestic monument and place of worship.. The structures have immense religious significance, but are equally a piece of artistic architecture.

Name: Amanda W
Title: Can't go in - it's not allowed
Review: You can only walk around this masjid unless you are a male muslim. The building is great, but I wouldn't bother making the effort to visit as you can't get inside and truly experience what is supposed to be the beauty...

Name: Anamika K
Title: Good place for leuisure
Review: The place is very clean and doesn't disappoint. There is a place for feeding pigeons and also houses resting place. Though we weren't allowed inside of the masjid, the masjid is an architectural beauty and vast. There is no entry fee and it just beside the Charminar.

Name: khijirahammed
Title: Char Minar
Review: Mecca Masjid is near Char Minar. I visited that place. Good place for muslim prayer. Many people travel to see the mecca masjid.

Name: ameer h
Title: Pleace of MInd
Review: Lovely place to have peace of mind. Umrah has been streamlined and Tawaf can be done only in the upper floors.

Name: Jason E
Title: Did not feel welcome here
Review: Beautiful place, went for a better understanding of Islam, had a good chat outside with some people and I loved that.  Then, for reasons unknown, we got thrown out of the Mosque.  Only place in Hyderabad where I felt unwelcome.

Name: Kernal S
Title: Best place to Perform Salah
Review: Public place it is many people come here to rest after performing shopping. Have facility for bathrooms and to do wazu. Outside you can find number variety of dishes hotels and shopping shops at a cheap rate.

Name: claritalewis
Title: Oldest Mosque
Review: This is the biggest mosque I have ever visited. It is not maintained well. Visited on Sunday in the afternoon. It is near the market area

Name: Sam S
Title: One of the oldest mosques of Hyderabad.
Review: I prayed in this mosque along with my brother, uncle and several others on one Friday noon during the summer holidays in the year 1987. There is a sundial, few graves, a big houz to perform ablution. It reminds us of the love of our ancestors for all the new generations and our love towards the heritage. The legacy continues but the Govt. and NGOs' must do more to improvise its sanctity on an international standard. The Charminar bus station beside it must be added to the metro rail or at least tram to facilitate the commuters living nearby the monument.

Name: LizaK0017
Title: poorly maintained
Review: this is supposed to be a place for worship but bird's poop was everywhere. The main prayer area is closed but one can pray at the balcony. You just have to avoid the birds poo, yikes..The ablution area is dirty and does not separate gender

Name: annejang
Title: Strict Dress code
Review: A couple of my friends and I were exploring the area around charminar and went to visit Mecca Masjid which is located right next to Charminar. We were covered and wearing kurti/ tee shirt with jeans but weren't allowed inside. We decided to get some duppata ( sold outside for 100 rupees which is overpriced) to cover our heads. Despite that we weren't allowed to enter. We took few pictures in the courtyard and left.

Name: Madhavi74
Title: Masjid
Review: Makha Masjid is oe of the oldest mosque in hyderabad.It is located near to charminar.It is very famous masjid in hyderabad.

Name: GayathriSharma
Title: Beautiful view from Charminar
Review: It's beautiful Masjid one can enjoy it's views from Charminar view points,famous in hyderabad.It has beautiful pond too

Name: rajveer0072016
Title: Makkah Masjid
Review: Makkah Masjid, is one of the oldest mosque in Hyderabad, India, and it is one of the largest masajid in India. Makkah Masjid is a listed heritage building in the old city of Hyderabad, close to the historic landmarks of Chowmahalla Palace, Laad Bazaar, and Charminar.It is famous because commissioned bricks to be made from the soil brought from Mecca.

Name: Mohamed Shakeer
Title: Just Beside Charminar
Review: The Masjid is located just walk able distance from Charminar , one can walk around and have the beauty of construction

Name: Rajani K
Title: Needs better maintenance
Review: This mosque cum tomb is located close to Charminar. It was built by Muhammad Quli Qutb Shahi, the then Qutb Shahi sultan of Hyderabad towards end of 17th century.The central arch was made with soil brought from mecca and hence it is called Mecca masjid.  The place has a very big central halls, several pillars and minarets.  The town of Nizams is housed here.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: peaceful place
Review: You will feel peaceful once you go to this place though there is a buzz of the crowd.there is a place to keep the bags and can be collected.you can see a lot of pigeons here.Since its a spiritual place guys cant wear shorts and women should wear appropriately

Name: Shailendra
Title: Historic mosque
Review: Located next to Charminar, Mecca mosque is one the prominent historical monument in Hyderabad. Architecture is simple and stable.Worth a visit if you are visiting Charminar.

Name: Bhavik Mody
Title: Grand Icon of Religion
Review: Mecca Masjid is situated besides the Charminar and is considered to be one of the biggest masjids of India. It is grand and huge. Made up of black stone it has its own way of impressing piousness on each one who enters the premises. If you are going to Charminar do visit this place. Won't take much time and will be an experience of its own

Name: Farjad A
Title: Wonderfully historic
Review: Very evocative mosque, full of elegance and history. The resting place of some former Nizam's. Really encapsulates Hyderabad.

Name: shekhehshan
Title: feeling like mecca
Review: very peaceful and historical place to visit. i was here during maghrib time to offer prayer.what a relief i got after nama that i cant explain in words.also a great place for leisure time.we can also see charminar from the mosque campus.

Name: Prasobh K
Title: Holy place - please do visit
Review: Mecca Masjid in the Charminar area is a great holy place to visit and offer prayers. Please do visit irrespective of your faith for a peaceful prayer !!

Name: trolleybag786
Title: Mecca Masjid
Review: A beautiful piece of architecture just a few meters away from the Charminar. Quiet and peaceful. Entry inside the mosque is restricted to followers of the religion.

Name: Krishna Sandeep Siram
Title: Must place to visit
Review: This place is peaceful and we can get mind relaxation playing with the pigeons and it is must when we visit charminar.!!

Name: Sree p
Title: Worth a visit
Review: This masjid is very next to the Charminar..... This provides an opportunity to anyone who has ever visited a masjid before...

Name: Krishna
Title: Parking Chaos -Avoid Nexus Forum
Review: Can anyone give mall parking to second car sales? Mall Management given to spinny complete 3 floors that from ground to 3 floors .how foolish ???? Keeping customer facility at bay..Already Mall lost its glory post covid .. though renovated..not par with other malls in the city and now this parking chaos....if you wanna hang out ... avoid Forum or Nexus now.

Name: PKB
Title: Overall Good
Review: It was good mall,no dowt. So many international brands Shop. Good movie theatre, fast food corner but only things need to improve is housekeeping cleaning

Name: sk a
Title: Bad experience
Review: The environment here is not friendly. I was sitting at a place hanging with my friends and doing my office work in my laptop. Someone from the staff came and put a card on the table without even a word and left.The card is mentioning not to work here which is disgusting .

Name: Loukya Gummadi
Title: Central Store
Review: Forum Sujana mall is a really good place to visit with family or friends. But recently when I went to Central store, Sujana mall for shopping with my family, I had to wait for a really long time for the billing. At last I had to leave behind a pair of clothes as the casher said it would take them a lot of time to resolve the problem. The cost on the tags and the computer were also different (computer showing less cost then the tags). The casher claimed that the computer was not showing the MRP. I couldn't buy the shirt I really liked as they were unable to resolve the problem within time. I was late for my next tasks because of this. Altogether I didn't have a good experience in this shop at all. Hope you can resolve problems like this.

Name: Archana
Title: 2times
Review: hyderabadForum is quite complete, PVR multi screen, a games arcade, food-court, starbucks, TGIF, and all the retailers you would like to shop at. The mall has ample parking and the best is multilevel parking that gives you direct

Name: vamsikrishna
Title: Shopping cum movies cum eateries
Review: The Forum Sujana Mall Kukatpally Hyderabad which has become the epicentre of entertainment is located at K P H B Phase 9, Kukatpally, Hyderabad, Telangana and remains open between 10:30AM–11PM. It is 820,000 square feet totally and was established in the year 2014. It has stores inside of the mall with different kinds of food outlets likeDil Punjabi, CocaCola, cream store, Keventers, Kailash Parbat, sizzling joe, Tibb’s Frankie etc. The mall also helps in conducting live events for Forum Purple Run, Summer Mania, Meet & Greet Chhota Bheem, Forum Rock on, Christmas Carnival etc are some of the events. Some of its amenities include Restrooms, Prayer room, Wi Fi, ATM, Lost and Found, first aid room to name a few. Some of the shopping brands include Bata, Haans, Maarket 99, Accessorize, Forever 21, adidas, Sephora, Smaaash, All, Solly, AND, Arrow, arches, American Tourishter, Clarks to name a few.I recommend it..

Name: Lucky143
Title: Shopping malls, food stalls and movies mania
Review: I love forum sujana pvr mall,I had a lot of memories in this place with my friends and family members,This mall had a lot of shopping experience with huge discounts ,And also food stalls like BURGER KING, KFC,PIZZA HUT ,DOMINOS,etcAnd i love burger king..When iam boring my first preference is forum pvr sujana mall for best movie experience..My best suggestion go and experience this mall..

Name: Akillchowdary
Title: Shopping malls and PVR cinemas
Review: Lot of shopping malls with great offers and also great cinema experience with pvr cinemas,and also budget shopping cloth experience,Lot food stalls like burger king,pizza hut, subway,etc..are had..great time spending....

Name: ellesse1952
Title: Neat and Clean Shopping Mall, with Universal Appeal
Review: It is a fairly big shopping Mall, with a wide range of retail outlets, food court, stand-alone restaurants, a multiplex, hypermarket and entertainment options. It also has really spacious parking facilities, both for two and four wheelers. The Mall is quite neat and clean and has something to offer for all ages and tastes. It is very well located, amidst residential localities and in close proximity to the IT hub of Hyderabad. The Starbucks outlet offers a good opportunity to rest a while and enjoy a well deserved cup of coffee.

Name: sunil
Title: One place for all your needs
Review: A very good mall with good options for food and beverages.We can go on shopping spree in this place .The only disappointing thing is the seats in pvr wch are very close without proper gapping between the rows.

Name: Supraja
Title: Good place for refreshment
Review: I have been to sujana mall with my friends it was a very hectic day for us . But as we visited mall we felt refreshment

Name: Prudhvi
Title: Nice place to shop and have fun
Review: It is located near to hitech city. It has several famous brand stores to shop. There is a food court to relax and have food. There is kid zone for kids to play and box office to watch cinemas

Name: Praveen
Title: Superb....
Review: I visited every week in this mall. I will spend all day and enjoyed in the mall. Simply very good place for visiting.

Name: Karthik K
Title: Good Collection of stores.
Review: Has good connectivity for prime locations and has good range of stores. easily accessible through cheap modes of transportation.

Name: imprash_p
Title: Decent mall
Review: Its a decent mall located in kukatpally area, it has most of the national as well as International brands for apparels, food, toys, electronics and much more. There is a food court with good options, kid's zone and a citibank Atm also.This mall has a multiplex theatre also. If u are just looking for a cafe, Coffee Day and Star Bucks both are present. Overall a nice place for shopping and entertainment.

Name: Shastry
Title: Loved it
Review: Ample parking area is available which is good for easy exit and entry. This mall has all international popular brands mostly for women. Amenities are good.

Name: Sunil
Title: Decent mall
Review: The mall is quite good and it’s located in famous area Banjara Hills where not Telugu celebrity stays. The mall is quite decent and it’s Looks really good and happening place in weekend

Name: rihab k
Title: Banjara hills
Review: It has good quality things of international Mark's and the price is reasonable. But the food restaurants with card bank just , not available by cash.

Name: Andukuri srinath
Title: Day full of entertainment
Review: Good for spending full day. You can shop everything from clothes to electronics and movie to live events

Name: kaliprasadm2016
Title: leisurely place
Review: it is a good place to hang out. nice food court on the top floorMultiple screens.for watching movies. Shops are not crowded.

Name: dsingla2015
Title: All under one roof
Review: Nice place to hand out and shop about right from low end to high end designer stuff. Good eateries and fun place for kids too...

Name: annejang
Title: Good Mall for Family Outing!
Review: The food court is really good with lots of options. There is a zone for kids to play and my niece had a good time. Lots of ethnic wear shops as well as  a supermarket for household necessities. There are a many restaurants and trendy shops too .  This mall has everything for everyone.

Name: Arunkumar
Title: Nice place to hangout in weekends
Review: A place where entertainment, food ,games,shoping meet up. Can spend a great day for foodies ,movie lovers and shoppers ..

Name: Anita Pradhan
Title: Nice Shopping Mall
Review: The only place to have a ZARA showroom in Hyderabad. The mall is quite big with lots of brand outlets and eateries. The card system for food court seems bit complicated and time consuming.  The parking facilities are good. Overall it has a variety of outlets and eateries and is a good place to shop, dine and enjoy with friends & family.

Name: Vishnu Teja
Title: Family time
Review: Very good place to hang on with family. Nice to have shopping, watching movies, a good place in Hyderabad for recreation.

Name: Ratna Kamalakar V
Title: Nothing great about it
Review: Parking is pathetic. Otherwise it is just like any other mall. Nothing bad or nothing great. Games zone is kinda okay. Food options are fair. Overall a decent place.

Name: Mohankrishna Eluri
Title: Pvr is good
Review: More chances of getting tickets because of more  Audi's and Food Court is good. Parking charges are more if didn't purchase anything and u spent more than 3 hours if u book a movie .

Name: Srisadhana
Title: Excellent place
Review: The entrance will speak a lot. It’s been great fun. Forum has lot of stores from worlds best selling brands. A whole day will be enough to spend.

Name: TabrezN
Title: Spacious and friendly mall with good gentry
Review: Easy drive to the place. Has excellent ambiance and is quite spacious and well organized. The choice of food is also great.

Name: jainms
Title: Sujana Mall
Review: One of the must visit mall in Hyderabad, very large and have several stores with several options. Cafeteria / food court is not that much good.

Name: Kuenzy
Title: One-stop-shop
Review: This mall offers a wide range of options (shopping, grocery, food) at affordable prices. It's very accessible and is located at the heart of the city. It's so convenient to shop because it's only five minutes away from my hotel-Trident. I was surprised that one salesperson even remembered me the next day I went to the grocery to get more spices and chocolates. 😊 Kudos to the team.

Name: Dilip kumar
Title: One of the Biggest mall
Review: This place has got variety of clothing showrooms and it has got good ambiance and you can spend a lot of time and have fun with your friends .

Name: Sujana
Title: Forum mall review
Review:
Hi Mr. Dilip.

Thank you for your kind words. We hope to keep entertaining you and your friends and family, whenever you visit Forum Sujana. Hope you have a great time again on your next visit.

Name: Sakaray S
Title: The fashion city
Review:
Hi Mr. Dilip.

Thank you for your kind words. We hope to keep entertaining you and your friends and family, whenever you visit Forum Sujana. Hope you have a great time again on your next visit.

Name: ramakrishnabanoth3
Title: One of the biggest malls in Hyd
Review: Visited krishna pearls and Jewellers in forum sujana mall ,Hyderabad  recently .. They have great collections and excellent customer service by Mr. Majumdar .

Name: Daniel T
Title: One of the big malls in Hyderabad
Review: A tremendous place for shopping and also for having food feast.Can enjoy watching movies along with all the stuff above.Good place to have fun.

Name: Usha65
Title: Nice mall with good collection of stores!!
Review: When it was first opened up for public, the shear size of this mall was too much to comprehend. One of the biggest malls in the city, its very organized and easy to navigate within. Each floor has separate escalators to go up or down. Many international brands have their stores here. Worth coming here for some upscale brand shopping.

Name: BhumiSanJose_CA
Title: Forum sujana
Review: Among the existing malls in Hyderabad, this one is a huge mall with almost all major branded shops, well maintained, neat and most of the time very clean. Food court is a good attraction in this mall. Great place for shopping and relaxed moments.

Name: Padma
Title: Good Mall
Review: Good experience and very clean, nice food court with all types of food options. Both indian stores and international stores.

Name: PariveshD
Title: Good One!
Review: Visited this place many times. Mostly on all weekends events will held here. As usual good shopping and food court is available. Of course forum is Hyderabads biggest mall as of and good number of movie screens also available.It would be better if any entertainment is provided for adults 😉 to like scary house , etc..,

Name: Dinesh_cbe
Review: All major brands are available at this mall. The food court is congested and does have a variety of food. If bored, good place to relax and rewind.

Good international and Indian brand stores here to shop apparels & accessories, food court with major chain of restaurants and movie screens also a part of this mall. Overall structure & lightings is pretty impressive.

Name: fozjon

A good selection of shops over three floors and a movie theatre on the top. I felt that some of the branded shops were then duplicated as concessions within larger shops but,  I could over look that.  The place was clean and tidy and that would just fine for now.I was impressed at the size of the food hall, didn’t eat anything but it was sizable.

You have to buy coupons and use that to buy food. Any balance left can be converted back into cash. A good place to beat a few hours.

The Forum is a fairly large property, unlike many other "malls" in Hyderabad. It is quite well-maintained as well. There's a good collection of brands/retail stores. The reason for the average rating - it has a pretty crappy food court payment solution. You need to buy a prepaid card loaded with cash and you can buy only with that card inside. No cash/credit cards. Worst part - if you are new to the mall, like I was, I had no idea on what the price charts looked like for each outlet. And there's queues for loading cash, and rushing back since you fell a few rupees short of what you calculated you expected to eat (seriously, singularly amongst the worst payment implementations for a mall setting). Management, if you are reading this, cash and credit cards work. You need to figure a better way of ensuring your tenants share sales data if you don't trust them! Not thrust a crappy solution on every visiting patron.

Dear Guest, 

We regret the inconvenience caused to you. There are other reasons and thought for the prepaid card system currently in place.However, we certainly take your feedback and shall explore initiatives for further simplification.

Team Forum
