Review: Simple and spiritual place with state of art architecture.Its currently under renovation and soon expected to get even better.

Name: V V S Ganesh N
Title: Holy place of Goddess Laxmi in DSNR
Review: ashtalakhmi temple in Dilsukhnagar is Holy place of Goddess Laxmi with great maintenance and centrally located in houses surrounded.the major thing that need to specify here is that its maintenace..

Name: nagesh1955
Title: visit of ashtalakshmi temple
Review: Very big temple near to Dilsuknagar, We can see the temple with very much rush as it is situated in the busy area

Name: Krishnan S
Title: Darshan of 8 Lakhmi Deities at One Place.....Very Holy.
Review: 12 KM from the Centre of the City of Hyderabad, well designed and constructed on a elevated place. neatly maintained and Daily Pooj is performed as per the Hindu Pooja rituals, Located in the Midst of the Residential Locality, ample car parking and easy accesible from the main road by Autos and Share autos. The Steps to climb are well designed even for the elders / aged to climb. good resting places are there near Sanctum after darshan, water arrangements are there for drinking. daily distribution of the Prasadam are happening without fail.Good to visit on Saturdays and Sundays...being the Women deity the Tuesdays and Fridays are normally crowded. on festival days will take minimum of 30 to 40 minutes time to complete thre darshan.

Name: V V S Ganesh N
Title: Holy Place
Review: Asthalakshmi Temple  loacated near to kothapet in surroundings of LB nagar and Dilsukh Nagar is maintained by Kanchi trust.the maintenance and poojas performed in a traditional way were very good.

Name: sarvesh4u
Title: Devine Place
Review: Ashtalakshmi Temple is popular destination in a busy and crowded place and yet so calm and devine.  Peaceful time in place of goddess Lakshmi is really appreciable.

Name: KalyanSamrajyam
Title: nice place to visit
Review: idêal time is early mornings or late evenings...properly maintained temple premises.small parking area

Name: Georgio Valentino Rayala
Title: Best Temple Near Kothapet
Review: This Temple is located in Kothapet and is very crowded on Fridays.We visited this Temple on Thursday at Noon and there were around 100 devotees inside the temple.It took us a total of 30 minutes for the whole Darshan.Photography is not allowed inside the Main temple where you can see Balaji Idol in the center and surrounding him are the eight forms of Goddess Lakshmi in Idols.After the Darshan you can get free Prasad which was very good.Also three forms of Prasad is sold here: Laddu,Pulihoora and Wada which all are priced Rs.10.The Environment was very pleasant and outside the temple there is also a Marriage Hall.

Name: rkkoya
Title: Very popular among ladies
Review: This temple is popular among ladies. always full with public well maintained. Does not have enough parking space.

Name: superb114
Title: place for worship
Review: nice place for worship really pleasant environment visited the place several times and it will be crowded in some part of the days

Name: TEJAVATH
Title: Asthalakshmi Temple
Review: This temple is very good and so many visitors came to this temple and pray the god.The temple is famous in LB nagar area.

Name: superb114
Title: Pleasant Temple
Review: Really a beautiful temple with pleasant environment for worship of goddess lakshmi temple and it will fully crowded on fridays and sundays

Name: sudheerg08
Title: Peace of mind guaranteed!!!
Review: First weekend of this month I visited along with my wife and my two kids aged seven years and five years old.We can find the address of this temple easily. Astalakshmi temple arch is located on the main road towards dilsukhnagar to L.B nagar besides more super market. The location of this temple is in vasavi colony. Opposit to the temple there is big open plot converted to free parking place by the temple authority. I parked my car in the place provided. We washed our legs and entered in the temple.When we entered the temple our hearts filled spiritual power and silence, thanks to Goddess Astalaxmi. Our children also very much enjoyed and meditated for half an hour. Photograpy inside the temple is prohibited, so we took the photographs on stairs. My children are really enjoyed. I surpriced to my childrens behaviour in the temple, generally they are very talkative at home and when we are shopping, but when we enter in the temple, there minds filled with spiritual power, they are completely silent, maybe the environment in the temple.We stayed there for two hours and went back to home with peace of mind heartfully and decided to come every weekend.Thanks n regardsSudheer.G8885559150

Name: aarti_rele
Title: Excellent temple made in Marble
Review: We visited this temple. Felt good to see Hindu temple in Hyderabad which was ruled by Muslim Nizams & Nawabs & their generations. The temple is extremely well maintained.

Name: Kondraju Y
Title: Ashta Lakshmi temple - Kothapet
Review: This is very famous temple. All avatars of Lakshmi place in one area we can find differentiate the Avatars in the temple. Pleasant temple and glow in the faces of each idol of lakshmi

Name: SrilathaVemula
Title: A must see place at Kothapeta

The trees and plants in the temple give a pleasant and happy mood to all the people going in and coming out.

Name: higghligght shiva
Title: The divine of godesses ashtalakshmi temple
Review: The design and the architecture  of D temple is nice inside ambience and maintenance is good 1st u can see adhi lakshmi inmiddle and side surroundings  all other idols like aishwarya lakshmi,santhana lakshmi, dhana lakshmi,dhanya lakshmi,vijaya lakshmi gaja lakshmi,veeralakshmi.i heard this temple many times at last i gone its apowerful temple,archana ticket is 21rs and astalakshmi pooja archana500rs so i done archana i suggest  travellers and hyderabadis must visit this place.jai mata di

Review: a Temple dedicated to goddess lakshmi. all the 8 avatars of goddess are here in this temple. the temple is also famous and well known.

Review: the temple as the name suggests is a place where one can find all teh avatars of Goddess lakshmi in one place.

Name: Harshith358
Title: cleanliness is close to Godliness
Review: This is the place where you find everything clean. The temple is perfectly designed and well maintained. The whole place well organised. Its a must visit.

Name: Narasimha Prasad G
Title: Rich Temple
Review: This temple located on Vijayawada Road ,very beautiful constructed by marble  and well maintained .I prefer you to visit this temple in late evening time

Name: Praveen K
Title: Landmark in itself
Review: The LAkshmi temple is a landmark in itself in the busy Dilsukhnagar Area. The temple offers a peaceful darshan of goddess of wealth - Lakshmi devi. The various avatars of Ammavaru are at one palce.

Name: Haokip
Title: Nice Temple
Review: Ashta Lakshmi Temple is also one of the nice temple in hyderabad, mainly Hindus loved them very much as well as every people living aroung, and also worth seeing for all travellers.

Name: Sriram K
Title: One of Hyderabad's crowing jewels and a fantastic Temple
Review: we have been visiting Temple since it was first constructed and love it each time we go. However the crowd has quadrapuled over the past 10 yrs and hence its better that anyone wanting to enjoy this place spiritually should visit it during very early hours in the mornings i.e. 6.30 or so. But the idols are breathtaking and the temple is quite clean despite thousands thronging in this place especially on Fridays!!

Name: Rohitflies
Title: Serene atmosphere
Review: The temple premises are very well maintained and one can spend peaceful time just by sitting on the stairs and relaxing.

Name: dr_vinaynenavath
Title: Peaceful n spiritual
Review: Astha Lakshmi temple a huge temple in vansathalipuram. many devotees visit this place on fridays. this temple is maintained well and clean n neat. good time is to visit in evenings. temple is big n we can sit here peacefully in evening hear the mantras in temple which will be soothing to ears n relax the mind

Name: Tnv K
Title: Place of Divinity
Review: Here is a place where you can find all eight forms of Laxmi Devi are found. Temple is located in a very peaceful locality with good connectivity.

Name: Robin A
Title: Good, peaceful temple
Review: One of must see temple if you are in this area of hyderabad or living in Hydrebad.Teample is very peaceful and calm, offering worship goddess lakshmi.Goddess have 8 avatars here. Entrance is free.

Name: Plan H
Title: peaful temple in hyderabad
Review: one the best temples i have ever saw in hyderabad. the santity and the divine blessings are the great in the temple. one should try to visit it.

Name: plan41
Title: Benediction from the Goddess of Wealth in Eight Different Forms
Review: Laxmi and I have been wanting to visit this most beautiful Temple but we could not make it till today...Laxmi had been there earlier, though. The Temple is located off Dilsukhnagar and Kothapet Fruit and Vegetable Wholesale Market, inside a locality called Vasavi nagar, off the Hyderabad-Suryapet-Vijayawada National Highway and easily approachable. The Municipal address is: Plot No.52-55, Vasavi Colony, Dilsukhnagar, Hyderabad- 500 035, The Temple is administered by the Sri Kanchi Kaamakoti Peetham of Kaanchipuram, Tamil Nadu.This beautiful Temple is in the midst of a sprawling complex that is maintained very well - absolutely neat and clean and inpires instant awe and appreciation. At the entry is a beautiful and blissful Ganapati (The Lord Controller of obstacles) and then the Garudaalwar - the Golden Eagle being the Divine Vehicle of Lord Sri Mahaa Vishnu and Sri Mahaa Lakshmi, His Divine Consort - ever present with Him and residing on His beautiful and adorable, spacious Chest. However, here, She is worshipped in eight different forms, known as: (1) Sri Aadi Lakshmi (the Prime Divine Consort of the Lord of Preservation - Lord Sri Mahaa Vishnu (2) Sri Dhaanya Lakshmi (the Goddess of Food Grains) (3) Sri Dhairya Lakshmi (the Goddess of Strength and Courage (4) Sri Gaja Lakshmi (the Goddess adored by the Divine Elephants (5) Sri Santaana Lakshmi (the Goddess of Progeny) (6) Sri Vijaya Lakshmi (the Goddess of Success) (7) Sri Vidyaa Lakshmi (the Goddess of Learning and Knowledge), and (8) Sri Aishwarya Lakshmi (the Goddess of Wealth and Splendour).There is no entry fee, but special services are offered at varying  prices - depending upon the type of service desired. There are ordinarily no crowds but on festive occasions and Fridays there will be considerable rush. There is a lot of circulation space inside the Temple. The consecrated food ( "Prasaadam") is offered for sale within the complex.One must visit it to see the most beautifully and gaily decorated idols of the Lord and the Goddess in Her Eight Divine, Blissful Forms.

Name: sugunapriya b
Title: An spiritual retreat
Review: A peaceful and well maintained temple with all the eight forms of goddess lakshmi in the same arena. The deities look good and a feel of goodness surrounds the temple.

Name: sugunapriya b
Title: a birthday sojourn
Review: A well maintained temple with all the eight forms of goddess lakshmi in the same arena. With calm atmosphere the temple looks  peaceful

Name: Naganna Travel and Food Expert
Title: must see temple in Hyd....
Review: Sriman narayan and adhi lakshmi temple....  with astaa lakshmi devi vigrahaas are also present..... Ganesh Temple at the Entrance is present.... Free Entrance.... 51/- Rs for Asta Lakshmi Archna...

Name: Harshith358
Title: Perfectly Maintained Temple
Review: The design of the temple is so perfectly planned. This is a very good place to enhance your spiritual feelings.

Name: Kaiz_sm
Title: Snow World Park
Review: Traveled solo. Concept is nice but the place inside is too small. Could have expanded it a bit more. One needs to stand in a queue to collect jackets, shoes & socks that one needs to wear before entering the main area.

Name: KASI VENKOBA RAO
Title: Excellent Temple
Review: Ashta Lakshmi Temple, located at Vasavi Colony, R K Puram, Hyderabad is one of the finest temples, not only in the twin cities of Hyderabad & Secunderabad but in the State of Telangana & Andhra Pradesh. The main Deity is Goddess Mahalakshmi  with Lord Srimannarayana surrounded by Seven other Lakshmis namely Goddess Santana Lakshmi, Gaja Lakshmi, Dhana Lakshmi, Dhaanya Lakshmi, Vijaya Lakshmi, Ishwarya Lakshmi and Veera Lakshmi.This temple is on a small hillock. As we climb the steps, we reach Ganapathi temple and as we walk few yards, we reach the main temple. Lord Garuda is placed just opposite to Lord Srimannarayana. The white structure of the temple gives a grand look when illuminated in the night.Yagna shala is situated just opposite to the temple in a huge premises and daily havan takes place. Abhisekam is performed to Goddess Mahalakshmi and Srimannarayana every Friday between 6.30 AM to 8.00 AM. A visit to the temple is a must for everyone.

Name: KASI VENKOBA RAO
Title: Great Temple
Review: Asthalakshmi Temple has become one of the prime attractions of Hyderabad & Secunderabad. Located at Vasavi Colony, between Dilsukhnagar and L B Nagar, it is a must visit temple. The main Deity is Mahalakshmi with Lord Srimannarayana followed by deities of Santana Lakshmi, Gaja Lakshmi, Dhana Lakshmi, Dhaanya Lakshmi, Vijaya lakshmi, Ishwarya lakshmi and Veera Lakshmi. At the entrance, there is Lord Ganesh. Opposite to the temple, there is yagna Shala where 'Havan is performed daily.The view of the temple gives a grand look. It is situated on a small hillock.  In the evening when illuminated, it gives a look of Marble construction..

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Space and Undersea travel experience
Review: The show starts only if there are 15 people. So it is advisable to first visit the science museum. In case the no of people wanting to see the show is 15, the security guards in the museum will tell you. You can they buy the ticket, watch the show and return to the science museum to complete your visit. This way you will optimize your time.The show changes. When we were there they were showing a film on Mars. One of the first planetariums in India it gives you a great space travel feel. After the show you move on to a different room where you see a 3D film on underwater corals.Not much of space travel fan, we enjoyed the underwater 3D show more.

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Nice show
Review: We had visited Birla Planetarium during our sightseeing in Hyderabad. Tickets are priced at 100 rupees per person and there are shows in English and local languages at different times of the day. From the parking lot one has to walk up an inclined path to reach the Planetarium building at the top. We enjoyed the beautiful architecture of the building and the show about planets.

Name: Praveen K
Title: science centre
Review: This place has science center and planetarium. The shows of planetarium are rarely done due to   few visitors. The science center has interesting  working models, old camera which is as large as truck. Interesting dynosaurus park, doll museum and precious exhibits. The various models of isro satellites are also on display

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Planetarium
Review: Birla Planetarium has a beautiful show which is enthralling. It is a good activity to enjoy with kids.

Name: Krishna Sandeep Siram
Title: Worthy Place
Review: It gives some good information regarding Galaxies and the experience could not be explained in words.Simply its a complete visual treat for all the age groups who are very much interested in Science

Name: Debasis N
Title: Nice place for family and young kids
Review: Its a nice place for young kids and family to have an idea about our solar system and to have a feel about indian space research. Overall worth visiting the place.

Name: Shalini N
Title: Not the best planetarium
Review: The Planetarium cum Museum is very huge.. lots of exhibits are there related to various subjects.. However,  the planetarium show can very well be avoided. The charges for the show is exorbitant and its not exactly a sky show. I would rather call it a slide show, for which don't need a dome shaped planetarium but a normal white scree projector is enough.  This is not how a planetarium show should be, given the fact that it is known to be one among the best planetariums in the country. The exhibits are all in working condition and very informative..

Name: OMKAR PAGADALA
Title: Birla Planetorium
Review: When I went to this Planetorium. I have learned about the basic details of Planetorium. This located near Birla Mandir Temple.

Name: sree143in
Title: Science center
Review: Birla Planetarium is near to birla mandir which is in banjara hills hyderabad. it is a science center.

Name: Ajit A
Title: Worth visiting
Review: We went there in the evening and it took some time to find it out since the local auto driver also didnt knew the location. We booked the evening 7.30 pm hindi show ticket and before that saw different museums. Dinosaur museum was good with a big skeleton of a dinosaur on display. The museum on ISRO was very inspirational as we can see the models of different rockets and satellite kept on display.The space show was excellent inside the big dome theater as it provides a lot of information and at the same time beautiful to watch. The entire place is worth visiting with kids.

Name: rggg
Title: So much to offer
Review: Please don't go in there just for the planetarium. This place offers so much more than that. 1. Science museum - interactive experiments... Not only good for your kids but for adults as well2. Dinasourium - one of the biggest fossils found in India are placed here3. A section dedicated to mangalyan and chandrayan 4. Art gallery which features works of some well known painters like tyeb mehta 5. 3D show 6. Planetarium 7. IEEE section8. Museum which has manuscripts of ramayan written on leavesPlease buy a jumbo ticket which comes at 260 and enjoy all this. You will require atleast half day for all this.

Name: jainms
Title: Science museum
Review: Lot of interesting facts and students can gain good knowledge about the facts of ancient times. Quite a few shows are good about how science works.

Name: Mr_Andy_UK
Title: Reasonable planetarium show worth combining with visit to Birla temple
Review: Enjoyed the planetarium show in English - one of a couple that day with the remainder in Telegu and Hindi.  There was also a 3D show about marine life in the Barrier Reef which was a nice add-on.  Unfortunately there wasn't time for us to take a look at the science museum, but the short walk across from the Birla temple to the planetarium was worth it for that alone.

Name: OnAir516505
Title: Interesting and interactive
Review: Nice place to spend the afternoons with the kids. We did as it was raining. Concepts & display are very interesting.

Name: Trending T
Title: good to visit
Review: This place has got good sight seeing thing and gives you enough knowledge to have with and to implement.

Name: HARISH
Title: nice and best
Review: birla mandir planetarium is best beside birla temple...there are daily show in all hindi,telgu,english language..

Name: NIL_MODI
Title: Space Stories
Review: B.M. Birla Planetarium is a kind of ordinary planetarium mostly people have visited some where. good for who seeks the space knowledge. different show timing with different language so better you choose best suits to you by getting info in advance,

Name: krajeevc
Title: Good for science enthusiasts and kids
Review: This one is attached to the Birla science museum at a walkable distance from Birla Temple.Checkout the English show timings beforehand. You will not understand anything if you reach there for the Telugu shows. Nice place to know any our planets.

Name: Daniel T
Title: Must visit for school-kids
Review: I'd recommend this place for every school kid. The artifacts displayed & the evening show will have the kids engaged and appeal to their imagination.You can either walk up the hill or drive from Adarsh nagar road.Kids will have these memories for many years to come.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: good
Review: Its good and we get to know the space more visiting this.But off late quality of showing is not improved much with growing technology.Though its very good

Name: Srinivas S
Title: Excellent place for science
Review: Birla Planetarium where it be and it maintains it's value to continuously bring science nearer to the children

Name: S R V
Title: Science and Technology
Review: We went her on 31st march. We were a group of 9 people all aged above 60. Entry fee is Rs 100 and the place is close to Birla Mandir. We saw two shows on the sky and underwater fish. The cool theatre gave us enough rest.

Name: Vids63
Title: Very Good and Knowledgeable
Review: The planatorium is okay, but the 3D show was amazing. There is science museum also, where dinosaur fossils are maintained. The different science experiments really good, you need to have ample time to see all the experiments.

Name: Dilip kumar
Title: Historicalplace
Review: This place is known for hyderabad historical place and will tell you all the previous kings and their kingdom details and will give you lot of historic information.

Name: Sumit S
Title: Very good place
Review: A must visit place for any tourist. It is near to birla temple and hence does not require special time

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Stars gazing
Review: This was a beautiful experience for us during Hyderabad visit. This planetarium offers you a nice information about stars and galaxy. Photo gallery was also nice. They shown us a nice 3D video on a marine life. Seating arrangement is good and temperature was cool. My kid enjoyed this place very much.

Name: Mahesh A
Title: Informative museum
Review: Due to time constraints, we visited only the museum.The ground floor has a lot of interesting science concepts explained in a simple way. All the instruments worked properly. For the under teen kids, this will be an interesting visit. They can see practically some of the concepts that are taught in the school.Apart from the mechanics, the illusion concepts are also really nice.Don't forget to view the different mirrors like concave, convex etc.,The dinasorium is an interesting visit.Tips:1. Visit early in the day so that you can see the planetarium shows in the language of your choice2. There are a couple of Tea shops just outside the planetarium that has all the basic stuff.

Name: vmaravind
Title: Nice campus. Nice shows
Review: The Birla campus is very nice. The Birla temple, the planetarium, a #D show hall and a lot of other educational institutions are present in the same campus. The shows were nice, but are a bit out dated.

Name: JitendraU
Title: Shows are informative but too lengthy and boring
Review: 2 shows - 30 min space planetarium and 20 min 3d aquatic life.Shows are in english, telugu and hindi at different timings. Hindi at 2 and 7:30pm. English at 4pm and couple more slots. Other slots mostly in telugu.Both shows are informative but lengthy and become boring soon. Shorter shows with more focused info could be better.Entry ticket Rs 100/-If purchased with science museum - combo at 160/-Kids below 4 are not allowed.

Name: Salil Sahasrabudhe
Title: Nice, informative sky show and aqua show
Review: This Planetarium has 2 shows: A 30 min space-related show and 20 min aquatic life 3D show. There are 3 shows in English and 4 in Telugu with specified timings. English shows are at 11:30 AM, 4 PM and  6 PM. The space show has engrossing content, explaining basic concepts like various Planets, Moons, Solar system, Ort cloud, Comets, Galaxies and the Universe beyond. It can be enjoyed by both adults and children. The second show delas with various aquatic animals and their food habits and overall life. It is 3D and visually looks good. However, it is a little repetitive, the accent is harder to pick up and the experience be improved if it is shortened by at least 5 minutes.

Name: deepa v
Title: Planetarium
Review: Located in the heart of the city.It offers shows in various languages..so check the timings before hand and reach early. It's generally rushy on week ends.

Name: tamizh1974
Title: Planetarium show is of not big attraction
Review: Boring show, Rs100 per head is not worth, just children enjoyed stars moving around. 35 minutes show duration but in ticket counter they said show is for an hour

Name: Sourabh D
Title: Well Organized
Review: Check the schedules on line before planning to go there. It is in the same Birla Science centre complex.

Name: Anurag Nirmal
Title: Bad experience
Review: I had a bad experience from visiting planetarium coming from facility and content itself. The facility is poor with old seating arrangement and extra cooling capabilities of AC. From content side, they are still running 90s video which talks about basic stuff. So, i warn your guys this is for kids only and the ignorant.

Name: venkatakarthik
Title: Dinosaurium is cool takes you to Cretaceous period
Review: i would highly suggest you to visit the dinosaurium where you could see bones of the dinosaur and also their eggs (or whats left of it anyways)enjoyable ride and enjoyed the place

Name: 73prashantha
Title: Good for a onetime visit
Review: I visited this place a few times with family. except for the space show i dint like anything much...

Name: SSSUUUNNNNNNYYY
Title: Great
Review: It is located in the complex of Birla Science museum and located at little height. Parking is difficult specially during weekends.Planetarium show is good for school going kids.

Name: muthukrish2000
Title: Planetarium
Review: This is located near Birla Mandir. It's inside Birla science museum. Ticket cost is 160 rupees combining platenaurium and museum. Refreshment there inside.English -30minsTelugu - 45minsMany shows available.Two levels one planetarium and one 3D show.

Name: idea614354
Title: See Stars
Review: BIrla planetarium is constructed by Birla people, a good visit place, you can watch a lot in sky from here.

Name: Keerthi K
Title: Nice experience, must visit once if you are in hyderabad.
Review: Planetarium provides around 45 minutes show in equal intervals, it will mesmerize kids with knowledge.

Name: rashinr2
Title: interesting n good place
Review: nice place, planatarium is good educational place to explore. show is somehow irritating as to keep heads up n old english views . basement has many things to keep u on..worth to go there.

Name: suresh n
Title: The Sky show is the most attractive feature of the Planetarium.
Review: Birla Planetarium Hyderabad: Located at Naubat Pahad in the heart of Hyderabad city, Birla Planetarium is one of the most modern planetariums of the country. Not just children, this is one of the popular Hyderabad sightseeing places that attracts everyone. It was inaugurated in the year of 1985 by the late Sri N.T.Rama Rao. This planetarium is the first phase of the Birla Science centre in Hyderabad, which was nothing less than a landmark in bridging the gap between science and the common masses. This dome shaped structure was developed with the technological help from Japan. This place present its visitors with latest information about Universe and about various invention and theories related to it.

Name: Prakash Chandra G
Title: Nice place to know the universe
Review: The B M BIRLA PLANITORIOUM is one among the few plsnitorioums is INDIA . It is very nice place to know about the planets. The shows conducted in three languages English, HINDI and Telugu at different timings.

Name: loveistanbu
Title: Educational trip
Review: Crowded place full of schoolchildren. Educational tour. Children enjoyed it for the most part. Huge room for improvement everywhere in regards to maintenance and cleanliness.

Name: UllasMumbai
Title: Boaring Presentation, Not much Knowledge sharing
Review: It was very stereo-type monotonous presentation. Practically now shown anything even what we knew. Show has some screens on wrong side - which means on some part it is flipped screen for you and you have to adjust to view / read that screen. After planetarium they taken us to 3D show - frankly, it was with not much 3D effects and could not understand what they wanted to tell. Whole movie they shown Dinosaur running, fighting and fighting. Waste of money and time.

Name: Gowrish P
Title: Little astronomy. Boring content.
Review: Birla Planetarium (BP) is a part of the Birla Science Center, but, only the Planetarium  is reviewed here.I think the BP set up is good, but the content has been not well thought out at all. We went with expectation of an astronomy focused visit, but were let down by the content. Very little relevance to science of astronomy. BP needs to buck up to remain with the times.Planetarium has three parts to it - Dome, 3D theater, and observatory. We did not visit the observatory as it was overcast and raining.*The dome* is designed for 70 or so people and it fills up fast. Take your tickets and make it to the show time as printed on your ticket. Shows run hourly from 10 AM till 5 PM. There might be shows in Telugu. Check with the ticket counter. *The show itself* was boring. The focus of the show evolution of astronomy from a historical perspective. This did not need a 40 minute treatment and turned out to be a drag. There are many advancements in astronomy and it would have been useful to show that. More than talking about symbolism of different cultures/civilizations (and how they converge) over time, it should be kept basic for children's sakes - basic solar system model visualized, how far we have gone with our travels in it, what planetary bodies can be observed with eyes, what methods exist to look farther, something about Hubble telescope, radio telescopes... these would pique the curiosity to explore further.*3D Theater* is a decent set up as well. However, the content was a let down. Our ticket said '3D Universe' for the name of the show. However, what was shown up was a 3D Animation movie about story of a T-Rex. It's all good for someone who has never seen a 3D movie, but today every mall and amusement center has 3D. You can see 3D on the cellphone for a small cost of the glasses. What's the big deal with a Jurassic Park kind of show at a Planetarium?BP needs to really think what people expect when they visit a planetarium. If they want people, esp. children to come back with more interest, BP need to think how they need to rejig the content. Else, the planetarium is just a tick in the box for someone who has not seen one in HYD.

Name: Priyank J
Title: Great place, Amazing collection of artifacts
Review: We spent almost 4 hours there, but it was not enough. Amazing collection of artifacts from all arround the world. One can feel the treasure of the art world from almost every corner of the world. A must visit place. The fossil of a dianosour was one of the attractions there...

Name: Gugan_Ilango
Title: Nice Planetarium
Review: B.M. Birla Planetarium located near birla temple is nice place to experience science. a must visit in hyderabad.

Name: smandal2858
Title: Birla Planetarium
Review: Birla Planetarium is located near Birla Mandir which is south to Hussain Sagar Lake. Show duration is almost 45 minutes. Shows available in Hindi, English as well as local languages.

Name: Anamika K
Title: A good place to see specially for science lover
Review: I am very excited to share my visit to Birla Planetarium. It is really a wonderful trip for the who are interested in the study of Planets like me. It has been really a adorable trip in my lifetime.

Name: Rahul S Khatri
Title: Amazing
Review: The place is a piece of Art. There are museums. The exhibitions are worth a visit. If U plan properly U can see planetarium Tour also.

Name: Ramya19
Title: Time well spent
Review: We were here at 10.15 and the counter opens at 10.30 every minute was worth the time spent. The show, the exhibits was worth a visit. Go with your kids to have that extra fun.

Name: shivamsmh
Title: Amazing
Review: This is really a piece of art and popular among science kids but is a bit boring and at the same time gives you knowledge of universe.

Name: nikhil0210
Title: People come to visit it
Review: I was staying below this for very lonf time and could see people used to come and visit this place. Never got interested in going inside as already saw Nehru Planetarium in Delhi.

Name: Sobha K
Title: Awesome experience of the Universe and traveling in space
Review: It's really a wonderful experience watching the show. Parents with small kids need to take care of their kids who might get panicky and start crying loudly when the theater goes completely dark as the show begins.

Name: GayathriSharma
Title: Best place to explore for kids
Review: Go early morning for a show,be there at 9-9.30 for science show,after that enjoy museum& can visit Birla mandir too

Name: lovetravelonly
Title: Indian science museum
Review: B. M. Birla Science Museum is an Indian science museum. This museum is located in Hyderabad. It is constructed by civil engineer Mr. P. A. Singaravelu. Planetarium, museum, science center, art gallery and dinosaurium are a must visit for students and kids.

Name: Rajani K
Title: One of the best planetariums in India
Review: This is a must visit place for Science and Astronomy enthusiast.  This is built in collaboration with Japanese and uses new technology. The sky shows, solar system tours etc are quite exciting. The way the knowledge is imparted to the visitors about comets, asteroids, meteors and other cosmic phenomenon is too good.

Name: FoodieYogiKrishna
Title: Not for noisy kids :)
Review: Thanks to google maps , else locating this place would have been very tricky. One you reach the well designed centre is impressive. A  brief astronomy(based on modern as well as vedic science) video is played against the ceiling of the circular auditorium. Suggest kids  6+ to be brought here. The toddlers were getting frightened/impatient in the dark room with heads pointed towards to the ceiling.  The show itself seems very outdated in terms of the clarity of the video, voice or music. But the content is exceptional and well detailed. From the time the universe was created till when it may pass the subject is covered well with basis from ancient vedas(pure sciences). A good visit for inquisitive children and parents.

Name: Pallavi748
Title: Good place to visit, only if you are interested in solar system and celestial bodies.
Review: we visited in summer in evening 7:30 pm show. Ample of parking. maintainance is also good. Apart from Birla Planetarium there is also dianosoure museum to see. They have different theme every year which is interesting.Overall it was good experience but if you compare with Nehru planetarium its not upto that level.

Name: Surajsweetie P
Title: DISSAPOINTED
Review: Loved it when i visited there as a child. Went with a lot of expectation! The documentary they are playing right now is pathetic and focuses on lot of assumptions than facts. Wished they used the resources better!

Name: avenkat2016
Title: nice demo and narration
Review: very nice, the kids were hooked. night sky was very nice, the material is a bit old compared to US standards), but they also have a newer 3D show to make up for it. though the 3D glasses are not very effective.

Name: pjanil1968
Title: Nice for kids
Review: This place is must visit for school going  children, they get a good chance to see and study about solar system, planets and stars

Name: durgapendyala99
Title: Good for Knowledge
Review: This is a very good place for children to know about our solar system and so on. It is both entertaining and educational as well.

Name: Bharatbackpacker
Title: Good place for children
Review: A very clean and decent place, but, I think is priced a little too much. The planetarium and science museum are in the same complex but has a separate fee for each. Also, there is a Art gallery. went for a planetarium (cost Rs. 100/-) which was not bad. There is one show in the planetarium for 30 mins which was very good and another in the science building which supposed to be 3D but was'nt. It was simulated 3D. The sad part is that I think that they did not know how to set it up otherwise it would have been true 3D.

Name: Shyamis
Title: Small but good
Review: The show was very good and the follow up in the 3D auditorium is very good. We enjoyed the show very much.

Name: Aishwarya R
Title: Experience that hasn't changed for years
Review: I had visited the planetarium just after going to the Birla Mandir. At first, I was very enthusiastic about the fact that I was setting foot in a scientific zone after a very long time. I stood in line to purchase the tickets. I had purchased a combo ticket for the Museum and Planetarium, and it cost me around Rs 150. The show was perfectly on time, so no issues with that. Once the content started playing, I felt that I was watching the same version that I had seen almost 10 years ago. There seemed to be negligible improvement in quality and content. I wish it was better. But, it is worth a visit if you're going with kids. They might like the visual experience. One most important factor that you should keep in mind if you are going during a weekend - try and buy your ticket as soon as you enter the premises, because the English show's tickets get sold out very soon.

Name: ParvezWORLDtrip
Title: PARVEZ
Review: B. M. Birla Science Museum is an Indianscience museum located in Hyderabad, India. Constructed by civil engineer Mr. P. A. Singaravelu, it comprises a planetarium, museum, science center, art gallery as well as a dinosaurium.

Name: Surajit B
Title: Awesome show
Review: It was really a lifetime experience.it seems i was in a spaceship while the entire show was running.It is a must watch show for all ages. Being a resident  of Kolkata I am proud for this.It is going to be a famous destination for Kolkata.All the best.

Name: Christopher B
Title: Educational!
Review: A must visit if you have kids. Lots to learn and understand. They also have shows that one should visit .

Name: Sampath Kumar S
Title: Knowledge Gaining
Review: Good to go once to have a good understanding on the planetary system in a better visual manner. They have put their efforts to give a visual treat which is really appreciated.

Name: arunbvkumar
Title: Good Place for Space enthusiasts
Review: My son enjoyed as it they were playing the milk way. He thought if stays for more time they will take him in a space ship. LOL. Good Place for children.

Name: Sriyukta
Title: Not suitable for kids under 7
Review: Not suitable for kids under the age of 7. Poor maintenance, lacks signage, rude behavior by security guards.

Name: BRKanth
Title: Science at Work
Review: Must to be seen place for mid aged kids where they could experiment and learn with results. Good for science aspirant kids.

Name: rambha b
Title: Finest Science Place
Review: This is one of the fantastic place for Science enthusiasts.  You have a world class planetarium which helps to reveal several facts about the universe. Trips to different members of the solar family is very thrilling.  The Dinosaurium (natural history gallery), Science Museum, Archeaology section, Fine Arts sections are very good and help impart knowledge to the visitors in an interactive and fun filling manner.

Name: ramasamy s
Title: good place for children
Review: place is very near to birla mandir. this has regular shows in english and telengu language. show is not as good as in chennai. it is very short . they should also include few things like solar eclipse etc. 3D show is good and knowledgable.

Name: venkateshke
Title: Dinosaur
Review: It has a Planetarium and Museum. Museum, Dinosaur is special attraction. It is useful for children above fifth class. Physics, Prism, mirror images with different angles and lot more.

Name: Sudha G
Title: Worth watching
Review: The experience was very good.  The show was very helpful for kinds as well as elders. In the same premises we can enjoy 3D show also.

Name: Rao1940497
Title: Good to visit it
Review: It is worth a visit to this to explore astronomy and solar systems. It is of particular interest for student community too.

Name: Vishal Goyal
Title: Not worth your time
Review: Visiting the Birla planetarium is certainly not worthwhile. The entire show is very sloppy and boring. If you have seen the planetarium at Delhi or Kolkata, you'll find this extremely pathetic in comparison. The Aqua show that followed was also not up-to-the-mark. This activity (if in your to-do list) can be skipped.

Name: Memoirs-Sachin
Title: Educational & Informative !!
Review: The Birla Planetarium is located very close to the Birla Mandir. The visit was very informative & educational. There are good shows which keep on sharing updates on space research & science. A must visit for people of all ages. We had visited the Nehru Planetarium in Mumbai & this was also a similar experience.

Name: Munikumar R
Title: Highly recomended educational space tour for all ages
Review: Before visiting plan enough time to this place you need 3-4 hrs min for this , it's walkable from birla mandir, and 2 km from Hussain sagar, lumbini park, NTR gardens and prasad IMAX. So plan accordingly on what to visit to avoid physical strain .Strictly visit planetorium official website to understand the space 3D show timings in English , it's a one hour show which gives you real experience of visiting space , kids will love and relate what they learn.Ticket pricing is reasonable , avoid bringing infants to 3D show they may disturb others and get scared due to thick darkness.After the space show you will guided to ocean experience , it's 3 times awesome than previous , you should be lucky to get a good quality 3D glasses to enjoy max , try complete silence , kids live to see the deep in ocean experience with lot of fish moving around them.Just give a try , help kids in understand everything there . Be patient to answer their queries

Name: anithaaravamuthan
Title: Superb View!!!
Review: Its a fun and learning place for kids. They are having different shows every year and also in recent developments in Science. Kids will loves the place.

Name: VIKAS27OCT
Title: BIRLA PLANETARIUM & 3D UNIVERSE
Review: For learners it is Good-to-know.For science enthusiast it is meaningless*Feel like the Basic source of information is not described well **What is Solar System, Solar System Model,     Interesting Facts, Planets Size, Visiting each Planet virtually **It's good that they stated there's billion of planets in universe3D UNIVERSE*Overall Setup has jsut a small screen, making it boring*Still use's old videos whereas in actual theatres its more fascinating@ Website saysWe have left no stone unturned in giving latest information and updating on the vast mysteries and inventions of the universe.Not only it is one of the best attended Planetaria in the world, it has also been acclaimed to be amongst the very best with a better rating than those in Europe, the US, Far East, Soviet Republics and elsewhere.~Believe me .. It is definetely NOT!!~~ Why don't they Upgrade and Enhance the show's, system, model, arrangements

Name: Repala S
Title: Fun place for young kids
Review: This Birla Planetarium in Hyderabad is like any other planetarium. Here the interesting thing is that they have different shows every year which is good as they present shows on recent developments in science.Although the quality should be much better, it is worth going once at least. Birla Planetarium is offers definitely something different from other hangout in the city.

Name: MIHIRDAKWALA
Title: Not only Educates but entertains ! Must Visit with 4-5 Hours time as the museum collection is excellent.
Review: It not only educates but also entertains its visitors in different ways. It has international standards of presentation, which has been rated among the best and highly visited planetarium of the world. It is a place for everyone and can be afforded by everyone too as the Birla Planetarium entry fee is also minimal. What I liked the most in the center were the exhibits where the different working model of various scientific principal are displayed and kids are encouraged to play with them. So the children visiting the museum can not only see the exhibits they can actually try them out and learn science principals that they may be aware only by theory from their school curriculum. Overall I would highly recommend visiting Birla Science Museum and Planetarium with your kids and spend a day learning about not only science, dinosaurs, planets, stars but it will be a day well-spent bonding with your kids.

Name: Venkat_Mumbai
Title: Sky Theatre + 3D show
Review: The Sky theatre show was at 4 pm in english.  (They run shows in English, Hindi, and Telugu) please check their website for revisions if any.  The area is on a hillock and felt cool.  We clubbed the same along with Birla Temple.  The show inside the sky theater was very good. The projector is the older one as compared to the one in Nehru Planetarium in Mumbai, and wanted to show my son, how that works.  Post this show, there is a 3D show in the next block, on ocean and aquatic creatures.. Show at sky theater is for 30 min and the other one for 15-20 min.  Value for money and time spent.

Name: Krupali S
Title: for science lover
Review: Its very good planetarium where you can know many things about science. Its very good place for kids age around 12 or above. Very good sky theater show organizing here. Better to check timing before reach here.

Name: Anisha N
Title: Intellectual
Review: A place for all kids and grown ups with fascination of science and technology.. go there and witness the magic of scientific world..

Name: Vipul556
Title: No entry
Review: with a lot of excitement we visited this place to watch a show in the evening but unfortunately there were not many visitors that day and they require a minimum of 15 people to be there for shows which did not happen so we could not watch any... there are 3 shows in English, 1 in Hindi and rest in Telegu.. not enough audience for any of them.. the goverment should do soemthing for if in a city like Cyberabad there arent many takers then where would they be in India

Name: itspriyanka
Title: Sky theater show was good
Review: We went on one of the weekdays and the place was full of school kids. The first show at 11:30 was already booked by schools, but luckily for us some kids did not turn up and we got the seats at the last min. The show inside the sky theater was very good. It would have been better without school kids shouting, but nonetheless the content was good. Our 6 yr old son loved it too! There was another show on ocean and aquatic creatures. The audio for that was very poor and we could hardly hear anything. Show at sky theater is for 30 min and the other one for 15-20 min.

Name: Vijay M
Title: Worth a visit for piquing your kids intrigue
Review: The pros: Museum and planetrium in the same complex. Good planning ensures you see the 2 places in half a day. One can add the Birla temple to the list of places to be covered in half a dayThe cons: Bad approach, narrow roads that are further congested with parked vehicles. No card/paytm accepted....Ahem..is this not accounted for money or black money 😢. Just 2 English shows from 10 am  to 5 pm. No restaurant on the  campus. No seating in museum or planetrium. Parking in the campus is tough. Museum can be further developed.

Name: Amitabh
Title: Shows at Planetarium
Review: Great place for kids and teens. Nice for family visit. Very calm environment. Could not see the science museum and art gallery.

Name: lankavignesh
Title: good place for science
Review: it is one of the good place for science lovers.planetaurium is highlight of this place must watchable place for science enthuiastic peoplr.

Name: santosh2ind
Title: Birla planetarium
Review: This very interesting place. while we go to this place we can see all historical things,photos,stones,weapons.every one should visit this place.

Name: PankajUpreti
Title: Must Place to Visit
Review: A Very good place to visit for all age group..Nice, cool, calm place to visit...A lot to see in B M Birla Science Meusium, Birla Planetarium, Can enjoy a very quality evening time at surroundings of Birla Planetaurium

Name: kmegha911
Title: Must Visit For science enthusiast
Review: Birla Planetarium unfolds the mystery of the cosmos like the comets,eclipse,UFOs.The science museum inside the Planetarium is another highlight of this place.Archaeology section is another important section of this museum.

Name: krishna p
Title: To view planets and space
Review: This located in Hyderabad and beside of birla mandir, where lord Venkateswara swamy locted on the hill and temple built with full of marble stones and very good temple and while coming to planetarium there will be 3 language shows each show for one language with timings and people of all kinds of ages can enjoy this here we can see 9 planets and space through big telescope projected on the screen on overhead....

Name: Rajesh k
Title: Fun with Science
Review: A great place to increase your knowledge on science and astronomy in particular.  The shows depicting the solar system and trips to different heavenly objects is a must watch.  They are enjoyable for both kids and adults.  The astronomical phenomenon are explained in an interesting manner. The place also houses a science museum which has several exhibits to illustrate scientific process in simplest possible method.

Name: jainneha
Title: Birla planetarium
Review: It is like the science center . U can watch all the planets etc . It is educational plus interesting.

Name: Xavier D
Title: Laad Bazaar
Review: This is near to Charminar , the bazaar has many traditional dress shops , bangles and pearls. Quite busy around the day.

Name: dr ganapathi bhat
Title: "May visit once"
Review: Very near to the famous Charminar. Those visiting the iconic heritage structure may go to Laad Bazaar  The vast area specialises in handbags and bangles for an average shopper.  The place always terms with people. An outsider is getter off by coming  in public transport and walk the length and breadth of  the bazaar. Shopkeepers quote high but are courteous. May visit this and other famous Hyderabad shopping centres Sultan Bazar, Koti and Begum Bazar.

Name: GANAPATHI B
Title: "A routine visit"
Review: Very near to Charminar. Specials is handbags and bangles for an average shopper. Always teeming with people. Better to go there in a public transport if you are an outsider. Shopkeepers are courteous but tough to negotiate. Along with Sultan Bazar, Koti and Begum Bazar, Laad Bazar is one shopping centre a shopping buff should visit in Hyderabad.

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Laad bazaar is Famous for Bangles, Pearls and Semi precious stones
Review: Laad Bazaar was set up by former ruler, Mohammed Quli Qutb Shaw who is the Founder of Hyderabad city. This Bazaar was set-up as a shopping destination for the wedding of his daughter.  Till today this Bazaar is famous and popular hub for a brides-to-be and wedding apparel.Laad Bazaar is also called as Choodi Bazaar which is located on one of the four main roads that branch out from the historic Icon Charminar.Laad bazaar is Famous for Bangles, Pearls and Semi precious stonesTips to follow for better shopping experience1. This Bazaar is of very narrow roads. Hence Auto Rickshaw's and Cars are not allowed inside. So you plan your trip on Two wheeler or book a Private Cab. If you are choosing to go by personal four wheeler then you will be in trouble. getting parking place for four wheeler also difficult here.2. Most of the shops are selling items at Negotiable rates. So don't commit to the rates what they mentioned. Negotiate at your best skills. Generally 20 to 50% is the Margin what they will tell you. so you have to bargain to get best price3. Please plan your shopping timings before 7 pm as in lighting there will be color variations. Best time is 02:00 pm to 06:00 pm

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Popular local market
Review: This is a very crowded market located in a narrow bylane which leads to the Charminar and we had walked through this market area during our visit to the Charminar in Hyderabad. This market is famous for bangles, earrings, pearls and many more items.

Name: Jajabor
Title: Not worth it
Review: It is difficult to get to the helm of Laad Bazaar if you are in a car or anything bigger. The narrow roads and millions of people make it unnavigable! You better go to this place in rickshaws or autos and be prepared to walk considerable distances on your own.Having said that, even the stuff on offer is very average. Can get it anywhere else in the world.

Name: jainms
Title: Pearls and Bangles
Review: Lot of pearls and bangles get here at less price but the quality is same as price. But one can experience the different designs of pearls & bangles of Hyderabad here. very crowded bazzar too.

Name: abrahamsuji
Title: Excellent shopping destination
Review: Variety of bangles, pearls, handbags, cosmetics, laces, traditional dresses etc available. Next to Charminar. Must visit for shopping.

Name: ShvRm_Traveller
Title: Bargain shopping
Review: Laad Bazaar is situated near Charminar and is popular among those who like bargain hard, prior making purchase. There are many shops selling bangles and pearls. There are unbranded clothes and other knick knacks being sold on the street.The place, though, appears heavily crowded because of small lanes and the large number of people visiting. This takes lot of effort to just walk through the area. There appeared to be more tourists than the locals, who were shopping there, as Laad Bazaar as well as the adjacently located Charminar is among the tourist attraction of Hyderabad.Overall, a good place to visit for those who want to shop as well as for those who just want to check out the shops.

Name: Tripntreatsuk
Title: Very crowded but good bazaar
Review: This is the best bazaar for bangles, clothes and everything else. Beware it’s very crowded and you need to have patience.

Name: Oxymoronish
Title: Interesting, but incredibly crowded
Review: It was tiresome navigating the minuscule walking space with children. People kept bumping into them causing them pain. So, if you're going to with kids, be prepared to carry them all the way. The shops are interesting and make for a nice evening stroll. Even if you don't buy anything, there's great opportunity for street photography as well as lots of material for observation. That said, keep your belongings secure as pickpockets abound (even the police station there warns us so). Lots of bangles shops; how much you pay for them depends on how good you're at bargaining (which I'll confess I was rubbish at). There's an old cafe right next to the Charminar, Nimrah Bakery; they had some good Irani tea and lovely biscuits. Lots of knickknacks to browse through. An enjoyable experience if you aren't too bummed out by crowds and people bumping into you. That said, I didn't have even a single bad experience as a woman - no perverted touching/grazing/grabbing. Good for you, people of Laad Bazaar!

Name: Swaroopaappa
Title: Charminar
Review: I visited charminar for shopping a pearls, I observe there many shops are selling pearls according to the tourist nature and charging the rate as their choice, but I noticed that one shop Laxmi Narayan pearls near to charminar monument,they have price tag on each sets and they are not comparing the tourist but they have the same price to tourist and the local people and one more surprise they are giving cash back value also

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Good for Bangles
Review: This is a market lane adjacent to Charminar in Hyderabad city. There are number of shops selling artificial jewellaries,bangles,pearls etc. This lane is very narrow and over crowded. Ladies enjoys shopping here.

Name: vyasch
Title: a must visit shopping lane
Review: Just in the shadows of Chaar Minaar, there is a long lane with a row of shops on the both sides. Pearl ornaments and chicken clothe are famous in Hyderabad. Visitors will get both here.

Name: sridharan2013
Title: Famous historic shopping area for bangles in Hyderabad
Review: This narrow street is historic for several shops that sell a variety of the famous Hyderabad bangles made with colourful stones,glass and metal with gold covering. This market place was set up by ancient rulers to provide shopping experience to the women. This market also provided incentive for the craftsmen to thrive in designing and making bangles with wonderful designs. The market is very congested and tourists must take care to pick the right outlets and do their purchases. Please ensure that you discuss payment modalities well in advance to avoid disappointments.

Name: Noor Ali Abbas
Title: Fascinating Bangles Bazaar
Review: Laad Bazaar is a very old and famous historic market in Hyderabad. It is a narrow street which is always crowded. It is located on the west face of Charminar.The bazaar is popular for bangles, precious stones, jewellery, pearls, gifts, velvet and gold embroidered fabrics. Most of the shops in the bazaar are selling colourful, fascinating and glittering bangles. We can also get famous Hyderabadi Biriyani and Irani Chai in the bazaar.It is also know as Choodi Bazaar. Charminar, Makkah Masjid and Chowmahalla Palace are nearby attractions.

Name: NayakMadhukar
Title: Good place for tourist
Review: While in Hyderabad every tourist needs to visit this place. You can have a wnderful shopping experience. You will get good bangles which are very colourful and you also get pearls.

Name: Karthik R
Title: Shopping .. bangles and pearls
Review: Laad bazaar is very famous shopping stop of Hyderabad. This bazaar is very famous for Hyderabad famous glass and decorated bangles, pearl ornaments and the famous biscuits and Iranian Chai of Hyderabad.

Name: Purplepassion123
Title: Bangles Haven
Review: If you want to buy bangles, this is the place.There are also shops selling embroidered borders and embroidery work if you have the time.There are some store where to get wedding dresses much cheaper than big stores. You just have to see stuff and enter the shop. Prices can be handled.Its old part of Hyderabad and nice to see the buzz.

Name: loveistanbu
Title: Laad Bazaar the glass bangle market
Review: Laad Bazaar is the dazzling, cacophonous, narrow lane lined by multiple shops selling glass bangles. This lane leads west from Charminar. Shops are illuminated by bright lights, which gets reflected in the crystals adorning the bangles and lights up the night.  Visit in the evenings.

Name: Manish K
Title: A glittering tourist attraction
Review: The Laad Bazaar is located right next to the famous landmark of the Charminar in Hyderabad and is particularly known for its jewellery shops. Tourists, whether from India or abroad, throng this place in large numbers to look at the bangles and pearls on offer.It's a place where one's bargaining skills are tested. The quality of the jewellery on offer can vary, depending on the shop. Those who are not that interested in shopping can visit the Mecca Masjid or Chowmahalla Palace nearby.

Name: Alind Kumar Bhatnagar
Title: Laad Bazar - Pearls at Hyderabad
Review: 1. Laad Bazar area must is wonderful to travel in night when glittering lights sparkles bangles hanged in shops2. But if you want to buy good quality product of PEARLS with perfect finish then you have to invest bit more at ultimate destination near GULAZA HAUZ CIRCLE at "Sher-E-Batil-Ki Kaman Road where you can find number of excellent show rooms.3. For more precious & designer exclusive purchase of pearls Best showroom belongs to Krishna Perals & Jewellers, if you have missed to go deep into city then their Outlet at Domestic Airport is good place with limited but selected collections.3. Learn to bargain - these show rooms keep huge margin which can be well negotiate

Name: Bobita Konwar
Title: Amazing place to buy bangles
Review: I had heard a lot about this place. So, thought to visit it and it was a great experience. Great place to wander and you can see wide range of bangles. You'll find some cheap bangles with great quality.

Name: Gregory D
Title: Interesting place to wander around
Review: We were not really here to buy anything- certainly not bangles(millions of them) or sarees etc. But an excellent place to wander around and observe locals etc, However, we did buy local perfume at a good fixed price shop. Just a really interesting place- although the roadwork around Charminar made walking a little difficult.

Name: Charlie_Maine
Title: Great for bangles, not so good for peace and quiet.
Review: My wife took me to this place, for the bangles. Almost every shop sells bangles. All of which seem to have millions of bangles. For my wife it is great while for me, not so great. Men should try and find a cafe in which to wait, if you can.

Name: Tanaya D
Title: Amaaaazing place to shop
Review: This is a shoppers heaven..so much to shop! Beautiful bangles...and of so much variety...clothes...pearl jewellery...artificial jewellery...you can get it here..Things to note: Only go if you like street shopping because it is very crowded at any point of time...and bargain hard...I got an artificial jewellery trinket for Rs. 50(the vendor was initially quoting Rs. 500 for it☺️)

Name: bose_rima
Title: Famous for painted bangles
Review: This bazaar is old as the Charminar, around which it operates. Artificial jewelry, pearals, handbags, silk kurtis, sandals and meenakari works are found at random. Be ready to bargain.

Name: fivestarholidays
Title: Great Market Atmosphere
Review: Lined with shops selling bangles, clutches, fashion jewellery and clothes. Typically Hyderabadi bangles are made on lac. They are more expensive than the metal version. Check and be sure about what you are buying. Good place to shop for embroidered borders etc

Name: Dhyan Chand
Title: Old Market  (Bazar)
Review: Laad Bazar or chudi Bazar located near  charminar. It's a vary old market famous for ladies Bengal which is make by stones, moti, lakh etc.

Name: Rajani K
Title: Market in the Charminar area
Review: This is a market in Charminar area.  The most attractive product sold here are Bangles. Beautiful designs and a range of colors to choose from, the market is a one stop solution for any and every kind of Bangles. You need to bargain to get a good deal. Also, there are several stalls to choose from and settle for a price.

Name: NasehaAlok
Title: Learn to Bargain
Review: Laad Bazar or Choodi Bazar as it is popularly know is adjacent o Charminar. The Bazar has been operating since the time of the Qutb Shahis and the Nizams. Pearls jewelry along with hollow bangles are the main attraction of this place. Unfortunately, the popularity of hollow bangles which was once the must have for anybody visiting and in Hyderabad is declining. However, it is something to have. Very light and graceful, delicate I must add. Another thing which is found only is Hyderabad's Laad bazar is the 'Chiksa'. It is a kind of beauty mask. Can be used in hair and skin. Before the facial, and body polish, every Muslim family which had a wedding planned, would make sure to get this. Brides used to use this every day for 21 or 14 days for a beautiful and naturally fragrant skin. It is worth a try. Before going, have an idea about the cost. If you are good with knowledge of price and quality of a commodity, and with bargaining, this is a place for you. Cheap and nice, but if you are someone like me who has no idea about quality and price and is bad with bargaining, be ready to get ripped off. The first price that is quoted to you is 3-4 time higher!!! Good luck

Name: Omer M
Title: The Ever Green
Review: I had been several times, for many things specially Bangles. The verity never seen any where else. The sales mans are very active and try max to not let you go away. Tourist make sure to bargain.

Name: rambha b
Title: This is a paradise for shopaholic ladies
Review: This is a very old market. It excels in ladies product. Good quality and excellent design silver and imitation jewellery is available.  Great variety of ladies dress material and ready made dresses and several branded and unbranded footwear shops make this place a paradise for shopaholic ladies.  You need lot of patience to bargain here to get good deals. And also, you need to spend lot of time.

Name: Samyuktha N
Title: Touristy and Affordable
Review: Go here if you want to see every kind of bangle ever manufactured by mankind! The roads are undergoing some repair work, so the area is rather dusty and dirty (as of February 2017), but the shops are bright and colourful and very affordable. Shopkeepers have a rude way of calling in customers, but the jewellery sold is excellent. Do NOT buy mehendi (henna) from here, as it's more dye than actual natural henna, and can cause problems on your skin. I had an allergic reaction. If you would like to buy typical Hyderabadi jewellery, this is the place to go!

Name: SampathTrips
Title: nice shopping
Review: Had good shopping in Laad bazaar... It is over crowded. We purchased Hyderbad pearls and it is good. Lot of ornaments and clothes available here. Good time to spent in shooping

Name: Tushar K
Title: Lively Traditional Bazaar of Hyderabad !
Review: The Laad Bazaar is located in the vicinity of famous Charminar and well-known for shops of traditional Hyderabadi bangles, pearl jewelry and other things. The Bangles shops are lined up and offer a large variety of traditional bangles. One need to bargain with the shopkeepers. I enjoyed my visit to Laad Bazaar very much !

Name: Lynn K
Title: A buzz but not much more
Review: I took a 33km tuk-tuk drive to get there which was a great way to see the streets bussling with bikes, cars, trucks and the odd cow and goat. The driving skills required to cross streets and dodge other vehicles was very impressive.The market itself was dissappointing mainly because of the quality of what was being sold. The fruit and veggie section was lovely to see but the goods were mainly very synthetic and too bling for my liking.  The journey made the trip worthwhile but doing it again I would've chosen a different destination.

Name: skTripAdvFB
Title: Laad Bazaar- Lively
Review: Laad Bazaar is so lively for shopping close to Charminar. Variety of stones, pearl jewelry, bangles, cloths & more.

Name: priteshkulkarni
Title: Shooping heaven for woman
Review: Laad Bazar is shooping area near Charminar. You can buy good stones, pearl jewelry, Bangles, cloths etc. Be ready to Bargain in shops. You need to start bargaining from one third price. It is must visit place in Hyderabad.

Name: samj911
Title: BUSY AND LIVELY
Review: A bustling place lively all the time, full of street stalls selling from fruits, vegetables, traditional fast foods to clothing, accessories, traditional jewellery and many more literally hundreds of them. There are also lots of jewellery shops selling traditional gold jewellery including the famous HYDERABAD BENGLE, prices vary from cheap to very expensive. There are also lots of clothing shops as well as shops selling verity of goods but do remember to bargain as it can bring the prices down. Hyderabad's FAMOUS TEA AND CAKE SHOP is situated in this bazar, you can ask anyone and they will point it out to you. It is a small place but always busy, one of the best tea I have had so far....no joke. They serve different types of tea but my favourite is the PERSIAN TEA, it is also famous for its freshly prepared traditional sweets and cakes.....A MUST PLACE TO VISIT.

Name: Gowthamcivilion
Title: Beautiful collections
Review: Accompanied my cousin for her shopping. There are many shops with many varieties and beautiful bangles and other accessories. It's mostly crowded in the evening and weekend. Parking is very hectic. Plan yourself.

Name: Manjunath V
Title: Amazing bangles with superb art work
Review: This is near Charminar and this road has number of shops selling colourful bangles with very artistically made. Bangles are available in several varieties, in glittering colours and excellent stone work. You will find it difficult to decide what to buy.

Name: cadmuspro
Title: An experience, fun, but hectic
Review: Being one of the most famous locations in India for shopping for bracelets (bangles). If you are going to get a good deal then you are likely going to get hustled. However, if you are going for the thrill of being able to bargain it what is probably the most competitive (bargain) place in the world to bargain in, you are going to have a blast. Almost at any time in the day, you are going to be overwhelmed by the sheer amount of people there.

Name: Douglas P
Title: Lights, action and more!
Review: Spent two interesting hours trying to decide what to buy among the lights and glitter at the Laad Bazaar. Too many shops to count easily as the shops lined both the main road here and down many alley ways. Bangles, pearls, chains, sarees, clothing , shoes, and so much more including a few food stands lined streets in all directions. The store owners and assistants called out for me and my friends to come into their shops. We did not feel pressured to do so although some shout outs were persistent. We did buy many items but only after much bartering. Prices were very reasonable and several good deals were had. The large crowds were well behaved and the local folks there just went about their way not being distracted by our large group of foreigners. [there were 20 of us]. It was a fun evening--we spent 2 hours plus there.

Name: journey2016
Title: CROWDING PLACE IN HYDERABAD
Review: we had booked a indica car for whole day and we told our driver to tell us about all places which we able to see during travel in car and laad bazaar was in our way. laad bazaar was crowding place and there was no peace and relax and every person was running for their work. but market was good and according to our driver he told us that this is famous laad bazaar in hyderabad and you will get everything what you need like our hazratganj and aminabaad in lucknow.enjoy laad bazaar.

Name: GKChaitanya
Title: Beautiful Bangles!!!
Review: Located next to iconic Charminar, Laad Bazaar is must visit for the people who like traditional Bangles. Wide variety and range of Bangles are available in this Bazaar. Some of the variety is unique which will not be available anywhere else. Don't forget to bargain prices...

Name: Shalu2127
Title: Dazzling!!
Review: If you are prepared for the crowded , narrow lanes and don't mind the rush and noise, you will love this market. You have no other choice but to walk through.Shops and shops of bangles and artificial Jewellery.Locally crafted stoned bangles are s specialty here.Not a clean market!But bangles that will leave you dazzled!Bargaining is a done thing.

Name: NilabhTripathy
Title: Complete wedding market
Review: All sorts of wedding dresses and colourful bangles and hyderabadi sherwanis are available here but must bargain for prices.

Name: Praveen K
Title: Also known as Chudi Bazaar
Review: This place is also known as chudi bazaar and women would love shopping here. The place is just next to charminar and has loads of places to shop. Road side shopping is popular here. one gets good collection of bangles and dresses for women.

Name: Laxmi S
Title: Laad bazar
Review: Evening shopping of bangles near to charminar. Very beautiful place in nice located area, colour full bangles can be seen with reasonable price.

Name: FatimaSub
Title: Amazing trip
Review: I always loved this place. It was a dream to do shopping here. And am glad I did it today. Though I couldn't buy a dress for myself. But got alot of other things. I would love to come again here. Every fashionista women's heaven is here.

Name: Tushar Joshi
Title: Pearls and Bangles for the Lady
Review: Situated around Charminar this is the exclusive Bangle and Pearl shopping alley... With loads shops displaying their work you can treat your eyes and empty your wallets here.

Name: Albia-Newton
Title: Vibrant
Review: A very colorful place for a walk - Especially in the evening when the lights are on the stalls.Some of the produce is a bit tacky - but there is good quality here if you look (and pay) for it.Beware of the pearls - Mostly not real

Name: srinivast5
Title: Ladies Bazar
Review: Ladies and Ladies..no gentlemen.  This is the must visit place for ladies of course you man should be accompanied with you to carry the  stuff.  This is the unique place adjacent to the Charminar.  The entire lane is called Chudi bazar or Laad bazar.  Plenty of bangles and other ladies items.  Under the lights every thing glitters.  So just check the colours under the normal light.  All the area is dominated by the local muslims.  Bargaining is must.   Narrow lanes ..heavy traffic irritates you but its a different experience.  This is one way of understanding the real old Hyderabad.  NO PARKING.  So come by local bus and Auto.  Nowadays Autos are not allowed near Charminar.  So you have to come Charminar visit and do shopping.  Near by another attractions are Mecca Masjid, Chowmahallah Palace.  Eatery s are plenty but hygienic is an issue.

Name: nitsj76
Title: Nice Hyderabad Market
Review: We visited the Laad bazaar during trip to the city of Pearls, Hyderabad recently.Situated close to the historic Charminar monument, this marker iscalso called the Chudi bazaar. One can find many shops selling a variety of bangles, pearls and other jewellery here. Would say this is amongst the best places to pick up some pearls in Hyderabad.Nice place to visit and shop when in the city

Name: Indrani C
Title: Must know bargaining while shopping at Laad Bazar.
Review: Excellent place for shopping especially for the women. You would love to spend hours  even if you don't want to buy anything. Moving around the bazaar itself would be a fun and if  you love bargaining then no worry, it would be the right place for you to shop. Bangles and chandbali are the specialities of Laad Bazar and of course visit of Charminar is also a great experience !

Name: Debopam
Title: Charm of the interesting old city.
Review: When you visit the Charminar, take some time to wander off into the street going out from Charminar with all the colourful bangles dotting the side of the street. Enchanting experience. Though there is a definite chance opf getting cheated by some vendors, but we had the best experience in one of the shops. Definitely worth a visit here.

Name: Nayaz Ahmed
Title: Famous for Bangles! !!
Review: Situated just next to Charminar is the famous Laad Bazaar famous for its bangles. You must know to bargain to buy these. Syed Junaid Bangle Store was the best of these as he gave me a bargain could not resist.

Name: gpradeepshenoy
Title: bangles & bangles bazaar
Review: This bazaar is in close proximity to charminar.If you have interest in shopping for bangles/ladies items you will be taken to this bazaar directly from charminar all by yourselves without asking for any directions to reach there.                It is really crowded and there are street vendors,shops which mainly sells bangles.I found it very difficult to bargain as no one was ready to sell their stuff even with a Rs less.              Not a big bazaar but worth a visit...

Name: ShikshaC
Title: Street shopping destination…
Review: Laad Bazaar is situated in a very congested area of Hyderabad near the Charminar. The place was very crowded as we visited in the evening during Ramzaan when people flock to the various food joints here to break their fast. You can get crockery, bedsheets, clothes, ittar(perfume), eatables, etc.  at cheap rates.

Name: JG_Trotter
Title: Bangles Bangles...
Review: A must visit place for ladies. Bangle shops till the end of horizon..numerous varieties and don't forget to haggle.

Name: higghligght shiva
Title: A nice Shopping Place to buy
Review: Here u can buy anything what u want all is available esspecially ladies vl shop over there here u have all types of bangles ,pearls& jewels .mostly dresses so while going take huge amount & go.  moreover u can bargain they vl tel more.many shops are there to buy best quality products in cheap rates .Hangout places moreover to eat snacks food items like street food.

Name: MARGDARSHI
Title: Unique Hyderabadi Women`s Shopping Legacy
Review: While in Hyderabad, it is a must for the ladies to visit this unique Hyderabadi shopping institution located on one of the 4 roads branching off from the famous Hyderabad landmark Charminar.Laad in Hyderabadi lingo means lacquer & this street is famous for the laquer made bangles studded with artificial diamonds.On the whole it caters to cater to all the womens  wedding related requirements which includes items like saris,bangles,semi precious stones,cheap jewellery,pearls,silverware,Bidriware,Nirmal,Kalamkari paintings,handwoven materials of silk,cooton,brocade,velvet,gold embroidered fabrics,perfumes & traditional Dupattas!As you enter its narrow i km long lane, where only two wheellers are permitted entry, you see throngs of burqa clad women filling up the various shops haggling & bargaining with the shop keepers for the choice of their items.Worth a visit with your family.

Name: raahgir
Title: Girls into junk jewellery will love it
Review: Alleys in alleys and glittering shops selling bangles in all shapes, sizes, hues in these alleys. Laad bazaar is the shopping area near famous Charminar of Hyderabad selling bangles, earrings, neck pieces and what not when it comes to artificial jewellery. The womenfolk who are into shopping will find this place insanely good. A word of advise though... little congested and a conservative area. But don't miss the place and find some beautiful pieces for yourself and your gal pals.

Name: Veejo_Mumbai
Title: Must visit for Ladies
Review: Laad Bazaar is a small street near Charminar. It has a wide variety of Bangles for ladies and is extremely crowded during evenings. Heavy bargaining is required to arrive at a fair price.It is also a good place to buy some cheap dry fruits.

Name: Parul S
Title: Best place to buy some finery adn everythign for a wedding
Review: Visit the bazaar to get yourself some bangles or maybe  a sherwani. Right next to Charminar it is a great walk.It has a lot of great places to eat and shop so take your time in the area.

Name: Shrcho
Title: Interesting experience
Review: Worth exploring too see the kind of assortment and range each shop has. There are many different kinds of shops and a fun place to buy trinkets from. If you're looking for something unique and truly Hyderabadi though you might have better luck in a fancier place like Banjara hills

Name: 1Worldtraveller2020
Title: Truly Hyderabad, still existing here
Review: previous generation hyderabad still existing here.Bangles, Pearls , clothes, .. we brought many!!this place is more like DUBAI's:  MEENA BAZAR or Gold Souk Mall(of-course no gold in laad bazar though)

Name: Veena G
Title: The true essence of hyderabadis
Review: A nice place..if u r gud @ bargaining u get gud quality stuff in cheap prices ..here liescthrctrue essence of the hyderabadis..

Name: TravelNotes
Title: bazaar
Review: The area surrounding the Charminar, at the heart of the old city is such a different vibe than the rest of the city.the laad bazaar is in a side street, full of pearls, clothing etc. make sure you bargain!

Name: Amit S
Title: Not bad, good fun
