Review: Probably the largest bangle market anywhere. you do get an exciting range, but you need to be good at bargaining! Opens onlt at 11AM so don't go too early.

Name: GeoffandLaura
Title: This is a must if you want the true local experience
Review: We went to Charminar but only visited the Makkah Masjid as well. Big mistake, visit all 3 because you are there. We went back to buy from the Bazaar.  Don't expect high quality merchandise you are in the heart of the market rubbing shoulders with the locals and asking questions. They don't care if you are black white or brown they only want to sell.  Do be aware their math can leave a lot to be desired until you question them on it, you will get a polite apology. Take it and move on it is all part of the trade and they are good at it.  Small bills are best no argument give them the correct money.  Enjoy this experience, we did. Oh and don't forget you will need to dodge the traffic as well, very easy to learn just make sure you signal your moves and don't stand still.

Name: ATULSHAHGOLDSTAR
Title: horribly crowded...
Review: Take care of your belonging in this crowded bazaar... do not fall into the trap of the hawkers and shop keepers.. they know very well that this tourists are not going to come back again, so they tries to take the maximum advantage...

Name: shaz7861
Title: A jewellery lovers heaven
Review: Laad bazaar sells almost every kind of jewellery particularly famous for stoned bangles that are must buy if you visit this fabulous city! Its near the charminar so you cant miss it.

Name: jyotipdeka
Title: Peaceful and Mesmerising Sunsets
Review: Located atop the Moula Ali Hill, it’s is not just the religious significance that attracts you but also the mesmerising view of the city and the sunset that you get from there - 400 steps climb to the hill is worth the effort.  During the evenings when the prayers start, the place feels all the more divine. The place lacks maintenance and it’s sad to see that we have not even spared religious places when it comes to spreading garbage. The authorities need to penalise such people who spoil the beauty of this place and also need to ensure sufficient garbage bins are in place that can be utilised for throwing waste inspect of degrading the beauty of this beautiful place.

Name: Sundaresh
Title: A nice dargah on hilltop
Review: The prayers are answered  and very holy place. from hilltop , beautiful bird eye of Secunderabad. The place is easily reachable with lot of convenient eating places.

Name: amars777
Title: One Rock HILL
Review: Magnificent Rock hill Dargah.  A tough one for aged ones. Initially, the steps are nice and small. As we go up they become large and steep.

Name: Wilayat
Title: Pilgrimage.
Review: Located at a distance of 10 km from Secunderabad,the Maula Ali Dargah is a famous pilgrimage destination and has been recognised as one of the 11 heritage sites that were identified by Heritage Conservation Committee. it is not just the religious significance that attracts you but also the view of the city from there. The mesmerizing.

Name: Shussa
Title: Heaven on Earth
Review: You climb nearly 350 + stairs .... experience - out of this world .... Just you .... Moula Ali / Moula Abbas and the AlMighty Allah .... serene , quite , HOLY

Name: GoWrong
Title: Favorite place in Hyderabad
Review: This was my place to chill... located at a huge monolith away from maddening crowd. I would sit here for hours in the cool breeze during the evening. Sight of the city from this place is breath taking

Name: CBVARMS
Title: Maula Ali a pristine place of pilgrimage
Review: Maula Ali Dargah is located on a hillock in Hyderabad / Secunderabad. There are  480 steps to reach up to the shrine. I have been to this place earlier too but this time we were surprised as we discovered a route which took us half way spot by car. The best part was there was enough parking as we had gone on a Saturday. The rest of the climb was very comfortable for my friends who went up. The serene breeze and a bird's eye view of the city of Hyderabad was mesmerizing.

Name: venkatakarthik
Title: Just a casual visit
Review: been there with a friend for a casual visit and observed the namaz, overall experience is good. the darga is huge and can accommodate more than a 100 people  or more at once

Name: Gowrish P
Title: Peaceful spot and panoramic views
Review: Highest point in Secunderabad, Maula Ali offers panoramic view of all of Hyderabad all around. Good spot to watch the sun set over the city.Maula Ali Dargah has two access points. One starts at the base with stairs all the way. Another one (likely, newly redeveloped) accessible from the road up to mid point to the top. We chose the former, which has parking only in small bylanes. The latter point is recently developed with broad roads and sufficient parking.The walk up the 400+ stairs is pleasant, and not tiring.Dating back to Qutb Shahi times, the Dargah has strong following and is believed to fulfilling wishes. This Dargah is claimed to have a handprint of Hazrat Ali, son in law of The Prophet.The Dargah is open and accessible on all days from dawn to 10 pm.The best time to reach here is an hour before sunset. Walk up the stairs, visit the Dargah and them settle down on the ample space around the Dargah. This space is essentially the side of a rocky smooth hillock. All sides are accessible to walk and each side offers views not seen anywhere else. You can faintly spot buildings in the remote financial district. Faintly, and phantom like.It is interesting play to identify remote spots such as the Golconda fort directly to the West. The small size of the fort emphasizes the distance from Maula Ali.Watching the sun set and lights turning on slowly all around the city and silence settling down after the prayer hours is to be experienced here.All in all, this spot should be on your checklist if you live in the twin cities.

Name: mahmoodkanji
Title: Words are not enough
Review: This a a religious place where millions come to for blessings, the best part of this journey is climbing 505 steps to reach the top.

Name: mk5445
Title: Peaceful and divotional place
Review: Its superb experience here , uts very calm and njyng ,its in the top of the miuntain and its a superb view at the night . Must go place

Name: Jamila N
Title: Nice peaceful place to visit.
Review: This is a very beautiful dargah on the top of a mountain and you have climb several steps to reach there. The scenic view while going on the top is very good.

Name: Praveen K
Title: Old and a famous dargah in hyderabad
Review: an old and famous dargah in the city of hyderabad. located on a hilltop gives a good view of teh once upon a time suburbs. good green cover of ECIL, NFS and railways makes a nice view from the hillock

Name: PavRao
Title: Excellent calm place
Review: Superb place to visit to pray or if you are after a calm peaceful environment. Good walk up the majestic rock formation . Great views of the  city from here.

Name: kunal v
Title: Best place to kick start New Year
Review: Visited  this place on 1 Jan 2017. I have not been to any trek for quite sometime so I was a bit sceptical. On the New Year eve, I decided to welcome the "New Year's Sunrise" from Moula Ali Hill.  I started alone at 6 in the morning, and to my amazement, I found the place beautiful, serene and perfect place to trek for beginners. It may also be a nice warm up experienced one.

Name: kmegha911
Title: Never miss this Place
Review: Moula Ali dargah is situated in the Moula Ali area of Hyderabad.There is also a pavilion and a place for beating drums at the dargah.The dargah is open all days from morning 8:00 am to 10:00 pm.The impression of Hazrat Ali's palm is installed in the shrine on a stone and an arch is built over the spot.

Name: Syeda S
Title: For the love of Sunrise and Sunset view
Review: This is the place to be early in the morning and in the evenings.  The view is serenic and you could just sit on the hilltop for hours to view the sunrise and sunset.  Given the 500+ steps, make sure to carry water and food cos you will not find it on the top.  Irrespective of the religion, it is a perfect place for medidation, but avoid going in the noon.  I would suggest going between 5-7 am and 4-7 pm.

Name: Debapriya D
Title: Casual
Review: Very calm place. Make sure you visit during evening to night time for a panoramic view of the city. Takes 20-30 mins to climb. Peaceful place for passing a quiet evening with friends and family

Name: Krupali J
Title: Good place
Review: Hill top dargah, which is situated almost 400 steps high. It was really very peaceful and calm place to visit.

Name: NasehaAlok
Title: A Serene Spiritual Experience just after a Work out
Review: I am ashamed to confess that I could not make it to the top. The timing was bad...I reached there at midday of May. Afraid of heights, it just could not muster enough courage to trek those last 50 steps alone. Next time I would be more prepared. and would travel with a company.

Name: deepammorparia
Title: A religious place where it is great to trek.
Review: Dargah has almost 500 steps climb. Hill top with great surrounding view.A super place for adventure enthusiasts as beautiful view from top & great place to go for a hike so close to city.A nearby other small hill is also interesting exploration.

Name: Rohit RC
Title: Beautiful vantage point
Review: This is a perfect place to visit in the evening. As you climb up the steps you start to get to see different perspectives of the surroundings. Nice location to click pictures of the city. There's another mosque right opposite on another hillock. That looks beautiful too.On top, there's a huge iron grill that is full of locks. A belief that people have to fulfill their wishes.

Name: Shalu2127
Title: Good experience
Review: Approximately 500 steps to climb, not a difficult one, not too steep either.Best time to climb is in the evening or early morning as sun can get very hot and their is less shelter.Carry your water and eats if you wish, nothing available top hill.Prayer songs sung by the ladies in the day were very nice and melodious.If only the place could be plastic free....&cleaner

Name: DeVa0072015
Title: Good spot for photography and trekking
Review: I have gone there for the first time with my photography meetup group for sunset, landscape and night photography. View from the hilltop/dargah was just spellbinding.Had to climb roughly 300-400 steps which was tiring :-)

Name: Kamal Verma
Title: Great Views of the City
Review: The place is sacred and has a huge religious significance. You get good views of the city. We visited in the morning (10:30 AM), probably not the "best" time to visit the attraction. Sunrise and sunset time would be ideal. The place is generally very calm and serene.

Name: SanaNaqvi
Title: Serene, calm, close to God
Review: Dargah is right on top of a hill. 500-steps climb is totally worth the calmness of the place. Visit to Maula Ali is worth every step for the peace of mind you get in the dargah.Can view the whole city from hill top.

Name: DRSSDASH
Title: Hazrat Ali Dargha
Review: This Darga was built during 1530-1550 and is dedicated to Hazrat Ali the son-in-law of the Prophet Muhammad at  the top of the sacred hill of Maula Ali ,Hyderabad.

Name: Doyen_in
Title: For Divine blessings of Maula Ali visit this Dargah
Review: This is the Dargah of Amirul Momineen Maula Ali (AS). This place is around 12 Kms from Hyderabad. U will feel peace once here.

Name: haiderrizvi70
Title: Devine blessing of Moula Ali.
Review: A peaceful place with a real Devine intervention or else how do you think a person who pants badly on climbing three story building could climb more than 300 to 400 steps in the sun of afternoon at an average temperature of 35-38 C. Truly incredible experience.

Name: AbhiSan
Title: Secularism win
Review: NIce old Dargah. NIce view from the top. Has kept essence of the old hyderabad still intact. All religions are allowed in - happy secularism. NIce long walk to the top of the hill.

Name: Harshith358
Title: Good Elevated Spiritual place to visit
Review: This place is located on the top of a hill and the scenario from that hill is totally mind blowing. A good place to visit.

Name: faizhusaini
Title: You will love the view from top.
Review: A very famous place that I heard from my childhood. Associated with Imam Ali(A.s), A very spiritual place. A bit far from city , but worth a visit.Good things come with a price , After climbing hundreds of stairs the view from the top is awesome. Blowing winds with wrap you and you will experience the peace and serenity of this pious place.Recommendations- Carry a water bottle.                                visit near evening and stay till sunset and after that, You will love the view for sure.

Name: SatyaPrakash P
Title: A nice trek and good views
Review: Awesome views from the top. A nice little trek will leave you with some sweat which feels nice when you find yourself at windy top. Nice views from the top. you can see most of the well known places from here. Reaching there is a little pain when it comes to public transport.

Name: Daya111
Title: Sufi Shrine
Review: This place is packed by a lot of people. Many people who are sick are brougth here for healing and prayers. If you visit in the evenings, you can hear songs, sufi music and meet with people who are more than willing to explain what is happening there. Watch out, when you step out, there will be tons of people coming to ask you money. Try not to encourage this practice.

Name: 117abbas
Title: Huge  clone of Ayers rock, Australia, with beautiful dargah on top
Review: Moula Ali dargah, which is said to have relics  relating to Hazrat Ali, son in law of Prophet Muhammad, is one of the many very holy sites for Shias, around Hyderabad.Though access is  little difficlut to discover, once you are at the huge dome of a rock sitting  in the midst of a residential area, you will see the arch through which you start th eclimb to the dargah.The rock is really huge, similar to the iconic Ayers rock in Northern Australia and visible from a long distance.The climb involves steps cut into the rock and is quite steep at places, but  railings have been provided at  certain points to help you keep your balance.As you climb, just keep stopping for breath and to admire the surrounding huge rocky hills with houses rising all around.You wlll pass through a couple of more large decorated arches before reaching the top where the main shrine is located.If you are planning to enter the shrine you have to be modestly dressed, covering your head, arms and legs and removing your shoes. A peep inside will astonish you. The glittering mirror filled walls and ceiling and decorations in silver with verses from the Quran liberally covering the walls, will keep you mesmerised. Anyone can enter and seek blessings from the priest who will brush you with  peacock feathers. On holy days when the Urs (religious festival dedicated to Hazat Ali is held), you can also view and touch the relics kept under a cloth covering.On the days of the urs, you wlll find huge throngs of men,women and children making the strenuous climb to seek the blessings of the 4th Caliph of Islam.Both a visually rewarding and uplifting spiritual experience!!

Name: soz1979
Title: Nice and Strange
Review: Visited Twice actually ...first time was thrown out as only foreigners can wear Tshirt and trousers and indians need to wear salwar suit..quite weird....

Name: PraveenHotha
Title: Nice little trek
Review: Great view in the morning. i've seen some great pics from the top during diwali. Have to try it this time.Carry a water bottle,camera and a stick(if you are scared of dogs)

Name: ADNSingh
Title: Experience The View on Top of this Sacred Hill
Review: This is a wonderful location with 3 hills. Solid Rock Formations, which can be climbed and explored in the early morning or in the evening. Excellent view for admiring sun rise & sun set. Also a fascinating view of the night skyline. Parking of the vehicles is a problem, make sure you dont parking in front of any residence door or gate. Carry your water & fruits, if you wish to explore the hill with some time. Wear canvas / tennis shoes with rubber sole will give you grip during the climb, and walk the rock surface.One can also test their endurance by doing a climb sprint on the nearly 400 stairs. I managed 2 back to back stair climbs, before i started huffing & puffing.If you wish to visit the Dargah, them make sure you are attired in a presentable way, to attend a place of worship. Carrying a head scarf or large handkerchief is advised, and leaving your footwear at the designated place suggested.Camera & Mobile phone is permitted. But avoid carrying any other valuable gadgets & wearing jewelry while climbing & exploring.The place has elevation, hence expect wind.Down the hill are few restored places also of historic significance, which can also be explored and appreciated.Since this is are place of worship. Respect the place and avoid disturbing anyone.I have enjoyed few very beautiful full moon nights ( Upto 8pm) here.

Name: Fareed0785
Title: Holy Place at Top of the Mountain
Review: With about 500 + steps to reach the actual spot of Moula Ali Darga, it is fun climbing the stairs. Outside food allowed hence do carry bottled water as well. Every step you take you get a better view of city surroundings.Best time to enjoy is during cloudy day / sunset time.Good place for children to play in the Darga premisesYou also have a verendah and covered place to sit and relaxGreenery on the mountains is amazing and you have shade every now and then to take break while climbing.

Name: Syed Ahmed Nizami
Title: " Peaceful Historical Place "
Review: Moula Ali Dargah is a scared place which has the NIshani (prints) of Hazrat Ali R.A. There is a bit of a climb involved in getting to the dargah, but the path is a broad and even stairway up which children can run, and adults of any age will have no trouble walking. The hill is spectacular: massive granite rocks overlooking a huge vista of the city. There is a nearby facing rock in which you can see some quarrying. It is a lovely place in the evenings and mornings.The dargah, now on a protected heritage list, is about 450 years old. As mentioned this Dargah has "miraculous" hand-print. As you climb the peaceful hill and look out at the vista of the city spread out before you will enjoy sitting up here to soak in the silence and calm.

Name: Kiaditke
Title: Calm and peaceful spot
Review: Moula Ali hill is not among the sights you will need to tick off on a weekend's trip to Hyderabad. But if you are here longer, or on your second trip, it would be worthwhile to make your way to the north-east corner of the city. Moula Ali Gutta, the hill on which the dargah stands is a landmark in itself. Other nearby landmarks are the ECIL cross roads bus station (about a kilometer away) and the old gateway called Moula Ali Kaman a few hundred meters from the bottom of the hill.There is a bit of a climb involved in getting to the dargah, but the path is a broad and even stairway up which children can run, and adults of any age will have no trouble walking. The hill is spectacular: massive granite rocks overlooking a huge vista of the city. There is a nearby facing rock in which you can see some quarrying. It is a lovely place in the evenings and mornings.The dargah, now on a protected heritage list, is about 450 years old. Unlike other dargahs, it does not contain the body of a saint. Moula Ali was the son-in-law of the prophet, and the dargah contains not his body bud a "miraculous" hand-print which is supposed to have been created by his spirit. It is a nice story to keep in mind as you climb the peaceful hill and look out at the vista of the city spread out before you. If you are in the mood, you will enjoy sitting up here to soak in the silence and calm.

Name: Rajesh1965
Title: Peaceful Place  & Nice View of City from Top.
Review: A great place to see Sunrise or Sunset any-day.Do wear a comfortable set of climbing shoes.Don't forget your camera and tripod for great pictures .During some special occasions and festival dates this place looks even better.

Name: Tulikachakravorty
Title: historical
Review: great to be there with friends and family. history overtakes modernity. holiness at its best. do visit

Name: Randolph M
Title: Great Panoramic View!
Review: Moula-Ali is a little over 10 kilometers from Secunderabad. It's fairly well connected by public transport. In addition to it's religious significance, the Moula-Ali hill is popular for adventure activities like beginner's trekking, rappelling and rock climbing. Several adventure groups like GHAC (Great Hyderabad Adventure Club) conduct adventure activities here often. It's a good place to relax in the evening and enjoy the panoramic view of the city. While the Dargah (Mosque) is located on top of the hill, there is also a little shop on the hill that offers refreshments. There are several groups that make it here on the night of Diwali to witness the festival of lights from an amazing view point.Great stepping stone for those who plan to get started with adventure and trekking.

Name: Aditya_Banerjee
Title: Breathtaking views and cool breeze
Review: This place is about 10km northeast of Secunderabad. There are frequent buses that take you there from the Secunderabad bus stand. The top of Moula Ali hill has breathtaking views of the city and cool breeze literally blows you away. Do read up on the history

Name: Saurabh C
Title: Absolutely Amazing Place
Review: This is a nice place to spend an evening. I generally take my guests to this place for a quiet and peaceful sunset. This place has amazing views of the city, especially during sunrise and sunset it looks beautiful. The dargah is also nice, you can spend some time praying inside if you like. The road up is a bit steep with hundreds of stairs, hence people who have knee problem or who cannot climb should avoid coming.

Name: Karthik Balasubramaniam
Title: Moula Ali Dargah
Review: This Dargah is situated on top of a tiny little hill also known by the same name Moula Ali Hill.The trek to the top of the hill is not really so tiring and enjoyble. Best time to climb the hill is during early morning or late evening. There is pretty much nothing much to do at the top except the Dargah. But the 360 degree view from the top of the hill of the surrounding area is something to look forward to after a decent trek(around 500+ steps) to the top of the hill.But what you are sure to be treated with is the peaceful and calm nature of this place which gives you a comforting soothing and relaxing sensation to your mind and body.

Name: PavRao
Title: Fabulous place away from the bustle
Review: Went here by chance as was nearby visiting a school camp. It was mid day but was still not too hot in March. It is a bit of a trek but the steps are well made and one can take their time. On the top was nice and peaceful to pray or contemplate. Would love to come back here on an evening to spend time and sit. The views of Hyderabad are great from here. For religious reasons or just a place to relax it's quite a good spot . Best part is that it isn't crowded

Name: talebali91
Title: Magnificent place
Review: A must visit for everyone... The place is quite and peaceful and will make you want to stay for long. The Pahad has a great view of twin cities. There are a lot of pigeons. I will return again..    God Blessed hyderabad Because the hyderabad is very peaceful city in India. I like hyderabad city very much And India is a best country in the world (SAARE JAHAN SE ACHHA HINDUSTAN HAMARA )

Name: vibha123
Title: Sukoon ki Dargah
Review: I love visiting all temples, churches, dargah etc, so here I was at the Moula ali dargah.I wasn't allowed inside but, by having hijab I was been allowed to see in around the dargah and trust me this place is small, comforting, soothing in all possible ways.I gives you the energy to feel relaxed, feather light, all worries seem to shoo away when you are here.many people might find it difficult to believe that these kind of religious places have different air, energy, and aura but I am a firm believer that these places have something super natural.

Name: Harshit_Wanderer
Title: Peaceful evening @ Moula Ali..
Review: While exploring places to visit in Hyderabad, we came across Moula Ali dargah and looking at its location we though of spending an evening there.Taking along our DSLR we moved there and with the first view it looked quite exciting.We found lot of trekking groups from corporates and few worshipers as well. After climbing 500+ stairs we reached till top and visited the place first and then launched our photoshoot. Rocks, city , pillars and lot more was there to capture in our camerasSunset, haze and then darkness all of these were phenomenal and we clicked b'ful pictures there.Breeze was cool and with the peace & serenity it made the place more blessed.I would say a must go place for travelling\trekking enthusiast in Hyderabad.

Name: Krishna Prasad
Title: super super
Review: one of the best places in the busy city, away from the hussle bussle still in the midst of the city.the best time is to hike in the early morning before sun rise the steps to reach the roza ( Dargah) are easy to take and once you reach the top you can have a view of the city and a glorious sun rise.the Roza has a palm print considered to be that ofthe great Prophet Mohammad.over all a great place to visit

Name: khanjan Antani
Title: Sunset at Maula Ali Dargah
Review: Maula-Ali is a suburb of Hyderabad, India located at about 10 km from Secunderabad. It is famous for Moula Ali hill on top of which a famous mosque (Moulali Darga) dedicated to Ali was built probably during era of Asif Jahi. The Moula Ali Dargah is one of the 11 heritage sites identified by “Heritage conservation committee” of HUDA. Maula-Ali is largely rocky with undulating terrain. However, presently it has become a major commercial hub. There is another hillock opposite the Moula Ali Hill, called "Qadam -e- Rasul" on which the sacred relices of the prophet were supposedly deposited by Mohammad Shakrullah Rahan a servant of Asaf Jahi. In addition to various mosques, Moula Ali also has lots of temples dedicated to Hindu Gods & Goddesses.

Name: mohsinabbashaideri
Title: Awsome
Review: Maula Ali Dargah is situated on top of the mountain. One have to climb 500 stairs to reach there. A very nice religious place. People who want peace must go there.

Name: Andrew D
Title: A cultural orientation
Review: Shilparamam is suprisingly lovely. I thought it would be a tacky tourist trap, but it is actually quite insightful.When you enter, there is a bazaar where arts and crafts from all around India are sold. For me, the highlight is the Handicraft Museum where you can learn about the crafts from different parts of India. The Bird Park, while a small area, does surprisingly exhibits interesting bird species! The Sculpture Park is another must-visit, and there is also a nice Cultural Show at the amphitheatre in the evening.

Name: stevebintley
Title: Great spot in an evening
Review: It might feel rather touristy at first but this is a great place to visit and is more than just stalls of mass produced goods. There’s entertainment on a large stage, some truly handmade crafts if you look close enough and plenty to admire with the statues and small museum in the centre. The colours are fantastic and none of the sellers were overly pushy, but remember to haggle if you do end up buying anything! A must visit when in the city!

Name: aruna
Title: Thiefs at Shilparamam parking lot
Review: Parking lot has many thief, they will take your away if you leave handbags and money in cars. Don't keep hand bangs or any luggage in shilparamam parking lot, its not safe place to park vehicle, they will charge 30rs for parking but will not care about your car.

Name: Arvind Kumar Yerram
Title: Wonderful. Must visit
Review: A beautiful ethnic crafts village. Crafts & artefacts are all available at very reasonable prices. Ample parking spaces. Paddle Boating available inside. Quite a good number of photo ops moments. Best place in Hyderabad for genuine and authentic crafts items for moments and gifts.  We can easily spend an entire evening here looking at the crafts are relaxing on the water side or in the greenery. Calm and serene. Must visit to carry some memories and memorabilia. Most of the crafts here are hand crafted.

Name: A N C NATARAJAN
Title: For Few Good Clicks and Handicrafts
Review: Recreation of Villages makes this place a must visit. They have tried to build all that you would remember if villages - bullock carts, mud houses, canals, lake, waterfalls etc  Sell a lot of handicraft articles. Better Bargain well. We grabbed a clay vessel out of the plethora of earthenware put for sale. Plenty of shops for home decor but we were more convinced with the door hangers sold at the entrance/exit. The best takeaway was the potrait of my 20 months old son, surprised that he cooperation for 2 minutes and went spellbound that the artist completed the picture within 5 mins.Covid restrictions not followed. No social distancing.

Name: Veer2468
Title: Must visit when in Hyderabad
Review: This is definitely a must visit place in Hyderabad. The entry tickets are a little pricey. The stuffs are ethnic. However lot of bargaining needs to be done.

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Shilparamam
Review: Shilparamam has a conclave of handicraft sellers from India. Do not forget to bargain while shopping here.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Must visit
Review: Plan to spend at least four-five hours at this place. There is so much to see. There are three museums inside the complex- Handicraft museum, Leather Puppet museum and Village museum. There is open air sculpture park. There are nice walkaways and a small lake inside the complex. And you have shops selling variety of handicraft items. But bargain hard. Most of the stuff you can get at 50% of the quoted rate. There is also a nice food court where you can get ethnic food. Entrance fee is Rs.60. Normal digital cameras are allowed but if you have one with adjustable or long lens then the fee is Rs.500. There is ample parking space.

Name: N.H. Vijayaraghavan
Title: Handicrafts Heaven.
Review: A must vist place for handicrafts items, the rates are very reasonable. Purchased sarees and dresses. beautiful garden,

Name: Jo-Ann
Title: Crafts haven
Review: Huge area to walk around. Entrance fee is 50 Rupees. Plenty of stalls that sell scarfs, throws, silk, pearls, crafts, toys, jewellery. Plenty to see and shop. Shopkeepers are quite pushy. If you need to buy, do bargain. The village museum is on this grounds.

Name: Neelam_Macwan
Title: Shopping
Review: The place was on a list for a while, so decided to go there on a Saturday. It's venture by the state government to promote art and culture not only of Telangana but alos of other states. The place has 2-3 galleries and many stalls where one can buy traditional clothes, jewellery and decor items mainly. Also, it accommodates an amphitheater where there was a Bharatnatyam performance going on. It is extremely clean and very well maintained. I feel it is a smaller version of Nampally Exhibition. A must visit place in Hyderabad.

Name: Jay Pradhan
Title: Traditional Handicrafts Village
Review: Shilparamam is a traditional handicrafts village. The entry fee per adult is INR 50. I found a lot of traditional toys, sarees, ornaments & clothes here. They also have handmade purses, cup sets & stone idols. They organise a traditional dance in the evening, it was quite delightful to watch. All the prices will be high and one has to bargain to get a decent price. Overall a good place to venture into old traditional handicraft tour.

Name: Raji
Title: Shilparamam Hyderabad
Review: Nice place showing Indian cultures and traditions for the people. Must visit place in Hyderabad . You can get many more Indian jewelleries here

Name: misskark7
Title: traditional arts & culture
Review: traditional articles and ornaments clothing are all good and also food is great . and the entry fee is minimum so affordable for everyone. overall vistible with family friends colleagues relatives all....

Name: jainms
Title: Handcrafts village
Review: The culture and heritage of handcrafts. Family outing with kids is enjoyable here as they have some evening cultural programs too.

Name: yesarar
Title: Heritage displayed.
Review: Nice place to spend half day, a view of heritage and lots of shopping of handicrafts. Nice bargains and quality items.

Name: Kinggops
Title: Shilparamam - A Mini Dilli Haat !
Review: This place is a mini dilli haat.You get handicrafts,footwear & clothes from a few states. Definitely not as big as the one in Delhi & not as well represented by all states of our country. Bargaining -  20 to 30% is a must. A lady can easiy spend 2 to 3 hours here. Men & Kids may find it boring. A couple of small eateries catering for fast food is available inside. Just opposite across the road a good vegetarian restauran 'Chutneys ' is there if you want an elaborate meal. It is advisable to visit in the evening to avoid the Hyderabad Heat.

Name: BRKanth
Title: Weekend evening hangout place
Review: This is at the heart of the IT hub, hitech city and place to visit with family during the week ends and especially during festivals. Could see night bazar and enough options for food.

Name: NIL_MODI
Title: Good place
Review: Shilparamam is near to hi tech city so you need transportation to reach there. Its arts and craft village. It presents shopping of art and craft items, some entertainment like cart riding. overall you will feel village life experience. spreaded across wide areas.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Must visit this place if you love Art and Handicrafts
Review: I have been to this place several times before. Every time you visit here it feels so nice and your heart wakes your skills that were sleeping for a while internally. You feel like you must spend some time on your hobbies that improve your creativity.One more reason is you can buy lot of useful things that are hand made, starting from foot wear, hand printed clothes, decorative items, statues and what not everything under one roof. You can find the same things in exhibition also. But here there is some special reason I found only after I visited there.Go there when you have liesure time. Happy Shopping and enjoy the visit.

Name: Sivakumar
Title: Multiple attraction within
Review: You see the shilpakalavedika next to it where audio launches and other cultural events happens. And Art & craft village where you get items like clothes, jute bags, flower vases all hand made by villagers. And a park with lot of space/boating, a place to capture nice pics. But the entry fee for adult is 50 and kid is 30.

Name: Dilip kumar
Title: Place for audio functions
Review: This place is mainly for big audio functions and school functions to be done and is located in hitech city which is great to viisst

Name: Usha65
Title: Replica of Andhra culture
Review: A nice place to go and shop for ethnic articles , dresses etc. The shops are housed in huts which and other constructions replicate the Andhra village culture. The boat ride in the lake inside, the small open air theater that hosts cultural performances are other attractions.

Name: Mandira P
Title: Heritage of India
Review: Stalls from different states showcasing their handicrafts is simply awesome, prices can be bargained, there is small food court for snakcs, lawns for kids to play, complete family outing

Name: nik c
Title: Great little market for handicrafts
Review: Shilparamam is a great market in Hitec City where you can buy from a huge range of Indian handicafts.   There is also a food court as well as lovely gardens with a paddle boat ride for kids on the lake.   A great place to spend a couple of hours.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: nice place
Review: Nice craft village which gives us various art options and also some tasty food and snacks inside.Easily accessible via road

Name: Suresh1976
Title: Nice Place to visit with family and friends
Review: Shilparamam is a nice art gallery where you can find many handicrafts stalls selling good products which is really worth. You will find some ethnic wear stalls also. You will find good handmade bedsheets, blankets stall also.The place is nicely maintained. There is an entrance fees. You will find few food stalls inside it selling dosas, chats and other items.we really had a nice time.

Name: Rajkiran Mahato
Title: Spicy chaat and Mouth watering snacks
Review: Good place for handicrafts shopping and hangouts and you can also find ethnic wear at a reasonable price and the food stalls for spicy delicacies are awesome

Name: Daniel T
Title: Visit here to know more about Indian culture
Review: This is a nice cultural place where many artisans display & sell their art works. You'll be surprised with the quality of art here. Most of the items are unique, something which you won't find in regular markets.Place can be visited with young kids.

Name: gabrial03330
Title: Good place to see AP's culture
Review: Shilparam is one of the famous places in hyd to visit where we can look back the history and culture of the place. Hand crafted  and some creative items are exhibiting there so if we preferred to buy we can buy better price if you you know how to negotiate better 😉

Name: Venkataraman M
Title: Not worth it!
Review: During the planning of our trip to Hyderabad, was told that this is one of the "must see" areas in the city. The closest comparision given was that of Dilli Haat, where I have been to and have enjoyed the experience there. I was therefore quite looking forward to the visit to this place. The place has an entry ticket of Rs. 50 for all adults (over the age of 10 years). The place was a complete disappointment and a waste of time. If you are coming here because you want to see the handicrafts and small scale/ cottage industry products, there are many other options available these days, where such exhibitions are held in nearly all the cities.There were very few traders there and the prices quoted by them were exorbitant. If you chose to walk away, you will get an immediate drop in price by as much as 33%. Clearly shows that the shopkeepers there have also become desperate.My recommendation is stay away and use your time more wisely in the city.

Name: koteswararao
Title: HEART OF CITY EXHIBITION
Review: This  is good place  in  city for diferent thpe Exhibitions  surounded by safevare cos Big marriage fiction hall top people meeting place

Name: plpalani
Title: Well maintained crafts and culture park
Review: This well maintained park has crafts expo, ethnic expo, village expo etc. There is a sand beach, mountain top, boating, etcThere are hundreds of small shops selling craft and textile goods.Well time spent

Name: ramakrishnabanoth3
Title: Village backdrop area.
Review: Well defined as well as built with good care of village locality.Nicely designed toys and sculptures of tribe and farming equipment.Feel good place to feel the village background.

Name: rockzzM77
Title: Fantastic place
Review: Must go this place whenever you are in Hyderabad, fantastic park, this is the theme park, maintained very nicely.

Name: Dipak Roy
Title: Must visit when Hyderabad
Review: It is in Hiteck city of Hyderabad.One can spent half day here. A museum show casing village life is well maintain. There is a open air theater and park.Good number of stalls are available for shopping handicrafts.

Name: Sandeep57
Title: A refreshing place
Review: Amazing place , it looks that Rocks speak and you can talk to them . A village scene created there is amazing , you feel like part of the village

Name: mail2mathews96
Title: Shilparamam
Review: Shilparamam is one of the best place to roam where we can see lots of shopping products place is well maintained and clean

Name: Bruce M
Title: Great shopping for souvenirs and gifts
Review: This is by far the best open air shopping area in Hyderabad. 50INR admission is worth it. Area is clean and well maintained. Shopping is from individually licensed shopkeepers with specific stalls assigned. Be prepared to bargain anywhere from 25-60% in the price of items. The amount to be bargained depends on the uniqueness of the item and amount of hand work required.  For instance, the pashmina comes in a wide array of quality and print and many shops have it, bargain at least 50%.  Hand painted terra-cotta is much less coin and hand painted. Recommend coming in the evening when it’s cooler. Uber might be difficult during the rush hour.

Name: ASHISH
Title: DEVINE
Review: If you have lost everything including hope than come to this place , haare ka sahara shyam hamara will solve all your problems

Name: sree143in
Title: big tempel
Review: Shyam mandir inkachiguda is very famous place in this area. mmust visit a very big temple place in the city.

Name: GLOBALSEAS
Title: radhe radhe
Review: one of the old temple of lord krishna located at kachiguda , nice place to visit along with other small temples inside the temple , shiva and hanuman temple is there in this temple .

Name: HARISH
Title: jai khatu shyam
Review: shyam temple beside kachiguda station is famous for khatu shyam temple...with hanuman,durga mata,shiv ,shani temple are inside temple ground.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: nice and good
Review: Well maintained and it has lot of small temples inside of various gods and outside temple they manage footwear.Its nice and pleasant inside

Name: idea614354
Title: Peaceful
Review: A good built and beautiful architecture of temple very peaceful and  good. people maintains q line for darshan.

Name: Sumit S
Title: Divine feeling
Review: just near kacheguda station is the shyam mandir. You feel very good visiting this place. Anyone going through kacheguda must visit this place

Name: convwp
Title: Peaceful and holy temple
Review: This was very old temple near railway station. Many devotees came here for Praying. Good place to visit. We have visit in morning time.

Name: Tarang G
Title: Religious feeling
Review: We go there on baaras and we feel delighted after visiting this temple as people keeps singing bhajans. It’s a huge temple , if you love to visit temples than it is one of the main spot in Hyderabad

Name: srinath18
Title: “Peaceful temple”
Review: Located at kachiguda center of the city Shyam Mandir totally peaceful temple in this city visited with friends

Name: Manish K
Title: Nice temple, located right next to the Kacheguda station
Review: The Shyam Mandir is dedicated to Khatu Shyam and is located right next to the busy Kacheguda railway station in Hyderabad. That said, one inside the temple complex, the noise and hustle outside are immediately forgotten.The temple is very well-maintained and contains a number of shrines, dedicated to various Gods. Facilities for devotees are good, with adequate drinking water as well as footwear deposit provided. There is some climbing of stairs involved, which may not be convenient for senior citizens, but otherwise, the temple is worth a short visit.

Name: Mintstar
Title: Peaceful temple
Review: Very old temple situated near Kachiguda railway Station...earlier it was known as veeranna gutta later changed the temple name to Shyam Baba temple...Very well maintained...it has goshala as well... has multiple temples and are well maintained...

Name: Gaurab2017
Title: Holy Temple - Must go place in Kachiguda
Review: You can have darshan of almost all gods. Been to this temple almost 10 times till now. Very near to Kachiguda Railway station and bus stop.

Name: Im O
Title: Shyam mandir
Review: Shayam mandir is beautifull temple devoted to radha krishan ji.temple is well maintenaned and nice to visit best to visit during sandhya arti

Name: sandeep g
Title: good
Review: a good place to visit to have a peace full mind and for mental peace , good place to visit. go with family

Name: rockzzM77
Title: Amazing place
Review: This ttempl is amazing, if you want to spend some time in peace and want to release your stress than must visit here.

Name: occlusion_vikas
Title: disgusting !except for its a temple badly managed
Review: the access is poor and badly behaved staff and arrogant behaviour . no parking available the hall is good and well ventilated but the cooks are horrible and absolutely unclean and unhygenic food

Name: sudha966
Title: A temple in Kachiguda
Review: shyam mandir near kachiguda station is a good place to visit.  the atmosphere here is very peaceful and everyone loves going to this place again and again

Name: Gugan_Ilango
Title: A Beautiful Temple
Review: Shyam Mandir is a beautiful temple and very clean temple. also is very quiet and have pooja at early morning

Name: Rita K
Title: Jai Shri Shyam
Review: We visited this temple at Hyderabad for second time and really liked darshan and cleanliness, prasad was also very tasty. Hanuman and Shiv temple in the same campus is very good.

Name: chittajallu r
Title: The utmost devine experience
Review: The Sham Mandir situated at kachiguda Hyderabad , on a hillock called veeranna gutta opposite kachiguda railway station. Its a serene devine place of different Hindu temples and the main deity Sham baba fulfils all your wishes once you durrender to him and in Ganesh temple the murthy of Ganesh is beautifully carved in marble stone looks like ready to bless the devotees.The shivji and Hanuman temples are equally devine and powerful. In this temple complex there will be some kind or the other devine programmes conducted in the open space, which give solace to the soul of audience.A must place to visit in Hyderabad

Name: BRKanth
Title: Shyam Mandir in City
Review: Visited this place while going out of station  from Kachiguda. Place is neatly maintained but sometimes lift do not work and could be difficult for old people. Overall grt place.

Name: chandrasg
Title: peaceful place
Review: the shyam mandir at kachiguda is a good place to pray in peace and have some solace. though it is situated in a busy, boisterous area,  once you enter the temple in the evening, you find the place very peaceful. there is also free lunch provided to the poor in the afternoon. its not crowded most of the time and you can have a good darshan and meditate if you like.

Name: anuradha2013
Title: Quite, peaceful and devine
Review: I normally am a temple goer and like to sit inside the Garbh gruha's. I also like the idol's, their dress and ornaments down south. It is always lovely for me.

Name: Prasad B
Title: Spiritual place :-)
Review: Place is simple and spiritual ..and well maintained with sanity and state of art architecture..A must place to visit

Name: Anand R
Title: Shyam Mandir
Review: its not popular as it is but TS Govt must promote the toursim this place would be better attractions

Name: jaggu536
Title: place of devotees
Review: this is a famous shyaam mandir near kacheguda railway station. famous and also the attraction in the centre for the travellers and tourists

Name: Yuvaraj V
Title: Nice and must go place.
Review: Nice and must go place.Very near to kachiguda railway station. Well maintained and peaceful place.Must go to to feel the spirituality.

Name: Krupali J
Title: Very calm place to visit !!
Review: I loved visiting this place, as the place was very silent and calm, though its located near to railway station. Personally, I found this place very calm and peaceful. One must visit this place.

Name: Hemanth Kumar Reddyshetty
Title: Peaceful Place
Review: I visit this temple 3-4 times a year. The temple has host of gods from Jagannath Swamy, Shiva, Ganesh, Navagrahas, etc. Even though this temple is located very near to Kachiguda Railway station, which is a buzzing place, I find this temple to be very silent and peaceful place. It is spread across vast area with many small temples around and I strongly suggest you to visit this place, if you haven't yet done so.There are lot of restaurants around movie theaters near by to this temple, so you may plan your weekend appropriately.

Name: rly241181
Title: Excellent Temple
Review: Nice place to go. Feels really peace and clam. Many gods Temple are there inside. Bajrang Bali, Shiva,Ganesha,Krishna,Shanidev, Durga maa.

Name: Kavitha R
Title: Worth a visit
Review: Situated just few meters from Kachiguda railway station, this temple is a worth your time. A very well maintained place with lift facility. The main sanctum is for Khatu shyam, grandson of Bhima.He had obtained a boon from Krishna to the effect that he would be known by Krishna's own name (Shyam) in the Kaliyuga era (presently ongoing) and worshiped.The sanctum is at a height but we can see the deity from the bottom itself, fully adorned in various flower garlands.There are separate temples for Ganesha,Hanuman,Durga,Shiva and Navagrahas inside the compound.

Name: Chandrapc
Title: calm and peaceful
Review: Eventhough this temple is opposite to the kachiguda station, calm environment  and peaceful atmosphere. it is having another name as veeranna gutta famous  oldest hanuman mandir is builtn inside

Name: sandy19880712
Title: Beautiful place
Review: Beautiful place to visit the temple and see the location inside will feel some peacefull and relax at any time i visited when i stay kachiguda.

Name: Jagadishwar R
Title: Spirirtual
Review: One & only Shyam Mandir in Hyderabad. Serene place quiet & peaceful , you have to spend some time here, there are other temples on this small hillock, One of the oldest Hanuman mandir is situated here, it is also called Veeranna Gutta. Lift is available for old & handicapped persons.

Name: NilabhTripathy
Title: Awesome temple
Review: One of the best temples in hyderabad. really clean and you will find peace in that temple. such an energetic environment with 7-8 different temples inside the premises.

Name: h12564
Title: Nice
Review: Very peaceful, even-though near to Kachiguda railway station.Tasty prasadam as well :)Can spend some time in that quiet atmosphere

Name: Kunal_2799
Title: Amazing
Review: Amazing Place to have relaxed , peaceful and calm environment, Mind will bed in spiritual state, and feel like linked to god

Name: Praveen K
Title: Peaceful and well maintained temple near kachiguda station
Review: a good temple near kachiguda station and is maintained well. This is on a small hillock just next to the kachiguda station.

Name: sudmaha
Title: Are you arriving at kacheguda station?
Review: This was the first place i visited when reached hyderabad. just opposite to the kacheguda railway station and good way to start the journey.

Name: guddu1954
Title: reverred by all hindus
Review: This temple complex is having many temples,but the main temple of Shri Shyam baba temple  is the centre of attraction.the temple also runs free charities.

Name: Karan K
Title: One of the best temples in Hyderabad
Review: From the start to the end, this place is just Lovely.!! the entire temple is clad in white glowing marble. it houses Beautiful temples of Ganeshji, Hanumanji, Shivji, Nau Grah, Durga Mata & the biggest one of Shree Sham Baba, one of the most peaceful sights. and the moment u enter the temple be prepared to be memorized by the awesome fragrance of the flowers & ithar this is a must visit place.

Name: Vikram A
Title: Beautiful Shyam Baba temple at hillock
Review: Its a beautiful temple at top of a hillock. Made with white Marble has idols of many deities. We visit it regularly.Its well maintained and located near Kachiguda Rly station. Must visit in Hyderabad.

Name: KASI VENKOBA RAO
Title: Temple on Hillock...Looking so Good
Review: Shyam Mandir dedicated to Lord Krishna is abode on a small hillock near Kacheguda Railway Station, Hyderabad. This small hillock was formerly known as 'Veeranna Gutta", meaning a hillock by the name Veeranna.The temple is open from 6.00 AM to 12.00 noon and from 5.00 PM to 10.00 PM every day. The attraction at the temple is the Bhajan by the devotees.in the evening. People are admired with the Bhajan.The temple complex comprises of Lord Sri Shyam Baba, Lord Sri Radha Krishna, Lord Sri Shiva, Lord Sri Anjaneya, Lord Sri Kaal, Bhairava, Amba Mata, Navagraha.The complex looks so attractive in the night with illumination. The hillock has a few steps to reach the temple. No doubt, this is one of the main attractions in the city of Hyderabad and one cannot afford to miss this temple and go without blessed by the God....

Name: Naganna Travel and Food Expert
Title: Nice and Big Krishna Mandir......
Review: Krishna mandir, called gutta in kachiguda, near to Railway station... this temple has most of the Gods and the prasadam and daily annadhanam is the activites been performed at here....

Name: wander93
Title: Beautiful
Review: This is an amazing temple. There's something really about the hymns sung at Shyam Mandor in devotion to Lord Krishna. Would recommend visiting around 6.30PM in case you are planning to attend the aarti.

Name: sriramsatuluri
Title: Reminds me of my childhood days.
Review: I still remember, when I was in school, I used to visit Shyam mandir often and sing aarti with crowd at 7pm. The best part was, the prasadam post aarti. :) In spite of being amidst heavy traffic zone, you will be lost in divinity when you enter inside the temple. You will be surrounded with some cosmic waves. Love this place.I would always recommend this place, even if you can take an hour aside from your schedules, you will know what I was talking about.Radhe KrishnaJai Sri KrishnaHare Krishna Hare Krishna

Name: shree1438
Title: Shyam Baba Temple
Review: The temple is well maintain by Kanchi Kamkoti and we will find lord ganesha, lord Veerabhadra, Lord Shyam Baba, Lord Shiva, Lord Hanuman and Navagraha temples at the same premises.

Name: Karthik A
Title: A good divine place
Review: Shyam Mandir is one of the well maintained temples. This is located near kachiguda station. There are different gods in the temple. The temple priest some of them will behave odd this you can except because this maintained by private. The atmosphere is very good. The morning Aarti time is around 8. Morning and evening you can see more crowd. The do serve free bhojan for poor everyday i think. The will conduct some camps regularly for physiotherapy.

Name: Avinash P
Title: must visit
Review: not too far from kachiguda cross roads and situated right opposite to kachiguda railway station, this temple is a must visit. very well managed, organised and neat. we went on a sunday afternoon and it wasnt much of a crowd. generally devotees were with families. the staff is helpful and courteous. no signs of commercialization and i pray it remains so. there are a few other deities in the premises that you should visit.there was some free medical camp organised when we visited so it appears the temple undertakes social responsibility seriously.

Name: vibha123
Title: Serene Temple and a Must visit places
Review: This temple is just 100 m from The Kachiguda Railway station.It has various gods apart from Shyam/Lord Sree Krishna.A very good and pleasant place and if you visit it in the evening it will be more good and it will give a very good look with lights all around the temple. Must see place while you are in Hyderabad.I have been there just once but feel like going there all the time i get chance.The best part about this place is that you have serene beauty of the God, Peace, Greenary and very less people which makes it a prefered place to be when you want to stay away from the sounds of the world.

Name: guddu3101
Title: Very Good Place To Visit
Review: This temple is just 100 m from The Kachiguda Railway station.It has various gods apart from Shyam/Lord Sree Krishna.A very good and pleasant place and if you visit it in the evening it will be more good and it will give a very good look with lights all around the temple.Must see place while you are in Hyderabad.

Name: Naren
Title: Yellamma Temple
Review: Balkampet Yellamma temple is a famous temple which resides at balkampet, it's very easy to reach temple from Ameerpet and Balanagar.

Name: jainms
Title: Balkampet temple
Review: have seen lot of devotees and visitors come here to this temple. I was staying near this temple for 3-4 months.

Name: BRKanth
Title: Divine place in SR nagar
Review: This is the oldest temple in SR nagar. Must visit place especially during Bonalu festivals and during durga puja.

Name: Sumit S
Title: Faith
Review: People have great faith in this temple. It is near my home and I visit it quite often to offer my prayers

Name: venkatakarthik
Title: devotional and enlightening
Review: we get to see Lord Ganesh first as he is the one to receive our puja first as he is considered to be the "pradama pujyudu"--meaning one who is to be devoted first before any other god or goddess. the designs on the wall of the temple are good but lack the intricacy we see in much older temples.

Name: Hari K
Title: Most Popular Historical Temple
Review: The Temple will give you a very peace mind and blessings from God Yellamma Thalli.Here Bonalu are very special event.

Name: GLOBALSEAS
Title: best temple
Review: best temple to visit as the god in the holy well , all dreams come true by visiting this temple a peaceful place .

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: spiritual as well as landmark
Review: This place is a big landmark in the area and people visit this place.Roads around are crowded but this place could be visited once for spiritual reasons

Name: ravi p
Title: Felt Devine and happy
Review: I felt very nice while visiting this temple.. seems to be very powerful ammavaru..It was Wednesday around 10 so there wasn’t much rush so had good archana and peaceful darshan too..Archana and special 10rs darshan ticket makes it quick To see ammavaru but it wasn’t required today as not much rush..Don’t forget to take ammavari abhishekha water as there is a say that it’s very auspicious water and cures diseases..Only issue is lack of parking for 4 wheeler.. if it’s not busy then you can get parking in side lanes but else difficult as temple is on main road..

Name: koteswararao
Title: temple with bhathi
Review: balkampet  temple  is famous for all  Hyderabad and many visits on many times feel that  good happen if they wish

Name: TADAKAMADLA A
Title: Powerful Temple
Review: Balkampet temple is very famous and most trusted temple by people, even Nita Ambani also visits the temple.

Name: Omkar T
Title: The Most Powerful Goddess!!!Yellamma thalli is Swayambhu in Balkampet
Review: The Great Powerful Goddesses Yellamma Thali is Swayambhu at Balkampet in a well.This Temple  has a History of Thousands of Years, we Need to get down to the well for Darshan of Goddesses Yellamma Thalli. Most Peace full & Powerful place in India.Aabhishakam will starts Daily Morning 5am to 6am, & Temple Closes 8:30PM.  Every Tuesday and Sunday there will be Special Pooja's like Pancha Aarthi's. Special Pooja's will held in the NavaRathri days. Yellamma Thali Kalayanam will Happen on every Year First tuesday of Aashadam masam, Where Lakes of Devotes will darshan yellamma thalli on that Special day.

Name: higghligght shiva
Title: A famous and powerfull temple
Review: MANY OF US THEY DO KNOW ABT tHIS PLACE .HERE U CAN SEE A bIG STATUE WITH LOTUS YELLAMMA Devi, inside many idols r beautiful nice 2see.First u can see ganesh idol inside u must go to D underground area to see yellamma goddess after that From right side u see pochama devi,naga devatha,&annapurna devi etc.every Friday they put anadhanam .& For spl darshan/laddu/pulihora only 10rs .if u do archanas/homam/or any sevas refer to pic [photo 3]details r available

Name: samvarth
Title: Some power in the temple
Review: I can tell you that there is some peacefulness once you enter it. Considered powerful by local people and it can be easily reached by local transport.Worth going

Name: sritilak
Title: Goddess temple
Review: This temple  is sacred temple of Hindus. In telangana Hyderabad. Mostly  this place is preferred to visit in Friday and Sunday.

Name: Raneshtalari
Title: Very powerfull Godess
Review: Even Ambani wife had visited this place, people cut hen and goat if the wish is fulfilled, the place is very powerful.

Name: Krishna P
Title: Historic temple
Review: Visited many times this temple.Temple maintained by local body.Must visit when you are in Ameerpet or SR Nagar area.fast darshan rs 10.Authentic south Indian village type temple.Temple offers many special sevas for which tickets are available at temple premises.

Name: Seaside702735
Title: Yellamma temple
Review: Very peaceful and powerful temple in Hyderabad,Jai yellamma talli, every one must visit this temple thank you

Name: santosh2ind
Title: Balkampet yellamma temple
Review: This is one of the famous temple in hyderabad. this temple is famous for boanalu. this is a very powerful temple.

Name: renu_73
Title: for those who believe in the power of the goddess
Review: This Temple is always crowded and has a huge number of followers who come there regularly for the blessings of "Maa". She is believed to fulfill all the wishes of her devotees. It is in the crowded part of the city but is a large temple.

Name: pavankumarraju
Title: Famous temple
Review: Balkampet Yellamma Temple is one of the famous temple in Hyderabad. It is situated near SR nagar. Lot of people visit this temple from every where.

Name: saikiran v
Title: Worship
Review: Nice temple and powerful godesses. If we wish anything and pray to that godess . Definetly it will be done withing 1 week.

Name: Naresh k
Title: Information About the people
Review: "people those days dug a well for water there they found surprisingly a rock with a sulpture of a devi engraved on it ,they try to remove it and wanted to build well for their agriculture usage"Here,some lines above describes about people, may i know the details about those people behind ?if you have no idea about those people. contact "kOTHAPALLY" surname family people nearby the temple, they will provide you all the details. thanks.

Name: V V S Ganesh N
Title: Famous for  Bonalu Festival
Review: Balkampet Yellamma Temple is Famous for  Bonalu Festival in telangana region and everytime the temple is loaded with local people with offerings to goddess yellamama on wide scale.

Title: Temple
Review: Very popular god Easy to reach here Balkampet Yellamma temple is an Hindu goddess temple located at Balkampet in Hyderabad. Yearly in ashadamasam kalayanavostam is done. It is very famous among Bonaalu and on Sundays

Name: nagesh1955
Title: Visit of balkampet temple
Review: Very big temple in the cloud area. Jathara will start in ashadamasam, lot of people will come to this temple

Name: Karthik T
Title: Very powerful temple
Review: Balkampet yellama temple very traditional and very powerful goddess Yellama Talli and I visit first it was a pleasant experience

Name: raja p
Title: popular goddess in balkampet
Review: this is famous yellamma temple in balkam pet.this temple opens by6am to 1pm and 3pm to 8pm.the goddess yellamma is 10feet in height.it is one of the oldest temple in hyderabad.

Name: Hima H
Title: Religious
Review: Famous and powerful ammavaru. Same yallamma temple is there in gajularamaram. Must visit. Please come to ushamullapudi cardiac center.its walkable from there

Name: Ermroy
Title: 700 years old historical renuka yellamma temple
Review: Yellamma temple known as balkampet yellamma temple in hyderabad is very ancient temple with great history.15 th century then nobody knows anything about this particular place filled with trees and agriculture fields ,people those days dug a well for water there they found surprisingly a rock with a sulpture of a devi engraved on it ,they try to remove it and wanted to build well for their agriculture usage ,many people tried but coulnot move the stone because there is so much of water ,people droped the idea of shifting the idol and built a small temple for the idol.overa period of time people came to know the water which is flowing from the head side of idol has curative powers and skin diseaces are being cured and many more experiences of people over a period of time became very popular .in1978 endowments department of the state took over the administration of the temple and alloted funds for development of the temple.to day this temple is in the heart of the city commercial center visited by thousands of people from all over the country .many engineears tried to source the water which is flowing from head side portion of the idol couldnot source the water flowing there at one they also tried to change the course of the water flow they could not do it now they pump the water continuously and distribute to people as holy water and also for curative powers of the water people from all walks of life come and fetch water for their skin problems .to day in a year there will be special poojas lakhs of people visit this temple ,every tuesday and sunday thousands of people visit this place in total faith.now this temple has become huge place of worship ,recently reliance chair person mrs neetha ambani also visited this place for darshan ,during ashadam and sravanam months supposed to be very auspicious ,every day the rituals starts from morning 5am and from 7am long quese for having darshan of this deity .this particular balkampet road as i told you is thickly populated area and a busy commercial center car parking is a problem .the new formed state of telangaana chief minister popularly known as kcr also visited this place .there is also nagdevta temple with in this premises attracts thousands of people for special poojas..

Name: Avirup Guha Roy
Title: Man Made Reservoir & Lake
Review: This Man made lake, lying 20 km to the west of Hyderabad, was built in 1920 by the VIIth Nizam - Mir Osman Ali Khan....spread over an area of 46 sq km, its created by the dam across the river Isa... this is still the main source of water supply for Hyderabad & Secunderabad

Name: anuj1401
Title: Waste of time
Review: Access road to lake is closed…park in front of Golkonda Resort is ok ok.. it doesn’t have washroom facility.. don’t waste your time..

Name: kk2089
Title: Closed for construction
Review: Place is closed and under construction, the nearby Jalamandal park is also closed ;Came after disappointment.The govt officials have not even put proper boards informing visitors, what a pity !

Name: Abhishek S
Title: Good Visit
Review: Visit this place early morining.It is a good road drive from Hyderabad.You can enjoy sunrise here and enjoy the cool breeze.Can take beautiful pictures and can do jogging there

Name: sree143in
Title: Plesent
Review: A Plesent place of evening visits. and some time to spend. good to visit once atleast. nice look of nature.

Name: Sunil
Title: Sunset  view
Review: The lake is really good and clean and well maintained and the best thing is to watch sunset at evening. It’s one of the best thing to watch

Name: Sudhir K
Title: Great place for a walk or peaceful moment
Review: I have been a couple of times to this place. It's a quite place and there are two small parks, which has entry fee. The place is nice in evening and one can spend 1-2 hours with family. During dusk time, some insects are there. Limited snacks facility available. Overall, i think its a good place to go with family for 1-2 hours, very quite not much activity but kids can get some free space to roam around.

Name: Sounak Poddar
Title: Sunset
Review: Very nice place to be during the sunset. very quiet and peaceful. Very few places are here in Hyderabad where to enjoy sunset, and this is one of them.

Name: jainms
Title: OK
Review: Osman sagar Lake is located outskirts of Hyderabad and not well maintained. Can visit once as one of the visiting place but nothing much to expect from here.

Name: beyondtravel
Title: Beautiful lake
Review: A very picturesque man made lake made by nizam of Hyderabad, located 15 km from city,  not commercialised hence simple. Good for sunset

Name: drpuneetkansal
Title: Hyderabad diaries
Review: In India we have many tourist spots if govt or tourism deptartment develops them a lot of people will get employment.

Name: EaterNGo
Title: can see once
Review: the late is beautiful, but i think many things can done to attract tourist here, perhaps can add some fun fair activities

Name: S R V
Title: Lake bereft of people
Review: This lake is 7 kms from Chilkur Balajee temple. The travellers can walk down the dam site and see the lake around. On a hot day we went and so no much crowd.

Name: Udayan N
Title: Nice lake
Review: Good place to go and chill out..but roads leading to lake from some areas is very dangerous during rainy season..also view during rainy season is good there

Name: Dilip kumar
Title: One of the timepass
Review: This lake will make your time pass well and you can enjoy with your friends.you can visit this place anytime.

Name: Usha65
Title: Favorite place
Review: It is my childhood favorite, very beautiful place near the Gandipet lake. It is a popular picnic spot for the people of Hyderabad. The facilities are to be improved.

Name: Daniel T
Title: More famous as Gandipet lake
Review: This water body which supplies drinking water for Hyderabad is very important for the city. Its more famous as Gandipet lake, given the area next to this is called Gandipet.There is a park next to this, which is a good place to bring young kids & family to spend a pleasant evening.Route to this place is isolate after sunset, with not enough street lights or amenities. So be careful to stay around after sunset.

Name: Subhasree M
Title: Nice for day picnic
Review: We visited this place last week. We planned for a day picnic and started around 11am and reached within an hour. There is a park at the destination, which has actually no view of the lake. Though there are lawns and trees and playgrounds for kids, but as the scenic beauty is completely confined within big nets, we didn't like the place much. After a short breakfast, we chose to move out and started walking beside the path of the lake. After few minutes we reached at another park and this time its better. We had lunch and played on the lawn. Kids enjoyed playing with ducks and hens. Had a beautiful view of sunset. As the day ends, we started to packup.Overall, had a nice day outing with friends. Recommend for one time visit.

Name: rsraghavan6
Title: Good place
Review: Used to be an Amazing place before. Now most part of this area is locked. Osman Sagar lake is quite Big and people mostly come here for chilling and enjoy the scenic beauty!!!

Name: venkatakarthik
Title: best place for a selfie addict
Review: been there with a selfie addict friend and most of the time i spend clicking his images in various poses, best for couples and friends who want to chill out. the garden is great...

Name: deepa v
Title: Nice lake
Review: The lake is situated in gandipet There is a small park and people can spend few hours here..Lot of greenery.People visit especially with friends.

Name: Debsree Pande
Title: Sunrise and Sunset Point
Review: This place has a park which I haven't liked personally.But there is a point from which you can experience the breath taking view of sunrise and sunset and another point from where the city view is amazing.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: pretty good
Review: Its pretty good with all the birds and natural scenic beauty.Mist go to this place if you stay in hyderabad.WIll be good in the morning for photos

Name: Avishek Chatterjee
Title: A Serene place a little bit out of the city
Review: I went to this place during the sunset, it is located near the financial district, outer ring road.The place is serene and very nice with not that much of activities. Its actually a dam built long back on the Musi river for the water supply of Hyderabad. The place is good as a picnic spot as well

Name: sudeshrele
Title: Breathtaking Lake of Nizam Era
Review: The lake was built during Nizam era o protect city from flooding. its a huge lake with a dam that divides city in 2 parts as Hyderabad & Secunderabad.

Name: Anamika K
Title: OGood place
Review: On the outskirts of Hyderabad, also known as Gandipet is the Osman Sagar lake. Elless world, Ocean park and Treasure island surround this lake, making it a famous tourist destination.

Name: Sam S
Title: The water bottle of Hyderabad.
Review: This lake served as a water bottle to the people of Hyderabad for 400 years. The Telangana Govt. has done a good thing by imposing restrictions on construction activities within a 100 Kms vicinity so as to restore the water catchment/storing feature of the lake. History tellers say that more than 40 villages were evacuated to build this lake which houses a water conversion plant. Its a good picnic spot for tourists, families, locals etc. Environment protection measures must be enacted to save it from pollution.

Name: GayathriSharma
Title: Evening sunset is beautiful
Review: Beautiful place to enjoy nature from concrete jungle.prefer sunset and sun raise timings to enjoy nature.

Name: Rajani K
Title: Full of life
Review: This is also a man made lake in the city of Hyderabad. Since it was monsoon time during my visit, it was full of water and looked so lively.  This lake supplies water to several places in the city. The lake side is a soothing place for people to enjoy a morning or evening walk watching the nature and few birds who visit the spot.

Name: pjanil1968
Title: Nice place
Review: Wonderful place to spend time with family especially on weekends or evenings. Nice view of sunset. Love the place a lot

Name: Gaurab2017
Title: Good Hangout Place with Friends
Review: If you want to witness a water body and a green surroundings - Gandipet is one of that place. Situated on Osman Sagar Lake, easily flocked by college goers and couples. One can come during rainy season to actually some water content in the lakes. Good Time pass place though.

Name: kc_dude
Title: A scenic place with some high viewing points
Review: Visted this place one evening and a pretty good place for relaxed walk or simply resting for some time. There is a gated road that you can walk along the lake bank and enjoy the breeze. There is a small hill and view point for photo oppertunities.There were couple of small vendors and a restroom facility. Nothing more.The place closes early like 5 or 6PM and it should open late. May not be a good place in the sunny day time.

Name: Im O
Title: Osman sagar lake
Review: Osman sagar lake is beautiful place of hyderabad.view of lake in evening get more attracted..nice to visit with friend and family

Name: SaiKumardaram
Title: Great place to spend with Family in low budget
Review: It is a great water body. Picnic Spot with family or friends or couple.Great when visit in months from July to Jan.

Name: higghligght shiva
Title: Beauty of Gandipet lake
Review: O.S.L. is 18 kms from mehdipatnam to gandipet there we have only 2 bus no's it is 120 &220 it is on timings. Lake is very nice full of water and plants, from top. it is very cool breeze & touching on my cheeksthere is nearby 2 gardens r there 1,Dwaraka & 2,rock garden.D differencebetween dwaraka garden It is very big and very good for friends and familiescome & play games ,they will enjoy a lot. full of disturbance , heavy noisein rock garden is a small many couples are spotting there. silence & peacefull i think this is best place 4 couples. i never think this place looks like Extraordinary. Y i miss this type of place or i shall  can'texpress in words but weakends much crowd R there i gone with my life patner i want 2 stay there only. . near bysome attraction R there saibaba & Gandi maisama temples, Ocean park.Out side some chill out snacks ,fast food etc.This locations is very good for all to see & 2 take pics

Name: Sweetbunnycute
Title: Mesmerizing view of the lake
Review: the lake of osman sagar is a water reservoir in hyderabad and it is a place to go in the morning and walk around the lake or may be meditate or take your bicycle along and cycle or just sit back and enjoy the natural beauty. it is located in gandhipet village. the view of the lake from the top of a big rock is mesmerizing. also there are a lot of big boulders(rocks) present on which one can climb and have a really good time with nature. if one can find time for themselves and wants to spend quality time with their families especially children or one enjoys natural beauty with peace then s/he should visit this place for sure.

Name: adventurous_adi
Title: Used to be a decent place to visit
Review: I used to often drop by this place either early mornings or late evenings with friends as it was a decent place for outdoor activity. Over the period of time it has deteriorated, roads are at times blocked due to some ongoing construction or  barricaded by traffic police. There are very few water bodies in Hyderabad little away from the city for a walk or bike ride, if such places are also blocked then there would be no other place to hangout.

Name: rambha b
Title: A lot more beautiful during the Sunrise
Review: We decided to watch the Sunrise near the lake. It was a long amazing road trip from Hyderbad to reach there before 5:30 am. Watched the orangish sky, clouds with golden lining and the powerful Sun God rising up in the sky.  The golden rays of the sun falling into the lake waters gave an spectacular view.  We spend some time sitting on the bank of the lake enjoying the cool gentle breeze and took a stroll along the lake shore.

Name: Subodh B
Title: Decent place to visit. Nothing exciting though.
Review: Away from the city. Averagely crowded even on a hot May afternoon. Parking is available. No restaurants at this location.

Name: Rajani B
Title: Serene place
Review: This is an artificial lake which is fed with water from Musi river.  It was constructed in the first half of 20th Century to provide a supporting source of water for the residents of Hyderabad city.  Before this lake, only Hussain Sagar lake catered to the water needs of the city. The place is very beautiful and serene. The lake provides cool,serene environment within the city premises.

Name: gani1997
Title: Place to enjoy
Review: I suggest you to visit this place during day time but its just a place to sit and chill the scenery for some time. Its gud go and have a visit.

Name: Rao1940497
Title: Just enjoy
Review: Once upon a lovers paradise like, with some even committing suicide due to breakdowns, it is just worth for a time pass.

Name: Parag Kumar R
Title: T
Review: It's an good one to visit with family. Loved it. Awesome place to stay. Would prefer this every time.

Name: Manish K
Title: A large and beautiful expanse of water
Review: The Osman Sagar Lake was built by the erstwhile Nizam of Hyderabad to ensure regular water supply to the city. While the city now draws its water from other sources, this massive lake retains its charm as a popular picnic and holiday destination. Located in Gandipet in western Hyderabad, it may not be as renowned as the Hussain Sagar Lake in the heart of the city, but has plenty to offer. it has nice gardens, including one on a small island next to the dam, good vantage points to click photographs as well as a couple of amusement parks nearby. However, only visit it when it has water and not when dry.

Name: Saurabha W
Title: Take a break from noisy city area and spend some time here!
Review: Its not a very big lake, but a beautiful one. You can click beautiful pictures here. Good place to spend some quite time from city.
