We have returned to parking around 10 PM and shocked to see that the speedometer set, dome (cockpit) part is broken and entirely dislocated.Previously, a two weeks back, similarly we have noticed scratches on the tank of our bike when we returned to take our bike from the parkingVery much disappointed with the POOR MAINTENANCE and NO SECURITY ALERT, especially in the PARKING AREAS.Kindly give strict instructions to the security staff to watch or monitor the vehicles parked in all the three level cellars. And observe if any person is in 'suspect' condition or stags / boys doing mischievous things in the parking lot.It cost us Rs.3000 to recover from the damage caused to our bike

Name: ramakrishnabanoth3
Title: NEXT GEN Mall
Review: With all the features like play house,Movie and shopping and good number of kids play station. Good place to have fun .

Name: Ravi M
Title: yderabad standards it is a good place for Shopping , Movies and food. For me, Delhi/NCR malls are so much larger, b
Review: For Hyderabad standards it is a good place for Shopping , Movies and food. For me, Delhi/NCR malls are so much larger, better in terms of International Brands and multi cuisine world class restaurants. The Galleria Mall is well located in the upmarket Banjara Hills. No problem about parking and no queues at the movie hall ans no waiting to get into a restaurant. The Big Bazar has facility for baggage drop for travellers who do not have to lug around with their bags. A nice experience overall.

Name: EaterNGo
Title: boring
Review: whats here? other than cinema and pricey outlet..ops..ya there are rich people who looks hop here..but NOT ME..not worth it...finally went to value bazaar at G floor and bought lassi to drink..burppp

Name: Georgio Valentino Rayala
Title: The Only Mall in Hyderabad which is Directly connected to the Metro
Review: The best thing about this mall is that you can go directly to the first floor of the mall from the metro. Also it has all the major anchor stores like Shoppers Stop, Pantaloons, Big Baazar and a huge multiplex "PVR Playhouse". I also like their food court which is the best in terms of sheer variety of food outlets. Other than the food court they have a coffee shop on the ground floor "Cafe Coffee Day" and fast food outlets like Pizza hut, KFC, Mamu, Norfest dhaba on the 4 th floor next to the multiplex. There is also a Japanese store "Miniso" on the basement floor and a Korean outlet right next to the entrance from the metro. There is a gaming area "Busters" on the top floor next to the food court.

Name: sugunapriya b
Title: Spacious mall with best stores
Review: This Titanic shaped mall gave an awesome shopping experience to us. Usually we are malls Hoppers and this one looked more spacious even on a weekend and found most of our favorite stores in one place. The food court is good and as I said finding my favorite Melting pot was another happy moment for me. .

Name: Naz_Aadam
Title: Shopping visit
Review: The place is very well built, and nice and spacious lots of variety of shops. We had something to eat and the food court is nice and spacious.There was a downside, the toilets are in poor condition. It’s like they ran out of money and made some random toilets. There wasn’t a changing table for my toddler did not look very clean the floor was really dirty and the cleaners were not helpful at all. She was drinking tea in the loo area with her friends.

Name: chjprakash
Title: spacious
Review: the mall is very huge and it is nicely kept. there are all sorts of brands in the mall and many restaurants in the food court.

Name: ramesh
Title: Very convenient from metro station.
Review: The mall has a very good lineup of brands. the best part it has a direct skywalk from the nearest metro station.

Name: Deboli D
Title: Awesome Mall
Review: Yesterday I visited this mall to watch the film Manikarnika . I was pretty impressed with the Mall starting from the parking facility , the ambiance,the shops and the food court. Name a brand and it was there with their awesome collection. Was too happy to see William Pen and Nykaa as soon as I entered the Mall. Collections at Neerus , W, shoppers stop , soch....was just awesome. You really have a good choice of food there. The movie hall was very clean with awesome sound systems.last but not the least was very impressed with the valet parking...they didn’t keep us waiting long in this cold temperature unlike other malls. I will rate it as one of the best malls of our Hyderabad and very centrally located.

Name: Mr. KEY
Title: Amazing mall, great brand line up
Review: Well, a lot of Indian brands, so be careful to skip them. You can find many European brands and that's lovely. Neat and big, crowdy at times, but I like it.

Name: Ravindra V
Title: Almost occupied now
Review: Good size mall with stores like Bib Bazaar, Pantaloons, Shoppers Stop, max etc. The mall is almost completely occupied now with many shops. Good collection of stores. There is Taco Bell, Burger King, Pizza Hut etc in addition to food court on the top floor. Has PVR multiplex with special PVR Playhouse screen. Has direct access to Punjagutta metro station which is very convenient.

Name: chandrasekhar g
Title: Best place for movies and shoppping
Review: I saw robo 2.o movie at Next galleria madhapur.Shopping malls,food courts and movies theatres are available.

Name: pardhreddyc
Title: The worst mall-PVR cinemas
Review: We went on 13th October 2018 to watch movie small foot..at 7:30pm show..show did not start at 7:30 pm and however it was started at 8:05 PM and the reason the show team gave us was,”first 15 minutes adds only” ,so we would be directly playing movie...but even after that adds were telecasted for next 15 to 20 minutes.The hanging chairs on backside were removed and placed on the gloor,where few were broken and my kids while playing hot hurt and finally we spent 1000rs for doctor on nextday..maintenace of play house is horrible and they just looting money from customers.We ordered popcorn and samosa with no bill.The answer what we got from him was”Shop is not opened”.How comw shop was not opened ....We got seating at G1 to 4,where earlier there was a barricade to avoid falling from the step,but yesterday they removed and we were worried a lot  about kids while they were moving at this area..I suggest this galleria mall should be visisted by Govt officials to check for the safety and the frauds that being executed by the mall prople.

Name: Shashank1961
Title: Great New Mall near Punjagutta Metro Station
Review: Hyderabad Next Galleria Mall is located just beside Punjagutta Metro Station.Shoppers Stop is very big and the best in twin cities.Food court is OK but limited space & options. For Mexican food lovers,Taco Bell is there. All usual upmarket brand stores are there like Soch, American Tourister etc. Big Bazaar outlet is also available for quick grocery shopping. Overall rating- 4 Stars.

Name: Voyager820777
Title: Awesome but food court
Review: Nice Mall. Movie theatre is awesome but the food court is bad (Not the food). Places like KFC and BURGER KING have very less seating space. KFC hardly has 9-10 tables. Food court can be improved. Seating is the only problem. Rest everything is good. Nice place for shopping too!! The gaming centre was awesome. I have never seen such advanced technology.

Name: Mir A
Title: VERY GOOD BUT NOT EXCELLENT
Review: I Visited with my friends.Mall is very good but not better then GVK One & Sujana Malll.Because GVK one & Sujana Mall entrance really awesome and this mall entrance simple please adjust it next time I will come with my family.Big bazar employees working very slow.

Name: ram2001aditya
Title: Imitated food court that was not authentic enough
Review: This review is purely on food court that didn't have proper black coffee options which is quite essential basic.  Except for some good food brands , there no local affordable nutritious good quality food options, This applies to all pseudo western malls in India.

Name: Georgio Valentino Rayala
Title: Nice Mall But Many Shops Yet To Open
Review: It is a nice mall which has opened recently and it is located in the lane opposite to the Central Mall in Panjagutta area. I went there along with a friend to watch movie "Black Panther" at the PVR Cinemas which is located inside this mall. Also it is huge and has anchor stores like Shoppers Stop, Pantaloons, Reliance Trends as well as many other stores but not many of them have opened. There is a food court on the Level 05 opposite to the PVR cinemas.

Name: yakubp022
Title: best visit the mall rock
Review: good mall best deals best shopping mall best games zone movie screen good good security good parking good whether service is good.

Name: Emmanuel P
Title: Spacious Mall, Good Shopping & Food
Review: One Stop mall for fashion geeks, food lovers and a retreat place to enjoy with your friends.  The shopping will go from economy to luxury. The mall has well spacious parking place, and the entire mall is well maintained.    Still there are a few more shops which are yet to open.  This mall has special PVR Playhouse screen.

Name: mohdyakubpasha3
Title: Next galeria mall
Review: Good fashion and amazing games and movie screen best in my city.Food is good, most vistable place I love this mall. Parking is awasome

Name: Ravindra V
Title: Good size mall
Review: Good size mall with stores like pantaloons, Shoppers Stop, max etc. There are some more shops which are yet to open. Good collection of stores. Food options are limited to Taco Bell, Burger King, Pizza Hut etc. Some more food options are yet to open. Has PVR multiplex with special PVR Playhouse screen.

Name: raviy4248
Title: Very good mall
Review: This is a very nice mall with all the facilitaties specially suited for the people who do not like the busy look of the  in city malls. Big parking place is available and lot of stores to do.

Name: D P
Title: Pacahmaplli trip
Review: The road from Hyderabad to Pochamplli is scenic , took less tha 1 hr to reach Pacahmaplli X road after which road quality deteroriates sharply. Another 11 km to Pochampally village/rural town. Many malls specialising in Inkatha/ Patola prints are there. However all have same kind of fare and little variety. All in all if you have spare half day and enjoy road trip ans as a bonus may like to browse through some sarees do the trip. Other than that it’s not on.

Name: Tarun
Title: Cultural visit
Review: Bhoodan Pochampally is in Bhongir Division. It is 40 km from Hyderabad on Hyderabad Vijaywada Highway. It has a museum and silk saree park, which is managed by government. Here silk saree weaving process can be seen easily. Nice place to visit, stay and buy some silk garments.

Name: Daniel T
Title: One of its kind textile village in Telangana
Review: For most Indians, Pochampalli sarees is a household name. If you want to experience the saree prep in person, then this is the place to come. More suited for foreigners who'd like to know more about the saree making process.Otherwise you can visit this place to buy sarees directly from the handloom makers. Its a nice experience to watch the artisans weave magic.

Name: Dinesh_cbe
Title: Textile Village
Review: Pochampalli is a village in Telangana which is on the list of World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Located just one hour travel from Hyderabad, this village is full of handloom business. Outlets exclusively for selling their own products at cheaper & resonable price - good value for money.

Name: Prakash
Title: Pochampalli - Land of the Ikkat Saree
Review: Pochampalli (officially called Bhoodan Pochampilli) is a small village located in Yadadri Bhuvanagiri district of Telangana. It is world famous for its weaving of Ikkat Saris and other textiles. It is on the tentative list of UNESCO world heritage sites. Situated under 45 Kms from Hyderabad City (around 57.5 Kms for the RGI International Airport) it can be reached by taxi or bus. As most of the drive is on the 8-lane Nehru Outer Ring Road (ORR) expressway, the drive is generally smooth. The town is situated 11.5 Kms off the ORR. One needs to pay Toll while exiting the ORR for the distances covered. One can see bunches of cute little monkeys on the road leading from ORR to Pochampalli..In the village one can see weavers at work (they do not encourage photographs) and you can buy the textiles form the many shops in the village. I found that the best place to buy Saris, handkerchiefs, shawls and bed linen is the government run Pochampalli Weavers Coop retail outlet.Prices of saris bought in Pochampalli are generally atleast 40-50% cheaper than those found in Hyderabad or other cities or online.

Name: bhalchandra g
Title: Pochampalli Sarees
Review: A place famous for Silk. I reached early there ( 11 AM ). I visited few shops to buy Silk Sarees but to my astonishment found that the sellers are least interested in any trade. There was a marked reluctance on part of every seller to show the Sarees that they offer.Ended up at the Weavers Cooperative Society. The sales girls were enthusiastic.Purchased 2 sarees

Name: Usha65
Title: Must visit
Review: This small village is close to Hyderabad, it is a textile paradise. The sarees and other cloths are priced reasonably and of good quality.

Name: madhu c
Title: Pochampally - the beautiful ikkat weaves
Review: Been visiting Pochampally since 1980s because of my love for Indian weaves. It was a pleasure as the whole village was literally involved in the job of weaving, you could walk into a house or on the road - it was brimming with activity.Lot of weavers and specially their children have left this job because the income is not enough. You hardly see people weaving there. The place to go to is Pochampally Hand loom Park which is about an hours drive from Pochampally. That's where you can see activity. It has been very close to my heart and I have done a documentary film on the weavers.

Name: Ranaari
Title: A fine collection of textiles
Review: I dare anyone who has visited this location and came back empty handed. They offer you one of the finest cotton and that too at a very reasonable (I would say real cheap deal) rate. Best to go on a weekday as weekends are generally crowded

Name: Amartya1987
Title: Saree hub - Long drive from Hyderabad
Review: We can also call this the saree village. I have never seen so many saree shops in a small village.Just on a lazy Saturday afternoon, also the absence of good places to see around Hyderabad, I decided to use Google for some suggestions within 100kms. I got an answer which neither my wife nor my mom can reject. Yes, that's right, Pochampally.Post lunch we just quickly got ready as most of the reviews said that the working hours would be mostly 9 - 6. Filled up some petrol around Gachibowli HP petrol pump near Citibank and made our way towards ORR. As usual the ORR offered a great ride and we took an exit at Exit 11(Pedda Amberpet). Took the Vijayawada Highway, NH65 and continued for another dozen or more kilometres when the Google maps screamed to take a left in another 900 metres. Was looking for a major road when a big arch on the left side read, Pochampally-12 kms and I took a swift left and continued on the road. Even though the road was single lane and a big shift from the NH but it was mostly vacant and those 12kms was like a cakewalk.Once deep inside the village, saree shops started appearing on both sides of the road. There is a new market of brick and mortar coming up and all you can see are saree shops. Continued for a few more kilometres and hit M.G. ROAD, here we decided to take help from localites and came to a old and under renovation building where the signboard read Pochampally Co-op weavers society. We parked the vehicle on the backside of the building. There is old Muruga Swamy temple just next to the building which acts as a landmark.Here the ladies got into action and went on to explore the shop's collection, but they were outside the shop within 5 minutes, which made me wonder. On enquiring I found that the shop was quoting exorbitant prices. Another family from Hyderabad who were coming out the shop shared the same experience. Now it was turn to explore the surroundings as the only thing that you can notice everywhere are saree shops. There were a few good shops around like Nataraja, Chandana and many more which I can't recall right now with good collections.While I was waiting outside I decided to venture out and gather more info. With my very limited knowledge of local language I got to know that there is a place called Pochampally Handloom Park where you can see the actual making and also buy a few of them.Here I turned the engine on and asked my family to hop on and moved out towards the location with Google maps and asking passersby on the road. After a drive through village roads reached the Handloom Park, couldn't see the action of saree making as it was almost time for the craftsmen to go back home as it was almost 6pm but we managed to sneak into the store and catch a glimpse of the collection, it was okayish as I suppose the good ones go to cities for sale and just a few display units are kept here.Heartbroken, we thought of returning back as it was around 6:30 pm and drive back home would take another 1.5 hours.We took help from the security guys and they told me that you can avoid the Pochampally village and directly connect the Vijayawada Highway. We followed his instructions and made an exit near Yallagiri. Took an u turn in another 3-4kms and continued on the highway, joined the ORR where the signage read Hyderabad and reached back home around 8pm.Few notes to the fellow readers:1. It's a nice long drive no doubt but don't go with the intention of buying sarees at a throwaway price, it's a myth.2. Don't go in chic clothes and please don't appear to be tourists, u may be ripped with the prices.3. Language is not a barrier, local language is a good to know but the name of the game is bargaining. The better u do, the better are the prices.4. As its a small village, don't expect pizza and burgers but u get enough to survive and they are tasty.5. Locals are great here, strike a conversation and he might help you get to the best shop around.6. Lots of ATMs around, also most of the big shops have EDC, no need to carry piles of cash. Just carry enough as you might carry on any long drive.

Name: Krtdas
Title: Day Outing and Shopping From Hyderabad
Review: We visited this place on a weekend. It is merely one and half hours drive from Hyderabad(Gachibowli) towards Ramoji Film City. There is a government run small industry where you can see how pochampally is design and fabric manufacturing is done. The industry is in interiors of the village and you may need to ask the locals for exact way upto the industry. There are direction marks but not very helpful.If possible ask someone to take you inside the industry and explain all the process and activities carried on. There is a small outlet outside the industry run by government for the fabrics and products manufactured there and are available for purchase. In the village area there were many small weaver shops who sell pochampally sarees, ikkat and kalamkari work dress material at negotiable rates. Quality wise products are awesome . Carry cash because atms and card machines were not working at weavers place due to network issues. There are no eating joints nearby - only coconut water and corns are available. Food is available only when u reach near ramoji which is around 30 -40 mins drive from the village.

Name: Vanitha108
Title: Weaver's Den
Review: Visited Pochampalli about 54 kms from Hyderabad to see the weavers at work. Glad I went. The famed pochampalli sarees come at an exorbitant rate. Found my cotton ikat saree. Bought a few and towels are good. Small village with no great hotels or facilities. Can visit for a day. Serious shoppers don't take elderly people or kids.

Name: renu_73
Title: Pochampalli Silk sarees are culturally well known for the Ikat style and designed fabric.
Review: Traditional Fabrics with geometric patterns using Ikat style of dyeing. The fine geometric designs are made into into sarees and dress materials,bed sheets and more

Name: ccwd w
Title: First place for Pochampalli Sarees
Review: the place is famous for pochampalli sarees and hyderabad people visit this place for purchasing sarees because it is near by to hyderabad and the cost of the sarees are reasonable comparing in hyderabad so people of hydrabad visit offenly

Name: kranthiRamana
Title: mircale at hands
Review: Pochampally, a cluster of 80 villages, has traditional looms, whose pattern and designs are centuries-old. Today this Silk City, which is more of a cottage industry, is home to more than 10,000 weaving families in 100 villages. The fabric is marketed through the cooperative society, many other linked organizations, the master weavers and the business houses in Pochampally. Pochampally does more than Rs.10,00,000,00 annual business in terms of yarn sales, purchase of handloom products and sales. The government in 2010 divided the belt into two clusters Pochampally 1 and Pochampally 2, and is proving common weaving centres. Because of its unique design, efforts are on to revive the dying art.Pochampally saree received Intellectual Property Rights Protection or Geographical Indication (GI) status in 2005

Name: Rao1940497
Title: Fabulous sarees
Review: Since Pochampalli is highly popular for hand crafted sarees, we never miss to visit it and we could get best cotton sarees.

Name: oxostar
Title: Tourist
Review: The Pochampally is one of the best tourist place for weaving cloths there Vinobha Bhava movement is started.

Name: krishnachaitanyac
Title: Great location for handicrafts !!
Review: Pochampalli is famous for Ikkath design sarees which are made by hands of artisans & weavers. The best quality of silk sarees are available here. We have a Pochampalli handloom Park at about 10 KM from Pochampalli village where we can see a huge range of designer like items. Good for shopping lovers. There is museum of Pochampalli history and Ikkath designs. Must watch to know about History of Ikkath sarees and handloom.

Name: rajesh r
Title: pochampally sarees
Review: Pochampally Saree or Pochampalli Ikat is a saree . They are popular for their traditional geometric patterns in Ikat style of dyeing. The intricate geometric design find their way into the hands of skilled weavers and make it to the market as beautiful sarees and dress material. The Indian government's official air carrier, Air India air hostesses wear specially designed pochampally silk sarees.

Name: chetanparikh2016
Title: Excellent Place for silk Sarees
Review: This is a small town about 40 km from Hyderabad. It has numerous shops and weavers selling traditional silk  and cotton Sarees.  Specially the Hyderabad Silk Patola.  Exclusive designs and prices that are very very reasonable. A must visit. Lots of cotton bedsheets and towels varieties are available.

Name: raja p
Title: excellent worked sarees
Review: this   village is popular for woven sarees.almost majority of people working in this woven saree units.from hyderabad it is approx 40km.i went for reliable woven sarees .no cheating here.

Name: DRSSDASH
Title: Pochampalli Sarees
Review: It is situated around 42 km from Hyderabad in Nalgonda district.This village is known for the beautiful  woven sarees where every home is a weaving unit.

Name: Praveen K
Title: Small Village where one can get to see sarees made and pickup some.
Review: Pochampally is a village on the hyderabad - vijayawada highway, where one can get to visit the village see the sarees being made and also avoid middlemen and encourage the hand loomed sarees. I prefer visiting here to get to understand and respect the efforts going into this skill of weaving beautiful sarees.

Name: Naganna Travel and Food Expert
Title: nice and cool village touch for Hydrabadies
Review: this place my friend lives with her husband.... nice place for Kallu and pure leaf vegitable and good place and we have Luxuary villas built here for software employess as welll....

Name: Rohit M
Title: Visit to Pochampalli
Review: I drove to Pochampalli with my family from Hyderabad. The route to this place is awesome. Starting with ORR for over 50 KMs which is a wonderful expressway and so well maintained that it could be counted in one of the best maintained roads in the country today. You need to take exit 11 from  ORR which takes to this nice loop leading to Ramoji Film City. Few kilometres after Ramoji, one has to take a left turn to Pochampalli. The way to the village is equally nice from there. Nice landscapes and beautiful roads.Finally we reached Pochampalli but the overall experience was a bit disappointing. We expected to see some Govt run set up of weavers where we could see actual weaving happening displaying this 'Ikkat' art which is what this place is famous for. However, apart from 10-12 shops on that stretch and an old small complex of cooperative society selling sarees, we couldn't see anyone really making it. We ventured into a few houses in village and could also see some small set ups of saree making but no one was working there. The shops have a limited variety and my wife and mom couldn't select much. Also, the rates are a bit inflated by the village standards and one needs to bargain hard.All in all still worth visiting but better use of time could be to combine Ramoji Film City with it where most part of the day should be spent.

Name: Aditya_Banerjee
Title: Home to Ikkat saris
Review: If you are in Hyderabad with your family, you must travel to Pochampalli to see a few geniuses at work. Pochampalli home to some fine craftsmen who weave the famous Ikkat Saris. Even if you don't buy the saris, just go there and observe the talented weavers at work

Name: TVREDDY02
Title: MAKE IN INDIA---HYDERABAD
Review: Had been to the Pochampally and found that the Handloom Park(known as factory locally) is worth a place to see if want to see how sarees/cloths are wooven.  A place for the children to see also.  Timings are from 0900 Hrs to 1800 Hrs.  Sundays are holidays (it comes under Textile ministry).  Though there are locally house made cloth made too but then one does not really know the quality of the same as such, hence procurement of the same from the handloom manufacturer is worth. Though we had been there on sunday and since they were working hence requested for an entry, the persons there had been very courteous and welcomed us. Had meet Mr Nagarjuna, Nagesh,Ashok, Shravan and Miss Ujjwala...all had been so nice to show us the whole factory and did not close the factory till we had left at 1730 hrs.  Thankful to all of them to have ensured that we did not waste the day.  Cost of the manufacture is found reasonable when seen the work that is going on.  Its a place for the people to get the job too.  They conduct 3 months training and pay a stipend of Rs 2,000/- and then one can work there and make a living by doing the job there itself.  A silent place and not much publicized.  Once in Hyderabad a place one should not miss out especially for ladies and children (for knowledge atleast).Place to reach .. From Hyderabad go towards Rammoji film city and then after 4-5 kms have to turn left...keep checking on the way as if one misses will have to go a long way for turning back as is a NH.

Name: KrisfromSF
Title: Enjoyable DayTrip from Hyderabad
Review: Nice excursion combining sightseeing and shopping. A village that specializes in hand-loom weaving of silk saris. We went to a couple of weavers' houses and to the "factory" to see all the stages of production, including the Ikat dyeing. Outlet store at the factory sells saris for 50% of what you will pay in Hyderabad. Bought two! And then ate our lunch (bring your own) in a field and drove back to Hyderabad.  Total time about 8 hours including commute.

Name: Kedarshukla
Title: Saree shopping and weaver's workshop.
Review: Actually if you are in Hyderabad and you are not buying pochampalli sarees.. Then you are missing something..  So why not go to the place where these sarees are made and see the work of weavers first hand.This place is around 40 km from Hyderabad and can be reached by city bus or car drive. Search for bhudan pochampalli on google maps for correct place. Just be warned that there is no decent eatery in or around pochampalli so carry your food OR eat before you travel. When in the village you can visit any handloom factory located in almost every house, you can see the age old machines and traditional technology of making sarees.. .. I am not sure but they may give you a try on their machines.. If possible have a person with you who can speak English cause the weavers don't speak any language apart from Telugu. You can buy sarees from any shop their or better to go to the cooperative society shop. Everyone gives flat10% discount on every purchase.Tip: carry a fat purse because there is lot of to buy in small hidden heaven of sarees.

Name: captsameerkhan
Title: Saree shopping
Review: it's a smooth one and a half hour drive from hyderabad city and is the perfect place if you're looking to do some heavy duty shopping for silk and cotton sarees and suits of the famous ikat work. It's purely meant for shopaholic women who have a keen interest in sarees and suits of that type and men will get bored helping women out in choosing what to buy :(There are bedsheets and cushion covers and the like also available in the shops there

Name: Kaushalps
Title: Best Botonical garden
Review: It used to be one of the best botonical gardens but now due to constuction this is being neglected .. Cycling is fun there.. Also there is a jogging trek for morning walk..birds do buzz here..overall place to be maintained..

Name: Anjana
Title: Walking
Review: It’s a place in the middle of a city still another world…….close to nature n beautiful. Peaceful and well maintained a lovely place to start your day with a walk here

Name: Twinkle Sonar
Title: hyderabad botanical garden
Review: The Botannical Garden is a sprawling garden in the heart of Hyderabad city. amazing place one must visit once

Name: sow
Title: Family time
Review: Good place to visit n have can good time.peacefull place.for children it's best to spend time over here

Name: BhaskarVVB
Title: Multiple early morning health based trips
Review: Signed up for couch to 5k Hyderabad runners program being held 3 times a week since January 2020.As part of this program, I end up being there at 0600 am for about 90 minutes.There are quite a few health freaks trying to run, jog, walk, stroll with kids, stroll with spouse, play badminton, do yoga or just laze around to get free vitamin D.I took the monthly pass which makes it a little easier for this month.You get to drink some hot flavored health drink at the entrance. I cannot endorse as i haven't tried yet. However, do see folks relish it.All in all recommended as a good place early in the morning if you want some clean air and fresh surroundings.Happy botanicking & stay healthy.

Name: jainms
Title: Nice garden
Review: well maintained park and suggested for regular walk as well, it has greenery and located in kondapur.

Name: Xyzz
Title: Botanical garden
Review: Its nice place to go with Friends and family.. .. .. Its located near kondapur.. . Its large garden with benches.. . Food items not allowed inside. . Nice place for couples as well.. . Greenry Mentainted and you can find birds and Squirral around.. .

Name: Katzistan
Title: Unrealized potential
Review: The gardens are not well-maintained, and there aren't very well-kept paths for walking. The pond is drained and muddy. Everything is dusty and unkempt. The children's playground is ok, but half the equipment is broken. It could be a really nice place if it was kept well.

Name: CuriousTraveller
Title: Beautiful greenery at Botanical Garden Kothaguda
Review: Its an awesome place where you can enjoy beautiful greenery with variety of plants that include variety of cactuses.very well maintained plants, trees, sheds to sit, view and relax under the tree shades.gardens is maintained very well.people also play shuttle.walking while looking at these beautiful plants is really worth. I wish to take my son next time.

Name: Srikanth M
Title: Best place to visit in Week end
Review: It's a nice place to visit in weekend with children's.peaceful place with lot of Greenery.and also best for morning and evening walk.

Name: Krish
Title: Cool place for jogging and hanging out with friends and family
Review: A good and serene place to spend evenings with family and friends, the place is kept clean so please do not litter.Entry fee Rs 25/adult Rs.10 for kids, and a monthly pass is 400It features an open gym and a lot of peacocks that are great to watch. Fun fact: A single round from the entrance, round through the Conservatory and back to entrance  is a distance of 3 km, with a lot of greenery making it a good place to jog. The only complaint is the small pond present could be cleaned to avoid the voluminous mosquitoes.

Name: Prudhvi
Title: Nice place to visit in free time.
Review: The place is spread across many acres and nice greenery around the whole place. There are many recreational activities like arrow shooting. There are food court to eat. For those who want to stay there are cottages. You can spot many peacocks as you roam around the garden.

Name: Souji
Title: Family visit
Review: It's a best place for children to know about the plants and also to have good time. The weather in evening is perfect for outdoor picnic with small children. We can get to know about all the tropical plants present in the region with their names tagged to the plants. With their scientific names too. It has a vast area with different shrubs, plants, trees and all.

Name: Prasad B
Title: Place with a beauty but needs the renovation.
Review: Botanical gardens is located near SLN terminus kondapur but it needs a impairment cum renovation to get the arena back.

Name: Traveller
Title: Very beautiful and warm environment
Review: beautiful gardens and landscaping across all its infrastructure projects. And to underline their importance and inspire our younger generation, who are the future of India, we have given these gardens a collective identity that connects

Name: Nitin A
Title: Still thinking what is there to do here
Review: Tortoise shaped building with a basic gym , few walkways and stinking water bodies. A covered area of different varieties of cactus is all I could find in this place.There were so many possibilities to make this place an educational place for kids but sadly the place is nothing to offer for kids.It is more of a joggers park rather than anything botanical about it.Disappointed.

Name: Sashi555
Title: Trip to Botonical Garden
Review: We all are very happy to visit Hyderabad Botonical Garden and we enjoyed a much. Actually we are on scientific research on Botonical topic and it helped to some extent.actually we expect some other species.

Name: Srikanth
Title: Friends with business
Review: It is very good place to have business works.it is very peaceful were we can do our work so perfect and clear

Name: Naren
Title: Botanical garden, kondapur
Review: Nice place to have fun with kids and family. Whoever want to do physical activities like Gym, warmups, walking.. for all this it's good place to join.. now a days governament has done fabulous job by maintaining the garden and greenary... Just have a fun

Name: Dil
Title: Botanical garden
Review: The botanical garden facilities the of a modern botanical garden to educate the people.it has 274 acres

Name: Hari Sri
Title: Dinner
Review: It was wonderful enjoying my dinner with my family. It's very tasty enjoyed the most delicious food.

Name: beyondtravel
Title: Strollers delight
Review: Is a beautiful botanical Garden amidst kondapur hustle,  a perfect getaway especially for morning walk with long walk (3.5 kms)  accompanied by flora,  peacock,  birds and water bodies.  Not as informative tho as a student interest.  Have 6am-9am,  4 -6 pm for walkers at 25 entry fee with daily,  monthly,  yearly pass available.  Ample parking available.  They have other attractions thru the day including minigolf,  food court,  activities etc.  A good place to feel fresh

Name: Wanderlust
Title: Average garden at Kondapur main road
Review: This is an average garden. One can go for running in mornings. Landscaping is good, but could be better. There is a small man made bridge where you click some good pics

Name: Vikram
Title: A park that has botanical plants and scope to do more
Review: This is one of the last few lung spaces in the HiTech / Gachibowli area of the twin cities. Amidst the concrete jungle, this garden has greenery and plants with medicinal value. This space could have been invested to yield more and provide more herbs as well as home to many species of insects, & birds. The lack of water for the plants is affecting many invaluable ones.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: nice
Review: It has some rare species of plants and a lot of greenery.Photography they say is restricted but people take pics here.Nice place to go once

Name: Dilip kumar
Title: Best to timepass
Review: This place will make you time pass and make your time go away easily and will give a good feel of enjoyment.

Name: EkMusafir
Title: Open Space For Recreation.
Review: The Botanical Gardens of Hyderabad, officially known as Sri Kotla Vijayabhaskara Reddy Botanical Gardens, is located on the Miyapur-Gachibowli Highway in the Kondapur area. There is a huge free parking lot for cars and two-wheelers.Upon entering you have to buy a ticket for ₹25 per person, and there is a stiff fee for photography and videography. It seems that these fees are meant for commercial shootings, but everyone was entering without paying for their cell-phone cameras, and many were taking selfies. If you are a regular morning walker you can buy a pass for ₹400 per month or ₹1500 for an annual pass.As you enter there are some life-like statues of animals and birds laid out in neat gardens. There are some demarcated areas for yoga, a wellness center, a party zone, skating rink, mini golf course, fitness center, an adventure arena, a video hall, conference hall, and an amphitheater. There are some cottages for rent and a Food Court which opens later in the day.The main walking track leads into a dry forest which is more brown rather than green. The track is made of a mixture of sand and gravel. The full round of the track is about 3.5 km. You can hear peacocks early in the morning, and if you are lucky you may even see some. Other smaller birds like bulbuls, babblers, sparrows, and bee-eaters can also be seen and heard.It is best to go early in the morning if you want to exercise your limbs. Compared to parks in other parts of the country, like Bangalore or Pune, the entry rates are very high, and the park is not so green and soothing to the eyes. The Telangana Forest Department should work on these aspects to make it a better experience for the nature lovers.

Name: Pradeep
Title: Awesome restaurant
Review: We really enjoyed . what I ordered food taste is Soo good . I really like restaurant also. Customer service is good

Name: Rahul Mishra
Title: Fresh breeze in concrete forest
Review: If you are in Hitech City Hyderabad , then at least once you should go here for morning walk. Walkway, Food-zone, Swings, Adventure Activities, Photogenic Location Everything is here.

Name: Sunita S
Title: Pretty interesting collection!!
Review: Loved the place for a morning walk, collection of nice plants and trees. It is a good study tour for kids to understand the different types of flora and fauna. Post renovation, has got better.

Name: Daniel T
Title: Nice place be amidst nature
Review: This is a nice place to keep young kids entertained, for walking, jogging activities. With the traffic n pollution around, this place gives a nice option to relax. Nice place for large groups as well

Name: nik c
Title: Some people would call this extortion
Review: Went to these gardens recently expecting to visit botanical gardens.When we went to buy entry tickets they wanted to charge the four of us the equivalent of $160 each for each of our cameras.   Needless to say we didn't go in.   Is this just another attempt to take advantage of tourists who might not know the value of the rupee exchange rate?

Name: SURESH babu
Title: Good
Review: We are happy with their service and quality of food. We will definitely visit again and again. It's great pleasure to us.

Name: GBee
Title: Very little to see, scamming tourists with cameras
Review: They are charging upwards of 4000 rupees (£43, $56) just to take a camera into the 'gardens' - since no right-thinking local would pay even a fraction of that amount. I can only assume they are trying to scam clueless tourists who have no idea of the relative value of the rupee.Once inside you'll be glad you didn't pay that charge, because the ornate entrance is just hiding a very tiny space that contains nearly nothing to deserve the 'botanical garden' title. It's smaller than most parks in the city and lacking in botanical interest - you'll see more plant species in the nearby waste ground than you will inside the perimeter.There are a few attractions  for the kids - a mini-golf course and an adventure/activity area for which you'll pay extra.

Name: karthik D
Title: Worst Govt Policies
Review: Definitely it's a big thumbs-down 👎 for the tourists visiting here with their cameras. They are charging like 4000 to 8000 rupees to allow a camera. You know, a camera lens can be bought with that money. Too ridiculous to charge that much. If it is a commercial photo shoot or film making it would be appropriate to charge as they would be getting money from the shoots. But for family and friends to make some good memories and store them as photos, it is too much to charge those amounts. I saw foreigners arguing with the staff and even left the place as they found the charges are to high.  It's not only about this place,every where in hyderabad they are charging like this only. There are only few places in hyderabad to visit and due to this camera charges we are not able to visit any of them. It will surely impact the tourism in hyderabad over the course of time.

Name: Maït F
Title: Now extortionate for nature photographers :(
Review: I came early in the morning for birdwatching with my pocket digital camera. The entry fee is still INR 25 but the camera fee has recently jumped from INR 500 to INR 4000-8000 (I was asked for 4000). The website hasn't been updated though...

Name: Bhagyashree S
Title: Morning walk with family
Review: Serene morning walk.it is very pleasant and entire park is free from pollution.Place good for exercise as well as meditation.Please visit.

Name: deepa v
Title: Garden
Review: It's a beautiful garden located in gachibowli area.. Very old... Full of greenery..a nice place to enjoy a day with family

Name: يونس يونس
Title: Plants and trees
Review: They have all for all. For the adults as well as the young. It was great.I loved the train, the large size insects and the people.

Name: SeshKomanduri
Title: Too much concrete- dry place
Review: It seems to be a very popular place for walkers and joggers and people rave about it. I could not understand what the fuss was all about. In the quest for ''modernizing'', there are too many concrete structures that have been erected and the gardens no longer feel natural. The gardens itself are very dry and dusty.  Went for an early morning walk and came back with clothes covered in dust! Not a satisfying experience at all

Name: dineshshradha
Title: Good
Review: Its a place to chill out with friends or family i loved it must go and do share your experience .I will recommend always find out places and review on TripAdvisor

Name: Mega B
Title: Well maintained park
Review: This park has improved immensely in last few years. With 25 Rs entry fees the open gym, walking/running path, play areas, adventure zones are more than one can expect.There's a small eatery, but not sure of quality of food provided.Overall a great park for morning or evening walks and kid's play.

Name: Ashish Kumar
Title: Morning walk & bird watch
Review: The place is improving every month, with more maintenance activity going round & better public amenities being introduced.A wonderful place for morning walk, yoga or meditation, but noting unusual to call it a botanical garden.

Name: Trending T
Title: Best of the best gardens
Review: This place has its own importance and has been registered as national park and it is very good for morning walk.

Name: njydlife
Title: Remodelled
Review: Best place to spend weekends with kids. Totally renovated. Amazingly carved landscapes are spcl attraction

Name: Ritesh J
Title: Wonderful Place
Review: This place has been redeveloped recently and there are many adventure activities available at an extra charge. The charges are nominal. Entry fees for adults is 25 rupees and 10 for kids above 5 yrs. Below 5 years is free. This place is vast with food court, gardens, adventure activities, cactus garden, jogging track, open air gym, enclosed gym, party area and lot of open place etc. The pics you see are very old but I am uploading the new pics today. It's clean and maintained well. But I saw someone dropped empty tetra packs in the cactus garden. The government is trying it's best but it is the citizens who also need to drive the culture of cleanliness.Feel free to like my review if it helped you.Enjoy your visit..

Name: Karthik Dasu
Title: Nice garden
Review: It is one of the better gardens in the city, very much near to the Gachibowli and Hitech City.Please do visit, if you are free.

Name: Abhilash K
Title: Great garden
Review: Here we can found lot of species of the plants and even I found different types of flowers Nd even very old trees here

Name: Naveen Mittal
Title: Great park with good variety of plants
Review: It's good park. I went during a light rain. It was good experience. I saw good variety of plants, and a lot variety of cactus.

Name: suresh n
Title: The park has been designed beautifully with water bodies complementing the lush greenery of the place.
Review: Botanical Garden of Hyderabad is also one of the interesting sights seeing  place  offering a refreshing setting and rich flora. Having been developed by the Forest Departments, Botanical Garden is situated in Madhapur near the Hi-tech City which is almost 16 km away from centre of the city.Botanical garden boasts of more than 600 varied species of plants. The garden is bestowed with dense flora with a few sparsely grown areas for visitors’ walking. Along with its vast flora variety, it also attracts many birds and insects, which further enhances the natural charm of this garden. Bamboo sector is the major attraction of the garden. All the bamboo trees have specific signboard with the scientific name and generic name of the trees. Another popular sector of the Botanical Garden is the Palm sector.

Name: vmsatheesh22
Title: Mmm
Review: Hyderabad  botanical garden,, a wonderful place to visit and enjoy the wonderful time, good atmosphere best

Name: Rohit Reddy
Title: Beautiful and Peaceful
Review: Very good and big place for family outings, kids play and for nature lovers. Only concern is parking is on the other side of road.

Name: njydlife
Title: Multiple varieties of plants
Review: A place for Multiple varieties of plants with green house ..also has boating facility. Generally crowded on weekends

Name: Ajitku
Title: Garden
Review: It is a beautiful botanical garden available in Hyderabad. All types of tree and plants available here.

Name: pdborade
Title: Very nice place
Review: Nice place in Hyderabad. You must visit whenever go to Hyderabad. You feel like natural feelings. Thanks

Name: Partha Sarathi M
Title: Too much money looting for camera
Review: The princes for photography are pathetic. Don't know how many people are affording it. How come they charge Rs 3000/- for photography? If mobiles phones are allowed what's wrong with DSLRs, since every phone has camera snow? They are looting too much mindlessly.In Hyderabad many such places even don't allow cameras. It's ridiculous. The reason is not yet clear. But such practices should be stopped, or they will be loosing their own credibility.

Name: Ravindra V
Title: Waste of time
Review: I have given it earlier 3 stars and now it doesn't deserve even 1 star. We went there to have photoshoot for our kids. But once we went there we were shocked after seeing the photography charges. It is 3000 INR. Yes, you read it right. Where in the world does any park charge that much for taking photos. There is another ticket for photography for INR 500 if you are there between 5 am to 8 am. We didn't take the photography ticket (well, who will take it) and went in to spend some time. It's good that we didn't take it. There is not much greenery in the park and it is getting converted into concrete park. They are building some buildings (like gazebos etc) and making it more like a public park than a botanical garden. This garden has lost the points which it had for whatever greenery it had earlier. Total waste of time.

Name: Chandu C
Title: Good one
Review: I would say that it is a good destination in Hyderabad and I would definitely recommend you all to have a visit and explore the garden

Name: LadyRider
Title: Under construction, good potential
Review: The garden is under construction now, so it is just a beginning of something very good.  Nothing to see at the moment, very small area to walk (I walked it all round in 10 minutes, the most of the area is closed). However there is lots of work in progress, so I’d like to return in about a year to see a big and nice organized garden. Keep going!

Name: Travellove1025
Title: Good Bicycle track
Review: It's a good park with well spread area. Ideal for picnicking with family and friends. It also has a good cycling track and you can rent bicycles from there and ride. The garden also has fun activities for kids.

Name: md hussain
Title: My Golden Days were here
Review: One of my fav places in hyd for nature seeing and picnic spots along with family. All greens everywhere and also there a pond with a scenic view. It has many plant species which are not found in common outdoors. I used to visit this place very often during my college days along with my friends. Lovely place :)

Name: Narasimha A
Title: For Relaxation
Review: It is very peaceful place visit. Who are enjoying nature those people are going to this place . I njyd  a lot. I hope you  feeling like this

Name: Vijay R
Title: Visit for Botanical Gardens
Review: Nice place for environmental lovers.Worth seeing it.Good variety of flowers exists here.Nice place for children they would love here to play.

Name: ravirjy
Title: Nice garden
Review: We went to this place and had Nice with friends. The garden is neat and fresh air. Best place to visit for relaxation.

Name: lovetravelonly
Title: Botanical Garden of Hyderabad
Review: The Botanical gardens in Hyderabad has a wide variety of trees and plants. It is located near Hi-tech city- Gachibowli area. The entire area is cool and pleasant due to the rich green environment. Very good place for walk.

Name: CAKrishnaC
Title: Pocket of  fresh air in Kondapur area , plenty of greenery
Review: Pocket of  fresh air in Kondapur area , plenty of greenery.10s of PeacocksWalking track is very good – about 3 kms.You should experience this nature ! Get your shoes on ! A god place to exercise,Yoga etc Park area for family and children,can have a picnic. Families come here for photoshoots of children..Explore this.Children play area is available.Children must watch the Tortoise House!2 ponds  have been made. Both were full in the monsoon of 2017.It was awesome to see it .Boating has just been introducedDiagonally Opposite the park ( on Botanical Garden Road) a cycling track/park is being started.Fitness freaks can makde good use of this. Pls donot carry plastic and dirty the park.Donot disturb the birds/peacocksSuggestions to dept :•	Fares have just been increased in October ( Rs 15 to rs 25 per entry).authorities should provide better amenities•	Improve toilets – bad condition, not in line with Swach Bharat•	Put proper signs of no. of kms in the walking track.This is v poor•	Put more seating stones inside the park •	The second park inside the park to be desilted and made bigger to store more water•	Fence the boundry of the lake – atleast temporarily, when the lake is full of water•	Introduce Fish in the ponds, so that it attracts birds•	Include more water birds in the lake – like ducks, swans etc •	Have more  children play area , include adventure activities in the park•	Encourage public to plant saplings in the park and take care of them•	Make it litter free area , no plastic.When lake was full, it was full of plastic bottles !Have more dustbins for public to throw waste. •	Invite public to contribute funds to the park maintenance

Name: GANESHNIYER
Title: Small place, kids park
Review: I visited with my son for a picnic. However, the gardens is in a small area. The lake was very muddy. Other lake was not properly maintained with plastic cover and bottles on the sides. There is a small kids park. Otherwise, nothing much is there.

Name: Saimanojguptha
Title: Good
Review: Absolutely superb hotel - fantastic staff who were all so welcoming to my friend S. Beautiful guest-rooms & hotel. Amazing restaurants with great choice of top quality Indian or Italian foods. The food is so tasty...

Name: Gaurab2017
Title: Badly maintained
Review: Was excited to visit this place but the entire area is badly maintained. Popular for couples and lovers. Can give a miss.

Name: vmsatheesh22
Title: Super
Review: Hyderabad botanical garden beautiful and enjoyable place, we all like the beautiful garden and beautiful flowers

Name: sandeep g
Title: plants
Review: you feel good if you are a natural and plant lover , you can see good number of verities of plants ..

Name: David D
Title: Poorly maintained
Review: Very puzzled by positive reviews. There's potential here (or faded glory) but this park is cluttered by crumbling "improvements" and is very poorly maintained. No comparison to KBR National Park, which is model that should be followed. People are "working" but they're not doing any maintenance. Visitors are confined to a limited area. Trails to most of the park (which must be where peacocks have escaped to) have been closed the two times we've been here. Go with very low expectations. Sad because there's clear potential here and this area of the city would benefit from a nice park.

Name: Akanksh S
Title: Variety of plants.
Review: The bloomed up plants are best viewed both in day and night. The best time recommended to visit here is evening because you can enjoy the natural beauty of flowers in daylight and the colorful lights at the night.

Name: BRKanth
Title: Time for Fresh Air
Review: Place to be seen with family and Kids. They could see different plants and how they are grown. Better for evenings.

Name: Siva R
Title: Very good place
Review: With family it is very good place for entertainment. We will see different types of plants and animals. For photos it is very good place.

Name: Jikuza
Title: Nice place to start the morning
Review: I have been to this park a few times and it has been a wonderful experience so far each time. It is a great place for morning walks/runs. I generally used a track which was about 400m, though once I went onto a track that was far far longer. Peacocks are very much a part of this garden.

Name: Travel-Adhikari
Title: Visit to Botanical Garden
Review: Though we lived in Secunderabad for years we didn't know existence of a 'botanical garden'. We visited it after we came across the information. May be due to peak summer season, the greenery would have depleted and water in two small reservoirs had evaporated, apathy towards maintenance was glaring. Again the same belief that government run institutions are most inefficient and employees get in them just for the sake of constant source of income, was seen to be true. But we had a very enjoyable experience of watching full grown gorgeous male peacocks....about 7 of them. One was atop the wall at one end of the garden. After sitting there for some time it slipped into the other side and we followed through a gate (no signs about whether we can actually cross over) and penetrated through the dried bushes stealthily. In a small open space surrounded by dried up trees about 7 peacocks had assembled around their feeding site. Other than this there is not other charm in the garden. Sanjeevaiah Park beside Hussainsagar would perhaps be few notches better than this.

Name: SuvodipMoitra
Title: Good Saturday Morning visit
Review: This is so near to our place in Gachibowli. Yet we have hard ever gone there. Made it a point to go there last saturday with wife to enjoy the early morning walk. It was indeed a refreshing summer morning walk.

Name: PavRao
Title: Great place for a walk...but needs improvement
Review: Loved the walk in the outer perimeter. Was surprised as to how large it actually is. The Botanical garden area itself isn't​ much and can be much better . Am happy that there is such a place in the city and can imagine how it'll be in time

Name: Nate J
Title: Under Repairs
Review: I explored the botanical garden today and what little there is of it has fallen into disrepair.  There is some new material (bricks, dirt, etc.) scattered around so it appears that there is some work being done but they have a long ways to go.  Also, you are limited to a very small area of the garden; most of it is walled off.

Name: shivaraikod
Title: Good for students
Review: This place is on my way to office so thought of paying a visit on my way back home. This seems to be good for botanical students to grasp real knowledge otherwise a one time visit

Name: Susan H
Title: Big Park in Concrete Jungle
Review: The bones of a well thought out Botanical garden are still present, but you'll have to look through creative eyes to see the what could be from the what is currently there. Currently more of a nice park for strolling. The three bus loads of children where having a great time racing through the paths surrounded by established trees and manicured lawn panels. Couples and groups of young 20 somethings where enjoying the benches and shade. A few labeled plant displays. Room for improvement.

Name: Dhwanit S
Title: Average place but scope for improvement
Review: It's a big place to walk around and relax. Not for summers. It needs lots of improvement and has potential to be one of the best place to visit.

Name: ReetaKarki
Title: Greenary around
Review: Botanical garden gives you good greenary view around. Perfect for morning walk. Good place to take kids too.

Name: ads634
Title: Green place amont concrete.
Review: Garden is very green, but maintenance is very poor. They charge entry fee but not do proper maintenance. Good place for doing exercise. Feel less pollution.

Name: janardhan j
Title: Super.........
Review: In Hyderabad i like this very much than others in this garden so many variety of plants and trees and good nature

Name: Lav Dwivedi
Title: Green grounds, full of fresh air.
Review: We enjoyed our Sunday evening at Botanical gardens.Pros: The greenery is picturesque and full of fresh air. We liked it to have long chats and click photos with friends. Photographers may find good view points here.Cons: Poor maintenance by the authorities. Because so many people visit this place on weekends, it's getting much of human waste which is making it look ugly sometimes. I guess cleaning and maintenance is not done properly. There used to be a drinking water tank which is not functional now.

Name: Veer2468
Title: Not at all maintained
Review: Very poor maintenance. Entry ticket and parking charges are high. No maintenance at all. Broken swings.

Name: RachanaR18
Title: Stretches of green right in the heart of the city
Review: The Botanical gardens has a wide varitey of trees and plants and is located near Hitech city- Gachibowli area. The entire area is cool because of this park.

Name: pjanil1968
Title: Good for a walk
Review: Nothing much to see here. Good place  for morning and evening walk. You can park vehicles in the opposite ground. Very near to Kothaguda junction.  Not a well maintained garden

Name: TravellingMe1234
Title: place to walk and work out
Review: ITs really not a place to visit, but apt for morning walks/ workout/yoga sessions. Recent rains helped to regain some of lost greenery and you can spot peacock/ other birds.

Name: Ravindra V
Title: Good place for walking but  ..
Review: This place is very good for morning walk as you get to walk in a natural garden away from city's pollution. However it's pleasant only in the morning. Problem with this garden is it is not well maintained. There is a tortoise shape building built for maintaining cactus plants but that building is a mere storage room now. Most of the plants do not have names written which is very much needed for plant lovers. You can see some peacocks and birds roaming around in the park. Parking facility is not bad. There is entry ticket of 15 INR and car parking charges are 20 INR.

Name: Swetha Nagarjun S
Title: An excellent place for walk
Review: We were surprised when we came here for a walk. I did not know that amid the concrete jungle lies a real jungle. A haven for nature lovers and joggers, this botanical gardens is an excellent place to breathe in fresh air, exercise, yoga and fun activities for early go getters. We could even spot a few peacocks and hear different animal sounds. There are many plant species which we have not even heard of and colorful flowers that attracts the eye. A good place for ladies to do jogging and yoga. Starts at morning around 5 am and entry fee is rs 10.

Name: Sravan Vadde
Title: okay place
Review: the place was good but not interesting enough to make you want to come back again. good place to spend a couple of hours.

Name: Sanjeev K
Title: Nice place for a walk
Review: I certainly like going to this one as it is fairly well maintained and the only big one in concrete IT area

Name: AshishBansal82
Title: Nice place for outing with family
Review: Nice place for outing with family during mornings. If you like runs , jogs or want to see peacocks or birds etc visit this place

Name: bkumar123
Title: Not so good to visit
Review: Have been to Botanical gardens many times, but these days the management of garden has become very very poor causing lot of inconvenience to the visitors. All the grass have become dry, water wont run from the outlets. The pond also has become dry and has lost its charm. Only you can find college going boys & girls sitting at the farthest points engrossed in chatting etc.

Name: AswinAnu

Review: Very small and good place to relax for a long time. Not a much to see in this garden. But can spend a good time with family and friends.

Name: Michael Anbumani
Title: Nice to visit

Name: sathish8281
Title: Good one to visit again
Review: Me and my friends going to these restaurant on the coaction of celebrating party.we order some of the varieties this restaurant.good taste is like homely made.we are decided to visit again

Name: Somaseshu Gutala
Title: cleanliness and serene surroundings. Spacious area and all facilities.
Review: This temple is located very close to Hyderabad. It is 10kms from ECIL Cross Roads and 5 kms before Keesera Gutta. It is connected to ECIL X Road by a four-lane road. Many city people visit this temple to enjoy the peaceful surroundings. The big lake before we enter the temple, with green paddy fields and trees refreshes one’s mind. The temple arch one of the biggest arches in Telengana region is very attractive with colourful carvings. On the top of the arch the idol of Sri Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy along with Lakshmi is seen flanked by idols of Ganesh and Hanuman bearing the Sanjeevani Mount. On the extreme ends two idols of Abhaya Anjaneya Swamy are seen. On the pillars of the arch the idols of Jaya and Vijaya and Garuda are seen. This is an exquisite specimen of architecture which captures the attention of the devotees.         The parking space before the temple is very spacious and there is a place assigned for breaking coconuts. There is a shoe stand just beside the parking place. On the way to the temple one can see stalls selling pooja material and a hotel. The temple hall is very colourfully painted with sculptures of various gods. Around the Pradakshina Patha (circambulatory passage) one can see the ten incarnations of the Lord Vishnu. The idol of Lakshminarasimha in the centre is very attractive. The idol of the founder (Sri Mallaram Eshwaraiah) is seen in a niche. There is a tortoise-pond behind with a beautiful statue of Lord Vishnu reclining on the serpent-bed in the middle of the pond. Inside the sanctum the idol of Shanta Narasimha with Lakshmi is seen under the shade of Adi Sesha.         There are many sevas done here. Every Friday Abhishekam is performed. Swarnapushparchana is done to the main lord. In every month on Swathi Nakshatra day, Swamy Kalyanam is done. There is a big hall for performing various rituals Satyanarahyanavratam, Sudarshana Homa, Annaprashana and Upanayanam. Many people make their wishes (Sankalpa) standing before Dwajha Stambham with a coconut in their hands and go round the temple for eleven, twenty-one or forty-one times. After their wish is fulfilled, they again come here and go round the temple for forty-one times. Many devotees come here on Saturday and spend the night here. The following day they do pradakshinas. Devotees believe that their wishes would be fulfilled if they sleep five Saturdays in this holy temple. The devotees who come here should not close their eyes before the main deity but look at the Lord with devotion. Here the devotees should come in traditional dress.  People wearing T-shirts and jeans are not permitted.          In 2015 the temple authorities constructed a choultry with 41 rooms with all facilities. On the days of Poornima and Amavaasya also, many devotees come here to spend the night and do pooja on the following day. So, this Lord is called “Sankalpa Siddhi Narasimha”. On every Tuesday special poojas are done to Lord Anjaneya and Lord Subrahmanaya. Kalasarpanivarana Pooja is also done on this day. On every Wednesday special poojas are done to Maha Ganapati. Special Poojas are done during the months of Kartik and Margasirsha months and on Vaikunta Ekadashi. In this temple Brahmostavams are celebrated in the month of April every year for three days.           There are many sub-shrines in this temple like, Maha Ganapati andAnjaneya. At the back of the temple near the choultry, one can see the shrines of Bangaru Mysamma, Nalla Pochamma and Subrahmanhya. These idols were found in the field of Ishwaraiah.           Regarding the founding of this temple, the credit goes to Mallaram Eshwarayya who is a staunch devotee of Lord Narasimha. He had a vision of Lord Narasimha who asked him to go to Yadagiri and worship the Lord there. He went there and brought a picture of Yadagiri Narasimha and kept it in his pooja room and lit Akhanda Deepam. Many people visited his pooja room and worshipped the Lord. Later His son, Mallaram Lakshminarayana too worshipped the Lord and received Narasimha mantra from Guru. Inspired by Lord’s vision he got Narasimha idol made on April19th 2007, and kept it in his pooja room. Later he thought a temple would be a suitable place to worship the Lord. So, in his field guided by the Lord he selected a suitable place and laid the foundation stone and did Pranapratishta on May 1st 2008. While digging the field, he saw a serpent as if blessing him. So, a shrine for Naga devata is seen in the temple. The shrines of Grama Devatas (Village goddesses), Bangaru Mysamma and Nalla Pochamma have been renovated.          In this temple the traditions followed by Yadagiri temple priests are followed here since devotees believe that Cheeryal Narasimha is a manifestation or Amsha of Yadagiri Lakshmi Narasimha. Many temples of Narasimha are seen in hill-caves. But here the Lord is seen on the ground floor and so devotees can go round the Lord to get their wishes fulfilled. Many Telugu serials’ shooting is done here. Telengana Chief Minister, Sri K.C.R visited this temple to fulfil his vows. The working hours of this temple are from 6.00 a.m. to 12.30 p.m. and from 4.00 p.m. to 8.00 p.m.  On Saturdays and Sundays, the working hours are from 6.30 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. and from 4.00 p.m. to 8.00 p.m. For city people this is a very nearby place to visit and spend peaceful time and worship the Lord who is regarded as very powerful and who removes obstacles and fulfils the wishes of devotees who pray to him with sincere devotion.                              ---------------------------------------------------

Name: Arvind Kumar Yerram
Title: Traditional and ancient
Review: One of the oldest and serene temples of Sri Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy. He is a swayambhu god here and that makes it even more poweful. Mental and emotional peace is guaranteed in the premises. We have temples for Surya, Sai Baba, Dattatreya, Ram & Hanuman and Shiva. We have lake near by but is dried up. They have changed the entrance and we can now goto temple entrance on a vehicle. 1-1.5 hrs drive from Hyderabad. Worth visiting. Not heavily crowded.

Name: baburammarch25
Title: Heritage place
Review: Full of cultural reflection, lots of art work which was pride, well maintained, well cleaned, well designed.

Name: Gajalakshmi
Title: Cheeryala Lakshmi Narasimha temple, Keesara
Review: This temple is very nice and well maintained. Though it is Dedicated to Narasimha swamy, you can call it a sarva Murthy temple. You can have Dharshan of Local Goddess , Shiva, Subrahmanya, Ganesha in the same premises. Very peaceful, spiritual with Devine vibrations. Felt blessed🙏

Name: idea614354
Title: devotional place
Review: a great and good devotional very famous temple. lord sri lakshmi narasimha swamy gives darshan here.

Name: shivaraikod
Title: Devine
Review: The place infact a devine place offers external and inner peace to every human who comes to his scared house.

Name: PROF.HARAGOPAL MATHSYARAJA
Title: Nice Place to visit.
Review: Nacharam gutta, Nacha giri  sri lakshmi narasimha Swamy temple is Worth visiting near Toopran. Its very ancient temple and on the out skirts of Hyderabad.

Name: Praveen K
Title: Good Temple in busy Nacharam Area
Review: A Good calm peaceful temple in busy Nacharam Area. the temple is frequented by the locals around hmt nagar nacharam and is peaceful. Well organized.

Name: tamizh1974
Title: Old and Nice temple
Review: Temple was old, but maintained. Ample parking available. 5 to 6kms from Toopran. But they were asking to buy Rs.10 tickets compulsorily for darshan. No Free darshan. The drive way from Hyderabad after national highway was excellently green and very good.

Name: BRKanth
Title: Famouse Temple
Review: Very famous and historic temple near to hyderabad. Approx 50 Kms from Secbad. Sometimes rush during week ends. Currently they are renovating the temple.

Name: Medagam Praveen
Title: Beautiful place of worship
Review: one of the holy indian temples, not so far away from hyderabad, good place to visit with family and pool was inside temple

Name: PavalikaV
Title: Management is trying out...
Review: Narasimhaswamy temple at Yadagiri is a very famous and iconic destination for the devout. While the management is trying to improve the facilities, the following needs immediate attention:- de-commercialise the complete arena from the hawkers and encroachers- Ensure proper pujas and archanas are performed- defocus on rituals and elevate the environment with spirituality- enhance the crowd management- provide clean, hygienic environment for the pilgrims- list only selected outfits for the restaurants with some price controls if possible- provide more information and counters for the usage of services such as pujas-

Name: raja p
Title: popular temple in hyderabad
Review: this is in yadagiri gutta .famous temple in telangana state..approx 60 km from hyderabad.very peacful place.it is on the banks of river godavari.

Name: ronitsingla
Title: Good temple@Hyderabad
Review: This is very good temple in Hyderabad.It is on banks of godavari temple. Very peaceful place and soulful atmosphere.

Name: Somaseshu Gutala
Title: A very beajutifuul temple with landscaped garden and sculptures nearer to the city
Review: On my Visit to Ratnalayam (Shamirpet, Hyderabad)For city people, “Ratnalayam temple” is a nearby sacred place of Lord Venkateshwara where one can see a model temple construction with beautiful surroundings, serene atmosphere, clean ambiance and modern facilities. This temple was constructed by T.R.Venkatesh just for family worship, but gradually expanded into a big temple. This temple was inaugurated by Swami Jayendra Saraswati on 19th February, 2003 with blessings of Chinna Jeeyar Swamiji Just like Birla temple, this temple is a tourist attraction. Here many T.V. serials are shot showing the landscape and shady trees dotted with beautiful fountains and statues. This temple is located at Aliapur Cross Roads near Aliabad bus stop. From the temple arch, it is only 200 meters distant.  It is nearly 30 kms from Hyderabad. The famous Saraswati temple at Wargal is just 25 kms away from this place. So, one can plan to visit both places.People of all ages including kids find this place quite interesting and delightful. The architecture of this temple and landscaped gardens is quite attractive and impressive. There is wide parking space with a beautiful garden at the entrance with water fountain structures in the form of Lord’s sacred Namam flanked by Shanku and Chakram. At another place one can see a fountain with figures of Lord Vishnu reclining on Adisesha with Lakshmi near His feet. The statue of Krishna dancing on the hoods of Kaliya amidst waters is another eye-catching spectacle. As one ascends the steps towards the main temple one can see the shrine of Lord Ganesha near the entrance. The statue in the main temple resembles the idol of Lord Venkateshwara in Tirupati. Lotus carvings in attractive colors are seen on the ceiling of the central hall. Poojas are done here as per Pancharatra Agama of Vaishanavite tradition. On either side of the main sanctum there are sub-shrines for Goddess Padmavati and Goda Devi. The idols are made of black granite and look very beautiful decked with jewelry and floral decorations. These idols were sculptured by the famous sculptor Sri Ganapathy Sthapathy and were brought from Kanchipuram. Near the main hall or mukha mandapam, there is a counter for selling tickets for various poojas and for selling prasadam packets. While going down the stairs on the way, there is a shrine of Goddess Kanyaka Parameshwari. There is also another shrine for Lord Hanuman.  In this temple there is a hall for doing tonsuring (Kalyana katta), a lecure-hall, a hall for performing homams, a goshala(cattle-shed). Along with temple rituals one can also perform ceremonies like Aksharabhyasam, Anna Prashan, Namakaranam, Sayanarayana Vratam, Gopuja and Vahana Pooja. Special poojas and rituals are done on festive days like Vaikunta Ekadashi, Janmashtami, Dussehra, Diwali and Sankranti. There is a separate area with swings and slides for kids to play. There is a small canteen beside the garden.  It is really a visual treat for city people to spend their time along with their kids in this temple located in serene and scenic surroundings. The temple timings are from 6.00 a.m. to 12.00 noon and from 4.00 p.m. to 8.00 p.m.

Name: Raj
Title: My experience
Review: Nice temple   super place  great  location one of the Very special  temple in Hyderabad very spacious....

Name: The Food Wanderer
Title: A Marvel
Review: The architecture in the temple was amazing. The main temple was sorrounded by a lush green gardens and fountains and there was ample parking space. Food is also provided during weddings.

Name: Capture photovideo Krishna
Title: Peaceful ...
Review: My first visit there make me discovered the peace and pure atmosphere of the environment and truly a destressful place to be ... a visit is a must....

Name: idea614354
Title: Neat and clean
Review: Temple premises maintenense is very good, greenary very nice. good atmosphere also. very huge space availbale for kids play and others.

Name: BRKanth
Title: Decent place for family weekend visit
Review: Nice and neatly maintained place. Could visit during weekend with family and friends. Evenings are better option as there are some special puja's are performed.

Name: GS R
Title: Very Green and peaceful temple
Review: This temple premises is located outside the city skirmishes of Hyderabad. It's a well maintained temple with abundance of green cover. It hosts Lord Ganesha temple, Lord Shri Venkateswara Swamy temple and Lord Hanuman temple. Its a very photogenic place with fresh air and people can generally spend here 1 to 2 hours.

Name: lalnat
Title: Amazing temple
Review: Replicates Tirupati . Lots of space. Well maintained . Also has a small park for kids . Neat and clean .

Name: Binoda C
Title: Wow it is amazing !!!!
Review: Please visit it when you at Hyderabad .. it is called Tirupati of Hyderabad. Nice place having with garden facility.Never you feel the boar after visit.

Name: eMokshaa
Title: Calm and Quiet Temple
Review: A simple well maintained calm and quiet temple away from cacophony of a large city. One may visit any day of the week though it is little crowded on weekends. Pious place to visit with family.

Name: Usha65
Title: One of the good temples in suburbs
Review: A very good temple and the main deity here is Lord Venkateswara. There also Lord Hanuman and Lord Ganesha temples inside. The are around the temple serve as a good picnic area.

Name: Srinivas A
Title: Neat and clean Worship place with Childrens play park
Review: A must visit Lord Balaji temple at Ratnalayam . The place is clean and neat with all facilities and ampule car parking and good play out area for small children. About the temple - its surrounded just on the Karimnagar Highway and 35KM from Secunderabad well connected with Buses . On visiting the temple  you feel more spiritual  and one can imagine Lord Balaji Idol of Tirupati much similar . You have various pooja offering's to do according to your convenience.

Name: Aruna G
Title: Rathnalayam
Review: Excellent place to visit with all the family members irrespective of age.. For kids we have playing resources, water fountain, peaceful temple interior.. Everyone will like the place..

Name: Amogh Natu
Title: Very beautiful and peaceful place to visit with family including children
Review: A very well maintained and planned temple. I visited the temple in the evening time. There was no rush at all and the temple premises are very very clean. Another point I noticed is that the temple premises are very well planned. There is also a childrens' play area which is great for little kids and also for youngsters. Overall, this is a very good place to spend quality time with family, even with kids. One more point I just have to make is that the laddus and wada are just too delicious!!  Make sure you try them! 😊

Name: lakjoth
Title: Wonderful place
